Role Purpose



The purpose of this role is to design, test and maintain softwareprograms for operating systems or applications which needs to bedeployed at a client end and ensure its meet 100% quality assuranceparameters



 



Do



 



Instrumental in understanding the requirements and design ofthe product/ software
Develop software solutions by studying information needs,studying systems flow, data usage and work processes
Investigating problem areas followed by the software developmentlife cycle
Facilitate root cause analysis of the system issues and problemstatement
Identify ideas to improve system performance and impactavailability
Analyze client requirements and convert requirements to feasibledesign
Collaborate with functional teams or systems analysts who carryout the detailed investigation into software requirements
Conferring with project managers to obtain information onsoftware capabilities
Perform coding and ensure optimal software/ moduledevelopment
Determine operational feasibility by evaluating analysis,problem definition, requirements, software development and proposedsoftware
Develop and automate processes for software validation by setting up and designing test cases/scenarios/usage cases, andexecuting these cases
Modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware,improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces.
Analyzing information to recommend and plan the installation ofnew systems or modifications of an existing system
Ensuring that code is error free or has no bugs and test failure
Preparing reports on programming project specifications,activities and status
Ensure all the codes are raised as per the norm defined forproject / program / account with clear description and replicationpatterns
Compile timely, comprehensive and accurate documentation andreports as requested
Coordinating with the team on daily project status and progressand documenting it
Providing feedback on usability and serviceability, trace theresult to quality risk and report it to concerned stakeholders
Status Reporting and Customer Focus on an ongoing basis withrespect to project and its execution
Capturing all the requirements and clarifications from theclient for better quality work
Taking feedback on the regular basis to ensure smooth and ontime delivery
Participating in continuing education and training to remaincurrent on best practices, learn new programming languages, and betterassist other team members.
Consulting with engineering staff to evaluate software-hardwareinterfaces and develop specifications and performance requirements
Document and demonstrate solutions by developing documentation,flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code
Documenting very necessary details and reports in a formal wayfor proper understanding of software from client proposal toimplementation
Ensure good quality of interaction with customer w.r.t. e-mailcontent, fault report tracking, voice calls, business etiquette etc
Timely Response to customer requests and no instances ofcomplaints either internally or externally

 



Stakeholder Interaction



 



Stakeholder Type



Stakeholder Identification



Purpose of Interaction



Internal



Lead Software Developer and Project Manager



Regular reporting & updates



Software Developers



For work coordination and support in providing testing solutions



External



Clients



Provide apt solutions and support as per the requirement



 



 



Display



 



Lists the competencies required to perform this role effectively:



Functional Competencies/ Skill
Leveraging Technology - Knowledge of current and upcomingtechnology along with expertise in programming (automation, tools andsystems) to build efficiencies and effectiveness in own function/ Clientorganization - Competent
Process Excellence - Ability to follow the standards and norms toproduce consistent results, provide effective control and reduction ofrisk - Expert
Technical knowledge - knowledge of various programminglanguages, tools, quality management standards and processes - Expert

 



 



Competency Levels



Foundation



Knowledgeable about the competency requirements. Demonstrates (inparts) frequently with minimal support and guidance.



Competent



Consistently demonstrates the full range of the competencywithout guidance. Extends the competency to difficult and unknownsituations as well.



Expert



Applies the competency in all situations and is serves as a guideto others as well.



Master



Coaches others and builds organizational capability in thecompetency area. Serves as a key resource for that competency and isrecognised within the entire organization.



 



 



Behavioral Competencies
Formulation & Prioritization
Innovation
Managing Complexity
Execution Excellence
Passion for Results

 



Deliver



 



No.



Performance Parameter



Measure



1.



Continuous Integration, Deployment & Monitoring of Software



100% error free on boarding & implementation, throughput %,Adherence to the schedule/ release plan



2.



Quality & CSAT



On-Time Delivery, Manage software, Troubleshoot queries



Customer experience, completion of assigned certifications for skillupgradation



3.



MIS & Reporting



100% on time MIS & report generation

Webdox es un Software que resuelve los desafíos asociados al manejo eficiente de los contratos en grandes empresas. Presente en 7 países de Latinoamérica, Webdox brinda soluciones tecnológicas para la solicitud, redacción, colaboración, negociación, firma y seguimiento de los contratos de sus clientes corporativos y multinacionales, muchos de ellos empresas Global Fortune 500.




Funciones del cargo




Webdox está buscando un nuevo integrante ¡Frontend! para nuestros desafíos de desarrollo Web. Lo que estamos construyendo es de un gran nivel y plantea muchos desafíos interesantes para cualquier desarrollador.




¿Qué tendrás que hacer en este cargo?




Desarrollar aplicaciones React, creando PWAs complejas, entendiendo profundamente las diferentes arquitecturas y patrones para construir apps.
Desarrollar funcionalidades y mejoras a nuestros productos haciendo pruebas unitarias de manera segura, siempre pensando en el rendimiento.
Defender la mejora de calidad, seguridad y rendimiento de nuestros productos.
Participar activamente en las revisiones de código.
Hacer mentoreo a los ingenieros con menos experiencia.
Asegurar que el código sea de buena calidad siguiendo estándares de clase mundial.
Impulsar desde tu experiencia, mejoras tecnológicas en el equipo.




Requerimientos del cargo




Conocimientos Técnicos Requeridos




Experiencia en desarrollo responsive.
Fanático de los tests e implementaciones complejas.
Experiencia con stack completo de frontend HTML + CSS + REACT + Integración a API.
Uso de metodologías ágiles y herramientas de gestión como Jira.
Experiencia en uso de herramientas de versionamiento de código como Git.
Experiencia laboral formal de al menos 3 años en el rol y con las tecnologías requeridas.




Habilidades Requeridas




Habilidad para crear y diseñar soluciones de la manera más ágil posible.
Comunicar y documentar el trabajo desarrollado.




Si cumples con los requisitos, ¡postula!




Opcionales




Inglés intermedio




Condiciones




¿Qué encontrarás en Webdox?




Trabajo remoto, flexibilidad de horarios y espacios.
En Webdox trabajarás en un ambiente colaborativo en donde escucharemos activamente tu opinión, tendrás autonomía dentro de marcos claros de trabajo, en donde podrás expresar tus ideas dentro de un equipo multidisciplinario y multicultural.
¡Te regalamos 5 días extras al año!
Webdox te regala 1 día libre en tu cumpleaños.
Seguro de Salud Complementario.
Viernes la salida en Webdox es a las 16:00, para que alargues tu fin de semana.
Dia de Mudanza: Te regalamos un día para que puedas tener un día de mudanza tranquilo.
¿Te casas? Webdox te regala 2 días adicionales a los legales para que sigas disfrutando tu luna de miel.
¿Fuiste papá? Webdox te regala 2 días adicionales a los 5 días legales para que pases más tiempo con tu hij@!




¡Además utilizamos un sistema de puntos para canjear múltiples beneficios!

Who is Bukalapak?

Bukalapak is an Indonesian-based technology company that has recently completed its IPO to become the country's most successful unicorn.

Bukalapak mission is to create a fair economy for all. We do this by building a platform that helps connect local stores to a world-class distribution, logistics, and payment network. At present, we have over 90 million users, across the web and mobile platforms and we're growing exponentially.




About Your Responsibilities for the Role

As a Full-stack Engineer, your primary role is to support the design and development of high-quality backend services and APIs, with specific emphasis on long-term maintainability, resilience against failures, and high scalability. You are going to write code that integrates with various other systems, both within our platform as well as those made by third-party partners.

Together with other engineers within your team, you are fully empowered to own the systems within your area of responsibility in production. From self-deployments to adding real-time metrics and automated alerts, you aim to understand the behavior and heartbeat of your systems in production.




Fully own end-to-end development (including design, implementation, automated testing, and deployment) and maintenance of robust, performant, and scalable web applications.
Apply the best practice of agile software development within a fully autonomous product-focused team.
Closely collaborate with other full-stack engineers and specialists from backend services, web frontend, mobile apps, security, and infrastructure on product and system design and ideation.
Apply design patterns and design principles to produce maintainable and easy to extend code.
Effectively communicate and collaborate with teams across time zones.




Requirements:

What you need to have (i.e., Minimum Qualifications)

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related fields, or equivalent professional experience in software development.
Strong experience in Golang and NodeJS is a plus
Strong knowledge building applications in ReactJS written in Javascript/TypeScript is a plus
Strong experience on both relational (MySQL, PostgresQL) and NoSQL (Cassandra, MongoDB and ElasticSearch) databases
Linux experience
General knowledge of networking and security vulnerabilities on web applications
Smart, highly motivated, pragmatic, and results-driven
Willingness to take charges regardless of big or small and learn new things
Strong experience in object-oriented, functional, or event-driven programming practices







Bukalapak is an equal opportunity employer. Our hiring committee considers all applicants based on their merits and qualifications for each position. Bukalapak does not discriminate applicants on the basis of their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law. We embrace diversity and encourage inclusion because we believe that to help create A Fair Economy For All, we need to build a workplace for all #BukalapakForAll

At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems, Cyber & Intelligence, we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training and education. Come and experience your future!




The Software Engineer develops, maintains, and enhances complex and diverse software systems (e.g., processing-intensive analytics, novel algorithm development, manipulation of very large data sets, real-time systems, and business management information systems) based upon documented requirements. Works individually or as part of a team. Reviews and tests software components for alignment to the design requirements and documents test results. Resolves software problem reports. Utilizes software development and software design methodologies appropriate to the development environment. Provides specific guidance to the software components of system design to include hardware/software trade-offs, software reuse, use of Commercial Off-the-shelf (COTS)/Government Off-the-shelf (GOTS) in place of new development, and requirements analysis and synthesis from system level to individual software components.




Our Program Is Seeking Innovative Engineers To Support a Critical Application Centered In The Analytic Mission As Well As Modernize The Legacy System Using a Microservices-based Architecture And Cutting-edge Technologies




Agile development and delivery of software
Monolithic Application Support and Maintenance
Microservices Architecture migration
User Interface and User Experience with enhanced workflows
DevSecOps and Automation of CI/CD pipeline
Help Desk and 24X7 system call-in and on-call support/maintenance




NOTE: This position requires an active security with polygraph and US citizenship for selection.

Staples is business to business. You’re what binds us together.

We are searching for you: fresh talent with new ideas, innovation, passion, and drive to bring to Staples. We have student and graduate opportunities where you’ll help businesses of all sizes to be more successful and productive while building a career fueled by purpose, people, and triumph. Whether you are looking for a summer internship, co-op, or an entry-level role, we’ll help you develop the technical and soft skills you need to thrive in the future.

Please note that when applying to this Intern position, you may be considered for several Global Technology roles, however, the preferred role is Salesforce.com developer.

What You'll Be Doing

Gather business requirements and collaborate with business partners
Research, design, test, deploy and maintain software solutions
Interact with engineers and other cross-functional teams such as Product Management, Release Engineering, Quality Assurance, Security, and Operations to develop innovative solutions that meet e-Commerce market needs with respect to functionality, performance, scalability, reliability, realistic implementation schedules, and adherence to development goals and principles
Identify and fix stability/scalability issues in a very time-critical environment
Participate in support site rollouts, helps to resolve site issues, and develop industry and product technical expertise

Description

Opal is building the next generation of access management. As engineers, we've all felt the pain of getting the access we need to do our jobs, whether it's for a piece of infrastructure, a newly deployed service, or a design doc. At Opal, we’re building a central hub for authorization to simplify this spaghetti mess and make best-practice access management automated, intelligent, and easy to use.

We’re tackling a difficult product and engineering challenge. Every system has its own philosophy for access control, which makes orchestrating them with a consistent set of policies challenging. We need talented engineers who can navigate this technically complex space and help us design and build the right abstractions to solve such a universal problem.

Your responsibilities

You will make contributions to all parts of our tech stack, which comprises Kubernetes, Golang, Postgres, Redis, GraphQL, TypeScript, and React
You will work closely with leadership, our product team, and other engineers in roadmapping, architecture, and product discussions
You won’t burn out — we’re building a great product while creating a fun, family-friendly, and remote-friendly culture


Our ideal candidate

Can take a broad mandate and design/build a system end-to-end to implement it
Can work full stack, is comfortable with frontend and backend work
Has 3+ years experience as a full-time software developer or equivalent experience
Thrives in ambiguous environments with significant ownership and with the opportunity to make decisions that have a huge impact on the business


Our benefits

Hybrid work: we have offices in SF and NY but fully support remote hires
Early employee equity
Biannual retreat: we meet somewhere around the world twice a year, all expenses paid
Unlimited PTO + 10 company holidays
Health, vision, and dental insurance
Weekly meal plan for coffee and lunch
Travel reimbursement
401k plan


Research shows that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds rarely apply unless they meet all the job criteria. We aren’t looking for someone who ticks every single box on a page; we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences. If you think you’d be a great fit, then please get in touch to tell us about yourself. Opal is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Compensation Range: $120K - $215K

Kroger Health & Wellness is one of America’s leading retail healthcare organizations with 2,200 pharmacies and 11 specialty pharmacies, and 225 clinics nationwide. Our vision is to help people live healthier lives and our mission is to improve health outcomes with simplified solutions that combine health, wellness and nutrition. We are seeking candidates who care deeply about the technical innovation, sustainable solutions, and reliable operations in the healthcare industry. In this role you have the opportunity to partner with over 22,000 healthcare professionals – from pharmacists and nurse practitioners to dietitians and technicians and serve over 17 million patients.




ROLE DESCRIPTION

Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve in-house software applications as well as third-party systems and integration within a complex fulfillment ecosystem.
Responsible for leading the implementation of best practices and industry recommended patterns striving towards the robustness, maintainability and scalability of the software applications and databases.
Collaborate with designers and product managers to iterate on the design and implementation of our Product.
Represent the Team and Product on inter-departmental initiatives involving multi-disciplinary teams across the organization.
Lead and mentor team members in software development principles, patterns, processes and practices.
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
Focus on overall product quality and user experience.
Provide development support, assistance and resolution for escalations and issues including off-hours.
Stay up to date on emerging technologies.

REQUIREMENTS

Senior level experience (usually 3+ years) using Java 1.7 or above, J2EE, JPA/EJB, Spring Framework, Docker, Oracle, PL/SQL, GIT, and JIRA.
3+ years of experience developing and deploying leveraging native cloud platform services from Azure, GCP or AWS.
3+ year of experience with messaging technologies like JMS, AMPQ, Kafka, RabbitMQ, or Active MQ
3+ years of experience with designing, creating, and consuming REST API’s and documenting use with Swagger and OpenAPI specification.
Comprehensive SQL and PL/SQL development experience, combined with advanced knowledge of high performance, optimized for concurrency database design, development, and implementation.
Experience leveraging automation technology to testing, build, and deploy code (CI/CD)
Collaborate with various team members to secure data (HIPPA, PI, and PCI)
Great communication skills as this will be facing internal/external users.







MINIMUM QUALIFICATION/EDUCATION

Seven years of software development experience, or five years with an advanced degree.

· Bachelor's degree strongly preferred.

BONUS POINTS

Knowledge of retail pharmacy or healthcare services processes and procedures.
Working knowledge of HIPPA, PHI, and PI data security requirements.
Experience in cloud environments including good understanding of the principles and architecture, application development and containerization are a big plus but not required.

· Python, Ansible, or Terraform scripting.

Experience being a senior member of a team that has built a high volume, fault-tolerant, highly available, and distributed system.

What To Expect

The UX Designer will contribute to the Enterprise Design Team's ongoing effort to establishing a culture and proactive design within our organization that will improve the way we deliver tools to our internal employees. At Tesla, the UX designer will be responsible for developing the overall user-experience functionality of our Internal employee applications. The UX Designer should be passionate about resolving our employees pain points through design.

While the team is evolving, the UX Designer will be responsible for defining user-centered processes and ensure they proliferate across the teams that they support. The UX Design team builds coalitions and brings teams together through a strong shared language of design and a passion for learning more about the technical aspects of UX Design. The UX designer will collaborate on business requirements, analyze technical limitations, perceive and conduct research on user behavior, and translate them into user stories, user journey maps, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes.

What You’ll Do

Interact with business users and product management team regularly and convert their ideas into concepts.
Regularly review all designs with the larger UX team to ensure consistency.
Develop and deliver wireframes, user journeys, mockups, and prototypes optimized for a wide range of hardware devices and interfaces.
Participate in design discussions along with product management teams. Provide walkthroughs and demos on user journeys, mockups, and other deliverables to the development team, business stakeholders, and product teams.
Conduct research, conceive, sketch, prototype, and test user experiences for our internal employee applications.
Take a user-centered design (UCD) approach to develop UX solutions. Rapidly test and iterate designs without slipping the deadlines.
Conduct usability tests on each application, module, web page, or feature on the web applications and create a report showcasing your findings to the management.
Identify design problems and technical limitations from time to time and devise elegant solutions using the latest trends and techniques.
Be passionate about all things in user experience and other areas of design and innovation—research and showcase knowledge in the latest trends and technologies from time to time.
What You’ll Bring

A minimum of 2-4 years experience in UX designing using best practices and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.
Expertise in standard UX software such as Zeplin, InVision, Balsamiq, Figma, and similar tools is necessary. Experience with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills is required.
Communicate clearly and effectively on the design processes, ideas, and solutions to the development teams, business stakeholders, and product management teams.
Candidate should have hands-on experience in planning and conducting user research, usability testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, and identifying accessibility concerns.
Have an open mindset to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.

Benefits

Along with competitive pay, as a full-time Tesla employee, you are eligible for the following benefits at day 1 of hire:

Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans, both have options with a $0 paycheck contribution
Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Aetna medical plan with HSA
Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
LGBTQ+ care concierge services
401(k) with employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
Company paid Basic Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability insurance
Employee Assistance Program
Sick and Vacation time (Flex time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
Weight Loss and Tobacco Cessation Programs
Tesla Babies program
Commuter benefits
Employee discounts and perks program

Expected Compensation

$88,000 - $300,000/annual salary + cash and stock awards + benefits

The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.

At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives.




Job Description Summary:




As a leader in fintech, PayPal is democratizing financial services for our customers around the globe with simple, affordable, and secure products that are available to everyone. Come join our inclusive and collaborative community working to change the payments landscape and reimagine the future of money for millions (and soon billions!) of customers worldwide. We are working in a virtual flex model so you will be able to work from home.




Job Description:




At PayPal, our Senior UX Designers influence teams to make customer-centric decisions across the product development lifecycle. This includes drawing on data and research to inform design concepts and decision-making. We start by asking the right questions and end with optimized deliverables that drive valuable outcomes for our customers and business. Our designers are great storytellers, active listeners, technology enthusiasts and experts of their craft.




As a Senior UX Designer, you will advocate for our customer needs and lead project execution in a complex or strategic product domain. You will establish a network across domains and your cross-functional team.




Your day to day:




Independently partner with cross-functional team members in the conceptualization, and delivery of our customer-focused products.
Create high-quality interaction design to improve ease of use, discoverability and comprehension, while being able to meet requirements, timelines and tell the story of the work.
Leverage and extend the use of established design system, style guide, patterns and assets in the creation of UX analysis, solutions, and deliverable.
Actively contribute to the wider UX community, possibly mentoring and developing others, leveraging your strengths to help others grow.






What do you need to bring:




5+ years of UX Product Design experience.
BA/BS + 2 years or Master’s degree +1 year’s experience in the field of user experience, design, research or related fields; for example, Design, Information Architecture, Human Factors/HCI, Psychology, Cognitive Sciences OR alternative equivalent project/design portfolio experience
Experience concepting and designing digital interactive for web and mobile.
Understanding of industry trends and today's creative landscape—how users engage with content, and trends within web and mobile.
A positive, high-transparency, and collaborative approach to your work.
Expertise in typography, composition, color, layout, design thinking, and content strategy in the design solutions you create.
Familiarity and experience with standard design, prototyping and user research tools, such as Figma, Miro, Adobe CS, Validately or usertesting.com.
Experience across products and platforms, mobile apps, financial services expertise an advantage.






We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don't hesitate to apply.

At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.

Our Company




Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.




We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!




The Opportunity




Are you a passionate designer ready to imagine, iterate, and execute across multiple design directions and workflows? Are you someone who favors interactive prototypes over flat mockups? Perhaps someone who also has a keen business sense and the ability to craft design directions that are creative and scale Adobe’s design products?




This is your opportunity to join a dynamic, growing team, think holistically about design, and help build the future of productivity tools for professionals like you.




All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols.




What You’ll Do




Have meaningful ownership. You’ll make important decisions about the way our internal product looks, feels, and behaves.
Critique and be critiqued. We value a positive personality who can give and take healthy feedback, encourage and develop the team’s ideas, and generally leave ego out of it.
Help drive the design process. From early vision concepts, to wireframes, to visual design and on to pixel-perfect delivery, our team does it all.
Understand and advocate for our users. Work with product managers, project managers and consultants to shape the tool they use every day.
Grow. You’ll sharpen your skills, take ownership of important aspects of the design, and help evolve our team as we continue to learn and tune our process.
Collaborate. You’ll be part of a communicative, healthy, product development family that includes products managers, engineers, and other designers.
Ship. We ship. You’ll have multiple opportunities to bring the hypothetical to the actual and enjoy seeing your work in the hands of thousands of internal users.




What You Need to Succeed




Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s in interaction design, new media design, HCI, or a related design field; or equivalent experience required graduating either December 2023 or May 2024
Ability to participate in an internship from May - September 2023
Previous project, internship or work experience in UX/UI design or related fields.
Experience working in teams with many moving parts.
Experience working with or conducting your own research, presenting results, and acting on those results.
Awareness of how visual design languages and UI frameworks affect the design process.
Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
Desire to be part of a fun, tight-knit team.
Love for all things design.
Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September




If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.




Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.




Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $26.00 -- $30.00 hourly. Your recruiter can share more about the specific pay rate for your job location during the hiring process.

Our Company




Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.




We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!




The Opportunity




Are you a passionate designer ready to imagine, iterate, and execute across multiple design directions and workflows? Are you someone who favors interactive prototypes over flat mockups? Perhaps someone who also has a keen business sense and the ability to craft design directions that are creative and scale Adobe’s design products?




This is your opportunity to join a dynamic, growing team, think holistically about design, and help build the future of productivity tools for professionals like you.




All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols.




What You’ll Do




Have meaningful ownership. You’ll make important decisions about the way our internal product looks, feels, and behaves.
Critique and be critiqued. We value a positive personality who can give and take healthy feedback, encourage and develop the team’s ideas, and generally leave ego out of it.
Help drive the design process. From early vision concepts, to wireframes, to visual design and on to pixel-perfect delivery, our team does it all.
Understand and advocate for our users. Work with product managers, project managers and consultants to shape the tool they use every day.
Grow. You’ll sharpen your skills, take ownership of important aspects of the design, and help evolve our team as we continue to learn and tune our process.
Collaborate. You’ll be part of a communicative, healthy, product development family that includes products managers, engineers, and other designers.
Ship. We ship. You’ll have multiple opportunities to bring the hypothetical to the actual and enjoy seeing your work in the hands of thousands of internal users.




What You Need to Succeed




Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s in interaction design, new media design, HCI, or a related design field; or equivalent experience required graduating either December 2023 or May 2024
Ability to participate in an internship from May - September 2023
Previous project, internship or work experience in UX/UI design or related fields.
Experience working in teams with many moving parts.
Experience working with or conducting your own research, presenting results, and acting on those results.
Awareness of how visual design languages and UI frameworks affect the design process.
Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
Desire to be part of a fun, tight-knit team.
Love for all things design.
Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September




If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.




Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

At Morgan & Morgan, the work we do matters. For millions of Americans, we’re their last line of defense against insurance companies, large corporations or defective goods. From attorneys to client support staff, creative marketing to operations teams, every member of our firm has a key role to play in the winning fight for consumer rights. Our over 3,000 employees are all united by one mission: For the People.




Summary




At Morgan & Morgan, we’re constantly challenging people’s idea of what an injury law firm can be. We are in a unique position as the largest injury firm in the world to continuously deliver a delightful and consistent client experience for people facing the greatest challenge of their lives.




The Morgan Labs team is on a mission to transform how legal services are delivered by leveraging technology and automation. We build products and experiences for Morgan & Morgan’s clients, employees, and partners. From tools that make it easier for clients to start their case, using AI to process documents intelligently, bringing transparency to our clients in an opaque industry, we do it all.




User-centered design is at the forefront of how we create intuitive and innovative products that our users love and depend on each day. We strive to design impactful solutions that are grounded in research, on-brand and repeatedly tested. We simultaneously blend the solving of our users’ needs with hitting our larger company goals.




The UX Designer will be crucial to delivering on the needs of various teams, so a tight process is crucial. You’ll work closely with product managers, researchers and stakeholders throughout the product development lifecycle. You’ll be expected to generate and deliver ideas quickly, via lo-fi sketching and hi-fi prototypes. You’ll be counted on to maintain and expand our nascent design system, and champion the user experience.




You relish the chance to present and defend solutions, and can seamlessly tie designs back to research and data. Your communication skills are as refined as your design skills.




This is a hybrid/in-office position. Mandatory in office attendance is required 2 days a week but may increase in time.




Responsibilities




Design crystal-clear, high fidelity mockups and prototype.
Create laser-focused artifacts (user flow, persona, wireframes, storyboards, etc.).
An ability to balance a focus of a UI’s details, with the bigger picture.
Collaborate with stakeholders and team members, at all levels.
Own the entirety of your work, from sketch to prototype to handoff.
Refine, maintain, and own our growing design system.
Systemize the design process for future designers.
Implement and expand on existing research alongside the UX Researcher.
Support and build out processes with the UX Director.




Qualifications




3+ years of user-experience design required.
Beautiful design portfolio containing real-world projects.
Excellent skills in Figma.
Comfort generating ideas on paper or whiteboard.
Ability to organize your work, document your solutions and show your process.




Nice To Have:




Bachelor's degree in Communication, Design, Human-Computer Interaction, User Experience Design, or a related area.
Working knowledge of Jira, Miro, and Notion.




Compensation: $100,000.00-$120,000.00 + Benefits DOE

Morgan & Morgan is a leading personal injury law firm dedicated to protecting the people, not the powerful. This success starts with our staff. For full-time employees, we offer an excellent benefits package including medical and dental insurance, 401(k) plan, paid time off and paid holidays.

For customers, enrolling in a health insurance plan is confusing and difficult, and seemingly small differences between plans can lead to significant out-of-pocket costs or lack of access to critical medicines and even providers. We use our technology, agents, and expertise to cut through the confusion and get customers enrolled in a plan with the right coverage and benefits.




Why Apply: GoHealth has established a culture where our employees feel empowered, engaged and inspired. We are looking for builders who will contribute to the long-term health of the company. We also understand that you may not check every box in our requirements list, most applicants don’t! In fact, frequently cited statistics show that women and underrepresented groups apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. GoHealth encourages you to break that statistic and to apply today!




About the Role: The User Experience Designer will have a chance to significantly influence the final product by working in close collaboration with a member of the UX, product and development teams, throughout the different design phases. Presenting ideas, gathering feedback and iterating towards product solutions that will help make the insurance purchase process better and easier for our users. You should have an understanding of best design practices on both Desktop and Mobile and an ability to clearly communicate them during product reviews and feedback sessions. What You'll Do




Create engaging web-based applications and products for Desktop and Mobile
Collaborate with product development teams to understand business objectives and user needs
Iteratively refine designs based on feedback from product development teams, business stakeholders, or clients

Prototype, validate and defend your product ideas based on user-centric design principles

Define overarching user experience guidelines
Help build style guides, create reusable interface elements, and refine existing ones

Highly motivated and takes pride in what's crafted
Online portfolio of projects

Our product is all about collaboration and innovation. So are our people. We’re a small team, but we’ve got a big vision: to build a brand-new infrastructure for operational risk management. It’s not easy. We’re redefining the way some of the world’s biggest financial services companies and banks work with data. There are a lot of challenges – but a lot of opportunities to think and act creatively, too.

Backed by banks (JP Morgan, Citi, Barclays, Lloyds, BNP) and ratings agencies, Acin helps banks objectively manage their risk control landscape. Based on a network of peers, Acin’s data protocols connect a bank’s risk control data across their firm and industry leading to greater cost savings, and creating huge efficiency savings across the bank both in front and back-office operations.

The role:

As a UX Designer, you will lead parts of product discovery to identify, validate, and propose solutions to solve problems of our customers and internal users. Reporting to our Senior UX Designer, you will be working alongside our Senior UI Designer, Product Managers, Engineers, and Customers to shape Acin’s market leading product. You will be primarily focussed on our AI data product, enabling Acin to process and transform data at scale, to provide value and insight to our customers.

Your activities will include:

Interviewing customers and internal subject matter experts
Using other exploratory user research techniques appropriate to the context
Analysing findings from user research
Ideating solutions within a group of designers and non-designers
Proposing user journey flows for customers with different needs
Producing low to mid fidelity sketches, wireframe, and prototypes
Testing and validating prototypes with users
Working closely with our UI Designers to deliver high fidelity designs that are ready for delivery
Supporting Product Managers to define user stories and acceptance criteria for delivery
Contributing to increasing UX maturity within Acin’s design team and organisation
Providing feedback to other members of the design team


Requirements

We would love to speak to you if you:

Can demonstrate experience in designing B2B product
Worked before in fast-paced SaaS start-up or technology scale-up
Are skilled in using low and mid fidelity prototyping tools


Additionally, it would be great if you are:

Excited about working on data rich and workflow products
Passionate about UX trends and blending human centred design with agile environment
Familiar with Figma

At Ohme we’re on a mission to make the global transition to green energy faster, easier and more affordable. Our intelligent electric vehicle charger, mobile app and web platform are already helping many customers save money and manage their energy smarter.

Now is an exciting time to join the Ohme team - the coming 10 years will bring huge changes in energy and transport, and with our integrated technology, robust data and strong partnerships, Ohme is set to be at the heart of this. Our vision goes well beyond electric vehicles - Ohme’s products could help shape the future of energy management not just for individual consumers but for the whole UK grid, and beyond.

We are looking for a UX Designer to join us on the next stage of our growth journey. Working closely with the product team, you’ll play a leading role in the end-to-end design of our digital products, coordinating user research and creatively solving user problems.

You will help us take Ohme’s UX to the next level through the development of user research activities, design systems and processes. You will be responsible for making sure all design output is not only beautiful but well researched, easy-to-use and delivers a consistent user experience. As a passionate user-centric design advocate, you will be able to win stakeholder buy-in and bring everyone on board with your creative vision.

This role is an incredible opportunity for a UX professional who can think on their feet, relishes a challenge and is eager to help shape a greener future with technology.

Requirements

What you’ll be doing in your first 6 months at Ohme:

UI/UX design of web and mobile products from ideation to launch
Working closely with the product team to solve complex design problems and find creative solutions that meet the needs of Ohme’s B2C and B2B users
Championing UX best practice and user-centric design across the wider business
Organising user research activities to keep the customer at the heart of all design decisions
Delivering wireframes, mock-ups and workflows as part of an Agile process
Building relationships to secure input and buy-in from all relevant stakeholders
Reviewing design processes regularly to improve the quality of team output


Who you are:

Proactive and independent: you thrive on autonomy and are eager to get stuck into a new challenge. You’re comfortable in a fast-paced environment and excited about having a real impact.
A team player: you support those around you to learn and grow and are invested in hitting wider company goals. You’re open to feedback and always striving to improve.
Confident and collaborative: you’re not shy about building relationships and enjoy gathering insight from across the business. You can communicate design concepts in a simple and accessible way.
Our ideal candidate will have:

4-5 years’ min experience in a UX or Product Design role
A good understanding of UX best practice with interest in the latest design trends
Fluency with design tools such as Figma, Sketch and Adobe Creative Cloud
Familiarity with the Android and Apple design guidelines for mobile apps
Experience advocating for users and championing UX principles to internal stakeholders
Experience using data to create evidence-based design (and on occasions conducting your own research activities)
A passion for consistency and quality, with experience creating design guidelines
Fluency of the end-to-end design lifecycle from strategy and conceptualisation to wireframing, UI design, art working and quality checking
Experience managing user research activities using Human-centred Design or similar


Benefits

Competitive salary and bonus
Hybrid office / remote-working practices
Beautiful central London office with outside space
Private Health Insurance
Aegon Pension Scheme
Life Assurance Scheme with death in service benefit of 4x salary
Income Protection Scheme for long term illness
Ride to Work Scheme
Payroll Giving Scheme
Season Ticket Loan to spread cost of travel over 12 months

Description




At DISCO, we strongly believe in the uniqueness of thought, experience and perspective that can only be achieved through having an inclusive and diverse workforce. We strive to continue to make DISCO an incredible place to work by fostering a culture of inclusiveness, diversity, openness and collaboration. We value all different kinds of experience, so even if you feel you don't meet all of the necessary criteria for this position, we encourage you to apply.




What is DISCO?




DISCO is the industry standard for managing, organising and sharing music and other media. We make music and media workflow fast, intuitive and simple, directly connecting people and their work to save time. Today we count UMG, Sony, Warner Music, Netflix, Amazon and Rockstar Games among our customers, and over 250,000 people interact with DISCO each month. Our customers are super passionate about our product.




Location




This position is a hybrid remote position. You must be located on the West Coast (USA) and be willing to travel to Los Angeles, CA as required.




Role




As our UX Designer, you will dive deep into our customers’ workflows, and come up with innovative UX solution that efficiently solve customer problems, based on in-depth user research. You will also work cross-functionally with our engineering, sales and support teams.




Responsibilities




Conducting user research and interviews in-person and virtually
Developing and validating wireframes and prototypes
Creating user journeys and user personas
Creating UI designs and flows




Requirements




At least three (3) years in full time UX design roles
A portfolio with at least three (3) launched design projects (please include folio link with your application)
Advanced Knowledge of Figma and SaaS product design
Strong user research experience
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and frontend development
Excellent communication, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills
Willingness to travel to LA regularly to meet with the team.




Benefits




At DISCO, our employees have told us what benefits mean the most to them, and we've listened. In addition to being a member of a friendly and fun international team, you will receive:




A competitive salary in a fast-growing startup
Office set-up allowance
Annual learning and development allowance
Four weeks of paid vacation leave per year
Paid bank/public holidays as outlined in our Leave Policy
Two weeks of paid sick leave per year
Paid Parental Leave
A company laptop
Monthly internet allowance/reimbursement
For US employees, health/vision/dental insurance contributions
The ability to work how you want. We’re not heavy on rule books. Everyone is trusted to figure out the best way to work; we just ask that you’re available to work with our LA team at our co-working space.




To apply for this position, please submit your application along with a link to your folio.




DISCO is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, we will provide reasonable accommodations for individuals who have disabilities. If you require any reasonable accommodation to participate in the application process, please note this in your cover letter and we will reach out to you.

21Tech is looking for a UI/UX Designer to support our Client in San Francisco, CA. This is a great opportunity to be part of a successful, growing, entrepreneurial international business and a chance to work with many different applications and data networks.




Position can be remote, occasional travel to client site may be required.




Project Timeframe: 12 Months




Job Description




Our Client would like a UI/UX designer to help with designing new web components and features. The client websites will compose the bulk of the work required, they will be redesigning and redeveloping much of the site from the ground up. The designer’s role will be to work with the end clients, to translate their new feature requests into wireframes and polished mockups that match our Client’s new branding guidelines, meet the functional requirements from the Digital Services development team, and fit seamlessly into their public-facing site that’s designed with our user’s needs in mind. For the new Intranet they will be moving at a slower pace, but will be looking to add new site components and features to meet their internal user’s needs; they will need wireframe and mockups created here as well.




The designer should have a strong UI/UX background as well as graphic design experience. We lean towards a simple and elegant design choices and an overall modern design aesthetic, though we do have an existing design template so we will not need to be creating a whole new look and feel for either of the web products. Finally, the designer should be familiar with both responsive design and designing to meet web accessibility standards.




Requirements




4 years of experience creating low and high fidelity wireframes of website front ends and/or user interfaces
4 years of experience using design software such as Figma, Adobe XD, or Sketch
2 years of experience using an Agile or other iterative approaches to design, develop and deploy digital products and services with a development team




Along with a PDF of your resume, please answer the following:




Link to a portfolio of work:
Total years hired as a full-time, paid, UI/UX Designer:
Total full-time, paid, UI/UX Design projects worked:
Describe the sort of work environment that helps you to thrive professionally and personally (2-4 sentences):
Share what interests you about this job (2-4 sentences):




Please send your resume, work portfolio and answers to the above questions to kellie.thompson-weber@21tech.com. Applications accepted until the position is filled. Client may contact candidates directly.




About 21Tech




21Tech services Public and Private sector organizations across the U.S. and Canada for over 25 years, especially those managing asset intensive operations. We specialize in managing large-scale transformations and application implementations as well as business processes improvement initiatives. We also provide system integration services for Infor/Hexagon products such as EAM, CSF, WFM, etc. Our clients range from the world’s top transit agencies, large cities and municipalities, and many more.

‒Assist with all dimensions of design – research, usability evaluation, information architecture, wireframes, visual, CSS and HTML – it’s ok not be an expert in all, as long as you are open and want to learn

• 1+ years of working effectively with Agile and lean philosophies

• 1+ years’ experience working independently with clients or stakeholder and designing business or enterprise applications

• 1+ years’ experience working in design and prototyping software tools such as Figma, InVision, Sketch or Adobe XD.

Why iCrossing

For over 20 years, iCrossing has been partnering with the world’s largest B2B and B2C brands to provide connected marketing & technology solutions that transform brand experiences and marketing strategies into superior business outcomes. Our human centric approach evolves customer experience, employee experience, and user experience across digital and physical channels powered by data and intelligent creative.




We believe our biggest asset is our combination of different backgrounds, cultures, and disciplines that come together to form iCrossing community. What we do starts with our people.




We are part of the Hearst Corporation, the world’s leading media, entertainment, and content company, which gives us access to the most valuable data and insights, talent and audiences.




Join us on our journey of evolution & innovation as we grow our User Experience (UX) team to help transform our client’s digital experiences for their customers.




About This Job

You’ll bring UX research and design thinking to some of the world’s best brands, ensuring our design solutions are built from a user-focused perspective while meeting our client’s goals. You’ll work with a cross-functional team of experts to solve a variety of UX Strategy and Design challenges across different client accounts and industries, from small digital experiences to large app or website designs. You’ll also get trained on the latest innovative approaches to CX, UX, and design to ensure that you bring the latest thinking to your work.




What You'll Do

Help conduct various types of qualitative and quantitative UX research such as field studies, user interviews, usability testing, card sorting, A/B testing and more.
Conduct competitive and best-in-class analyses of other websites and apps to inform your work.
Translate user research and strategy insights into UX Design deliverables such as user stories, experience maps, user flows, site maps, sketches, wireframes, etc.
Help design and craft interactive prototypes for user feedback.
Explore new, competing experiences and UX/UI methods.




Who You Are

2+ years proven work experience as a UX Designer on two (2) or more large product design projects
Experience working on eCommerce experiences
Have a variety of experience in aspects of UX Design such as information architecture, wireframing, prototyping, and have real-world work to prove it
Participated in conducting UX Research activities such as user interviews, concept testing, card sorting, surveys, usability testing, etc.
Clear and effective communication about your design ideas and solutions when presenting to others
Experience utilizing UX Design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Sketch, AdobeXD , and InVision




Our Mission & Values

The iCrossing mission is to Transform Experiences. The “we” is implied, but never taken for granted. This mission impacts the way we work, the way we think, the way we treat one another, and the way we evolve into what we want to be. We operate as a community of humans, and we can adapt and evolve because we are guided by values not rules. Our core values map back to our vision.




Be Kind: lead with compassion. What you truly know about someone’s life is very little.

Lead with Candor: know the line. Is what you say true, good, and useful?

We Before Me: lead for others. The sum is always going to be greater than the parts.

We evolve clients for a human-centric future - creating a better world for everyone.




For New York City, the estimated salary range for this position is between $80,000 and $100,000 . The range for the position in other geographies may vary based on market differences. The actual compensation will be determined based on experience and other factors permitted by law.

Medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance
401(k) Retirement Plan
Flexible Spending & Health Savings Account

Parental Leave
Employee assistance program and other company benefits.

Company Description




YouGov is an international research data and analytics group.




We help the world’s most recognised brands, media owners and agencies to plan, activate and track better marketing activities. As pioneers of online market research, we have been building an ever-growing source of consumer data for the past twenty years. Creating the richest and most complete understanding of your customers’ complex lives. We call it living data.




We are driven by a set of shared values. We are fast, fearless and innovative. We work diligently to get it right. We are guided by accuracy, ethics and proven methodologies. We respect and trust each other, and bring these values into everything that we do. Unlike our competitors, we understand how opinions and trends change from day-to-day, week-to-week and year-to-year. That’s why we have built a platform that gets you right to the source for reliable, accurate data that reflects the reality of a complicated world. Imagine if you could know what 17 million+ people in over 55 markets were thinking now? Or last week? And do so again and again? That’s why we’re different.




Rather than commissioned research that’s already out-of-date by the time it reaches someone’s inbox, our data is alive. So, no matter how quickly things change, our clients are always in the know.




YouGov. Living Consumer Intelligence.




The Culture




Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to YouGov. We are committed to giving the world a voice by capturing the opinions of all groups, including the ones that are often under-represented in research. We are also committed to making sure that our products and tools are free from any bias, as accuracy is key to what we do. None of the above can be done without having a truly diverse workforce, in an inclusive workplace. We are very keen on attracting and retaining the best talent. And best talent also means a diverse pool of talent, with various backgrounds and perspectives.




Supporting the wellbeing of our staff, including maintaining a good work and life balance, is important to us. We support flexible working arrangements where appropriate for a role, with many locations offering a hybrid office-and-remote working approach.




As an Equal Opportunity Employer, qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. All employment decisions are made on the basis of occupational qualifications, merit, and business need.

YouGov is looking for a UI/UX Designer to join the SAAS product team.




You will be joining a cross-functional team of software engineers, developers, product managers, designers, and data analysts. Your main focus as a designer will be taking part in enhancing our customers' journey within the YouGov ecosystem.




You’ll be responsible for researching, creating concepts, user flows, wireframes and interfaces for our SAAS products and services and working collaboratively to ensure the team is delivering maximum value for our clients and for YouGov. This includes testing and presenting your ideas with users and stakeholders.

Contribute to the design system and component library
Qualifications




A portfolio of design projects you’ve delivered
Experience of solving complex problems – through collaboration with various stakeholders
Strong understanding of human-centric design principles
Proficient with Sketch/Figma and Zeplin
Excellent communicator, with strong written and spoken English (B2/C1+)

The ODP Corporation (NASDAQ:ODP) is a leading provider of products and services through an integrated business-to-business (B2B) distribution platform and omnichannel presence, which includes world-class supply chain and distribution operations, dedicated sales professionals, a B2B digital procurement solution, online presence, and a network of Office Depot and OfficeMax retail stores. Primary Responsibilities:

Customer Advocacy - Consistently focuses attention on the user problem to be solved. Asks good questions to gain clarity or depth on customer or user problems and can speak to how work solutions align (or not) to stated problem.

Research Methodologies - Partners with lead designers or researchers on methods to validate design work. Able to use and align to generative research. Participates in research activities and communicates activities and results with cross-functional team.

Leverages modern design tools (Figma, Sketch, Adobe CC, etc.) efficiently both for delivery and collaboration.

SamKnows is a global platform for measuring internet performance. We are used by governments, ISPs, enterprises, academics and consumers, to better understand quality of service and quality of experience. We are an independent company without any external investors. We are profitable and growing, but we do this in a sustainable way.




We are proactive, innovative and guided by our social mission to make the internet better for everyone. We measure our success in terms of the positive impact we have on the world. Our platform collects a huge amount of data, which is used to find insights that will genuinely improve people’s lives.




What will you be doing?

You will be joining our Product group, a collaborative team building interfaces and data visualisations to display home internet performance for consumers. To do this, you will work as part of a cross-functional team consisting of a democratic group of engineers, designers and product managers.




Your team will be designing a platform that helps people observe the performance of their in-home internet connection.
We have a well structured design system which we’re adding to all the time, contributing to this is a big part of the role.
You will be visualising large amounts of data, for people around the globe with varied technical knowledge, by creating simple, elegant and meaningful insights.




We are curious innovators, good listeners and we are devoted to data. We want to design products that can be used by people of every ability, wherever they are. The current product suite consists of responsive web interfaces, native mobile applications and emails. They are at a relatively early stage of growth and this role provides an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to be involved with the development of a product design strategy.




Your life at SamKnows:

SamKnows is an extremely open company, so you will have access to anyone in the organisation. We will make sure you know as much as possible about the company, our strategy, plans and progress. We know the importance of helping your career development and you will have access to a training and development team who will give you a focused training and guidance plan, just for you.




SamKnows is a supportive environment to work in. You have autonomy but you'll also be part of a team. Your team, and all of your colleagues are there to help you. We will make sure you have everything you need, but then we’ll get out of your way, so you can do your work! You will have complete liberty to make your own design decisions. We want you to feel empowered so that you feel confident to work independently.




Your experience and contribution:

You have experience working with and contributing to design systems.
You are very organised, structured and can communicate your ideas across the team.
You are someone who can combine a research-based approach using product data, and user feedback.
You will have a good awareness of user interface, usability and accessibility standards.
You will have experience of validating design ideas via research and product data and we would like you to demonstrate how you have done that in previous roles.




Recruitment process:

Screening Call (20 mins)
Questionnaire: At-home Assessment
Design Task Technical Interview using Figma (1h)
Cultural Contribution Interview (1h)




What we offer:

Team: Friendly team from all over the globe and a supportive company culture
Environment: Amazing brand new HQ in Bermondsey, includes genderless bathrooms, collaborative and social spaces
Pension: Pension contribution of 6% of your annual salary per year
Sick Pay: Full sick pay for 15 days in any calendar year
Hybrid working: Flexibility to work at home and at the office, allowance of £312 per year for you to spend on your home workstation
Growth: Personalised career plan. And, own your personal development with a £1,500 training budget and 5 training days
Family friendly policies: Enhanced parental leave for birthing and partner parents
Financial support: interest free loans including cycle to work scheme, season ticket loan and discretionary employee loans up to £5,000
Holiday: 25 days holiday each year (pro rata) plus bank holidays. And an extra day off to enjoy your birthday!
Health care: Medical insurance includes cover for dental, optical, private healthcare and mental health care for you, your partner and dependents
Recognition: Company bonus

We are seeking a talented and experienced, fully remote UX designer to join the design team at our award-winning studio. This is an auspicious opportunity for the right candidate to champion the latest UX methodologies and best practices on a first-in-class AAA game IP.

The perfect candidate will have at least 2/3 years’ experience on a published game title in the role of UX Designer and be able to demonstrate excellent creative and technical skills. You will ensure that the user experience is both objectively efficient and subjectively pleasurable.

You will determine the end user experience for every single feature with the game designers, as well as create the best possible user flows with UI. You should expect plenty of design overlap, from signs, feedback and usability, to accessibility and onboarding. As such, we are searching for a candidate with strong game design knowledge, as well as strong visual design skills.

On this project you will be involved in the development of experiences for a clearly defined, console-based target group. You will therefore be required to have strong knowledge of player motivations and requirements for console demographics and couch gameplay. It would therefore be beneficial if you are a keen gamer, the perfect candidate ideally a gamer on both console and PC, with knowledge of demographics and player requirements for these platforms

Analyse the objective and subjective of game features.

Write detailed reports communicating the results of your work.

Host and attend meetings for reviews, internal playtesting, and progress sharing.
Work with research resources and stakeholders to plan and conduct user testing.
Identify areas for workflow improvement and optimisation to improve productivity.
You will strive to keep up to date with emerging UX design practices, methodologies, technology and tools.

Provable working experience in a UX design role in game development.
A solid understanding of UX methodologies and the application of game design.

Strong visual communication and game design skills - for example typography, iconography, layout, colour theory, motion design, accessibility, signs & feedback.
An ability to create and work with a variety of artistic styles.
Designing experiences to a strict vision.
Have excellent problem-solving skills and an aptitude for logical approaches and simple, intuitive end user experiences.
An aptitude for designing experiences which meet objective and subjective end user requirements.
A solid understanding of UX methodologies and how they apply to game design.
A team player who is flexible and open to ideas and criticism from their colleagues in a respectable manner.


Desirable

Planning and conducting user research and carrying out competitive analysis.
Interpreting data and working with feedback.

Join the hundreds of talented and innovative team members who are making an impact every day at California Times, incorporating Los Angeles Times and San Diego Union-Tribune, two of the most iconic media brands in the nation. Whether you love to tell compelling stories or want to drive our award-winning powerhouse in new directions, the Los Angeles Times team is the place to be.

Job Description Summary

This design role is focused on creating a compelling user experience that ensures our subscribers obtain the maximum value from what The Caltimes (The Los Angeles Times and San Diego Union-Tribune) has to offer them. You understand that a user experience needs to be considered from the user’s perspective in order to be engaging, compelling, and consistent. By creating an integrated Web and Mobile user experience, you will help to drive feature adoption, subscription growth, and improve customer retention. The core measures for success for our Product Innovation team are subscriber growth and engagement, and you'll be a part of the user Engagement team, including both Web and Mobile experiences. This team is a cross-functional squad composed of expert product managers, UX researchers, and UX designers, who work closely with product engineers and data scientists. The work of our teams is central to our mission to deliver the best subscriber experience possible. More user engagement will lead to subscribers spending more time reading the paper, and incline new folks to start a subscription. You will use your expertise to ensure that the user experience (Web and Mobile) provides users with the most value and the least friction. To deliver a best-in-class engagement experience, you will contribute your design efforts to creating a holistic user experience that has subscribers coming back more frequently, and new users becoming subscribers. You will build products our users love based on insights, data, user testing, and design insights. The experiences you produce will provide vital support to The Caltimes’ business as the company continues to grow.

Job Description

Main Responsibilities:

Designer for the Caltimes’ user Engagement team. The scope includes the full experience of a user engaging with our content on the Web and on our Mobile app
Participate in brainstorming and critique sessions that foster big picture thinking while raising the bar on the details
Work on the entire lifecycle of the engagement experience: design strategy, problem identification, user research, heuristic auditing, user flow/journey mapping, wireframing, prototyping, high fidelity comps, and collaboration with engineers on implementation
Collaborate closely with user Engagement & Mobile Team members, including designers, product managers, engineers, UX researchers, and other cross-functional teams, in product discovery & product delivery
Meet regularly with product managers to discuss project status, goals, roadblocks, and areas for improvement
Collaborate with the User Research team and evaluate user testing and prototype-based user research initiatives
Balance the needs of the users, the editorial team, and the business
Use a data-driven approach to create visual design variations for A/B testing and rapid iteration with rational design adjustments based on testing results
Contribute to the growth of colleagues by providing feedback, candid critiques, and bringing fresh thinking to the team
Identify opportunities for improvement in the products and processes and take the initiative to recommend solutions
Undertake the responsibilities of the role using the tools, software or technologies that may be available or required at the time
Achieve the outcomes and results of the role as described above using the most appropriate methodologies and best practices available or required

Job Requirements

5+ years of professional experience working on digital products as a designer
Ability to grasp the essence of complex design problems and user struggles and translate them to practical design solutions
Ability to clearly and passionately articulate the thinking and evidence that informs a design
Excellent interpersonal skills such as empathy, active listening, & emotional intelligence
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, highly collaborative environment while also contributing to process improvement efforts
Experience designing and launching successful web and mobile products
Ability to gather user research and project requirements to create user stories, wireframes, prototypes, and final designs for user-facing products
Demonstrated understanding of visual design in the service of user-centered design and product best practices
Proven record of exceptional designs and strategies that meet user needs, product requirements, business goals, and customer needs
Software expertise with modern product design tools such as Sketch, Figma, and Adobe Creative Suite, and using wireframing and prototyping tools, such as Invision, Omnigraffle, XD or Balsamiq

The L.A. Times is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes expressions of interest from people with diverse backgrounds and perspectives. Explore our company history, achievement, values, mission and more on our career site.
