What To Expect

Tesla is looking for an exceptional User Experience Designer to help design the future of the Tesla Design System. The candidate will be responsible for researching, designing, innovating and prototyping new user experiences standards, paving the way for the future of Tesla experiences.

The Digital Experience Team focuses on digital experiences for both consumer and enterprise-level applications. The candidate will collaborate with global product, design, engineering and content teams.

Candidates should possess exceptional design skills, systematic thinking, a great sense of aesthetics, as well as user-centered design principles. The applicant must have an affinity for minimal design, typography, and attention to the smallest of details. A strong ability to research and distill complex problems into simple, elegant solutions is key to success at Tesla. We are a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial spirit. The work will be focused on creating consistent design solutions and guidelines that enable faster time to market.

The candidate will be working on the design system for the most advanced vehicle and energy solutions in existence both today and tomorrow.

What You’ll Do

Partner with Product, Engineering, and other desingers to continually evolve and improve the design sysstem and product experiences
Develop creative and innovative design solutions that provide the most opportunity for reuse
Author robust guidelines and documentation by partnering with key stakeholders
Partner with engineers to validate correct implementation of patterns
Maintain and evolve UI Kit(s) for use throughout the company
Monitor performance of existing patterns and iterate to improve as necessary
Invest in building relationships and trust with stakeholders, peers and working groups. Build a strong network across Tesla, globally
What You’ll Bring

Must be a systematic thinker
Experience in writing clear and robust documentation
Demonstrate amazing visual and interaction design sensibilities that scale
3+ years work experience advocating for, creating and building and world-class experiences for mobile, web, TV or other digital devices. Knowledge of global design best practices and working for international companies a plus
Knowledge of accessibility best practices, designing for a global audience and a great technical understanding building design systems
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills including the ability to effectively present complex information clearly and bring clarity to stakeholders and team members.
An excellent portfolio showcasing UI/UX and visual design work with a strong design sensibility and articulate storytelling. Evidence of exceptional design ability is a must.
Must be proficient and highly skilled in Figma and other design tools
Ability to prototype in Figma, Keynote, or HTML/CSS
Understanding of front-end web and mobile technologies such as HTML/CSS and general understanding of back-end technologies that are required to build out experiences. Partnering well with technology is a must
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Strong ability to communicate design concept ideas through sketches, prototypes and wireframes. Experienced and comfortable with presenting work to executives and large groups.
Strong ability to communicate complicated concepts and bring clarity to stakeholders and team members.
Self-motivated, able to work independently but also collaborative and driven by group critique. Proven track record as an expert in design who can collaborate well with other functions.
Strong ability to communicate design pattern concepts through showing application across experiences.

We’re looking for a talented UI/UX designer to help build and nurture a culture where creativity and innovation succeed.




We are based in Bromley, Kent but are currently operating in a hybrid working environment, and also offer opportunity to be fully remote for this role




Role background




As a Bromcom UI UX Designer, you will be responsible for working collaboratively within a cross-functional team (UX designers, UX researchers, UI designers, UX copywriters, product owners, solution architects, BAs and developers). You’ll help craft first-class online interfaces for our customers across our digital products. Working with multiple stakeholders from various backgrounds, you’ll guide them through an approach to create design concepts at various stages in the design process.




You’ll create consistent, predictable, and trustworthy UI for our mobile and web products. Your designs will be both inclusive and accessible, and you’ll ensure that design quality is at its highest. You’ll be involved in creating the design system that all Product Design teams, Engineers, and Product Owners use to design and develop at Bromcom. You'll create digital experiences loved by customers and internal users.




The core responsibilities of an internal design team should be governance and guidance—You’ll approach problems holistically, ensuring your designs work at an individual product level and as part of a unified system. Using your exceptional communication and collaboration skills, you’ll work closely with engineers and product owners to guide the development of UI and support designers in other product teams in adopting and improving the system. You’ll document system foundations and component information and outline contribution and delivery processes.




Bromcom is creating a culture of collaboration, support, and creativity. You are an advocate for simple, elegant, and accessible design. Your expertise positions you perfectly as a mentor to other designers and helps team members across the business learn.




What will you be doing?




Consolidating the UI direction across an ecosystem of products
Creating simple, beautiful UI that our users love
Creating a unified and cohesive set of UX, visual and system guidelines for all of Bromcom's customer-facing and internal products across responsive web and mobile apps
Working closely with engineering and product to plan strategically and define the future of the design system
Using data and user insight to inform your work
Validating concepts by creating and testing high-quality prototypes—User feedback is an essential part of our design process; we learn and iterate as we go
Thinking big and exploring new ideas that will inspire the team, then working iteratively towards your vision
Helping elevate the status of design within the business—We have big plans for the design team, and you’ll have a key role in helping with design strategy and improving our community of practice




What We’re Looking For




We’re always on the lookout for talented designers so if you don’t have all the skills listed below but you feel that you can still have a positive impact at Bromcom, feel free to apply.




3+ years of experience doing visual/UI design for web, desktop, or mobile applications
Experience working on design systems
Highly proficient working in current design and prototyping tools, like Figma
Exceptional visual design skills
Experience designing digital products and systems, not just websites
Experience designing experiences across a range of devices – desktop, phone, tablet
A solid portfolio demonstrating recent work experience, deliverables, and outcomes
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, so that you confidently present to all levels within the organization




Skills That Will Help You In The Role




You’re a thoughtful, empathetic, and experienced designer, with broad skillset spanning UX and UI Design
You put the customer first
You articulate ideas and solutions clearly and concisely
You work collaboratively with a low-ego team and stakeholders
You want to help shape and nurture a growing design practice and discipline
You obsess over detail but also think holistically, zooming out to think of the bigger picture

Intelus is an early-phase Seattle-based startup with the mission to democratize machine learning to the wider developer/citizen developer community. Join Intelus to build a world class IDE for AI. Intelus Duet is a platform for developers that makes AI accessible to developers by adopting programming concepts familiar to programmers such as decomposition and lifecycle management through source control. Intelus Duet enables developers without machine learning expertise to build custom AI models interactively starting from little or no labeled data. These models enables enterprise automation scenarios like customer support, analysis of legal contracts or financial statements.




We are looking for a senior UX designer to join Intelus. We are working to build an elegant experience that involves the human in the loop in building AI models. The Intelus experience focuses on extracting the domain knowledge from the human and uses the human knowledge with the underlying machine learning to build high quality AI models. The Intelus experience is and AI IDE that simplifies machine learning concepts an put them in the language developers understand. Problems we are trying to solve include how to provide a conceptual flow to build robust models, how to guide the user at each step where the tool informs the user of the next best action to take, how to hide the complex machine learning concepts and let developers focus on conveying their domain knowledge, how to provide the right guidance to the developer on how to improve the model based on real traffic, how to manage the lifecycle of AI models using source control, and other problems that will challenge your critical thinking and creative abilities as much as your programming skills. We value new ideas, team players, and responsible self-starters




Responsibilities




Build an interactive machine learning platform for developers to build and maintain AI models
Work closely with the dev and research team to close the loop on new features and ship science innovation




Qualifications




7+ years of experience building UX for software products
UX experience with machine learning system and/or developer tools is a huge plus
Passion for creating simple and functional UX
MSc./Ph.D in UX-design or related discipline

Job Description

Position Overview:

The User Experience Designer will be a generalist responsible for driving forward UX research and design on new features and products being developed within Tiffany & Co. as well as the ongoing enhancement of our current products. This role collaborates heavily with other digital and user experience designers, product owners, developers and business stakeholders, and our end users in an agile process, to deliver high-quality UX thinking and design work that meets user needs while balancing business and technology goals.

Tiffany is for looking for an experienced, detail-oriented and deeply collaborative UX Designer capable of validating and executing product strategies across teams, initiative and channels to help facilitate the optimum luxury omni-channel experience for our customers. This role reports into the User Experience Manager.

Strategy & Design:


Incorporate market analysis, data-driven insights and user research findings to help drive design strategy and product decision making delivering a consistent, intuitive best in class luxury experience across all channels, with the customer at the heart of every decision
Understand enterprise goals and KPIs to ensure value is delivered against them.
Think ‘blue-sky’ and push the bar on UX design. With maturity and pragmatism, challenge the product teams to deliver design that delights our customers and sets us apart from the crowd.
Lead & participate in brainstorms/workshops to generate innovative digital solutions for maximum engagement and conversion
Help design omni-channel experiences that connect the digital journey with the physical brick and mortar retail experience, solving customer problems and finding opportunities to innovate within this space
Partner with creative, brand and marketing leaders to inform content and communication across customer touch-points by helping to shape briefs, guiding content strategy and tone of voice, contributing to establishing KPIs and ensuring content flows well, is coherent, engaging, executes on business goals and customer needs
Partner with the insights teams to inform user research and testing - guiding focus, test criteria and questioning, leading testing and analysign results when appropriate
Partner closely with the IT/development team to implement designs and find solutions to blockers. Test, review and log issues when needed.
Work closely with designers, product managers, data analysts engineers, marketers, and executives to define and deliver products/experiences that produce measurable results that support business objectives while maintaining a holistic view across channels to ensure a consistent user experience
Help to prioritize different design problems by understanding their significance and impact on the overall ecosystem.
Incorporate UX research tools, data, personas, competitive analysis and metrics to help shape user experiences
Participate in requirements definition process with Product and Engineering Teams
Revise and iterate designs and documentation based on continued user testing and feedback.


Communication and management:


Must be a team-player with the ability to work with interdisciplinary teams fostering idea-sharing, and streamlining.
Develop information architecture guides, wireframes, prototypes and presenations that can communicate core features/functionality and product structure to stakeholders and technology team
Work within schedules and budgets while able to manage own workflow from concept to execution.
Build relationships with cross functional team members and executives across organizations, and effectively speak to process, design goals and team vision as a strong representative of the design team .


Research & Innovation:


Keep abreast of latest interactive technology, developments/trends and UX/UI best practices in the digital landscape, and evaluate suitability for Tiffany.com.
Engage with outside vendors to assess compatibility with Tiffany ecosystem and integration of features/software/products. Guide the integration and execution of any relevant partnership
Partner with IT colleagues to ideate on potential innovations that solve real customer problems and capitalize on business opportunities
Inspire what’s possible by quickly producing multiple concepts, knowing when to apply attention to detail, and when to make low-fi sketches and prototypes


Qualifications:


Candidates must have an undergraduate degree in a relevant field.
A minimum of 2-4 years of professional experience.
Strong communication skills, organization skills, and time management skills.
Must exhibit highest level of work standards and keen attention to detail.
Candidates must be self-motivated, possess a strong work ethic, with the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously.
Must be technologically savvy, with proficiency in relevant design and prototyping software for documenting, communicating ideas/outputs/solutions, showcasing flows etc such as Figma, Principle, Adobe Creative Suite and more.
Experience with research and analytics platforms like ContentSquare and usertesting.com preferred.

Why iCrossing

For over 20 years, iCrossing has been partnering with the world’s largest B2B and B2C brands to provide connected marketing & technology solutions that transform brand experiences and marketing strategies into superior business outcomes. Our human centric approach evolves customer experience, employee experience, and user experience across digital and physical channels powered by data and intelligent creative.




We believe our biggest asset is our combination of different backgrounds, cultures, and disciplines that come together to form iCrossing community. What we do starts with our people.

We are part of the Hearst Corporation, the world’s leading media, entertainment, and content company, which gives us access to the most valuable data and insights, talent and audiences.

Join us on our journey of evolution & innovation as we grow our User Experience (UX) team to help transform our client’s digital experiences for their customers.




About This Job

You’ll bring UX research and design thinking to some of the world’s best brands, ensuring our design solutions are built from a user-focused perspective while meeting our client’s goals. You’ll work with a cross-functional team of experts to solve a variety of UX Strategy and Design challenges across different client accounts and industries, from small digital experiences to large app or website designs. You’ll also get trained on the latest innovative approaches to CX, UX, and design to ensure that you bring the latest thinking to your work.




What You'll Do

Help conduct various types of qualitative and quantitative UX research such as field studies, user interviews, usability testing, card sorting, A/B testing and more.
Conduct competitive and best-in-class analyses of other websites and apps to inform your work.
Translate user research and strategy insights into UX Design deliverables such as user stories, experience maps, user flows, site maps, sketches, wireframes, etc.
Help design and craft interactive prototypes for user feedback.
Explore new, competing experiences and UX/UI methods.




Who You Are

2+ years proven work experience as a UX Designer on two (2) or more large product design projects
Experience working on eCommerce experiences
Have a variety of experience in aspects of UX Design such as information architecture, wireframing, prototyping, and have real-world work to prove it
Participated in conducting UX Research activities such as user interviews, concept testing, card sorting, surveys, usability testing, etc.
Clear and effective communication about your design ideas and solutions when presenting to others
Experience utilizing UX Design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Sketch, AdobeXD , and InVision




Our Mission & Values

The iCrossing mission is to Transform Experiences. The “we” is implied, but never taken for granted. This mission impacts the way we work, the way we think, the way we treat one another, and the way we evolve into what we want to be. We operate as a community of humans, and we can adapt and evolve because we are guided by values not rules. Our core values map back to our vision.




Be Kind: lead with compassion. What you truly know about someone’s life is very little.

Lead with Candor: know the line. Is what you say true, good, and useful?

We Before Me: lead for others. The sum is always going to be greater than the parts.

We evolve clients for a human-centric future - creating a better world for everyone.

Summary

Apple is working with advanced technologies to build ground-breaking new products. The Technology Development Group is seeking a Technical UX Designer to act as an interface between our product group and the design teams at Apple, and to help drive development of future facing products. We build technology that inspires people. What inspires you? We are looking for forward-thinkers to work with our group of innovators to help bring their ideas to life.


Key Qualifications

Senior level experience (5+ years) crafting user experience solutions and applications for 3D application and/or games

Strong abilities in sketching, mocking up, and evaluating interaction design

Real passion for user experience and actioning user feedback

Excellent visual, written, and verbal communication skills

Ability to thrive in a joint working environment within your team and beyond

Self-starter and able to work independently, and can handle multiple projects under minimal supervision


Description

As a Technical UX Designer you should be able to analyze the content domain, build scenarios and use cases and craft design specifications for the product. Have you advocated for design at all stages of the work and at all organizational levels, and demonstrate a history of close and productive collaboration with software engineers and engineering managers? You will be expected to serve different roles and work on different projects at once.

SOME OF THE RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

- Producing design documents that explain your design

- Prototype ideas, experiences and scenarios

- Collaborate with creatives, project managers, and executives to pursue complex 3d problems with simple solutions

- Keep up with the evolving landscape of available tools, technologies and resources


Education & Experience

BS or MS in Human Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Information Science, Graphic Design with emphasis on UI design, or Computer Science with emphasis on UI development


Additional Requirements

Design for Mac OS X

Some experience in user research and usability testing Interactive prototyping skills

Technical writing and communications design


Pay & Benefits

At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $121,000 and $230,000, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

Job Title: UX Designer para Bootcamp de Tecnologia
Job_Description:
No Mercado Livre, estamos democratizando o comércio, o dinheiro e os pagamentos na América Latina.




O IT Bootcamp é o nosso programa de treinamento regional para profissionais de tecnologia que desejam fazer parte do enorme desafio de desenvolver a plataforma tecnológica líder na América Latina. É uma ótima oportunidade para quem busca sua primeira experiência profissional como UX Designer.

Farão parte do programa aqueles que passarem com sucesso por todo o processo seletivo. Desde o primeiro dia serão contratados pelo Meli como profissionais do time de Tecnologia, por meio de contrato, e serão incorporados a projetos estratégicos após o programa de treinamento, uma vez que estarão no nível adequado para trabalhar lado a lado com nossa equipe!




Temos um desafio para as pessoas que:




Vibram energia empreendedora: são movidas pela curiosidade, nunca desistem e estão focadas em superar seus próprios limites.
Dão o máximo, porque adoram trabalhar com compromisso e dedicação.
Encaram as mudanças como oportunidades e aprendem com seus erros.
A excelência e a execução são primordiais na sua forma de fazer as coisas.
Promovem o bom clima, a alegria e a diversão.
Sabem como construir com outras pessoas e desfrutam trabalhando em equipe.




Imagine você empreendendo projetos desafiadores, dinâmicos e inovadores, e sendo responsável por:




Liderar todas as fases de design de produto para diferentes projetos web
Garantir a melhor experiência do usuário em cada iniciativa.
Investigar as novas tendências do setor, a fim de aplicá-las em nossas plataformas.
Trabalhar em conjunto com a equipe de Desenvolvimento, com o objetivo de detectar oportunidades de melhoria no produto.




Requisitos:




Ter formação superior completa ou em andamento em carreiras como Design Gráfico, Multimídia ou Industrial, ou ter concluído cursos de User Experience, Design de Produto ou similares.
Dominar as ferramentas gráficas, como Adobe, e as de prototipagem de produtos digitais, como Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, saber o que é um wireframe e como criá-la, além de ter experiência profissional em funções de design.
Ter disponibilidade para trabalhar em período integral e residir em qualquer cidade do Brasil.




Nós lhe propomos:




Ser parte de uma empresa com espírito empreendedor, na qual adoramos pensar grande e em longo prazo.
Ser protagonista de seu desenvolvimento em um ambiente de oportunidades, aprendizagem, crescimento, expansão e projetos desafiadores.
Compartilhar e aprender em equipe, com excelentes profissionais e especialistas.
Um excelente clima de trabalho, com todo o necessário para você viver uma grande experiência. :)







No Mercado Livre, trabalhamos para promover uma cultura inclusiva, que busca a equidade e valoriza as diferentes perspectivas. Isso se traduz em Gênero, Religião, Pessoas com Deficiência, LGBTQIAP+, Etnia e diversidade de experiências. Trabalhamos todas as nossas vagas com base nessa premissa. Faça parte do nosso time!

About Union:




Built for the busiest bars in the city. Our cutting-edge technology rewards guests, increases service speed, and makes more money for bars and bartenders!




Union is the leading guest-led POS engagement platform built for high-volume bars & venues to deliver improved guest experiences and turbo-charged efficiencies. Our all-in-one engagement platform is moving the hospitality service experience forward and delivering transformative experiences that enable everyone to win. At Union, we believe hospitality is more than just a happy customer; it’s a happy bartender, a happy venue, and happy partners.




The role:




The UX/UI design role is integral to our growth and success at Union. You’ll be working with our product managers, clients, internal teams, and development teams to create the best bar and restaurant products on the market. 




This position is responsible for designing new experiences for all Union products: iPad-based point of sale application, manager portal web application, iOS, and Android-based Union Mobile native app, and our new Alcohol brand software.




We'd like someone with at least several years of experience as a UX / UI designer. You must have all the expected skills for the position: create prototypes, wireframes, and high-fidelity U/UI designs. You will work closely with the product and development teams. We require an easy personality,  good communication skills, the ability to hit deadlines and manage their schedule, and the ability to receive and apply feedback. 




Your Responsibilities

Create wireframes based on specification sheets from the Product Manager
Create UX/UI guidelines and processes 
Collaborate with the Product Manager on design elements
Work with clients as necessary to review design elements 
Design new experiences for our products
Ability to work on multiple types of products (iPad-based point of sale, manager portal web application, IOS & Android native apps)

What we are looking for:

Prior experience designing multiple products (IOS & Android Apps, web-based apps, reporting, dashboards)
Good cross-departmental communication skills 
Ability to make informed decisions on designs, present limitations and create new designs off of the limitations 
Ability to create a design process 
Open to feedback and applying feedback 
Strong organizational skills, you’ll be working on multiple projects at once
Quick learner 
Detail-oriented
General Wireframing Knowledge
Bachelor's Degree preferred
US Work Authorization Required 
5 years of UX/UI experience preferred 
UX/UI portfolio 




Summary benefits:




Health Care we pay for: max $970/month for employee/family
Dental: $40 per month
Vision: $6 per month
401k match: 4%




UNION is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

WeArisma is an influencer marketing solution helping brands and agencies understand, measure and optimise influencer marketing RoI. We help clients increase the effectiveness of their influencer marketing strategy and grow brand equity. 

 

As the importance of influencer marketing grows and as the industry matures, so does the need for independent effectiveness specialists. Join us in our mission of bringing independent measurement, accountability and effectiveness to the industry. 

 

You will be joining us at a very exciting time of growth, we have received investment from Morgan Stanley and have been named one of the most promising AdTech companies by Business Insider. 

 

We are looking for a UI/UX Designer looking to accelerate their career in design leadership as a part of a creative and dynamic team.

 

We have a fantastic culture with a collaborative environment where everyone pitches in and has the chance to excel. 




JOB DESCRIPTION

 

As a UI/UX Designer at WeArisma, you will be an advocate for crafting a visually rich, intuitive, and user-centric design across the whole customer experience, providing information for management to make decisions and delivering platform tools in an effective and efficient manner through design, user research, prototyping, and storytelling. 

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

Drive end-to-end design initiatives to create an intuitive and delightful experience for our users.
Create high quality responsive UI designs and optimize existing designs for user-facing web applications ensuring intuitive and best user experience.
Create user stories, journeys, intuitive and user-centric wireframes, page layouts, prototypes, mockups, and UI designs with an application of usability principles.
Research and synthesize user data to create 'simple' practical design solutions to complex design challenges.
Maintain design standards throughout the products' interface, as well as continue to improve our existing design system.
Collaborate with various stakeholders and the wider product and development teams to ensure delivery of the user interface designs and design standards.
Assess the competitive landscape, understand patterns and trends, analyze customer behaviour and collaborate with others to improve the overall design, holistic experience, and quality.
Follow up on the final implementation of all features to ensure proper execution.
Work with developers to ensure pixel-perfect UI implementation.
Performing tests for intuitive and best user experience.

 

REQUIREMENTS

At least 5 years of professional experience as a UI/UX designer in an agency or client side. 
Demonstrating solid understanding of web technologies and application of user-centered design methods with knowledge of high-fidelity interaction design, UI/UX principles, best practices, and techniques.
Portfolio of UX/UI works demonstrating quality examples of clean and clear designs, easy-to-use flow and principles that meet user stories.
Prior experience designing for Analytics and SaaS products preferred
Strong background in visual design with an understanding of graphic design communication skills, like colour, iconography, typography, and layout a plus.
Proficiency in industry-standard tools for design, presentation, and prototyping, such as Adobe Suite, Figma, Sketch, etc.
Understanding front-end concepts such as HTML and CSS is a plus.
Knowledge of social media, websites, applications, and digital marketing is a plus.
Experience with creating simple and clear design documentation for multiple audiences (developers, product owners, and other stakeholders).
Experience working within an Agile environment using Agile methodologies and comfort with fast-paced Agile/Scrum environments.
Ability to communicate effectively using tools such as JIRA, Confluence and Slack.
Self-starter with strong analytical and critical thinking skills to learn and apply with problem-solving skills.
A positive, can-do attitude and strong task follow-up skills.
Great team player who communicates openly, honestly and completely; seeks input from other team members and shares knowledge openly and regularly.
Excellent communication, fluent in English, good time management and organization skills.




To Apply: 

Please share your portfolio and CV at job@wearisma.com with high quality samples of your work so that we can get a better understanding of your style and design skills. In addition, for a project of your choice within your portfolio, a paragraph with the user stories and your thinking behind the design and how the design achieves the goals.

 

LANGUAGES

English Mandatory.

 

BENEFITS

Team Offsite trip to a European location
20 days annual leave in addition to public holidays
Incentivized bonus plan
The hybrid co-working space environment
Monthly coaching and team lunch/dinner




 Annual Package:

Competitive

 

 

About WeArisma:

 

With the boom of social media, the growing need for authenticity in brand communications and the recent changes in advertising personal data policies, brands are shifting budgets from traditional media and social platforms to influencer marketing. The channel is now a key part of the digital media mix, expected to grow by 32% p.a. over the next 4 years. 

 

3 in 5 consumers trust influencer recommendations. Done well, influencer marketing can grow brand equity and increase RoI for brands. Yet, 4 in 5 brands say measuring influencer marketing RoI is a challenge. This is where we come in to solve one of the industry's biggest challenges.

 

Our solutions enable professionals from brands and agencies to develop impactful influencer strategies, evaluate the effectiveness of influencer partnerships and optimise return on investment.

 

We empower our clients across multiple sectors with the tools they need to revolutionise their influencer marketing approach, and our technology is designed to be easy-to-use for everyone – from practitioners to C-level executives. 

 

WeArisma was one of the first influencer marketing solutions, founded in 2015 by Jenny Tsai, a prominent and inspiring leader in digital marketing whose work enabling influencers and brands to connect and establish hugely successful partnerships had transformed the world of influencer marketing. 

Since our inception in 2015, we have been powering some of the world’s most valuable luxury brands and fortune 500 brands like Unilever, Hermes and more, with user-friendly software, intelligent and independent data and actionable insights.

As a User Experience (UX) Designer at SLB, you will be working in a team of professionals with a passion for elegant, forward-thinking, modern user experiences. Schlumberger takes design seriously and believes that designers have a significant voice at the table in defining any successful digital initiative. As a team member, you will be collaborating with domain subject matter experts, project management, strategy and engineering to develop original UX concepts, and guide projects from concept to launch.




Essential Responsibilities and Duties:

Create the vision for developing, communicating, and implementing the user experience and associated UI framework and assets for Schlumberger
Produce detailed user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and user interface specification
Lead user experience research and testing processes
Perform metrics analysis to inform design/UX optimization efforts; apply a data driven approach to all design activities
Drive the development and communication of design and experience guidelines
Work directly with product owners and other stakeholders to develop a shared vision of the end product
Work directly with the engineering team to align with platform best practices and implementation details
Work in a rapid development and prototyping environment where effective communication is paramount




Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s / Master’s degree in User Experience, Interaction Design, Visual Design or similar experience
3+ years of relevant experience preferred
Experience in collaborating with stakeholders, domain experts, users, and developers
Mastery of wire-framing and prototyping software
Understanding user centered design theory and best practices
Experience working in Agile delivery environment
Self-driven, detail oriented designer
Eye for clean design with the ability to translate ideas and requirements into detailed interaction flows and prototypes
Ability to prioritize and use time efficiently
Capable of juggling multiple projects and related complexities at the same time
Exceptional creativity, enthusiasm, team spirit, commitment, and professionalism
Must have strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a diverse group of clients and employees
Willingness to learn new technologies and design techniques
Knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, JQuery a plus

This is a 100% fully remote role. Work virtually from anywhere in the U.S.

The ODP Corporation (NASDAQ:ODP) is a leading provider of products and services through an integrated business-to-business (B2B) distribution platform and omnichannel presence, which includes world-class supply chain and distribution operations, dedicated sales professionals, a B2B digital procurement solution, online presence, and a network of Office Depot and OfficeMax retail stores. Through its operating companies Office Depot, LLC; ODP Business Solutions, LLC; Veyer, LLC; and Varis, LLC, The ODP Corporation empowers every business, professional, and consumer to achieve more every day.

As a UX Designer you will partner with others across design, software development and product management to deliver elegantly designed experiences for business and consumer customers. You'll be part of a centralized customer experience team and will work with other design leaders on long-term initiatives in design and research.

 

Primary Responsibilities:

Customer Advocacy - Consistently focuses attention on the user problem to be solved. Asks good questions to gain clarity or depth on customer or user problems and can speak to how work solutions align (or not) to stated problem.
Strategic Design Decisioning - Is able to quickly explore solutions with direction; offers improvements upon suggestion directions; seeks to understand technical constraints and offer solutions.
Asset Development and Production - Develops assets to express design ideas in both low fidelity and high fidelity (ranging from wireframes to diagrams to hi-fi mockups or no-code prototypes as needed). Upholds appropriate use of components, usability of interaction design, and maintains clean document management. Is able to quickly iterate designs based on feedback from design leads.
Facilitation Techniques - Facilitates basic techniques for alignment on solutions and prioritization of work with cross-discipline groups. Co-facilitates or supports active participation in techniques for alignment on opportunities and research insights. Seeks support from others as needed.
Research Methodologies - Partners with lead designers or researchers on methods to validate design work. Able to use and align to generative research. Participates in research activities and communicates activities and results with cross-functional team.
Tool Mastery - Utilizes modern wireframing and design tools (such as Figma, Sketch, InVision, Adobe Creative Cloud, etc.) with ease and can independently adapt to tool changes as appropriate.


Education & Experience:

Level of Formal Education: Specific degree is not required
Area of Study: Not required but candidates may have degree in design, fine arts, or computer science
Years of Experience: 2-5
Type of Experience: Web and mobile UX design, interaction design, visual design


Skills and Ability:

Builds collaborative relationships
Makes decisions using analytical thinking
Has relentless focus on customers; engages with them directly to bring their needs to the center of the design and build process.
Has impeccable attention to detail, from problem statement to pixels.
Leverages modern design tools (Figma, Sketch, Adobe CC, etc.) efficiently both for delivery and collaboration.


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by associates assigned to this classification and are not intended to be a complete list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of associates so classified. Other duties may be assigned.

Benefits and Perks

Discounts on Office-Depot/Microsoft/Apple's products and services
Auto, Home, and Pet Insurance
Medical / dental / vision, AD&D, and Life Insurance
Paid-Time-Off (PTO) and company paid holidays
Health Saving Account (HSA)
Long Term Disability and Short-Term Disability
401(k) matching program
Retirement Savings Plan Rollovers
Banking Services
Military Leave
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Regular pay for Funeral/Memorial Service Observance
Opportunity for professional growth and career advancement
100% permanent remote work in any states of United States

About the Role:




10Pearls is looking to add a UI/UX Designer to the team! This motivated, strategic, and creative individual will have significant responsibilities in our efforts to build best-in-class products and collaborate with our entire team to define the vision and design innovative solutions that address clients’ complex business problems. This person will passionately serve as the voice of the client and ensure that users’ needs, wants, and expectations are always met. If you are ready to work with a fast-growing company that has a start-up mentality, where your input is valued, please apply.




Your day to day:




Create client-centric designs that meet a brand standard while also meeting business and user requirements
Participate in and lead design sessions and discovery workshops to understand the vision, business, and product requirements of clients
Manage all aspects of product design including the management, mentorship, and providing feedback to other designers
Conduct research and analyze the user experience and product usability, identifying trends or patterns and incorporating findings into the experience
Ensure the layout, content, and interactions create an intuitive and easy to use user experience
Provide internal and external executive updates to project sponsors on UX/UI needs and strategies for both customer-facing and internal efforts
Participating in translating complex ideas into understandable concepts that evolve and enhance the product experience through discovery, brainstorming, whiteboarding, and iteration
Championing prioritization of design-centered product enhancements grounded in research and analysis
Supporting effective storytelling and presentation of visual concepts to various stakeholders via process flows, wireframes, prototypes, functional design specifications, and high-fidelity design treatments




What you will bring:




5+ years of experience in Digital Product (UX/UI) Design with at least 2 years working in a consulting or agency environment
Capable of generating ideas and prototyping concepts that are anchored in research insights, subject knowledge, technology requirements, and business goals
Extensive experience with establishing and managing branding, style guide, and design systems
Self-starter who can prioritize tasks and meet deadlines with minimal supervision
They have an exuberant passion for the power of simple and straightforward design and an “anything is possible” mindset
Effective communicator who can facilitate, write, and is comfortable presenting to senior stakeholders
Passionate about improving the experience of users
Deep understanding of strategic design methods, HCD, and UX for mobile experience and enterprise applications
Experience in planning and conducting effective design sessions and discovery workshops including meetings with stakeholders and clients
Ability to strategize scope of UX/UI work and balance being a customer advocate, branding, and user experience needs
Experience working in cross-functional collaborative teams
Deep understanding of custom software and designing across Web, iOS, and Android platforms




About 10Pearls




10Pearls is a growing, energetic, and highly reputed product development company that specializes in mobile apps, enterprise software, gamification, and great user experiences. We are proud to announce that Ernst & Young named Imran Aftab, Co-founder and CEO of 10Pearls an Entrepreneur of The Year 2022 Mid-Atlantic Award finalist, CRN named 10Pearls to its 2022 Solution Provider (SP) 500 List, , recognized on the Inc. 5000 Fastest-Growing Companies List for the 4th year in a row, winner of the Best Tech Work Culture Timmy Award in Washington DC by Tech in Motion for the 2nd year in a row, was ranked the #1 Most Diverse Midsize Company in Greater Washington, and named on the Washington Business Journal’s 2022 Largest Companies Owned by People of Color in Greater D.C. list. Led by an experienced management team, and serving impressive clients, 10Pearls is seeking professionals with entrepreneurial spirits. We seek professionals who thrive on new challenges. Our employees have the unique opportunity of not only helping solve challenges for our clients but also to help define 10Pearls’ growth and direction. Our unique business practices, culture, and immense opportunity for growth help us attract professionals that have an entrepreneurial spirit. 10Pearls‘ diverse clientele includes start-ups and entrepreneurial ventures, high growth small and medium-sized businesses, as well as large enterprises and corporations that are publicly traded.  10Pearls is headquartered in the Washington DC Metro area with offices globally in South America, Europe, and Asia. DISEÑADOR/A UX

Digital Virgo es una Compañía Multinacional líder en su sector. Desde hace más de 10 años, trabajamos con operadores de telecomunicaciones y merchants de bienes y servicios, desarrollando aplicaciones y portales web multitemáticos para móviles. El Grupo, proporciona soluciones tecnológicas interconectadas en más de 40 países, y cuenta con un equipo de más de 900 empleados, permitiendo una gestión global de los principales desafíos del ecosistema digital: Pago – Monetización – Marketing.

¿Qué buscamos?

En Digital Virgo estamos buscando un perfil de Diseñador/a UX con experiencia en el diseño y en la conceptualización, para nuestro equipo de producto en nuestras oficinas de Madrid. Las principales funciones serán :

Identificar las necesidades de los usuarios y proponer soluciones mediante técnicas de investigación, entrevistas con usuarios y stakeholder.
Conceptualizar experiencias digitales, trabajando en todo el ciclo de vida del diseño del producto, desde el descubrimiento hasta la entrega.
Traducir los conocimientos en prototipos, presentaciones y soluciones digitales siguiendo un modelo de diseño centrado en el usuario.
Convertir esos conocimientos en componentes, organizar la arquitectura de contenidos y diseñar el flujo de navegación.
Convertir esas ideas e interacciones en un diseño usable utilizando papel o herramientas de prototipado siguiendo un diseño interactivo basado en el feedback de los usuarios.
Realizar test de usuario (incluyendo test AB), analizar la información y alcanzar conclusiones.

Requisitos mínimos

Experiencia de al menos 1 año en conceptualización y diseño UX.
Conocimiento e interés en el ámbito de experiencia de usuario, el mundo digital y la tecnología
Técnicas de UCD (brainstorming, Design Thinking, focus groups, card sorting…)
Se valorará tener afinidad por los principios de diseño de interacción y diseño visual.
Herramientas de prototipado (Sketch, XD, Figma o similares)
Habilidad para trabajar en equipo y comunicar efectivamente ideas complejas al resto de perfiles del equipo.
El candidato/a tiene que poder desenvolver en inglés, tanto a nivel escrito como oral.

Te ofrecemos

Te ofrecemos la incorporación en una compañía Multinacional líder en el mercado y con presencia en más de 160 países. Formando parte de un equipo trabajo multidisciplinar donde podrás crear experiencias que satisfagan a los usuarios finales y aporten valor en el negocio de nuestros clientes. Contrato a través de consultora externa. Paquete salarial competitivo en el mercado y beneficios sociales.

Si estás interesad@ adjúntanos tu cv. Es importante incluir porfolio de conceptualización y diseño UX.

Deutsche Telekom is one of the world's leading integrated telecommunications companies, with some 248 million mobile customers, 26 million fixed-network lines, and 22 million broadband lines. Deutsche Telekom is present in more than 50 countries including the US.

Leading in customer experience, leading in technology, and leading in business productivity. With these aspirations, Deutsche Telekom is targeting further growth. About You

You are passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. You are passionate about resolving user pain points through great design and are open to recieving feedback and constructive criticism.

About The Role

We are looking for a user-experience (UX) designer able to understand our business requirements and any technical limitations, as well as be responsible for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mockups and prototypes.

You will also be expected to design the overall functionality of the product, and in order to ensure a great user experience, iterate upon it in accordance with user-testing.

You will research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies while collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.

About Wazoku

Will you help to provide clean water to schools in Mexico? To find a better solution to protect astronauts? To invent the next multi-billion market breakthrough? At Wazoku, that’s exactly what we achieve as we; change the world, one idea at a time.

We do this through our enterprise innovation platform that help organisations to find that one person who has that one idea wherever they are to solve their smallest to biggest problems to generate solutions that truly change the world. We work with Global 2000 organisations from the likes of NASA to Nissan and GSK, helping them discover new products and services, continuous improvements, but also ways to sustain our planet.

Wouldn’t you want to be part of this? To be involved in a new breakthrough idea that helped change the world into a better place? If so – we would love to hear from you!

Responsibilities

Translate concepts and specifications into user flows, wireframes, mockups and hi-fi UI prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
Facilitate our overall product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for the Wazoku platform.
Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
Identify design problems and suggest user experience improvements.
Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.
Take a user-centered and persona defined design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
Conduct user- interviews and research.
Ask questions, take risks and champion new ideas


Requirements

Previous UX design experience. If you have previous experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments this will be a bonus!
Expertise in standard UX software such as Figma, Adobe CC, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, Balsamiq, Framer, or any other best practise design tools is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript knowledge is a plus.
Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.
Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions.
A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.
Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.
Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.
A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking.
Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.


At Wazoku we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles

Complimentary Mental health service – We are partnered with InsideOut, an on-demand mental health platform, dedicated to breaking down social stigma and opening up the mental health conversation. Everyone has mental health and we couldn't support their mission more. Employees can join at any time
Social Events – Including company offsites, summer & Christmas parties, charity engagement and more
Great vouchers and offers through our Thanks Ben platform
£30 per month to spend on your own personal Health and Wellbeing

Job Description




We are on the lookout for a UX Designer who has experience with design software, wireframe tools, journey mapping and has a portfolio of design work for web and mobile applications. In this role, the UX Designer has the ability to translate a vision of customer or user experience into requirements and understands best in class design and usability. Collaborating with Product Owners, you own customer and user experience documentation for the assigned initiatives and delivering wireframes, prototypes and usability testing.




Responsibilities in this role include but are not limited to:




Consult with stakeholders and product owners to understand goals and objectives
Research best practices and analyze competitors and effectively explain research results
Create wireframes, storyboards, screen flows, for ideation
Rapidly develop user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and full-fidelity mockups
Conduct usability tests
Build re-useable design components for current and future use including design systems
Collaborate with Product Owners, engineers, and other stakeholders to execute and deliver end-to-end product designs for multiple features
Ensure user and stakeholder feedback is validated before finalizing designs and submitting to development
Develop UX cycles that release pieces of design for development
Ensure technical feasibility of UX designs
Deliver finished resources ready for developers to incorporate into the application
Optimize designs for maximum speed and scalability
Actively educate yourself on new design trends and concepts to improve delivery of designs




Qualifications




BA or degree from design school
UX/UI design or graphic design certification
3-5+ years UI and UX experience building consumer software on web and mobile, or equivalent education experience
Proven work experience as a UI/UX designer or similar role
Portfolio of design work for web and mobile applications
Understanding of web development including HTML5, CSS3
Basic understanding of server side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SAAS
Understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery
Knowledge of frameworks such as Anhulas JS, KNockoutJS, BackboneJS, ReactJS
Proficient in understandoing cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to resolve them
Understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
Basic understanding of SEO and marketing principles to ensure the application will adhere to them
Responsisve and proactive communicator familiar with working in an agile environment

Why members of our Corporate team love working at Sleep Country Canada/Dormez-vous?:




This is not a job but a CAREER with opportunities for growth and advancement
Diverse and inclusive work environment
We will invest in you and provide extensive training, mentoring and continuous development

About Our Team
We’re a group of developers, artists, and storytellers that make games full of wonder, danger, and humor. Everyone at our studio, whether an industry vet or new voice, impacts each game through collaborative feedback, mutual respect, and creative empowerment. If you want to make games that leave a meaningful impact on players: we want to hear from you.
We’re looking for new teammates who deeply care about the work they do, the stories they tell, and the people they create with. As part of the Netflix team, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration.
Learn how our story-loving game people came to join Netflix’s team of game-loving story people.
UI/UX AT NIGHT SCHOOL
Weaving complex narratives, driving stories through interaction, and making players feel emotions: it’s all at the center of our games. Great user experience takes players on a journey from ambiguity to understanding. It’s more than just UI designs and wireframes. In collaboration with game designers, developers, artists, and other stakeholders, UX at our studio means inventing, iterating, and honing in the best storytelling experience for our players.

About The Job
You’ll hit the ground running helping us define and shape the UX of our current games in development. As a new discipline at our studio, you’ll work across the development pipeline to define a great player experience, setting a high bar for design and usability. You’ll fully own this process through research and then build user flows, wireframes, and interactive prototypes to collaborate with your teammates. Ideally, you’re excited about being an advocate for our players and being the UX expert for our studio.

Responsibilities


Own the full user experience of our games from blue sky to UX specs to polished UI designs
Design UI/UX wireframes for prototyping user flow
Build UI systems that can scale in production, owning them from concept to shipping
Advocate for trends and best practices in UI/UX for games, become our subject matter expert on all things UX
Collaborate across studio disciplines to explore, test, and evolve our games



Skills & Requirements


Ability to visualize and present UX in an interactive format
Able to manage multiple tasks and be self-directed to meet deadlines
Expert skills in design and prototyping tools (Figma, Sketch, Invision)
Experience with Unity
Solid background in traditional arts, sketching and/or illustration
B.A. in graphic design or comparable training and education
Experience in shipping three games



About You


Enthusiastic about critique, feedback, and iteration
Able to communicate ideas clearly and effectively
Self-starter willing to find solutions and ask questions when needed
Attention to detail and a desire to make excellent narrative games
Lead by example, creating a strong sense of purpose and community, promoting a culture of excellence



Required Application Materials


Required: Resume
Required: Portfolio

These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.
The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $50,000 - $600,000
This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

Position Purpose




At The Home Depot, we get UX; it is baked into our DNA. Now we are expanding our team to drive new initiatives. As a member of the UX team, you will work with other strategists, designers, and researchers to help craft end-to-end experiences and identify customer needs.




You are a designer with a desire to solve interesting and meaty customer problems. Whether it's using design thinking techniques to drive ideation and alignment or bringing a paper prototype to your user for a quick experiment, you can identify and execute the right steps towards solving a problem. You recognize the value of well-crafted design along with the value of imagination and play in building great products within a business environment.




With passion for good interaction and visual design, you can craft end-to-end experiences to enact cutting-edge retail strategies; balancing user needs with business strategy and ultimately creating delight for your customers. You love to work hand in hand with your users to build a more effective and efficient experience for them. You might not consider yourself a researcher, but you have solid awareness of research best practices and know that research is the foundation towards good design. You can also use evaluative approaches to iteratively improve your products.




You appreciate feedback and support from fellow researchers, designers, engineers, analysts, or product managers in our cross functional environment. You enjoy collaborative effort, taking feedback and input to your UX activities as a means of improving the end result. You are as comfortable influencing business leadership as you are your product leadership and individual contributors. You are the customer and user advocate. You drive innovation by championing actionable user insights, deeply understanding our customers, enhancing product usability, and providing our team avenues to delight our customers. You communicate effectively and share a point of view that guides quality decisions.




Key Responsibilities




90% Delivery & Execution - Exhibits courage and provides strong perspective, has voice in room; Provides UX design artifacts, leads research activities, & tests usability of their assigned product; Leads and participates in research data collection and synthesis; Collaborates and pairs with other product team members to design solutions; Communicates ideas and designs to end user and product team members; Advocate for design centered thinking inside your product
10% Strategy & Planning - Partners with Product, Development, other UX resources; Understands business goals at a feature & product level; Executes on the experience vision & purpose; Actively and consistently seeks learning opportunities




Direct Manager/Direct Reports




This position reports to Systems Engineer Manager or Sr. Manager
This position has 0 Direct Reports




Travel Requirements




No travel required.




Physical Requirements




Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.

Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.

Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

2-4 years of UX experience in an Enterprise or retail environment
2-4 years of experience working with agile software development teams
Desire to thrive in a fast-moving environment

Strategic Design Decisioning - Is able to quickly explore solutions with direction; offers improvements upon suggestion directions; seeks to understand technical constraints and offer solutions.
Asset Development and Production - Develops assets to express design ideas in both low fidelity and high fidelity (ranging from wireframes to diagrams to hi-fi mockups or no-code prototypes as needed). Upholds appropriate use of components, usability of interaction design, and maintains clean document management. Is able to quickly iterate designs based on feedback from design leads.
Facilitation Techniques - Facilitates basic techniques for alignment on solutions and prioritization of work with cross-discipline groups. Co-facilitates or supports active participation in techniques for alignment on opportunities and research insights. Seeks support from others as needed.
Research Methodologies - Partners with lead designers or researchers on methods to validate design work. Able to use and align to generative research. Participates in research activities and communicates activities and results with cross-functional team.
Tool Mastery - Utilizes modern wireframing and design tools (such as Figma, Sketch, InVision, Adobe Creative Cloud, etc.) with ease and can independently adapt to tool changes as appropriate.


Education & Experience:

Level of Formal Education: Specific degree is not required
Area of Study: Not required but candidates may have degree in design, fine arts, or computer science

B2C or B2B Experience

Has impeccable attention to detail, from problem statement to pixels.
Leverages modern design tools (Figma, Sketch, Adobe CC, etc.) efficiently both for delivery and collaboration.

As a UI/UX designer at mmob, you will be responsible for delivering an outstanding user experience, creating a functional, intuitive and appealing journey through our product. You will use your eye for design along with your technical knowledge to develop great journeys for our customers. You should have experience with design software and wireframe tools and a portfolio of professional design projects that includes work with web and mobile applications.

A prodigious opportunity to join our ambitious Fintech at a pivotal point on it’s (hyper) growth journey!

Collaborate with the Product team to execute product experiences in line with the roadmap and vision
Develop and deliver UI mockups, prototypes, MVPs and final products
Manage all phases of the project lifecycle; requirements gathering, user analysis, UI design, testing and implementation

Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets
Create original graphic designs (images, sketches and tables)
Test new ideas to identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)

Deep conceptual thinker across both visual and interaction design with a spirit for innovation
Capable problem solver with an intrinsic passion for delighting the customer
Highly collaborative with other team members to deliver the best possible User Experience
The ability to explain design options clearly and concisely
Flexible attitude, especially through multiple revisions or work
Qualifications in graphic or multimedia design or relevant work experience


Benefits

A competitive salary, package and the ability to make your mark at an ambitious fintech
Programmes for personal development, with options for professional training
Flexibility with working hours – we're focused on outputs, not hours worked
Unique mmob culture, with regular office socials, perks and celebrations for team and individual achievements
Fun, modern and informal office environment with hybrid working

An amazing team, founders and investors, backed by a supportive board committed to our mission to be the global leaders of embedded finance

DESCRIPCIÓN DEL PUESTO




Responsable de traducir todos los hallazgos / insights de la investigación con los clientes, para garantizar la usabilidad de los productos digitales y de crear la mejor experiencia de los usuarios. Dentro de sus actividades / responsabilidades están




Análisis de datos (KPI’s, métricas).
Proceso de investigación inicial (benchmark, competencia, best practices).
Entrevistas a profundidad con stakeholders y usuarios.
Encuestas a usuarios.
Levantamiento de blueprint / jornada de usuario / mapa de empatía de situación actual o deseada de un proceso digital o de un diseño de servicios.
Creación de arquetipos / user personas.
Arquitectura de información.
Diseño de wireframes.
Creación de prototipos de baja y alta fidelidad y probarlos con clientes.
Validación de hipótesis y soluciones mediante diferentes técnicas de pruebas de usuario (cardsorting, encuestas, A/B testing, microinteracción, entrevistas presenciales o a distancia).
Supervisar la implementación de la solución e impulsar la mejora constante.
Requisitos




Dos años o más de experiencia en diseño UX (User Interaction) y en el conocimiento de buenas prácticas de usabilidad así como en los procesos y las herramientas para investigación y la creación de experiencias digitales (web, móvil y app), como por ejemplo Figma, Typeform, Usability Hub, UX Tweak, entre otras similares.
Capacidad de análisis de datos de uso y KPI’s.
Experiencia en la planificación y realización de estudios de campo y pruebas de usabilidad, entre ellos perfilamiento de usuarios y reclutamiento, creación de prototipos / guiones para entrevistas y pruebas, facilitación de sesiones, reporte de resultados, rediseño de flujos y soluciones basado en hallazgos / insights.
Colaboración con los PO y diseñadores UI para crear la experiencia total y completa del usuario.
Orientación a resolver problemas con soluciones creativas, capacidad de identificar oportunidades de mejora y proponer soluciones a flujos y/o diseños existentes.
En contacto constante con los usuarios y defenderlos activamente como parte del proceso de diseño.
Conocimiento de Lean UX / haber trabajado en equipos ágiles (deseado, pero no obligatorio).
Conocimiento en UX Writing (deseado, pero no obligatorio).
Habilidades interpersonales (empatía, escucha activa, observación, iniciativa) y de comunicación (verbal y escrita con usuarios, stakeholders y con su equipo).
Tener apertura a retroalimentación continua de usuarios, stakeholders y compañeros.
Entender y crear visiones de producto, diseñar de manera sustentada, tener mentalidad centrada en el usuario y capacidad para gestionar a los stakeholders dentro del proceso de diseño.
Capaz de ayudar a crear la narrativa de la visión del producto y el papel del diseño dentro de ella. Puede presentar esa visión con convicción a las partes interesadas. Ayuda a los pares de productos y negocios con la estrategia para implementar en el tiempo pactado.

Maisons du Monde de par son ADN et sa raison d’être est une entreprise singulière, composée de femmes et d’hommes engagés depuis toujours au développement d’une offre unique pour nos clients.

Chaleureuse, car l’humain est notre première richesse, notre façon d’être ensemble est primordiale grâce à des relations simples, sympathiques, basées sur l’entraide et la proximité.

Inspirée, grâce à l’innovation permanente au service de nos clients, qui nous fait avancer toujours plus loin depuis 25 ans.

Durable, car engagés dans les causes les plus nobles autour de projets environnementaux et citoyens, nous prônons l’égalité des chances et le développement de chacun à l'ouverture au monde.







Contexte

Notre mission chez Maisons du Monde est de permettre à chacun de créer des maisons inspirantes et durables.

Nous avons pour ambition de transformer l’e-commerce du mobilier et de la décoration en une expérience émotionnelle et inspirationnelle pour nos très nombreux clients.

Notre équipe UX/UI, avec ses compétences en UX research, UX, UI et CRO, est au centre de cette démarche produit comportant à la fois des enjeux d’expérience et de performance.




C’est dans ce contexte que nous recherchons un(e) UX designer pour notre équipe UX/UI au sein de la direction e-commerce.

Nous recherchons un(e) UX designer talentueux(se) pour nous aider à améliorer et différencier notre expérience client et concevoir le e-commerce de demain.

Dans un contexte de démarche produit, il ou elle aura la responsabilité de l’amélioration et/ou de la création de parcours digitaux.

Expert(e) et passionné(e), il ou elle aura à cœur de contribuer au développement de nos activités et méthodologies UX ainsi qu’au rayonnement de l’expérience client au sein de Maisons du Monde.







Votre rôle et vos responsabilités

Conduire les travaux d’UX design de la phase « Discovery » à la phase « Delivery », puis en amélioration continue.




1/ Discovery

- Comprendre les enjeux business et utilisateurs pour les traduire en opportunités, en proposant le meilleur dispositif de discovery (analyses data, tests utilisateurs, benchmarks…) en fonction du contexte et des enjeux

- Piloter les phases de recherche utilisateurs : mener des études quanti/quali et des tests utilisateurs pour identifier les pain points et attentes clients, cartographier l’expérience client et restituer des insights actionnables.




- Mener les audits de parcours client et consolider les benchmarks.




- Observer et analyser avec l’aide de la data (analyses Contentsquare, etc…)

- Préparer et conduire les ateliers de co-conception, avec une démarche adaptée et dimensionnée selon les enjeux du projet.




- Structurer des recommandations d’optimisation produit




2/ Delivery

- Concevoir des solutions innovantes prenant en compte l’ensemble des enjeux internes et utilisateurs en faisant adhérer l’ensemble des intervenants




- Mettre en place l’architecture de l’information, créer des user flows et réaliser les wireframes.




- Travailler en binôme avec les UI designers pour concevoir des prototypes haute définition.




- Piloter les tests utilisateurs de vos prototypes et gérer les retours d’expériences liés à ceux-ci.




- Réaliser un hand-off de qualité en spécifiant chaque détail pour permettre à l’équipe tech de réaliser au mieux les interfaces




- Jouer un rôle clé dans la qualité du delivery en participant aux groomings avec les PO et l’équipe tech et en contribuant aux recettes.




3/ Amélioration continue

- Contribuer à la démarche CRO et d’amélioration continue pour maximiser les performances

- Contribuer à définir une démarche de test & learn en fonction des enjeux.







Vous menez également une veille permanente des tendances, des meilleures pratiques, des méthodologies de design et les partagez avec vos pairs au sein de l’équipe.

Vous contribuez à la démarche de design ops au sein de l’équipe et à l’amélioration des méthodologies de travail.




Profil :




Vous partagez nos valeurs d’Optimisme, de Créativité, d’Engagement et de Proximité




- Vous maîtrisez les principales techniques d’audit UX et d’UX research. Vous avez les compétences pour rédiger des protocoles de tests utilisateurs, des questionnaires clients et vous savez mener des entretiens avec des utilisateurs.

Vous savez également formaliser et restituer les learnings de vos recherches utilisateurs et les rendre activables.




- Vous maîtrisez les méthodes de Design Thinking, Lean UX ou Design Sprint et êtes à l’aise pour préparer et conduire des ateliers de co-conception.

Vous êtes un facilitateur (trice) et savez faire émerger les solutions au sein d’un groupe.




- Vous êtes expert(e) en architecture d’informations, conception de parcours utilisateur (création de personas, cartographie de l’expérience utilisateur, etc...), wireframing, user flows et prototypage.




- Vous êtes un(e) utilisateur(trice) expert(e) de Figma, vous avez l’habitude de travailler dans un environnement de design system et de contribuer à la création de composants.

- Vous savez intégrer aussi bien les enjeux business que les enjeux et contraintes techniques dans votre démarche UX.




- Vous avez déjà travaillé dans un environnement produit, en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de PO, développement, QA …




- Vous collaborez de façon efficace avec les parties prenantes et vous vous positionnez comme acteur(trice) incontournable dans les décisions relatives à la stratégie produits.




- Vous avez la capacité à vulgariser et expliquer simplement des concepts complexes.

Vous savez partager votre vision, la justifier et convaincre vos interlocuteurs.




- Vous êtes « problème first » et disposez d’une forte capacité d’analyse et de synthèse.

Vous aimez solutionner des problèmes complexes.




- Vous êtes compétent(e) en communication écrite et orale.




- Rigoureux(se) et précis(e), vous avez le sens du détail, mais aussi la capacité à prendre du recul avec une vision plus holistique.




- Curieux(se), vous êtes en veille permanente.




- Vous faites preuve d’empathie avec les utilisateurs comme avec les parties prenantes




- Vous disposez d’une forte capacité à vous adapter, dans un contexte d’entreprise en pleine transformation







Expérience requise

- Expérience de 6 à 10 ans en qualité d’UX designer ou product designer, en entreprise, agence, ou en tant que freelance

- Diplômé(e) d’une école de design, d’un master en UX ou ergonomie…

- Quelques notions en sciences cognitives ou psychologie

- Expérience du e-commerce et/ou du secteur du retail

- Connaissance de Contentsquare et/ou Testapic







Ce que Maisons du Monde vous offre :

- des bureaux en plein cœur de Paris, proches de la gare Saint-Lazare

- une politique de télétravail flexible, avec 2 jours de télétravail par semaine

- une vie d’entreprise riche : cours de sport, évènements associatifs, soirée d’entreprise…

- une offre collaborateurs avantageuse sur tout le mobilier et les objets de décoration de Maison du Monde

- une carte tickets restaurants.
