Description

About VORTO

We are building software which enables businesses to be more economically and environmentally sustainable by digitally transforming the supply chain.

About The Role

You’ll work with our CPO and our product and engineering teams to design interfaces that simplify complex problems. You’ll work primarily on designing mobile and web applications with a focus on ease of use and minimizing time to market.

We are a fast paced, high intensity team and can get somewhat obsessive about the problems we are solving. To be honest: we don’t have the luxury of much work-life balance at this point in our company’s growth.

You will design interfaces taking into account the unique needs of each category of our users:


Thousands of truck drivers and small fleets who use our 5F Trucking Platform (https://5f.app/) as a business-in-a-box – like a “Shopify of Trucking”.
White collar professionals at large shippers (Pilgrims, Olam, Halliburton, et. al) who use our analytics and automation tooling to automate their supply chain.


Responsibilities


Work directly with our CPO, product and engineering teams to rapidly solve the highest impact problems for our customers.
Immerse yourself in the business & company strategy to design holistic solutions.
Have a primary focus on UI/UX design (90% of your time), but as an early design hire you will take a “whatever needs done” approach to handle other miscellaneous projects (e.g. design a trophy for winners of an in-app challenge).


Requirements


Bachelors in Graphic Design or similar
7+ years of experience designing user interfaces.
Can quickly and easily understand a problem and design a solution.
Experience creating storyboards, workflows and UI using Figma.
High Impact: You’re a self-starter who can proactively identify opportunities for impact even when they’re not assigned to you.
Low Ego: You enjoy collaboration, feedback, and iteration.
Need for Speed: You are fast to respond to messages. You like shipping, and are willing to make hard tradeoffs in order to get features in the hands of customers.


Compensation: $75-150k

Benefits

At VORTO we are committed to developing our employees and providing them exciting opportunities to grow and prosper in their careers. We encourage you to visit our careers page and read this blog post to learn more about our culture.

We offer a competitive benefits package as well as numerous additional perks including:


Competitive compensation package
Health, Dental and Vision Insurance
401k with matching
Company paid life and short-term disability insurance
Company paid parking or transit pass
Modern office space in downtown Denver
Daily coffee, tea, drinks & snacks
Team happy hours


VORTO is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

We’re on a mission to make the global transition to green energy faster, easier and more affordable. Our intelligent electric vehicle charger, mobile app and web platform are already helping many customers save money and manage their energy smarter.

Now is an exciting time to join the Ohme team - the coming 10 years will bring huge changes in energy and transport, and with our integrated technology, robust data and strong partnerships, Ohme is set to be at the heart of this. Our vision goes well beyond electric vehicles - Ohme’s products could help shape the future of energy management not just for individual consumers but for the whole UK grid, and beyond.




We are looking for a UX Designer to join us on the next stage of our growth journey. Working closely with the product team, you’ll play a leading role in the end-to-end design of our digital products, coordinating user research and creatively solving user problems.

You will help us take Ohme’s User Experience to the next level through the development of user research activities, design systems and processes. You will be responsible for making sure all design output is not only beautiful but well researched, easy-to-use and delivers a consistent user experience. As a passionate user-centric design advocate, you will be able to win stakeholder buy-in and bring everyone on board with your creative vision.

This role is an incredible opportunity for a UX professional who can think on their feet, relishes a challenge and is eager to help shape a greener future with technology.




What you’ll be doing in your first 6 months at Ohme:

UI/UX design of web and mobile products from ideation to launch
Working closely with the product team to solve complex design problems and find creative solutions that meet the needs of Ohme’s B2C and B2B users
Championing UX best practice and user-centric design across the wider business
Organising user research activities to keep the customer at the heart of all design decisions
Delivering wireframes, mock-ups and workflows as part of an Agile process
Building relationships to secure input and buy-in from all relevant stakeholders
Reviewing design processes regularly to improve the quality of team output




Who you are:

Proactive and independent: you thrive on autonomy and are eager to get stuck into a new challenge. You’re comfortable in a fast-paced environment and excited about having a real impact.
A team player: you support those around you to learn and grow and are invested in hitting wider company goals. You’re open to feedback and always striving to improve.
Confident and collaborative: you’re not shy about building relationships and enjoy gathering insight from across the business. You can communicate design concepts in a simple and accessible way.




Our ideal candidate will have:

4-5 years’ min experience in a UX or Product Design role
A good understanding of UX best practice with interest in the latest design trends
Fluency with design tools such as Figma, Sketch and Adobe Creative Cloud
Familiarity with the Android and Apple design guidelines for mobile apps
Experience advocating for users and championing UX principles to internal stakeholders
Experience using data to create evidence-based design (and on occasions conducting your own research activities)
A passion for consistency and quality, with experience creating design guidelines
Fluency of the end-to-end design lifecycle from strategy and conceptualisation to wireframing, UI design, art working and quality checking
Experience managing user research activities using Human-centred Design or similar

Flat is an iBuyer for the Mexican market, focused on solving the liquidity problem of residential real estate, with a deep tech layer to the traditional home-flipping business, similar to what other players have done in other geographies (Opendoor.com, loft.com.br).Flat offers clear benefits to both sides of the transaction. For sellers, it makes the process easier and faster, with the possibility of immediately sell the asset. For buyers, it guarantees the conditions of the property, a fair purchase price, and a seamless buying experience.




Funciones del cargo




UX Designer




En Flat estamos revolucionando la manera en la que se venden y compran propiedades en México. A través de una detallada investigación de datos y el uso de tecnología, estamos enfocados en simplificar los procesos tediosos de comprar o vender una propiedad. Con Flat, los vendedores pueden vender sus casas a un precio justo en cuestión de días. Para los compradores, Flat garantiza las condiciones de la propiedad, un precio justo y una experiencia de compra única. Estamos motivados por el desafío de cambiar una gran industria que no ha incorporado innovación y tecnología en los últimos años.




Sobre el rol




Como UX designer serás clave para lograr nuestra misión, tomarás pulso constantemente de cada uno de nuestros clientes y generarás los insights necesarios que serán usados para guiar nuevas iniciativas de diseño y desarrollo.




Debes de tener gran curiosidad por conocer a los clientes, utilizar varias fuentes de información para analizar y formar una clara idea de que va bien, que va mal y comunicar internamente. Este perfil tendrá una gran influencia en cómo hacemos las cosas hoy.




Principales responsabilidades
Tener una vision clara de hacia donde va el producto y evangelizarla internamente
Elaboración de user personas según nuestros clientes (internos y externos):
Desarrollo y mantenimiento de user personas a través de investigación directa con usuarios
Evaluar la experiencia de usuario con el producto actual y proporcionar recomendaciones respaldadas en métricas obtenidas por:
Entrevistas con usuarios y personas
Diseño de encuestas y cuestionarios
Mystery Shopper
A/B testings
Tests de usabilidad
Análisis de Métricas de usabilidad y experiencia de usuario
Comunicar de manera efectiva al resto del equipo los hallazgos encontrados en la investigación.




Requerimientos del cargo




Tu perfil




+3 años de experiencia como UX Researcher, Product Designer y/o UX/UI.
Background en carreras como psicología, antropología, sociología, diseño, comunicación.
Experiencia en pruebas de usabilidad, prototipado y hand off a product managers.
Conocimientos sólidos en metodologías de investigación cualitativa y cuantitativa
Conocimiento en metodologías ágiles (Scrum/Kanban)
Conocimiento en User Science (user interviews, product discovery, digital analytics, A/B testings)




Opcionales




Experiencia en el rubro de Prop-Tech
Experiencia trabajando con empresas B2C y B2B

Nuestros perks




💰 Stock Options




🏡 Remote Work




🌴 15 day vacation since year 0




👶 Family Leave

Company Overview

Glass Lewis is the world’s choice for governance solutions. We enable institutional investors and publicly listed companies to make sustainable decisions based in research and data. We cover 25,000+ meetings each year, across approximately 100 global markets.

Our customers include the majority of the world’s largest pension plans, mutual funds, and asset managers, collectively managing over $40 trillion in assets. We have teams located across the United States, Europe, and Asia-Pacific giving us global reach with a local perspective on the important governance issues.

Founded in 2003, Glass Lewis is headquartered in San Francisco with offices across the US, Europe and APAC regions.

Position

Working within the Product team, you will help create and craft the user experience for Glass Lewis customers. You will use research and product design skills to identify and develop visual solutions to customer problems in existing and new products.

You will work within brand guidelines (colour, aesthetics, shape, font) while also utilizing your own creative capacity and a love for visual storytelling to bring new ideas to the products and branding materials.

Operating in an Agile environment, you will work closely with our engineering teams to produce innovative designs that balance usability with consistency and clarity. Your approach will be to use an iterative design methodology, to constantly test, learn and validate.

Responsibilities

Design and develop engaging user experiences for a variety of applications utilising user-centred design and related design methodologies.
Gather requirements, understand user needs, analyse and generate concepts, from sketch to high fidelity designs, feeding into a design system.
Create original graphic assets (e.g. images, visuals and charts) to translate marketing and branding strategies into successful and engaging creative content.
Collaborate with customers, product owners, business stakeholder and development teams to design better user experiences, based on research and validated data.
Evolve the identity and brand of Glass Lewis in visual communications, maintaining a library of design materials for supporting the marketing and sales of our products.
Drive the design process through iterations, leading design sessions, gaining consensus, and articulating thinking from whiteboard sketches to high-fi interactive prototypes.
Create product designs, low and high-fidelity wireframes, prototypes, logos, icons, and other design deliverables to convey your ideas and solutions.
Proactively identify pain points and tackle UX problems for our customers.
Contribute to process documentation, design guidelines, component libraries, and best practices.
Use digital standards and style guides to ensure design consistency across products.
Participate in user research and usability testing and apply learnings to designs.


Requirements

3-5 years’ experience in software UI/UX design in an Agile environment.
Ability to produce low and high-fidelity wireframes, mock-ups and prototypes of designs.
Experience working within an Agile environment.
Experience in creating visual assets, including logos, icons, charts, illustrations and presentations.
Demonstrated experience with UI design and prototyping tools (Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, Axure, Adobe XD and similar).
Strong communication skills.
Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite.
Familiarity with user-centred design and relevant design methodologies.
Bachelor’s degree in Design, Computer Science or relevant field.


Benefits

Employer pension contribution*
Private health insurance*
Life insurance*
Long term illness cover*
Supported Study Leave*
on completion of 6-month probation period

Your team




We’re looking for a Product Designer to join our Paddy Power Design team. We design, develop, test and maintain all of Paddy Powers digital assets across online sports, gaming & our digital touch points instore.




You’ll work collaboratively with the business to create innovative products, applications and software that can handle the biggest of challenges - like 11m financial transactions every Saturday afternoon.You’ll have a passion for creating easy to use, enjoyable experiences for our customers that are engaging, consistent and encourage Safer Gambling.




If you want to learn more about what it's like to work here - check out https://www.paddypower.design/ find out more about what it’s like to work in Paddy Power and who your new team mates will be. We’re an open, friendly bunch – please reach out to any of us to find out more.




If you’d like to visit our site https://www.paddypower.com/bet please use a VPN to access from outside of Ireland or UK.




As part of the flutter group, we’re also part of a larger, strong international design community working across multiple brands and disciplines — we regularly share knowledge, insights and experience to build great products.




What You’ll Do




Focus on the customer - first & last - using research and data to define a customer centered approach to our designs.
A collaborator with the wider business; PMs, other Product designers, developers, researchers, marketers, and others on all projects.
Create low, medium and high-fidelity wireframes and functional prototypes.
Partner with stakeholders & team members to tease out requirements and defining user goals and pain points.
Use your extensive knowledge of design methodologies to educate and influence cross-functional team.
Define incremental Product Design development paths for new and existing functionality across products.
Communicate the value of design solutions to a range of stakeholders with varying familiarity of design and technology.
A clear understanding of design systems and be able to make the most of an established visual system.




How You’ll Do It




Focused Product design experience — designing software products/web apps.
Ability to design polished, high-fidelity mock-ups of your solutions using modern design tools such as Figma and Sketch.
A portfolio demonstrating thoughtful problem-solving skills. Walk us through your design process, including the problem you were trying to solve and the research and sketches that brought you to your final design solution.
Ability to inspire confidence in colleagues through your strong communication, planning and organisation skills.
Motivated self-starter who can deeply collaborate with other disciplines including product management, development, research, and analytics.
A growth mindset – we put this at the heart of our team culture. Willingness to own problems. Comfortable with ambiguity. A desire to make things better.
A balanced sense of optimism and humility.




About PaddyPower




Work that makes play jealous




Paddy Power has been breaking and re-writing the rules since 1988, from on-track bookmakers to cheeky upstart mischief-makers, to part of the largest betting and gaming technology company in the world.




Although we’ve grown to the betting behemoth we are today, we’ve not forgotten our roots. We continue to offer great value and entertainment to our customers and keep them at the heart of what we do.




Our culture of hard work, boldness and an innovative spirit got us to where we are and we take our work seriously, but not ourselves! We win by having the best people working well together. Don’t pigeon-hole us either – our company is a mix of sports nuts, gaming innovators, tech geniuses, perceptive people-people, inspiring leaders… and a very busy legal team.




We’ve got a growing squad of specialists, and we make the work fun. Sound good? Maybe there’s a spot on the team for you!




Plus, PaddyPower is part of the Flutter UK & Ireland family – a collection of big-hitting entertainment brands such as Betfair, Sky Betting & Gaming and Tombola.




What We’ll Offer You




£1,000 learning fund
Unlimited holiday
Twice-yearly bonus (with part of it guaranteed!)
Pension contribution scheme
Private healthcare
Flexible ways of working – home or office, it’s your choice!
Access to thousands of Udemy courses
Invest via the Company Sharesave Scheme
16 hours paid volunteering time per year

Role: Business Analyst

Summary: The Business Analyst (BA) works with Business partners to analyze critical business

challenges, gathers detailed project requirements and documents functional requirements and process

flows for SAP-Hybris based systems. This role will work with a cross-functional eCommerce team to

ensure appropriate solutions are developed, tested and delivered to stakeholder expectations.

Job Description

- Works with the project managers and user experience analysts to facilitate requirements sessions with

business partners and cross-functional team members.

- Identifies and interviews internal and external subject matter experts to gain a deep understanding of

requirements.

- Based on requirements, develops use cases, activity diagrams and other detailed requirements

documents.

- Interfaces with Product Owner and communicates progress of requirements gathering and

documentation activities against project timelines and deliverables.

- Creates prototypes and functionality demos.

- Presents functional requirements to development, quality assurance and technical architecture teams,

and represents stakeholders while addressing technical questions.

- Works with quality assurance analysts to create test plans and/or execution test scenarios to support

requirements validation, user acceptance testing (UAT) and system testing.

Must have:

- Previous experience as a Business Analyst for SAP Hybris based systems

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse

group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.

- Strong analytical capabilities to break high level business requirements into specific functional

requirements.

- Deep understanding of UX principles and best practices, specifically as they relate to the translation of

business requirements to user interfaces and the holistic digital journey.

- Ability to create current state analysis, process maps and flows, business requirements documents

(BRDs), functional requirements documents (FRDs), test cases, use cases and requirements pertaining

to data, interface, usability, security and other disciplines as required.

- Experience working with onsite offshore model.

- Gap-analysis skills.

Why Zensar?

We’re a bunch of hardworking, fun-loving, people-oriented technology enthusiasts. We love what we do, and we’re passionate about helping our clients thrive in an increasingly complex digital world. Zensar is an organization focused on building relationships, with our clients and with each other—and happiness is at the core of everything we do. In fact, we’re so into happiness that we’ve created a Global Happiness Council, and we send out a Happiness Survey to our employees each year. We’ve learned that employee happiness requires more than a competitive paycheck, and our employee value proposition—grow, own, achieve, learn (GOAL)—lays out the core opportunities we seek to foster for every employee. Teamwork and collaboration are critical to Zensar’s mission and success, and our teams work on a diverse and challenging mix of technologies across a broad industry spectrum. These industries include banking and financial services, high-tech and manufacturing, healthcare, insurance, retail, and consumer services. Our employees enjoy flexible work arrangements and a competitive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), among other benefits. If you are looking for a place to have an immediate impact, to grow and contribute, where we work hard, play hard, and support each other, consider joining team Zensar!

Role: Business Analyst

Sectors: Manufacturing, Retail, Consumer Goods, Utilities, Energy

Location: London




In Cognizant’s Digital Business Operations, we help our clients create smarter businesses by optimising processes, increasing productivity and reducing time to market. In Consulting, we work with our clients to solve their most complex business and technology challenges advising on and delivering process optimisation and automation.




You will be part of the Enterprise Automation Process Consulting team, with your role centered on evaluating, clarifying and optimising business processes and working with our clients on their transformation agenda, helping to shape their business operations for the future. The role includes clients from one of the following sectors - UK Manufacturing, Retail, Consumer Goods, Energy & Utilities, but it is not specific to these sectors.




As a Business Analyst, you will conduct effective analysis to clarify, define or evaluate business problems, opportunities or requirements for change and deliver solutions using the client’s chosen methodology (e.g. SAFe Agile). You will use your influencing, negotiation & communication skills to challenge business requirements where appropriate, to ensure that solutions developed are viable within the operating environment and are focused on delivering the anticipated benefits.




You will bring your technical knowledge and experience to analyse systems and data, supporting the business to identify requirements for system change to meet the business need in line with the project objective.




Responsibilities:




Clarify, define and evaluate business problems, opportunities and elicit requirements from business stakeholders
Analyse systems and data to drive out rules and business requirements
Ensure requirements (covering business, functional, non-functional) are documented, organised & prioritised
Support assessment of commercial viability of proposed change
Document accurate representations of business processes and data-flows
Ensure requirements and solution scope remain aligned and focussed on delivery of business benefits
Work collaboratively with stakeholders ensuring a common understanding of the requirements
Continuously review and challenge solution scope and requirements (where needed) to ensure they remain aligned to delivery of benefits. (e.g. highlighting of gaps or 'gold-plating')
Assess impact of proposed solutions on an organisation (people, organisation, processes, metrics & systems etc)
Contribute to the production of RFI/RFPs where required
Validate technical solution designs and test approaches to ensure they will meet business needs
Engage stakeholders and ensure full comprehension of proposed solutions
Conduct organisational readiness/business change readiness assessments
Support overall analysis efforts for larger projects / programmes / investigations
Support functional testing and UAT




Essential Skills & Experience:




Experience working with one of the following sectors – Manufacturing, Retail, Consumer Goods, Utilities or Energy
Agile knowledge and experience
System analysis capability
Stakeholder management skills
Workshop management skills
Requirements elicitation and definition skills
Requirements gathering




Desirable Skills & Experience:




Ability to use core analytical techniques including:
Business process modelling
Data flow modelling
GAP / SWOT analysis
Cost/benefit analysis
Traceability Matrix
Organisational & planning skills







We Offer:




A career in one of the largest and fastest growing IT services providers worldwide
A comprehensive training programmes
An exciting and diverse environment
Opportunity to work for the large multinationals and other leading companies
Personal and professional development

Cognizant helps clients to reimagine, redefine, and transform their businesses to create new sources of value and become digital leaders. We do this by working in a true partnership relationship, helping our clients become digitally relevant and enabling them to disrupt their own markets, with unparalleled levels of insight, innovative solutions and delivery velocity. Our entire organisation is focused on turning clients’ initial ideas, visions and strategies into successful realities. Already a global leader in business and technology services, we are agile enough to engage with clients on their most strategic initiatives and have the know-how and financial strength to deliver the most challenging transformation programmes.




What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment. 3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst
Experience with User Stories, Documentation, and translating technical requirements to software teams
Strong communication, verbal and written
Experience with Scrum and Agile methodologies




Plusses:

ServiceNow

Day to Day:

The Business Analyst will be responsible for the design, delivery, and support of workflow offerings for Disney Technology customers.

This individual will engage business stakeholders to: elicit and define business requirements; design, develop, and collaborate with other team members to implement solutions that meet business needs; collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement integrated solutions; provide Scrum support for a major project initiative.

The role will help service owners and stakeholders achieve business benefits by ensuring that requirements for both the end user and the delivery team are considered and included. The role will advise the technology customer on which functionality is important to their product set and target customer base and will be responsible for documenting any required business changes from the standard functionality of service catalog.

The role requires extended understanding of business processes and practices and an end user mentality; strong business analysis skills; strong project management and communication skills. The role will interface with multiple departments across Technology and our End User communities. This role will also require some Scrum experience, with approx. 25% of the role dedicated to managing project planning and sprints, in conjunction with the functional team and project resources.

Activities include:

• Work with technology and end user communities to understand business processes and elicit, define, analyze, and document requirements. Lead discussions and workshops mapping business requirements.

• Collaborate with functional and technical teams across Disney Technology to define, design and deliver robust integrated solutions that meet business needs, follow industry best practices, leverage standard application functionality, adhere to application design guidelines, strategies, best practices, knowledge of the requirements and past project delivery experience to help identify risks and prioritize tasks.

• Ensure quality and relevance of user requirements, functional specifications, technical specifications, data models, and process flow diagrams to control engagement scope, sustain high delivery quality and ultimately deliver the project successfully.

• Create deliverables according to the Software Development Lifecycle such as user stories, requirements documentation, functional and technical specifications, test cases, and system documentation.

• Create integrated test cases to cover business processes and system functions; collaborate with QA resources to execute tests; analyze and resolve defects.

• Collaborate with business partners throughout the development lifecycle to ensure solutions will meet business needs and deliver the desired benefits.

• Facilitate resolution of cross-team business issues.

• Collaborate with business partners on deployment including training, change management, and communications.

• Manage own work to deliver according to project schedules; be accountable for delivery.

• Apply project management standards and concepts; prepare work estimates and work schedules; create and update documentation including project plans, user stories and manage the sprint backlog.

• Support production systems; proactively work to analyze and resolve production problems in a timely manner. Assess and resolve end user service requests. Contribute to continuous improvement processes including identification of root cause and corrective actions.

• Identify opportunities to leverage applications to improve business processes, and support business re-engineering efforts. Research and represent industry best practices.

About the Role:

We are currently recruiting for a Business Analyst with a bias towards FinTech, who enjoys working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Reporting into a Senior Business Analyst, you will work with a team across Product, Risk, Engineering and Operations, with responsibilities ranging from performing detailed requirements analysis, assisting solution modelling, documenting operational processes, resolving risks and issues, and helping business users in completing user acceptance testing.

If you love challenges, finding the answers to the problem and have a great sense of humour then Satago is the place for you!

Elicit and assess functional, non-functional and data requirements from clients, end users, and other stakeholders, and perform analysis

Conduct meetings to gather critical information, to produce usable reports, and to present ideas and findings

What We Stand For

We are the leading scale player in a specialist market – maternity and nursing wear – with 20 years of experience behind us doing this and nothing but this.

But what we do at Seraphine is more than just fashion and clothes. We help women feel confident in their changing bodies and enable them to continue to express the choice and style they had prior to pregnancy and during pregnancy, whilst providing them with product innovations that make motherhood a breeze.

What We’re Delivering

We are highly international (more than 2/3 of our sales are from markets outside of the UK) and highly digital – we were an early embracer of eCommerce and the channel now represents 90% of our revenue. We’re also a digital marketing machine: acquiring customers profitably from first order, with more than half returning for a second order during the current pregnancy and more and more coming back to us again when the family grows further. This all contributes to market leading profit and product margins and our double-digit growth rates across the world put the rest to shame.

But we’re just getting started. With plans to significantly expand in our key markets in the next 12 months and to add more acquisition channels, we’re really in the sweet spot. We have significant momentum – but we’re still small enough that you’ll see your impact every day.

Workplace and Culture

Always motivated by new innovations in technology – we are a team of driven and ambitious individuals. Fuelled by the success of achieving market leading results, we place great importance on resourcefulness and dependability and encourage inquisitive questions that challenge us to see things from all perspectives.

We do what we love and push the boundaries on a daily basis – you need to be excited for that. We foster the habits of go-getters and are always in search of exceptional people from various walks of life, with diverse experiences to join our team.

Purpose of the role

Reporting to the Lead Business Analyst, you will work with stakeholders to review problems and opportunities to understand real business needs. You will analyse and clearly document requirements, working with a small team to validate proposed solutions. The solutions will involve changes to technology, people and process and you will be key to implementing change and ensuring success is measured.

As a business analyst, you will be exposed to a variety of business areas predominantly focused on back office operations including merchandising, product information and lifecycle management, operations and customer service, and will be required to use differing analysis techniques and documentation types as appropriate.

You will have wide-ranging business analysis experience and enjoy working in a dynamic environment across multiple projects and initiatives at various stages in the project lifecycle. You are confident with all types of analysis and can flex outputs and communication to meet the needs of the project and stakeholders.

You are obsessed with outcomes, ensuring that they can be measured, and that the solutions implemented will have the biggest positive impact.

Initiatives may require a tactical and strategic view, so you will be comfortable defining an MVP or pulling out quick wins whilst also considering longer term requirements or larger scale change.

Requirements

Work with the Lead Business Analyst and business stakeholders to scope projects and change
Elicit requirements using a variety of techniques such as interviews, requirement workshops, observation, and document analysis
Ensure requirements are clear, concise and unambiguous and that they are structured in a way that can easily be communicated and reviewed with stakeholders
Define the approach, estimates and timelines for business analysis activities required on assigned projects.
Pro-actively update on progress of business analysis activities
Highlight and document dependencies and impacts of change
Document business processes and complete task and workflow analysis to identify opportunities for improvements
Work with stakeholders to implement changes to process and ensure the changes are embedded within the business
Scope and document test scenarios and conduct QA across system changes


Knowledge, Skills And Competencies

Experience working within a retail environment and good understanding across a variety of business domains
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to present ideas to groups of stakeholders
Proven experience of working across the full project lifecycle from initiation to benefits realisation
Strong analytical skills including a thorough understanding of how to interpret internal and external customer needs and translate them into requirements
Ability to simplify complex problems, processes or projects into component parts and to complete systematic analysis
Good understanding of data and information flows and experience with data mapping

Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve, and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives, and needs is an important part of our culture. Operations is one of the largest divisions in the firm and has diverse responsibilities, including correctly settling and recording millions of transactions per day, identifying and mitigating all operational risks, developing strong client relationships, and partnering with technology to realize the full potential of IT and e-solutions. Throughout, the Operations department continually seeks ways to improve while actively supporting the development of new businesses, structures, and markets.




Global Wealth Management Operations provides brokerage, investment, and financial services to hundreds of thousands of individual investors. We apply our expertise in serving institutional clients to create new opportunities for people to achieve their personal financial goals. Morgan Stanley has one of the largest retail brokerage networks, with numerous worldwide representatives and retail locations. Our services are tailored to each client's investment objectives, risk tolerance, and financial needs. Products include mutual funds, stocks, bonds, and alternative investments where appropriate, as well as banking, mortgages, insurance, and annuities. The Alternative Investments Operations team is responsible for processing transactions, facilitating cash payments between asset managers and investors, and updating and managing client's alternative investment positions on the MSWM platform. Transactions include subscriptions, capital calls, distributions, dividends, redemptions, and transfers. This role entails heavy interaction with our internal business partners in Alternative Investments and Operations and external contacts at the asset management firms whose products are on the MSWM platform.

Business Analyst Job Description:







It's official!! The people of Credico have spoken and we are so proud to announce that we have earned the Great Place to Work® Certification™ for two consecutive years!




We are a global leader specializing in brokering direct sales services, marketing, and digital acquisition. With operations in the US, Canada, UK and South Africa, our clients include both Fortune 500 and mid-market companies, as well as many of the world’s largest non-profit organizations.




At Credico, we embrace a culture of collaboration, innovation, and work-life balance. As such, we focus on attracting and retaining the best and brightest achievers who love what they do. We offer challenging and rewarding work, personal development, excellent benefits, and an engaging environment. Do you have what it takes to explore Credico?




POSITION SUMMARY




The Business Analyst will create reporting and analytics deliverables that support business objectives. The individual will implement reporting and forecasting best practices and develop actionable insights and recommendations for their assigned clients. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements. This is a great opportunity to work in a dynamic environment with new and robust technology. The role collaborates across finance, business intelligence, client services, business development, and quality and compliance experts. The successful individual has a great attitude and passion for providing solutions.




This position has a hybrid work schedule with most days in our beautiful west loop office, and with regularly scheduled work from home days.




Responsibilities:

Serves as a single point of contact for all projects that impact your assigned client(s).
Gathers detailed and actionable requirements for deliverables and projects that are intended to increase client satisfaction.
Ensures that client needs and requests are addressed accurately, completely, and on time. Responsiveness and a high sense of urgency are important.
Provides overall coordination and management of activities completed by Credico on behalf of assigned client(s).
Develops and maintains relationships with assigned client(s) to understand their business requirements and offer long-term and ad hoc solutions.
Takes a large role in the planning, preparation, and execution of the client business review meetings. Tracks and communicates status on client requests and outcomes.
Coordinates and communicates with clients on all change events.
Other assignments and projects to support the business




Required :

Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Computer Science, Marketing, or Business Management
4 + years of relevant experience.
2+ years’ experience developing reports for business users.
Exceptional analytical skills and ability to hone and communicate insights
Deep understanding of financial statements
Strong technical background and knowledge of metrics management
Excellent leadership skills including the ability to lead initiatives, manage change, and improve processes

About Snapsheet:




Snapsheet is an industry leading technology company building products that make insurance simple, for everyone. We create platforms that drive efficiencies using data and technology to enable the easiest, fastest and most accurate claims processing in the industry.




About the Role:




As a Business Analyst at Snapsheet, you are a data-driven individual with a natural curiosity and a passion for optimizing processes. You understand that the development of the best success metrics, tools, labor modeling, and workforce processes will lead to the overall success of any customer-focused organization, and ultimately improves Snapsheet’s relationships with clients and internal stakeholders alike. Most importantly, you are motivated in fast-paced environments and eager to learn and grow your career.




In this role, you will be leveraging data to build sustainable and accurate models for our Operations department. You will analyze metrics and KPIs to identify systems and processes to improve the overall efficiency and performance of each team. You will work directly with operations leadership to ensure our metrics and planning processing are ever-evolving and utilizing technology to automate and allow for efficiency wherever possible. You will be the data SME and go-to person for our VP of Operations.




Responsibilities:




Leverage data to identify the biggest areas of opportunity for improvement and accuracy within the Operations department
Create integrated database tracking tools for staffing shrinkage patterns (vacation, sick, training, etc.) to optimize staffing forecasts
Analyze Operations data to enable and support sound executive decision making
Work with cross-functional teams to gather, analyze and summarize business data to illustrate insights and aid in decision-making. This includes collecting, consolidating, and communicating management data/reports to track performance against business goals and strategy.
Provide analytical support, creating visibility into performance opportunities
Assist senior operations leaders in the analysis and reporting of performance metrics and trends
Oversee success in forecasting workload, scheduling resources to the work, and monitoring the real-time performance of staff and workload
Analyzes and develops weekly recommendations for scheduling and uses staffing requirements and operations schedules to determine required staffing levels to ensure the organization's ability to meet operational commitments




What You Have:




M.S. degree in Data Analytics, Information Systems, or related fields
1-2+ years of experience in an analyst or consultant role
Proficiency in leveraging SQL to build reports
Experience in building, maintaining, and managing reports & dashboards using data visualization tools (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Sisense)
Successful previous experience working with managers and executives to report business analytics
Ability to tell a story with numbers, identifying trends and reasons behind the numbers calculated and presented
Eagerness to work in a fast-paced, production-based, and results-driven environment
Desire to thrive in a remote environment ripe with opportunities to advance




Benefits & Perks for Snapsheet Employees:




100% Remote
Competitive compensation
Growth and advancement opportunities with quarterly promotion opportunities
Unlimited PTO Policy
4% match on our 401K
Medical, dental, and vision coverage through Blue Cross Blue Shield
Monthly Wifi reimbursement




Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Snapsheet, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.




Snapsheet is an equal opportunity employer.

Job Title: Business Analyst

Day Rate: £500-525 Outside IR35

Contract length: 4-6 Months – view to extend.

Business Analyst is required to join a Consultancy to look after a client within the automotive Industry. A Business Analyst who wants to help industry leaders solve complex problems as a team, someone who is excited and understands the impact of applied AI&ML software on clients’ problems. You will be working independently to build business intelligence - identify new markets and opportunities for products and consulting in the B2B sector, report to the Chief Product Officer and thereby join a young team who wants to challenge what the industry has to offer.

As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for informing and inspiring new business opportunities for our three-fold product suite - in AI & ML software products, cultural change training and an educational membership provision serving long term client engagements. As the company operate in a volatile tech environment, your job is to continually screen the horizon for changes in the market and competition alike and inspire new product development. We are looking for someone who is commercially aware, has a keen interest and basic understanding in AI & ML software and is trained in writing proposals and business plans for new services we want to offer. We are looking for an engaged, curious person who shows proactivity in continuous improvement, and a team player who closely works with the product management team and beyond.




Key Accountabilities:

● Work with the product management function to identify new business opportunities.

● Good knowledge and understanding of B2B markets, such as supply chains, logistics, transport of goods.

● Planning and managing business diagnosis and market screening for our entire offering

● Continuous horizon scan on the AI&ML driven software market and identifying strategic gaps and opportunities.

● Being able to present and write business plans and pitch new additions to our offerings.

● Identify potential clients for our existing software.

● Understand and analyse functional impacts of changes in AI & ML software on client offerings and our competitive position.

● Performing/interpreting requirement analysis to identify value creation opportunities for clients.

● Easily translate between AI&ML capabilities and the impact on client experience




Participate in all aspects of agile working (stand-ups, backlog management, planning meetings, reviews, and retrospectives)

Work with experts and leaders from across the business and develop a deep understanding of business problems so that you can translate their requirements and needs for the team.

Outstanding written and verbal communication skills. Confidence to present to the entire company.

Contribute to an open, creative, and collaborative culture where everyone feels accountable for shaping the future of the company.




Basic Requirements:

BA in Business / Business Analytics with 2 years of experience, preferably in tech consulting
Master’s degree in Business / Business Analytics with at least 1 year of experience, preferably in tech or management consulting

Why Join us?

Our success is driven by the collective talent, expertise and enthusiasm of each unique employee working toward a common goal of delivering a superior customer experience. Yet, in spite of having one mission, we encourage individual contributions, ideas and challenges to ensure we’re always on the cutting edge of FinTech solutions that our clients won’t find anywhere else.

Position

BorrowWorks is looking to expand our team by adding a Business Analyst. The Business Analyst will gather high-quality software requirements in an Agile development environment, perform UAT on completed work and provide clear stakeholder communication across business lines. The ideal candidate will enjoy working with a team of analysts and will have excellent communication, time management and problem solving skills.

Elicit business requirements from business users and subject matter experts. Gathers & catalogues functional, non-functional, and technical requirements for stakeholder requests.

Certification in Agile Scrum, specifically Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) and/or Certified Scrum Master (CSM)
Minimal 1 year business analysis experience.
Experience with Agile methodology, writing user stories, managing scrum calls, prioritizing backlog, etc.
Experience delivering requirements for consumer facing web and mobile solutions




Preferred Experience

Some experience in project management and leadership
Experience in financial services with a preference for fintech or consumer lending




Technical Skills/Abilities

Experience configuring and operating various software tools
Experience in using appropriate Agile Project Management tools such as Jira, Rally, VersionOne, or equivalent
Experience in effectively uncovering hidden or non-functional requirements
Understanding of software systems, technologies and software development practices




Personal Skills

Ability to take strategic direction from executive management
Ability to see tasks through to completion without significant guidance
Organized and process-oriented
Problem solver, proactive, self-organizing, and self-motivated
Excellent communication skills
Customer-focused mindset
Embraces change and ambiguity
Effective listening skills

WHO WE ARE

AVI-SPL is a digital enablement solutions provider who transforms how people and technology connect to elevate experiences, create new value, and enable organizations to thrive and grow. We are the largest provider of collaboration technology solutions, which include our award-winning managed services.

Our highly certified industry experts and innovation leaders share a vision to help people work smarter and live better. We believe that success starts with a sound team and that an inclusive and diverse workplace moves us all forward.




What You’ll Do

As a Business Analyst in IT, you are responsible for the collection, documentation, visualization & management of business processes, user workflows, requirements, and test cases, as it reflects current and desired states . In this role, you will partner closely with Product Owners and business team members to logically align defined processes & workflows with product and service domains and applications. Your contributions will support efforts to ensure business functions and identified needs align to objectives and translate to technical requirements, to continuously improve business outcomes.




Day-To-Day Responsibilities

Contribute to a high-performance team culture that is purposeful, fun, and rewarding.
Establish strong relationships with Product Owners, business SMEs, and Technical Delivery teams. Learn what makes them successful and effective and incorporate those learnings into your work products and the ongoing improvement of the continuous delivery model.
Visualize business processes & workflows to identify areas of opportunity for improvement.
Map people, processes & technologies vertically & horizontally to demonstrate and communicate how data and work flow across activities, resources, and products.
Work with business architecture leads to map and ensure alignment with process diagrams.
Learn and incorporate understanding of epics and features for the creation and documentation of business requirements, acceptance criteria, and change impact, ensuring they are cohesive and complete, properly supporting what the business needs throughout project lifecycle.
Document key objectives and what’s in scope verses out of scope, while mitigating misunderstandings between business and technical teams, bringing clarity to both sides.
Act as a liaison between business SMEs and technical developers to collect and document user stories and test cases in our centralized systems, following Gherkin language.
Support unit testing and quality assurance functions.
Speak the right language to the right audience, incorporating storytelling to explain and demonstrate, complex and nuanced concepts logically and simply.
Employ root cause analysis to evaluate business processes and identify areas of possible improvement where quality issues or process inefficiencies are evident.
Collaborate with Business Process Analysts, Product Owners, and Project Managers to execute on the right priorities and cadence of work.
Collaborate with business leaders and the Business Intelligence team to ensure business requirements result in the necessary visibility for data and reporting needs.
Experiment with and learn new processes, techniques & tools, participate in technology communities, an d be deliberate about knowledge sharing for business analysis practices.
Research and build knowledge of modern business processes and IT advancements to recommend innovations toward future state.




WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

A strong and functional working knowledge of artifacts that are central to effective Business Analysis: various analyst methodologies & tools; collaboration tools; visualization tools
Exceptional organizational and time management skills with astute attention to detail
Exceptional multitasking capabilities while adapting to changing priorities
An approachable and collaborative disposition that embraces continuous improvement
Ability to communicate and interact with internal and external stakeholders in a consistent, professional, and courteous manner in both verbal and written form
Ability to analyze problems, understand nuances, & generate solutions creatively & technically
Ability to materialize concepts into functional operational working models




Helpful To Have

Business Analyst (BA) certification
2+ years as a business analyst or similar experience
Direct experience with Azure DevOps (ADO)
Direct experience with Microsoft applications and collaboration tools




WHY YOU’LL LIKE WORKING HERE

Medical benefits, including vision and dental
Paid holidays, sick days, and personal days
Enjoyable and dynamic company culture
Training and professional development opportunities




More About Us

AVI-SPL is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law. AVI-SPL is an AA/Disabled/Veteran Protected Employer VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

AVI-SPL reserves the right to alter work hours and work location as necessary. Work hours may vary based on client requirements and may include travel to various locations in support of the account.

Business Analyst




About Us

Home. There’s no place like it. And there’s no feeling like helping people create the joy of feeling truly at home.




At Dunelm, that’s what we do. We’re the UK's number one choice for homewares because we make home life lovelier for our customers. And the caring and supportive culture we've created makes this a place you'll feel right at home too.




You might not think it, but remaining the first choice for savvy homeware-shoppers involves some pretty advanced tech. We've recently made our whole company serverless, making us the largest user of AWS Lambdas in Europe (2nd in the world), and we’re bringing more and more tech into our stores. But that’s just the beginning.




Join our Tech Team and you’ll not only be part of stimulating projects that are making an impact across our business, but you’ll be also somewhere you can build a long-term career that always promises to challenge and excite.




Find your happy place.




About Business Analysis

We have an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst to join our Finance team who focus on Implementing robust and efficient financial processes and integrations at Dunelm within both our financial software solutions and the wider Dunelm Tech estate.




At Dunelm we are working in a hybrid manner, which means you are able to work wherever you feel at home, this could be at your base location at our Digital Technology Centre in Syston, Leicester, or our London office or at home, it is a balance of what works for you and your team.




Behaviours / Values

Our shared values of 'act like owners', 'keep listening and learning', 'long term thinking', and 'stronger together' help ensure we are always finding better ways of doing things and spending our time focusing on what’s important.




As a Business Analyst with us; we value team work and collaboration. This means building trust with colleagues, communicating in engaging ways and sharing information to enable understanding.




It is also important to have courage and challenge stakeholders when things can be improved, or alternative options could be considered. Having a can-do attitude and self-awareness will propel your career forwards.




The Role

The successful Business Analyst will work closely with the Agile Delivery Lead, Quality Engineers, Engineers and business stakeholders (internal and external) to ensure the team is delivering the right outcomes for Dunelm and its customers.




Building strong relationships is key as you will help the business understand concerns, dependencies as well as potential blockers and conflicts. In capturing this information in robust requirements, you will help enable a smooth delivery pipeline.




You will also become a member of our thriving Business Analysis Chapter, a place where you will give and receive support to work on both your competencies and your craft with like-minded individuals and leaders.




Your main responsibilities will include:

Collaborate with users, key stakeholders and project team to translate business requirements into meaningful work increments with clear scope definition for the development team to build and test
Collaborating with various third parties to support implementation of deliverables
Understand any technical solutions and validate the work produced by the team
Write clear acceptance criteria (using BDD format is a real advantage) supporting the delivery and release process
Participate in team ceremonies, facilitating where necessary




About You

If you are positive, self-motivated and can collaborate coherently in a team, then this could be the role for you. You will know what a good BA looks like and the value our skills can bring. You will know how to work with initiatives from ideation to delivery using a variety of tools and techniques that will produce high quality analysis and requirements and you won’t be afraid to share this information to help others grow.




Essential Qualities

Experience of working in a Finance environment and/or accounting principles and their application
Strong multi-tasking and organisational skills
Ability to be able to work with the project team on multiple outcomes
Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing work priorities




Other key qualities include:

Previous Agile & Waterfall experience is advantageous
Knowledge of SAP system and its integrations would be a bonus
Experience working to tight deadlines - at pace where necessary
Effective communication skills including verbal, written and presentation skills
The ability to build strong relationships and networks, with both internal and external stakeholders
An inquisitive mindset, curious about how systems, processes and operations work




We recruit people from all types of backgrounds, who share our entrepreneurial, hands-on approach to work. We are committed to creating a full inclusive environment that is representative of our customers and locations. We recognise the value and importance in inclusion and diversity and welcome applications from all candidates, regardless of sex, age, race, religion, disability, neuro-diversity, gender or sexual identity, socio-economic background or education.

Company Description




ABOUT SYNGENTA




Syngenta Group is a $28B leading science-based agtech company, operating in more than 100 countries, with more than 50’000 employees. We are proud to stand at the forefront of the tech revolution in agriculture. Using the latest digital innovations, data, and cutting-edge technologies we want to transform the way that crops are managed and enable farmers and agronomists to enhance efficiency and sustainable food production.




Our business success reflects the quality and skill of our people. We recognize that human diversity is as important to our business as biodiversity. Embracing the unique perspectives and capabilities of our employees helps us continue to catalyze innovation, maximize performance, and create business value. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.




Job Description




MAKE A DIFFERENCE




In this role you will work within a multidisciplinary global team to discover, define, and design experiences that empower farmers to work more effectively and efficiently by utilizing our data-driven solutions.




You will lead the business analysis activities for multiple R&D capabilities; ensuring that cross process opportunities are identified, understood, and leveraged. Maintains product backlogs and creates user stories describing the changes that are required.




Also ensure an effective engagement strategy. Interface with key subject matter experts and leaders at various levels. Work with members of Syngenta IT Leadership to create and maintain a visible and well understood stakeholder map and governance landscape.




Together with key stakeholders, the role establishes direction for IT solutions and related ways of working.




You will ensure that an up-to-date investment portfolio across multiple R&D capabilities is maintained in order that priorities are clear and directly drive business needs & strategy.




Ensures business needs are translated into user stories that enable the incremental delivery of value to R&D through IT solutions.




We all have a critical role to play and add value. Here is how this role will help:
Defining and maintaining a 3-to-5-year IT strategy across multiple R&D capabilities aligned to drive business goals, ensuring business value is generated.
Ensure data ownership and integrity by working with key stakeholders and technical leads to develop:
Data Pipelines
Data Products
Microservices
APIs (Application Programming Interface)
Defining and maintaining a portfolio of investment in IT solutions aligned to a 3-year strategy
Develops business cases for initiatives
Managing multiple product backlogs in the format of prioritized user stories
Ensuring all User Stories are INVESTable
Working effectively with key stakeholders to ensure the backlog is accurate and continuously prioritized
Be an active member of the analyst community, contributing to setting best practice, peer review, mentoring and coaching
Promotes a culture of considerate risk taking
Lead and drive the development of a digital future landscape across multiple R&D capabilities together with key stakeholders in those areas
Identify opportunities to create breakthroughs
Identify strong and engaged product owners in the areas of responsibility.

Job Description




Job objective:




The Business Analyst works closely with the project team within the PMO to support the delivery of change through the analysis of business opportunities, systems and processes against customer and operational needs. Instinctively inquisitive with a methodical approach to problem-solving and strong analytical abilities, the BA works to ensure all questions are articulated and answers are quantified and understood.




Working in an emerging function within CGA, the Business Analyst works flexibly to maximize the value of business analysis to the business, drawing on both their extensive subject matter expertise as well as strong interpersonal and communication skills to bring to life business analysis process and practice to support CGA’s growth.




Main Duties & Responsibilities:




Leadership & autonomy




Provides input into the mission, vision, and strategy of the department
Influences the organization, partners, and peers on the contribution of business analysis
Is an ambassador for the practice area, co-ordinating and delivering training within the department and the wider business as appropriate
Plays a role in the definition of departmental KPIs and objectives within own specialism and is responsible for ensuring that agreed standards are achieved
Proactively identifies opportunities for improvements to processes that BA either owns or is a customer of and initiates action to realize those improvements
Collaborates with PMO Director to inform operational resourcing decisions
Facilitates the development of colleagues and team members through training and mentoring activities
Contributes to the active development of team culture and improvement of employee engagement
Is a role model, living CGA’s values




Business Analysis




Prepares business cases that define potential benefits, options for achieving these benefits through the development of new or changed processes, and associated business risks
Investigates operational requirements, problems, and opportunities, seeking effective business solutions through improvements in automated and non-automated components of new or changed processes
Contributes to selection of the requirements approach and business analysis methods, tools, and techniques for projects; selecting appropriately from predictive (plan-driven) approaches or adaptive (iterative/agile) approaches
Assists in the analysis of stakeholder objectives, and the underlying issues arising from investigations into business requirements and problems, and identifies options for consideration.
Works with stakeholders, to identify potential benefits and available options for consideration, and in defining acceptance tests.
Conducts suitable modeling activities for significant change programs across multiple business functions
Has an in-depth knowledge of industry-standard techniques
Capable of developing bespoke models for unusual contexts.
Contributes to discussions about the choice of the modeling approach to be used.
Obtains input from and communicates modeling results to senior managers for agreement
Plans and drives scoping, requirements definition, and prioritization activities for large, complex initiatives.
Obtains input from, and formal agreement to, requirements from a diverse range of stakeholders.
Contributes to the development of organizational methods and standards
Reviews requirements for errors and omissions.
Establishes the requirements base-lines, obtains formal agreement to requirements and ensures traceability to source.
Investigates, manage, and apply authorized requests for changes to base-lined requirements, in line with change management policy
Reviews technical and non-technical design documents for conformity to requirements
Investigates corporate data requirements, and apply data analysis, design, modeling, and quality assurance techniques, to establish, modify or maintain data structures and their associated components (entity descriptions, relationship descriptions, attribute definitions).




Stakeholder management and communication




Builds appropriate and effective business relationships
Leads on user/customer collaboration throughout all stages of work.
Facilitates collaboration between stakeholders who have diverse objectives.
Communicates fluently, orally, and in writing, and can present complex information to both technical and non-technical audiences
Collaborates with stakeholders at all levels and operates as a critical friend and partner to senior business leaders, helping to drive effective decision-making




Business knowledge




Has a thorough understanding of industry and specialist BA bodies of knowledge as necessary
Has gained a thorough knowledge of the domain of the organization
Is able to apply the knowledge effectively in unfamiliar situations and actively maintains own knowledge and contributes to the development of others
Rapidly absorbs new information and applies it effectively
Maintains an awareness of developing practices and their application and takes responsibility for driving own development
Implements, communicates, and trains out to others changes to the CGA BA process




Qualifications




Fluency in English
Strong analytical skills
Excellent attention to detail; good communication & stakeholder management skills
Comfortable working in a digital-enabled environment
Ability to work within a virtual environment
Ability to work in a team environment
Minimum 3 years of professional work experience
Proven ability to develop and drive solutions
Excellent knowledge of the MS Office Suite, particularly Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio
Experience working in an emerging department and managing teams would be beneficial
University degree

Title: Technical Business Analyst




Job Description

The transportation industry has no shortage of complex problems requiring creative solutions to scale efficiently. In this role, you will lead engineering teams and work closely with products to deliver best-in-class software to address those industry problems.




Responsibilities:

Manage the development lifecycle with an iterative and incremental approach for multiple teams
Manage risk, dependencies, releases and cross-team coordination
Facilitate recurring and ad hoc meetings within the development lifecycle (Stand-up, Sprint Planning, Refinement, Sprint Review, Sprint Retrospective)
Guide the Product Manager and Development Team on effective backlog management and help create backlog items when needed
Identify and remove impediments and interruptions to team productivity
Teach teams how to estimate and ensure backlog items are estimated prior to Sprint Planning
Define test cases and assist with manual testing duties (regression and sprint-level)
Help teams triage, investigate and resolve defects
Create meaningful Jira dashboards that provide real-time transparency into the status of sprints and projects (burndown, velocity, defect rates, etc.)
Collaborate with stakeholders to translate strategy into prioritized requirements
Work with engineering teams to create requirements (epics) around key product areas and help prioritize the backlog based on these requirements
Develop measures for understanding product feature success
Develop an understanding of Client's users and act as an advocate for their needs Customer-facing.




Requirements

4+ years of experience leading or managing teams and projects in a software environment
Experience with customer engagement/customer-facing roles
Strong communication and meeting facilitation skills
Experience in the logistics industry is a plus
Jira experience a plus
Project Management or Agile certification a plus.




Benefits include comprehensive healthcare, dental & vision, 401k plan PTO, etc.

Title: Business Analyst IV (Product Owner)

Location: Charlotte, NC, Dallas, TX, or New Jersey (hybrid)

Duration: 12-month C2H




Position Summary

This role is responsible for maximizing the value for a product. Key responsibilities include defining the vision and roadmap for the product, defining and prioritizing stories in the product backlog, and articulating this to both stakeholders and the development team. This role works closely with stakeholders to understand their needs, and with the Product Manager in a scaled Agile model, to ensure there is alignment. They are developing in the role of a Product Owner, possessing a working knowledge of the product, and basic understanding of the business or technology domain.




Required Skills




Business Products & Strategy: Working knowledge of products, services, business flows and understanding of financial context in which technology and operating principles are used within their business area.




Risk Management: Understands risks and can apply the controls necessary to mitigate. Knows when to escalate risks.




Financials & Resource Management: Ability to provide input for financial planning; Understands the variances.




Planning, Execution & Process: Facilitates team planning ceremonies against backlog/prioritized work. Manages risk/dependencies/impediments for one team. Ability to answer teams Agile/waterfall framework questions.




Governance & Stakeholder Management: Contributes to artifacts needed for governance forums. Understands stakeholder expectations and creates regular updates to keep stakeholders informed.










Desired Skills




Solution Delivery Process: Understands all roles and responsibilities within their team and uses the tool sets within the software lifecycle.




Solution Design: Has knowledge of software development but has not been involved in hands-on application development/coding.




Test Engineering: Has general awareness of testing practices but has not been involved in hands-on testing.




DevOps & Release Automation: Basic knowledge of automation and continuous delivery practices. Ability to participate in their role and utilize necessary tools with minimal guidance.

Application & Data Architecture Basic awareness of architecture and design. Ability to comply with bank standards for information security and business architectures.




Data Management: Has knowledge of data management practices and technologies but has not been hands-on with the development of a data system.




Experience Design: Supports the delivery of branded, accessible design solutions. Understands and can comply with design, brand, and accessibility standards.




Analytical Thinking: Demonstrates ability to identify root causes to solve complex problems in highly unstable situations.




Promotes Collaboration: Collaborates with own team and across teams. Asks questions to obtain views from others.




Influences Decisions: Uses a combination of factual and emotional points to exert influence. Receives agreement to ideas by identifying and working collaboratively with specific stakeholders and senior managers.

Achieves Sustainable Results Sets KPIs for teams to follow. Makes decisions about technology that will increase or deliver business value.

About Insight Investment

Insight Investment is a leading asset manager focused on designing investment solutions to meet its clients’ needs.

Job Title: Business Analyst – Private Credit - $175,000-200,000 Salary + Bonus
Job_Description:
Work in the front office, helping to deliver a new credit investment platform, followed by a new data management platform.




Plenty of investment in new technologies and multiple new hires are making it a pretty exciting time (you’ll have the final say on this) at this multi-strategy investment manager. You’ll be joining to focus primarily on the private credit arm of the business and working closely with various stakeholders to deliver new technology platforms.




Your first task is to work on various greenfield programs of work; the credit investment platform, which has completed phase one of three and the new data management platform, a project which is yet to start. You’ll be joining the team at a pivotal point in their growth journey where you’ll be given plenty of opportunity to make a real impact on the direction of the team and business.




The great thing about this is that you’ll sit within the front office, an area of investment management that most (not all) want to work with. You’ll be able to see your work having a direct impact to PnL and your bonus will be in line with this impact you make.




You’ll need to have a couple of years’ worth of BA experience under your belt, and this must be within private credit, supporting and/or implementing specific private credit technology. It’s a given that you’ll have strong business knowledge of credit instruments, for instance CLOs, CREs, etc.




Proficiency with SQL and other associate technologies will also be required. Working with third party vendors and managing the selection of them and the implementation process will also be expected in your experience.




Starting salary will be in the range of $175,000 to $200,000 plus a bonus that could take your total compensation as high as $300,000 in some cases. This is all performance related.




Want to be part of this significant digital transformation? Get in touch.




No up-to-date resume required.

Take responsibility for your personal development including working with your manager to set objectives and milestones and identify your training needs
Identify new ways of working and supporting technologies that will assist the team to become more efficient and deliver a higher quality of business analysis to the business
