Digital Business Analyst



About us



Infosys Consulting helps the world's leading brands create a sustainable path to growth in an age of constant disruption. We are passionate about helping our clients solve their most pressing corporate, human and societal challenges. In order to bring the most value to our clients, we bring together professionals from countries from all around the world, at all levels and from diverse backgrounds. We empower our consultants to thrive, grow their careers and make a real-world impact for a better future.



At our Infosys Consulting practice Experience Transformation and Innovation (XTI) we successfully drive end-to-end experience transformations by helping our clients think comprehensively and act holistically in pursuit of profound transformation. We focus on key activities that enable smart, impactful transformation.



We link digital strategy to customer experience, and how enterprises function, to deliver value
We enable continuous innovation across the organization
We design smart products and services
We leverage platforms to drive speed and scale
We drive efficiency and resilience through smart operations

Our multidisciplinary teams develop interlocking digital, technology and implementation strategies and ensure real business value from digital transformation with our comprehensive platform methodologies. Depending on their current situation, we accompany our clients in the planning and implementation of scalable platform solutions with a wide range of functional focuses.



We are constantly learning and fostering personal development, enabling intellectual growth, teaching and coaching to empower our employees to take responsibility.



The role



As a Digital Business Analyst, you will work with our clients' organisations to help them improve their digital processes and systems.



In collaboration with the client's stakeholders and internal experts, you conduct research and analysis of business structures, orchestrate gap analysis to develop digital solutions to business problems.



You support our clients to build new digital systems and prepare them for productive use. You work in agile project structures and use digital solutions such as JIRA/Confluence and Azure DevOps. Accordingly, you are integrated into agile development structures such as Scrum or SAFe.



Your tasks also include the execution of comprehensive end-to-end tests (E2E) at application level or in distributed system solutions.



You are involved in the implementation of process and product interconnections.



You..



Have a broad business skill set including stakeholder management, problem-solving, and resilience.
Have experience gathering, validating, synthesizing, documenting, and communicating data and information for a range of audiences.
Have excellent interpersonal skills and strong written and verbal communication skills in English (C2 proficiency).
It is an advantage if you already have experience in:
a consultative role
strategic, technical or digital initiatives
You have proven analytical skills and a general interest in researching and designing work processes.
You have already worked with various process modelling techniques such as BPMN or UML.
You are familiar with relevant business principles and can represent and describe them in sub-models using a simple process representation.
You are digitally savvy and familiar with digital content, marketing and sales platforms.
You have a sound knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Visio, Project) and other relevant software packages (e.g. Jira, Confluence) and can integrate them into your daily work.
You have a strong awareness of agile principles and their objectives.
You enjoy working in large distributed and cross-functional teams.
Ideally, you already have one or more certifications for the above qualifications.





Why join us?



As part of the global top-5 IT brand Infosys, we combine our strategic foresight with technology feasibility to transform goals into reality. Infosys Consulting works with best-in-class clients across industries, unleashing the potential of design combined with technology.



Our innovative approaches and services are in demand, and we are growing fast. That's why we're looking for entrepreneurial and creative consultants. If you value a diverse culture, a voice with top management, and recognition for shared achievements, you've come to the right place! We strive to foster an inclusive work culture that drives us to excel.



Infosys has been recognized by the Top Employers Institute as a Top Employer 2021, across Europe, the Middle East, Asia Pacific, and North America in recognition of our excellent employment practices, cultural diversity, and dedicated training and career paths we offer our consultants.



Our core values, IC-LIFE, form a common code that helps us move forward. IC-LIFE stands for Inclusion and diversity, Client value, Leadership, Integrity, Fairness, and Excellence.



We offer industry-leading compensation and benefits, along with top training and development opportunities so you can grow your career and achieve your personal goals. Curious to get to know us? We'd love to hear from you!

Company Description




Leidos makes the world safer, healthier and more efficient through information technology, engineering and science. As a large scale prime systems and services integrator, we turn complex data into usable solutions for our customers. In practical terms, we deliver software applications for a wide range of missions in the Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance domain as well as health solutions. We provide critical projects to the Department of Defence whilst supporting the IT environment for the Australian Taxation Office. We also maintain legislative websites for a number of governments.




Job Description




Your new role




Working on a business critical program for one of Leidos’ largest clients, the Business Analyst will be responsible for customer engagement, process modelling and development of system requirements, as well as the elicitation of business and technical requirements and the modelling of new and existing business processes to inform ICT project delivery for a fast paced, dynamic business unit.




Tasks include:




Liaise with Project Managers, Solution Architect/Engineers in the scoping and estimating for new initiatives
Translate business requirements into technical specifications in-line with proposed solutions
Document, analyse and revise current and proposed business processes
Document Functional and Non-functional Requirements
Support the Implementation and delivery of systems, services and software as per customer specifications and agreed solution document
Investigate issues/errors/flaws in the current setup and identify ways to improve systems performance and efficiency by suggesting best practices in line with the organisations’ processes and system deployment standards
Complying with applicable standards, processes and governance
Liaise with development teams, other technical stakeholders and external vendors.
Use your understanding of the different stakeholders in healthcare to plan and facilitate workshops to further define functionality, service and system flows.
User Story development and participation in sprint planning and execution.
Participate in working sessions with the scrum team to provide clarity on user stories, prioritise user stories and refine acceptance criteria.
Qualifications




To be successful in this role, you will have three or more years of experience, as a business analyst and can clearly demonstrate:




Experience across multiple stages of the system development lifecycle, in particular in transforming requirements into a cohesive design or solution
Manage the challenges and constraints of integrating existing systems with new technologies and methodologies
Develop clear and concise documentation, for a broad range of purposes
Strong interpersonal skills, in particular with building positive relationships, both internally and externally, in addition to effective verbal and written communications
Work with a high level of autonomy, with a capacity to support other members of the team




In addition, while not essential, the following are also desirable:




Defence/ Government experience would be high regarded
Experience with complex projects
Delivery of ICT
Establishing or working in support organisations




Additional Information




This position can be based in either Canberra or Melbourne (Scoresby) and due to the nature of this work the successful candidate will need to be an Australian Citizens with a minimum Baseline security clearance.




What You’ll Love




At Leidos you’ll enjoy 12 weeks’ paid parental leave as a primary carer, flexible work practices, discounted health insurance, novated leasing and more. Foster your career through complete access to learning and development and mentoring opportunities, we have a strong track record of internal promotion and career transitions. Join a company who acknowledges “People First”.

*** This role is NOT open to Corp to Corp *** and will require an individual legally authorized to work for any US employer.




Our client is a law practice in downtown Nashville. This role will be hybrid (3 days onsite/2 days remote.)




--




Our client is looking for a qualified, professional individual to join our growing PMO team as a Business Analyst in our IT department located in Nashville, TN. This position is responsible for facilitating the delivery of business requirements in support of various technology-based initiatives. We are looking for an individual with experience in multiple project management/SDLC methodologies committed to delivering distinctive service while working with our legal partners and staff to ensure IT’s understanding of business needs. The Business analyst will elicit, analyze, specify, validate, and document the business needs of all project stakeholders. This person should be business process-oriented and experienced in documenting current/future state business processes and use cases to elicit requirements and provide context around how systems are used today and the changes desired in conjunction with implementing new technology-based solutions. The Business Analyst will also apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help support the development and implementation process to ensure that project deliverables are met according to specifications. The Business Analyst may also be required to support and/or coordinate the testing of project deliverables.




Primary Responsibilities

Leads interviews, workshops, and/or other methods to cultivate, elicit and document business stakeholder requirements for assigned projects.
Creates process workflows, technical specifications, user stories, and other technical diagrams/charts to provide direction and context to project team members.
Assists business stakeholders in identifying business objectives through expert analysis of business functions while gathering information and evaluating input and output requirements.
Assists in developing a business case when required
Works with business stakeholders and the project team to prioritize requirements.
Assists in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed-upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts.
Communicates modifications of requirements – verbally or through written documentation – to project managers, sponsors, owners and other stakeholders so issues and solutions are understood.
Designs, implements and executes various test plans and scripts as part of testing; assists other departments in designing test plans. This may include, but is not limited to functional testing, regression testing, performance testing, and user acceptance testing.
Participates in establishing practices, templates, policies, tools, etc. to help expand and mature capabilities within the PMO.
Other duties as assigned.




Qualified candidates should have Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience; 5 to 10 years’ experience as a business analyst in an Information Technology environment working in both Waterfall and Agile SDLC methodologies. Candidates should have proven experience working with business & IT stakeholders to cultivate and document business and technical requirements, business process flows, use cases, data models and other best practice project artifacts; exceptional analytical and statistical skills with ability to apply them to systems issues and product solutions; a proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment demonstrating teamwork, innovation, and excellence. In addition, candidates should have a proven ability to engage with business stakeholders to establish credibility, influence, solve problems, build consensus and achieve objectives; proven experience working with external service delivery partners to deliver business technology solutions; be detail-oriented with excellent interpersonal skills with both technical and non-technical associates; have experience working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment; be self-motivated, decisive, and flexible with proven ability to conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical problem-solving capabilities. Candidates are expected to demonstrate a functional acumen to support how solutions will address business goals while maintaining alignment with industry best practices; have excellent listening, verbal and written communication skills; have excellent customer service skills - tact and diplomacy in dealing with both leadership and staff and be proficient with Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project). Preferred skills includes experience in a growing PMO organization; business analysis certification(s); legal industry experience; and experience working with Project Management tools (ServiceNow Project Management preferred).

If you are experienced in working with Agile and Scrum methodolgy, have some experience in Marketing and want to work in a flexible hybrid environment, then this role is for you. Ideally, you will have experience with Adobe and Hubspot, however if you have experience in similar experience then we would love to hear from you!

Rentokil Initial has a very exciting IT strategy of developing and deploying bespoke applications across the Prospect to Cash business processes. The Group Digital Product teams are responsible for developing, maintaining and supporting the core technology applications through regular engagement with the business.

Within the Sales and Marketing portfolio workstream, we have a number of agile product teams that have developed a range of exciting applications, along with integration of our bespoke solutions with off-the-shelf products and platforms, to ensure the business processes are supported by technology.

The UK office is based in Crawley (near Gatwick) which will be relevant for some business meetings or workshops. Depending on the need, hybrid working (i.e. a mix of home / office working) may be appropriate. We will definitely require some business travel - as our products are deployed globally there is an exciting opportunity to meet colleagues from our business all over the world.

The Global BA role is responsible for the new ways of working across Sales and Marketing workstreams. The role is central to ensuring the right processes are captured from each of the harmonised regional businesses, and are played back for review and analysis to the development team. In addition to mapping the processes, an understanding and experience of Gap analysis will be required to work with each business to identify differences between current and future ways of working.

Reporting to the Sales Product Owner, the successful applicant will have a passion for helping our businesses adopt technology to support sales processes, working very closely with over 50 markets globally, and regular engagement with our internal colleagues using our products to better understand how we can improve our products.

Main Responsibilities

Gathering the requirements, ensuring that the requirements are captured at the correct level of detail. This includes detailing out processes, scenarios and key data to support the requirements, together with the benefits and justification.
Captures all requirements that have been validated as agile user stories in JIRA, to be used in refinement with the development team. This includes detailed acceptance criteria.
Supports the team in estimating features (Points per Sprint vs Capacity) and setting sprint priorities (from the backlog)
Understanding of both functional and nonfunctional requirements
Ability to act as a gatekeeper for the scope - any new requirements would be channelled through the BA before going to the development product team or product owner
Attends workshops and demos and plays a key role in controlling additional requests / change being raised later in the project (i.e. after the original requirements are agreed)
Monitors progress of requests for support and ensures users and other interested parties are kept informed. Takes corrective action to avoid or minimise delays.
Is responsible for Support Services and maintenance of the product(s) including application support and second/third line support
Initiates speedy and permanent resolution to problems within the applications, by coordinating the efforts of the resolution team or teams. Documents such incidents and problems within the configuration management defect / problem reporting system. Matches unresolved incidents against existing problems, known errors and other incidents
Captures and disseminates technical and business information. Monitors the level of business benefit / value actually achieved

Requirements

Successful applicants will possess the following skills/experience as a minimum:

Significant experience as a BA, ideally working within an agile framework on a global scale with geographically dispersed teams
Strong communications skills, both written and verbal
Articulate, concise, a detailed and analytical thinker who also understands the bigger picture. Can bring structure and formality to analysis and requirements activity
Operates at a senior level, has sufficient gravitas to interact with senior stakeholders, drive workshops and be an effective requirements "manager"
Able to identify and control new requirements and has strong appreciation of change control
Experience of working with development teams to convey the requirements and work with Product leads to understand the functional impact
Not afraid to ask questions and challenge the status quo
Customer Focus: Always keeping our service to the programme stakeholders and business operations at a high standard
Keen to promote business analysis best practice
Team Player: respectful, open, helpful, considerate, trustworthy and has a high work ethic.
Commercial awareness: Be aware of the value of change programs and the impact of change on business operations to be able to track benefits realised
Ability to travel if required

Work with digital media stakeholders to identify business requirements related to digital media operations and performance.
Collaborate with the data analyst and data discovery and exploration specialist to develop and implement data-driven solutions that address business requirements.
Develop and maintain documentation related to digital media business requirements, use cases, and user stories.
Conduct business process analysis to identify areas for process improvement and optimization.

Support in defining business and functional requirements for clients. This includes determining how to measure business results, modelling current/future business processes, gathering technical requirements and identifying the organizational changes required to successfully realize the benefits of the solution architecture.

Elicitation and collaboration: facilitate workshops and document outcomes and risks.

Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.

About Annalect

Annalect is the data, technology, and analytics division of Omnicom.

We help CMOs and their teams harness data, technology, and advanced analytics to grow their brands. We have built a variety of innovative product and specialist service solutions for clients and agency partners.

We build and maintain the Omni platform which gives agency and client teams access to these capabilities as well as the ability to integrate and combine their own data and technology with Omni. Omni has over 30,000 active users and is recognized in the industry as a leading marketing platform. We continuously innovate the platform to ensure our clients stay ahead of their competitors in data driven marketing.




Our team of Annalectuals is growing rapidly and are based in over 80 countries around the globe, supported by global and regional team hubs in NY, London, Singapore, Gurgaon, Bangalore, and Hyderabad.




The EMEA team is responsible for global and regional relationships clients led from London, as well as the development of new data-driven marketing capabilities. They form part of our global team and collaborate closely with local market Annalect teams across EMEA as well as regional Omnicom agency partners.




Flexible Working

We are committed to supporting and helping Annalectuals have a great work/life balance and a positive attitude to well-being. As part of this we have a flexible and hybrid working model as a core part of how we operate.




We believe flexible & hybrid working can increases individual motivation, improves performance and productivity, and reduces stress as well as helping manage wellbeing generally. We will work with you to implement the best flexible working solution for you without compromising team performance and client delivery.




Employee Benefits

We offer pension contributions, life insurance, health insurance, a generous holiday entitlement and many other employee benefits for all. We have an enhanced maternity leave, shared parental leave, paternity leave pay policy.




Diversity

At Annalect, we are focused on equality and believe deeply in diversity & inclusion of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different.




We welcome remarkable people from a broad range of backgrounds who bring their diverse attitudes, opinions, and beliefs into a culture where you are treated with respect and can be comfortable at work just being you. Embracing our differences results in a stimulating and inspiring environment will lead to everyone viewing the world, our work and each other with fresh eyes.




We are keen to encourage applicants from people from all walks of life and we want you to be at your best throughout the recruitment process, please discuss any specific adjustments with a member of the Annalect People team.

Role: Business Analyst

Location: Manchester/London – Hybrid working




Xeinadin Group is one of the leading professional services groups in the UK and Ireland. Through innovative thinking by leading professionals, we offer decades of experience, specialisms and achievement. We are setting out to disrupt normality, by being business advisors who focus on your future and we thrive when we can add value to your business through collaboration and a deep business understanding.




The accountancy market is filled with small firms that can only deliver a few services, or huge international groups that can provide a wide range of services but can lack the personal touch of a local firm, so our model is designed to give businesses the best of both worlds. We build trusted personal relationships at a local level, but with the benefit of innovative technology, centralised back office support and a wide range of specialist expertise from across our national group.







About the role:




Business Analysts are critical to ensure projects are delivered successfully and are the vital bridge between the business and delivery teams:







To-Be Process Development – Deliver a rapid and high-level mapping of As-Is processes for a defined set of offices to segment the estate and establish approach for transitioning to To-Be processes.

Requirements Management – Gather, document and agree technical, bandwidth, functional, non-functional and business requirements that are clear, unambiguous, traceable, testable and measurable and deliver the Xeinadin target operating model.

Delivery Management - To develop and manage a workplan to capture relevant information on the As Is organisation and generate agreed To Be information in line with best practice and to meet the timescales of projects dependent on this output without the need for supervision.

Facilitation - You will also plan, facilitate and review a variety of different workshops as required and create and communicate clear outputs/documentation from them that contribute to overall definition of To Be processes and definition of business, data and resource requirements.

Interdependencies – Understand the interdependencies between processes and data flows and ensure that impacted areas are informed and able to respond to effectively deliver and embed the new To Be processes.

Fit for purpose – Ensure the developed To Be processes have a future proof design and requirements while meeting the current needs of the business and taking into account any current constraints (e.g. different systems in different regions).

Problem Solving – identify and clearly articulate problems with As Is and proposed To Be processes, develop options to resolve, evaluate the options, apply the solution and assess its effectiveness, providing necessary trouble shooting and defining any next steps where needed.

Stakeholder Management and Communication - Build, develop, and grow any business relationships vital to the success of the project. Define communications plan and effectively communicate project expectations to those involved and stakeholders in line with Marketing team standards and processes.

Mentoring – Coach junior and less experienced team members to ensure they grow and develop their change and delivery skills.







About you:




4 years’ + solid experience in a BA/process delivery role or similar, delivering transformational process change, preferably within the Finance & Accounting domains.
Consultancy experience so is comfortable mapping the current landscape, defining the vision and the options to achieve the various business goals.
Expert in defining business processes and requirements that deliver the target operating model, developing tests and measures that prove delivery of the requirements and outcomes, utilising a variety of methodologies that best suit each project.
Strong workshop facilitation skills with ability to manage strong characters and keep focused on objectives and timescales of the sessions
Experience of working with third parties.
Proven track record in delivering successful process change that involve cloud solutions and wider business change.
Experience and knowledge of various process modelling standards e.g. Business Process Modelling Notation (BPMN)
Proven expertise in business process improvement and delivery of efficiencies, preferably with Lean Green belt or higher.
Experience of successful process change in distributed organisations and professional services preferable.




Xeinadin’s vision is to be the most trusted business advisory and accountancy group for owner-managers of small and medium-sized enterprises across the UK and Ireland. We’re more than the sum of our parts so if you are interested in hearing more bout opportunity and journey we are on, please send your CV for immediate consideration.

Every person at Leidos plays an important and valued role bringing science, engineering and technology together to produce practical solutions for our customers’ most complex problems. Here in Australia, we’re agile and growing fast. Our 1,400 employees are busy building an enviable reputation for innovation and delivery. And, as part of a US-based organisation with 37,000 people and a 50 year history, we are able to draw upon world-leading technical expertise to help us provide the best solutions to our customers.

Your New Role

Hands on analysis of data and the system to help contribute towards solutions in workshops

Job Description

MORE ABOUT THIS SKILLSET

Helping clients navigate markets to support their investment goals.

Individuals across these teams have strong communication, integrity, time management and problem-solving skills. It is also key for these colleagues to embody a client-first mentality, exercising good judgment, tact and diplomacy when interacting with clients, executives and other levels of management.

If you apply to this skillset, you will be considered for multiple roles across the firm that require this skillset. Please note business and function examples below are representative of opportunities common for this skill-set. The list is not exhaustive, and availability of open roles is determined based on business.

Businesses And Job Functions

Asset Management Bringing together traditional and alternative investments, we provide clients around the world with a dedicated partnership and focus on long-term performance. As the firm’s primary investment area, we provide investment and advisory services for some of the world’s leading pension plans, sovereign wealth funds, insurance companies, endowments, foundations, financial advisors and individuals, for which we oversee more than $2 trillion in assets under supervision. Working in a culture that values integrity and transparency, you will be part of a diverse team that is passionate about our craft, our clients, and building sustainable success. We are:

Investors, spanning traditional and alternative markets offering products and services
Advisors, understanding our clients’ priorities and poised to help provide investment advice and strategies that make sense for their portfolios
Thought Leaders, providing timely insights across macro and secular themes to help inform our clients’ investment decisions
Innovators, using our suite of digital solutions to help our clients address complex challenges and meet their financial goals

Wealth Management Across Wealth Management, Goldman Sachs helps empower clients and customers around the world to reach their financial goals. Our advisor-led wealth management businesses provide financial planning, investment management, banking and comprehensive advice to a wide range of clients, including ultra-high net worth and high net worth individuals, as well as family offices, foundations and endowments, and corporations and their employees. Our consumer business provides digital solutions for customers to better spend, borrow, invest, and save. Across Wealth Management, our growth is driven by a relentless focus on our people, our clients and customers, and leading-edge technology, data and design.

FICC and Equities We make markets in and clear client transactions on major stock, options and futures exchanges worldwide. Through our global sales force, we maintain relationships with our clients, receiving orders and distributing investment research, trading ideas, market information and analysis.

As a Business, Our Strategic Objectives Include

Investment Banking We pride ourselves in our resourcefulness and work on a variety of initiatives. On any given day, our work could include advising a company on a cross-border merger, structuring the initial public offering of a subsidiary, refinancing an outstanding bond and more.

To be the world’s preeminent investment bank – trusted advisor, financier and risk manager for our clients on their most important transactions
Build long-term relationships with clients and bring them world-class execution by “delivering the firm” over time
Drive superior returns for our stakeholders
Be the employer of choice for all career levels by providing a highly dynamic, meritocratic, diverse and rewarding workplace

Platform Solutions We build and embed cloud-based, developer-centric financial products and services in our clients’ ecosystems to help them better serve their own clients and customers.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree (2019 – June 2023)
0-3 years of prior work experience in a relevant field.
Proficient to advanced skills with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)
Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Strong ability to manage multiple projects with competing deadlines
Team player with positive attitude and strong work ethic
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Ability to adapt quickly to a variety of industries and businesses
Ability to self-direct, analyze and evaluate and form independent judgments
Ability to effectively interact and build relationships with senior management and global stakeholders
Commercially savvy with ability to exercise discretion with respect to highly confidential/sensitive information
Integrity, ethical standards and sound judgment

Salary Range

The expected base salary for this New York, New York, United States-based position is $70000 - $130000. In addition, you may be eligible for a discretionary bonus if you are an active employee as of fiscal year-end.

Singapore Airlines

Sales Planning Analyst




Singapore Airlines Americas is looking to add a Sales Planning Analyst to the growing Marketing and Sales Planning team. This role will provide analytic support and business intelligence to the sales and marketing team to enable data-driven decision making and drive overall revenue growth. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working independently, across large sets of data and multiple platforms, to identify trends, share actionable insights, and make recommendations to stakeholders to achieve targets. This is currently a hybrid position, with requirements of partial on-site work in our Los Angeles office.

Job Functions

You will be responsible for turning data into information and insights, and insights into recommendations for sales steering decisions. The Sales Planning Analyst will be responsible for supporting Agency, Corporate, TMC, and direct sales teams with reporting, analytics, and assisting with strategic sales initiatives.

Create and own dashboards, reports, and data visualizations that synthesize raw data into digestible and actionable information
Gather specifications for report requirements, providing consultation on report design, data quality, and feasibility
Interpret data, analyze results using multiple data sources and provide insights and recommendations that the business can action
Gather and analyze marketplace data, booking, competitor pricing actions, air partners’ network and provide analysis to relevant stakeholders in sales and marketing
Recommend pricing, sales and marketing strategies to stakeholders in achieving KPIs for the region
Identify and recommend airline partnership opportunities for the region to Headquarters
Evaluate and assess the results of pricing and marketing activities and communicate the observations or results to relevant stakeholders
Take projects and requests from end-to-end, defining business needs, developing strategies, producing necessary reports, and implementing insights
Effectively communicate results through compelling data storytelling across the regional team
Provide additional ad-hoc analysis as needed




Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative filed such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Engineering
Minimum 2-3 years of relevant work experience in analytics and/or business intelligence
Exceptional analytical skills – with a proficient ability to work with large and complex datasets
Quantitatively inquisitive with a desire to develop and continuously improve analytic processes
Expert in Excel and Power BI
Experienced in Tableau or similar data visualization tools
Strong storytelling skills for technical and non-technical audiences
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and an ability to convey complex concepts to a diverse audience
Problem solving and troubleshooting capabilities
Ability to work independently and collaboratively with different levels of employees

Nice-to-haves

Experience in programming languages such as SQL, Python, or R
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and design
Prior experience in commercial airline or travel industry is a plus
Passion for aviation and travel
Experience taking vague requirements or objectives and manipulating them into polished final products

The Team




Nasdaq Private Market (NPM), is a leading provider of secondary liquidity solutions for private companies, investors, shareholders, and employees.




We are building critical infrastructure to advance the state of the private capital markets. NPM offers technology solutions and a secondary equity marketplace, designed to centralize private market trading activity thereby increasing efficiency and transparency for all participants.




NPM serves private companies with a robust set of technology and trading solutions. Our products and services enable clients to meet their liquidity goals through tender offers, auctions, capital introduction, block sales, and secondary share settlement. NPM supports investors, employees, and shareholders who wish to individually buy or sell private stock. Our advanced technology helps leading banks, broker-dealers, and their institutional and wealth management clients efficiently invest in the private market.




NPM spun out of Nasdaq, Inc. in September 2021 as an independent company. Our strategic investors and partners include Nasdaq, Inc, Silicon Valley Bank, Citi, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, and Allen & Company.




NPM has transacted over $43B of secondary value across more than 600 company-sponsored liquidity programs for some of the fastest-growing VC-backed companies globally.










The Role




The Analyst, Company Solutions is responsible for supporting NPM’s sales and business development teams with research and analysis.




• Lead NPM’s analytical efforts to support client-facing teams to drive revenue

• Manage private company research to assist in identifying and winning new clients

• Drive analysis of pipeline and historical client wins

• Lead sales reporting for the team, executives, Board of Directors, and investors

• Generate insights and assist in writing internal and external reports and marketing pieces

• Assess and respond to inbound client inquiries

• Drive improvements in sales targeting and other processes

• Maintain internal and external sales systems (e.g., Salesforce, Pitchbook)

• Develop deep familiarity with NPM’s products and solutions

• Collaborate with sales peers to support team and company-wide goals

• Work cross-functionally with Product, Marketing, Operations, Technology, Legal, and Compliance







About You




You are an analytical thinker who wants to make a meaningful impact in an industry-leading company that is shaping the future of the private capital markets.




• Experience with sales support or other research functions

• Experience in management consulting or investment banking

• Ability to analyze data and synthesize into actionable insights

• Ability to learn a complex and regulated product offering and environment

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills

• Experience with Salesforce

• Self-starter who can thrive in a fast-paced startup environment




-------




· Bachelor’s Degree

· 2 - 5 years of experience

· Based in San Francisco Bay Area or NYC

· Comfortable with a hybrid office environment and about 25% travel

BODYARMOR Sports Nutrition is a fast-paced, dynamic environment where brand builders work together with the goal of becoming innovative game-changers in the world of sports and active hydration. Extreme passion and teamwork are the essentials of being a successful member of the BODYARMOR Sports Nutrition team – which consists of BODYARMOR and POWERADE brands. BODYARMOR Sports Nutrition exudes an entrepreneurial culture backed by the resources and insights of one of the world’s most iconic companies, The Coca-Cola Company, which acquired BODYARMOR in 2021. This unique environment gives employees the ability to move quickly, exceed expectations, develop valuable relationships, and have fun while we work to achieve our goal of becoming #1 in Sports Hydration.




BODYARMOR is looking for a Customer Sales Analyst to join our team.

The Customer Sales Analyst is a key role within the Customer Sales team, responsible for creating and maintaining customer specific reporting suites, customer business plan reporting, and executive summary presentations communicating performance and insights to support and drive execution on behalf of BODYARMOR. Reporting into the Chief of Customer Sales, this individual will support the Walmart customer team with ad hoc reporting and also assist in coordinating and organizing data, materials, and presentations for the Chief of Customer Sales.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Prepare and disseminate weekly performance reports to ensure progress and alignment to sales goals
Create and maintain departmental performance dashboards with the responsibility of calling out any trends for escalation to Executive Leadership
Responsible for supporting any presentation creation and ad hoc additional reporting as needed on behalf of the Chief of Customer Sales
Participate in a variety of cross-functional meetings with the responsibility of reviewing data, providing feedback, and interpreting any key points that require attention
Identify sales growth opportunities by isolating and communicating item voids at store / division level
Enhance promotional results by identifying and communicating stores that have not complied with the promotional look of success
Improve future promotional results by performing post-promotion analysis ensuring ROI and by identifying promotional elements that worked and those that could be improved in future executions
Utilize research tools (Nielsen, Retail Link, MADRID, IRI) to identify and communicate regional differences that can be exploited to drive growth
Prepare portfolio selling materials to drive incremental performance with bottlers and with customer divisions
Assist with customer processes and documentation as required to support portfolio sales
Develop item-level forecasting to support regular inventory turns as well as to ensure strong inventory position during promotional events

REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s degree required
1-2 years experience in relevant roles, analyst preferred
Advanced skills in PowerPoint, Excel, Tableau and PowerBI required
Able to deliver clear, succinct insights and recommendations for decision making
Able to develop objective point-of-view and feel comfortable sharing it
Able to demonstrate agility and can pivot focus based on changes in business needs/conditions
Ability to present findings, insights, and strategic recommendations – written and verbal
Able to establish priorities, strong attention to detail, ability to multi-task and manage major projects simultaneously
Self-starter able to work independently on project
Position may require some travel (5%) by car and plane, including both local and neighboring geographic territories







Perks to Highlight!

100% PAID for by BODYARMOR Health Insurance Coverage (Medical, Dental, Vision)
All Positions are Bonus Eligible
15 days of PTO
Generous referral program




Salary Range:

$65,000- $85,000 annually

Base pay offered may vary depending on geography, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

Farmer’s Fridge is on a mission to make it simple for everyone to eat well. We serve healthy, handcrafted meals and snacks from our growing network of 500+ Smart Fridges (software-enabled vending machines). We are striving to change the food system from the ground up – one Fridge or delivery at a time.



We are a team that cares -– about the business, the impact our product makes, and each other. We are data-driven, innovative, and quick to move on to a good idea. We are looking for people who want to collaborate in an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture and have a passion to succeed.



Farmer’s Fridge is entering a period of rapid growth, and we are looking for a motivated Sales Analyst with strong data management skills and business acumen to help support the overall success of the Sales team.




What You’ll Do:



Research and identify target accounts across our markets, helping drive our sales strategy
Analyze our Fridge portfolio, proactively identifying trends and opportunities for the Sales team to target
Audit Salesforce data, this will include:
Monitoring and updating the established account architecture to ensure that the proper relationships are created between accounts
Entering and reviewing inputs from Clients and the Sales team
Assisting with ad hoc report requests from both the Sales team and other departments
Being the go-to resource for all Salesforce-related questions within the team
Manage sales reporting requests, including weekly and monthly reports and ad hoc requests from Clients
Provide assistance with operational support such as completing vendor forms and ensuring regulatory compliance in our markets

What Your Background May Look Like:



0-2 years of relevant experience
Strong data management skills; Excel experience is preferred
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment; prioritizing workloads and effectively demonstrating time management
Exhibit strong attention to detail
Exceptional troubleshooting ability
Self-starter attitude
Salesforce experience is a plus!





Benefits at Farmer's Fridge:



In This Together - We stay connected, whether in person or virtually. We encourage transparency through monthly town hall meetings and weekly financial updates. Participation ranges from sampling and providing feedback on the new menu items we’re coming up with in our test kitchen to contributing meaningfully to our DEIB committee. We enjoy cross-functional lunch & learns, social hours, and game nights but also respect that you have a life outside of work.



Happier Weekdays - Each day at work should fill you with joy. We're a fun and passionate group, and we don't take ourselves too seriously. Bring your unique self to work, dress comfortably, and always feel free to share your thoughts and opinions. We encourage curiosity; there's no hierarchy here when we're all swapping ideas.



Never run on empty - Daily Farmer's Fridge meal, draft cold brew and beer, office snacks, and Friday happy hours are just some of the offerings to make sure you aren't distracted by a growling stomach.



Innovate & Elevate - We're all teachers and learners. You'll grow, and help grow the company through cross-functional collaboration, open access to leadership, and regular business updates. You have a direct impact on the company’s bottom line. You can also impact your personal bottom line by participating in our 401(k) plan that includes a company match with immediate vesting.

About Us

Since our founding in 2011, Nature’s Bakery has been baking better-for-you snacks to nourish families and enable them to thrive. We believe that the choice to snack healthier should be an easy and desirable one. Today, we are a top 10 granola and snack bar brand, with approximately 500 employees baking soft-baked snacks with real, recognizable, and wholesome ingredients, such as whole grains and sun-ripened fruits.

Our marketplace success led us to join forces with KIND to create a health and wellness platform within Mars, Inc. While continuing to operate as a standalone company, we are now part one of the most well-regarded consumer goods company in the world. That independence allows us to remain an agile, insurgent brand committed to our brand purpose and founding.

Nature’s Bakery is a fast-growing company with a bright future ahead. We have achieved great things, and there is more opportunity for growth both on the digital and retail shelves, through expanded distribution with existing and new retail customers. To achieve our aspirations, we are expanding our team of growth-minded, nimble, and entrepreneurial individuals who like to roll up their sleeves and get things done. We think like owners, act like operators.

So, come join us to create a world of snacking that is both good, and good for you.

About The Role

As a Sales Analyst, you play a very important role working directly with the sales teams to ensure that the support functions for the team are well communicated and operating effectively. This role is tasked with a variety of administrative and sales operational duties and special projects but will have opportunities to continue to develop to positions of increase responsibilities, sales roles and other functions as the business expands. This position reports to the Director of Business Development and a key support function to our sales and customer teams. You will also partner and interact with other members of the Nature’s Bakery cross-functional teams, as well as outside brokers and vendors. This is a hybrid position that will be based in the Nature’s Bakery Commercial Office in Pasadena, California two days a week.







The Critical Success Factors

You will be most successful if you:

Highly organized, managed and maintained accurate product specs, pricelists and sales support materials that is needed by the sales teams and brokers.
Worked with industry vendors and published and maintained Nature’s Bakery master data, product specifications and marketing assets in compliance with industry standards to our retailer partners.
Managed and owned internal cross-functional sales projects and processes to ensure sales needs are well coordinated and met, plans and initiatives are documented and tracked e.g., sales sample order process and management, trackers, customer specific coupon programs set-up, new customer set-up process, certification.
Developed sales materials e.g., sell sheets, product catalog, proof packaging artwork.
Organized sales meetings, agendas and coordinating logistics.
Gathered information for sales communication and action.
Analyzed shipment and consumption data to understand product and customer performance and trend.




The Ideal Candidate

In addition, to perform this job successfully our ideal candidate:

· Must be a highly organized self-starter, that can multi-task in a fast-paced and lean work environment.

· Able to work independently in ambiguous settings.

· Analytical, problem solver with acute attention to detail.

· Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written

· Demonstrates strong interpersonal skills – candidate must build solid working relationships across the organization.

Strong sense of accountability and ownership

· Must have a dedicated, team-oriented mindset.







The Minimum And/or Technical Requirements

At minimum, the candidate for the Sales Analyst position must have:

· A four-year college degree - Required.

· 4+ years of related administrative or sales experience in the CPG industry – Preferred.

· Strong skills with the Microsoft Suite: including Word, Excel (Knowledge of Pivot tables & VLOOKUP a plus), PowerPoint, Outlook, or other analytical and data visualization tools.

Experience with product and vendor information portals like 1-WorldSync, IX-One, Brandbank

· Experience with IRI/Nielsen is a plus.




Your Career Journey at Nature’s Bakery

As a young company, we have had the opportunity to shape, reinforce and live our five core company values daily:

Growth Minded. You are incessantly curious, you believe career development is journey built on experiences, feedback, and personal growth.
Solutions-Focused. You excel at both thinking and doing and have a track record of turning organizational objectives into actionable solutions
Respect. You thrive in environments where team members treat each other with respect and support one another, in fact you believe the best solutions emerge when you can engage in fact-based, low-ego discussions
Stronger Together. Working as a team towards a common goal, we thrive on collaboration because we believe each of us has a unique perspective to offer
Integrity. “Doing the right thing” guides you, it is the compass that guides every decision and action you take







Our culture enables our success as individuals and as a company. From the start, you will have ownership over projects because we are a lean organization that tightly collaborates for faster decision-making. In doing so, you will deepen your skillsets while having exposure to broader experiences and senior leadership. Named by Fortune as one of the “World’s Best Workplaces,” Mars, Inc. is a purpose-driven organization that will also provide you access to advancement and career growth opportunities, either within Nature’s Bakery or the broader Mars family of companies.

Our brand purpose extends to our own employees—we know that when you thrive, so does the company. That is why we offer market competitive compensation. In addition to a competitive base salary, our annual incentive plan rewards achievement toward company and individual goals.

Our benefits package reflects our commitment to your health and wellness. Every team member is offered 100% employer paid health, dental, vision, life, AD&D (accidental death and dismemberment), and short-term disability insurance. Our 401(k) plan provides a safe harbor company match. Team members receive 10 paid holidays a year and paid time off. Finally, there is a suite of other benefits, such as a healthcare flexible spending account, a one-year subscription to Peloton Digital Membership (a $155 value), wellness activities and wellness awards (valued at up to $400), and an employee assistance program offering free confidential legal, financial, and counseling services.







The duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and meet strategic objectives.

Nature’s Bakery is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

HOURGLASS COSMETICS — Sales Analyst

Hourglass Cosmetics is a vegan and cruelty-free brand that exists at the revolutionary intersection of science, beauty, and luxury. Established in 2004, Hourglass is known for its breakthrough formulations, technological innovations, and unwavering commitment to reinvention. Following its debut at Barneys New York, the brand has expanded into Bergdorf Goodman, Sephora, Nordstrom, and Space NK in the U.S. and into 1,000 doors worldwide. Hourglass became part of the Unilever Prestige division in 2017. Discover more about the Hourglass brand story and mission on our website hourglasscosmetics.com.

The Sales Analyst is responsible for maintaining and building key reporting and providing insights as part of the Sales team. This person will report to the Director of Commercial Finance and provide key business insights on retail sales data at Hourglass.

WHAT YOU DO:

Compile and analyze sales data from various retailers to identify trends and forecast future sales
Support the Sales teams with analysis on retail sales and retailer inventory
Support with analysis of sales data to determine trends, market events and SKU level productivity
Gather and analyze sales data to understand and assist in sales strategy
Monitor daily retailer Purchase Order and sales activity by retailers
Work closely with Planning Analyst to ensure all launches are sold-in to avoid excess inventory and returns
Optimize Market Trainer productivity and assist in KPIs to evaluate productivity
Assist in investigating large scale inventory issues and liaise with retailers to improve efficiency
Analyze wholesale order and retail sales data, identify trends in sell-in and sell-out to close gaps in inventory, support sales growth, and respond to business needs
Assist in monthly sales forecasts, annual budgeting, and compilation of retailer P&Ls
Manage and communicate to retailers weekly Out of Stock reports
Produce and analyze ad-hoc and/or ongoing reporting as needed
Analyze monthly fill rate by retail partner and improve & optimize opportunities to increase fill rate
Maintain account alignment and make semiannual recommends on field optimization


YOU'LL LOVE THIS JOB IF

You are STRATEGIC: You are a strategic thinker who can efficiently anticipate, identify, and articulate problems in real-time; you have sound judgement and can effectively cope with change and shift gears comfortably.
You are extremely ORGANIZED: You are not overwhelmed by the thought of tackling multiple tasks at a time.
You are DETAIL ORIENTED: You appreciate the importance of having detailed and precise information.
You are a strong COMMUNICATOR: You are a people person, natural leader and collaborate well with others.
You are AGILE: You adapt well to changing needs and priorities and are able to pivot easily to achieve goals and deadlines.
You are PASSIONATE about beauty: You are eager to learn and absorb all things related to beauty, brand and creative strategy.

Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or related fields and at least 3-year experience in an analytical role.
Strong knowledge of Excel and Microsoft Suites, including PowerPoint
Superior problem-solving, analytical and communication skills
High level of organization and detail-orientation
Strong work ethics, openness to learn and willingness to take initiative
Good attitude toward teamwork as well as ability to work independently
Curious and positive individual with an ability to problem solve, implement new ideas and processes

OVERVIEW

Naterra is a US sales and marketing company with an established portfolio of products including but not limited to HBC, Baby Care and Personal Care Categories. Working at Naterra you will get the opportunity to work in a diverse environment with a team that is committed to manufacturing personal care products of the highest quality. At Naterra we believe that everyone deserves self-care without compromise.

GENERAL DESCRIPTION

Do you have experience in Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) and feel up for a new challenge and an opportunity to advance your career?

At Naterra our core values are Candor, Teamwork, and Innovation and we expect team members to bring these skills to the work that they do. If you have a strong work ethic, critical thinking skills, and are an excellent communicator then we may have the perfect opportunity for you!

We are looking for a Sales Analyst to help mine for insights and create impact for our business. On the Naterra Data and Analytics Team you will be able to influence across the organization through developing actionable insights that lead to business results. You will be a valuable team member that supports the Sales, Product Development, and Brand Management teams and utilizes Point of Sale (POS), Syndicated, Panel, and other data sources to develop insights. This role presents an opportunity to collaborate and grow within the organization.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND ESSENTIAL DUTIES

Develop and maintain accurate sales reporting and analytics tools to enable shared value across the organization.
Analyze and interpret data to gauge trends and patterns, measure performance, and quantify opportunities that can be converted into operational insights for the sales, product development, and brand management teams.
Ensure timely submission of items to syndicated databases such as Nielsen, IRI, or Label Insights.
Utilize panel data to bring the customer to the fore front of decision making within the organization from decisions impacting product pipeline to marketing activations.
Take active role in preparing and providing quarterly business reviews and insights reviews for the organization.
Collaborate and build strong cross functional relationships.
Support the line review and sell in process with account specific insights as needed.
Provide technical review of key tools within the organization to ensure accurate function of formulas and data.




WHAT YOU’LL BRING

We’d love to see candidates who have:

1-3 years working in the Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG) industry in Sales, Category management, or Customer/ Account Management.
Bachelor’s Degree
Desire to work in office in a fast-growing organization where your insights and solutions can be turned into actions to grow the business.
Analytic experience and curiosity for the business.
Strong problem-solving capabilities and a track record to finding solutions to complex problems.
Knowledge and general understanding of CPG industry.
Attention to detail and effective time management skills.
Proven experience managing complex data for multiple categories and retailers.
Excellent knowledge of sales analysis and metrics including retailer specific POS systems, Syndicated data sources like Nielsen, IRI, Numerator, or Tableau.
Critical thinking skills, not limited to piecing together data analysis to help create a sales story that is relatable to the specific retailer.
Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to tell a cohesive, fact-based data and insights story.

SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES

To use analytical, statistical, and programming skills to collect, analyze, and interpret large data sets. To use this business intelligence information to develop data-driven solutions to maximize sales opportunities and address sales operations issues as well as organizational and process challenges and gaps. To have and use various technical skill sets including statistics, big data management and application, report building / coding languages, machine learning, reporting and data visualization dashboard tools and technologies.




This is a 2 year contract position.




KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Collect, review and analyze data from various databases for the purpose of maximizing sales opportunities, while addressing operational gaps and issues in support of the key business objectives and strategy development
Collaborate with various key stakeholders within the Sales Team and cross functionally throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to facilitate data-driven action planning and decision-making.
Use statistical modelling and scenario-building by applying data-driven approach to produce proposals and recommendations to optimize revenue generation, process improvement and business outcomes while enhancing customer and stakeholder experiences.
Determine accuracy of new data source, as well as data effectiveness and relevance. Develop frameworks and create processes to review, validate and monitor data accuracy continuously and consistently.
Prepare and publish periodic sales operations reports that provide value-added insights, key findings, observations, and recommended actions to recipients.
Enhance existing reports and develop new automated reports and dashboards that are user-friendly (clear, concise, organized) and utilizes latest data visualization and reporting tools and technologies.
Active involvement in the implementation of key initiatives and projects. Perform other duties as assigned with high level of engagement and sense of urgency and accountability.

SKILLS & ABILITIES

Wide-ranging experience in big data management and application, forecasting, analytics and sales reporting tools and techniques.
Strong knowledge and experience with statistical techniques with various applications.
Advanced Excel skills is a must
Usage of various business intelligence and reporting systems and platforms (Business Objects, Cognos, Tableau)
Attention to detail and high level of data accuracy, credibility and output quality
Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and critical thinking skills.
Strong oral and written skills
Ability to uphold confidentiality, accountability, and strong sense of urgency
Ability to work overtime as needed to meet customer needs

will drive the critical insights for our selling sales teams to exceed revenue goals. Citeline is one of the world's leading providers of data and intelligence on clinical trials, drug treatments, medical devices and what's new in the regulatory and commercial landscape. Relying on us to deliver vital advantage when making critical R&D and commercial decisions, our customers come from over 3000 of the world’s leading pharmaceutical, contract research organizations (CROs), medical technology, biotechnology and healthcare service providers, including the top 10 global pharma and CROs.

From drug and device discovery and development to regulatory approval, and from product launch to lifecycle management, we provide the intelligence and insight to help our customers seize opportunities, mitigate risk and make business-critical decisions, faster. As the pharma and healthcare sector faces unparalleled upheaval, customers rely on our independent advice, enabling them to cut through the clutter and make sense of changing drug development, regulatory and competitive landscapes.

Now, Citeline is proud to be a part of Norstella, an organization that consists of market-leading pharmaceutical solutions providers united under one goal: to improve patient access to life-saving therapies. Within this organization, Citeline plays a key role in helping clients connect the dots from pipeline to patient.

We are looking for a motivated and experienced Sales Operations Analyst to join our team! As a Sales Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting all sales operations activities, including sales forecasting, opportunity and deal support, and making sure sales teams are appropriately maintaining accurate sales records. This person helps to optimize the success of our sales teams by managing sales goals, projections, and processes.

Responsibilities

Support the field team on all sales operations activities including opportunity management, forecasting, RFP responses, reporting, quote, and order management
Collaborate with sales and support functions to ensure Service Level Agreements (SLA) are met
Document and create knowledge repository for first-tier sales support
Create and implement reporting and dashboards for the sales organization that focuses on improving efficiency, effectiveness, and productivity
Manage the operational aspect of on-boarding new employees and transitions of existing employees
Identify opportunities for process automation and optimization, with a focus on scalability and driving significant growth
Collaborate with Marketing to ensure proper lead management processes, metrics, and policies
Maintain data integrity within customer records in Salesforce.com and other systems
Monitor system adoption and data compliance and governance
Maintain and evangelize communication best practices for sales and sales support functions
And other duties as assigned


Requirements

Demonstrated progressive relevant experience and an understanding of sales operations
Strong analytical ability and able to prioritize multiple projects
SFDC experience and knowledge of enterprise SaaS tools
Excellent problem solving, project management, interpersonal and organizational skills. Bias toward action.
SaaS and B2B experience preferred


The guiding principles for success at Norstella:

01:  Bold, Passionate, Mission-First 

We have a lofty mission to Smooth Access to Life Saving Therapies and we will get there by being bold and passionate about the mission and our clients.  Our clients and the mission in what we are trying to accomplish must be in the forefront of our minds in everything we do.  

02:  Integrity, Truth, Reality

We make promises that we can keep, and goals that push us to new heights.  Our integrity offers us the opportunity to learn and improve by being honest about what works and what doesn’t. By being true to the data and producing realistic metrics, we are able to create plans and resources to achieve our goals.  

03:  Kindness, Empathy, Grace

We will empathize with everyone's situation, provide positive and constructive feedback with kindness, and accept opportunities for improvement with grace and gratitude.  We use this principle across the organization to collaborate and build lines of open communication.

04:  Resilience, Mettle, Perseverance

We will persevere – even in difficult and challenging situations.  Our ability to recover from missteps and failures in a positive way will help us to be successful in our mission.

05:  Humility, Gratitude, Learning

We will be true learners by showing humility and gratitude in our work.  We recognize that the smartest person in the room is the one who is always listening, learning, and willing to shift their thinking.  

Benefits

Employee experience is very important to us. On top of joining a supportive, diverse and ambitious team that welcomes all types of candidates. We are also flexible with different working patterns and prioritize promotions internally.

We have a full package of competitive benefits and perks available:

Medical Benefits, Dental Benefits, Vision Benefits

Basic Life and Personal Accident Insurance, Basic Disability Insurance, Voluntary Group Life Insurance, Voluntary Personal Accident Insurance

Company Overview

The Imperial brand represents luxury, integrity, and individuality. Wearing Imperial says something about your spirit—who you are and what you like to do—like a badge of honor. Imperial stands for a lifestyle of leisure, but a drive to pursue excellence. Look good, feel good, play well.

Imperial has been making premium hats since 1916. After more than 100 years, many things have changed but one thing has not.... our dedication to making America’s finest headwear. When you wear Imperial, you are part of a unique group that values quality craftsmanship and unwavering attention to detail. People who wear Imperial believe a hat is not just a hat, and that every stitch matters and every moment should be cherished. We will never forget that each and every cap we make is a cap that will be proudly worn as a badge of honor, a commitment to be showcased, or a story to be celebrated. Our dedication to detail has driven us forward for over 100 years. So, wherever you go, Imperial will be right there with you.

Imperial is the leading manufacturer of premium quality headwear, apparel, and accessories for the golf market. Imperial’s products can be found at 99 of the Top 100 and over 75% of the Top 400 golf courses in the United States, as well as the US Open, PGA Championship, Ryder Cup, Presidents Cup, Solheim Cup, and many PGA Tour events. Compile and analyze data over time to forecast sales trends for multiple customers, including Nike, S&S Activewear and others

Collaborate with team members and clients

Advanced problem-solving and analytic skills
Superior oral and written communication skills
High level of organization and detail-orientation
Strong work ethic and willingness to take initiative
Good attitude toward teamwork as well as the ability to work independently
Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritize
Excellent time management

Background & Purpose Of The Job

This position will support the Nutrition Customer Business Manager and ad hoc support to the broader Kroger Team by providing proactive analysis and insight of business trends, oversight of contracts and forms, monitoring business performance, developing sales presentations, and identifying opportunities and risks impacting the business. This is a developmental role and successful candidates typically progress to business manager roles thus making business development understanding crucial to success in this role.

Who You Are & What You’ll Do

The position will require advanced skills in analysis, project management and proficiency in Microsoft Office with exceptional Excel skills. The Sales Analyst is expected to quickly become proficient in Kroger systems such as Market 6 POS system, DemandTec/Tradepoint, 1 World Sync, IRI Market Share, Stratum, Numerator, and various Kroger forms. The Sales analyst is responsible for weekly analysis and reporting of sales trends, shopper analysis, competitive activity and creating actionable insights from the analysis of these trends. The Sales Analyst is expected to regularly meet customer deadlines for monthly sales plan submissions and other ad hoc requests.

You’re detail oriented: This position will require meeting cyclical deadlines as well as ad hoc deadlines in addition to proactive business analysis that will identify risks and opportunities to drive competitive growth. The ideal candidate manages these changing priorities and ensure customer and internal deadlines are met.
You’re a dot connector: The position will require the ability to retrieve and analyze many different data points from multiple sources and have business acumen to connect these data points quickly to identify emerging trends, determine the resulting business implications and clearly communicate these findings.
You have an owner’s mindset: The ideal candidate will see the categories they work on as their own business and have a strong sense of accountability and responsibility to the business. They will be proactive in looking for ways to grow the business and offer solutions and ideas. They will identify issues quickly and effectively work to prevent them in the future.
You have a team mindset: In partnership with the Customer Business Manager, the ideal candidate will interact with Kroger and Unilever internal teams to develop a relationship, and lead communication around business operations and data insights.
You’re a changemaker: The ideal candidate focuses efforts on continuous improvement, work simplification, and the elimination of non-value-added work that will more effectively produce quality results
You’re an effective communicator: The position will require timely communication and problem-solving skills. The ideal candidate doesn’t just present the problem, they have connected the dots on several different solutions and where possible is empowered to make decisions on their own.

What You’ll Need To Succeed

Undergraduate degree is required with 2+ years of relevant sales experience
Existing relationships with Kroger is a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communications.
Must be able to effectively relate with multiple levels of management, internally and externally.
Must be a “get it done” person that can work in a highly collaborative environment.
Must have strong relationship building and time management skills.
Experience in mining insights and leveraging them to drive growth is a plus
Skilled in using Excel, PowerPoint, Office. Power BI and other applications a plus.
Working knowledge of POS Reporting systems (Nielsen, IRI, Stratum, and Market6) and Sales Planning Systems are a plus

What We Can Offer You

Opportunity to work with iconic, global brands. Competitive compensation package including base salary & bonus structure. Office location in downtown Cincinnati with close proximity to customer.

Meet the Women of Customer Development | Culture for Growth | Top Notch Employee Health & Well Being Benefits | Every Voice Matters | Global Reach | Life at Unilever | Careers with Purpose | World Class Career Development Programs | Check Out Our Space | Focus On Sustainability

Pay: The pay range for this position is $67,000 to $100,500 Unilever takes into consideration a wide range of factors that are utilized in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, qualifications and education, and other business and organizational needs.

Bonus: This position is bonus eligible.

Long-Term Incentive (LTI): This position is LTI eligible.

Benefits: Unilever employees are eligible to participate in our benefits plan. Should the employee choose to participate, they can choose from a range of benefits to include, but is not limited to, health insurance (including prescription drug, dental, and vision coverage), retirement savings benefits, life insurance and disability benefits, parental leave, sick leave, paid vacation and holidays, as well as access to numerous voluntary benefits. Any coverages for health insurance and retirement benefits will be in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable plans and associated governing plan documents
