Job Title: Sales Operations Analyst (m/f/d) Banking - Sustainable Finance
Job_Description:
Do you want to be part of a new, fast-growing global company delivering the next generation of software solutions for the financial services industry?

As a spin-off from SAP (a market leader in enterprise application software), SAP Fioneer builds on a heritage of outstanding technology and a deep understanding of corporate and consumer demands. This gives us a head start to bring financial services to the next level with innovative software solutions and platforms. We are helping companies in the financial services industry to achieve speed, scalability, and cost-efficiency through digital business innovation, cloud technology, and solutions that cover banking and insurance processes end-to-end.

SAP Fioneer is a global company with subsidiaries in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, UK, UAE, Canada, US, Brazil, Mexico, Japan, Australia, India, Singapore. Our rapid growth, great team and lean organization make SAP Fioneer a great place to accelerate your career!

About Our ESG Project

SAP Fioneer is developing the Sustainable Finance Platform – the ESG platform enabling financial service industry players to tackle their end-to-end ESG challenges centrally across all units. The platform is built around a Sustainable Finance Workplace, consolidating holistic, integrated ESG applications, such as climate risk stress testing, ESG advisory, and emission management and steering. A database integrating external with internal ESG-related sources serves as the foundation. Together with financial industry players, we will jointly develop applications to serve their priorities, while also allowing them and their partners to integrate custom solutions on the platform.

About The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Sales Operations Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in the financial services industry, and a passion for environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues. As a Sales Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the sales team in all aspects of their work, including tracking and analyzing sales performance, identifying bottlenecks in the sales process, structuring deals and commercial terms and onboarding of customers. You will also be responsible for providing data-driven insights to increase revenue, sales productivity, or operational efficiency, and to drive strategic decision-making and identify trends. In this role, you will work closely with the sales team and other cross-functional teams, including marketing, finance, and product development, to ensure that the sales organization is running efficiently and effectively.

Possible working locations for this position are our offices in Munich and Berlin or remote from any location in Germany or Austria combined with willingness to travel (50%).

Requirements

2-3 years of experience in sales operations or similar role and expertise in software/IT industry or financial services industry
Strong analytical skills and experience working with data to drive decision-making
Excellent communication and presentation skills in German and English
A passion for ESG issues, developing sales strategies and helping customers achieving their performance targets
Customer-focused, self-motivated and team oriented interpersonal skills with believe in teamwork and cross collaboration
Proficiency in CRM and business intelligence tools
Bachelor´s or Master´s degree in business administration, mathematics, commerce or STEM
Willingness to travel up to 50%


Benefits

The opportunity to work together with some of the smartest professionals on very ambitious projects
We help shape the rapidly changing financial landscape, while advancing your career
We combine a pragmatic, fast-paced startup culture with years of system delivery expertise, a strong reputation on the market, and a long-established customer portfolio
You will be offered growth opportunities on the basis of merit and individual goals, as well as the space to bring new ideas, drive innovation and challenge the status quo
An attractive compensation package
Show more

· $500/day + Super

· Salesforce – Sales Cloud

· 12 months – Remote (Aus)




Do you have a mix of Salesforce and Analytics skills?




This is a great opportunity for analysts who want to utilise their salesforce skills in an operational role, supporting a great sales team.




You’ll have the opportunity to work with a global SaaS finance business in a long-term contract role with likely extension. The role will suit someone with a combo of sales and operational skills. Remote role open to candidates across Australia offering $500/day + Super.




Requirements




Strengths in Salesforce are essential – especially Sales Cloud objects account
Experience building dashboards and reports in Salesforce is needed
General strengths in data analysis, pipeline analysis, writing conditional statements
Great communication skills are a bonus







What’s in it for you




Long-term contract that’s likely to extend
Chance to work with a global SaaS business
Can be delivered 100% remotely from anywhere in Australia

Brief Description

The Sales Analyst is responsible for measuring the effectiveness and success of Baldor’s overall sales & marketing strategy, as well as supporting the reporting needs of the sales organization.

This individual will be integral in transforming the way that Baldor consumes and reacts to data, optimize sales opportunities, stabilize inventory turnover, and reduce financial liabilities.

This position will have the opportunity to present findings and share insights with multiple business

leaders throughout the organization including sales, merchandising, marketing, and senior leadership.

Essential Functions Include:

Maintain and improve daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly dashboards and reporting for sales, customer success, and executive management to track essential KPI's, and report on trends.

Analyze KPI and metrics to identify trends and data-driven insights; provide recommendations to improve sales effectiveness.
Develop and evolve key performance metrics to help drive sales productivity.
Use story-telling skills to deliver insights that are clear, concise, and actionable.
Perform all regular and ad-hoc sales reporting requests and identify options for automation of reporting wherever possible.
Further develop and maintain suite of sales performance dashboards in Tableau/PowerBI. Identify and develop opportunities for self-service analytics dashboards and reports wherever possible.
Assist Sales team members with completing RFPs, including updating content, working with a cross-functional team to obtain all the necessary information, and ensuring that the final product is accurate and delivered on time.
Work with sales directors and managers to assist with sales strategy development and execution.
Provide training to end-users on sales tools, processes, and best practices.


Minimum Qualifications:

Strong business intelligence and data skills.
2-5 Years’ experience in an analytical role is preferred.
Bachelor’s Degree in Business/Marketing or similar or equivalent work experience is required.
Report-writing/storytelling skills – developing/delivering recommendations & summaries to key business partners at all levels.
Expertise in BI tools (Tableau; PowerBI) is strongly preferred.
Expertise in Microsoft Excel is required. Knowledge of VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, and other basic formulas is a must.
Experience with or working knowledge of SQL is preferred but not required.


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Organized, enjoys bringing daily rigor to projects and reporting in high-growth environment.
Creative, problem-solver mentality with a knack for identifying areas for improvement and spearheading change.

Job Summary:

The Sales Analyst, eCommerce will work closely with the National Account Managers to contribute to Sanofi CHC Values and Vision by maximizing long-term and short-term goals with our largest growth contributing retailer partner. This position is remote but favored in the Eastern or Central time zone. This person must thrive in a team environment and maintain high-level of internal and external contacts and relationships. The Sales Analyst will have high interactions with Sanofi National Account Managers and Directors assisting with strategic decisions on new items, Trade Management, Promotional Planning, and content and ASIN assortment. Understanding the role of the competitive environment, maintaining awareness of competitive conditions are also required.

Job Responsibilities:


Assist NAM & Category Management in creating customer-facing presentations including Business reviews, monthly meetings, and email communications
Work with NAM to develop accurate SKU-level forecasts each month based on expected baseline demand, seasonality, and promotional activity
Gain thorough understanding of Sanofi trade management software and assist with forecast input process
Partner with our Agency of record for new item set-up process, price change submissions, and item maintenance within Amazon’s Vendor Central
Support Omni-Channel team in maintenance of online content, including online syndication process
Provide data-based recommendations to aid in yearly Merch package selections and promotional deal depth/timing
Maintain an accurate and up to date Catalog of existing items, new items, discontinuations, and temporarily unavailable items
Leverage data suite to perform pre and post promo analysis to include VPC promotions, Best Deals, and Tentpole Events such as Prime Day and T5
Manage with the Agency of record weekly/monthly updates to sales team, with focus on sales trends, category & market share, competitive performance, and pricing by leveraging Vendor Central and Profitero data

Perform other ad hoc duties as required

Experience utilizing Vendor Central, Nielsen or IRI syndicated data and BI dashboards with the ability to analyze and evaluate several sources of data to develop actionable insights

Ability to bring outstanding interpersonal skills (including excellent oral and written communication), strong problem-solving skills to any discussion with colleagues and/or customers

You are always thinking about how to help the teammates around you excel
Extremely organized, dependable, and self-motivated with the ability to excel in a fast-paced environment

¿Quieres cambiar el mundo? Eso es lo que hacemos en Cabify. Nuestro objetivo es hacer de las ciudades mejores lugares para vivir, mejorando la movilidad de las personas que viven en ellas, conectando a pasajeros y conductores con tan sólo pulsar un botón. Es posible que algún día las ciudades sean lugares donde nadie necesite un coche privado, pero aún nos queda un largo camino por recorrer… ¿nos acompañas?

En el equipo global de growth estamos buscando la persona idónea para que se incorpore como Global Sales enablement Analyst

¿Cómo nos ayudarás a cumplir nuestra misión?

Crear y mantener contenidos de formación en diversas plataformas (Google sites, Google Slides, spreadsheet etc.)
Impulsar la mejora continua a través del análisis de los datos e identificar qué áreas necesitan ser formadas a continuación
Trabajar en colaboración con nuestro equipo de Sales y Success para garantizar que el contenido sea pertinente y esté actualizado
Apoyar el proceso de onboarding de nuevos empleados C4B. Asegurar que el modelo se está implementando correctamente, acompañar de manera local las sesiones de formación.
Impartir cursos de iniciación a la empresa y de mejora continua según sea necesario
Apoyar el equipo de ventas locales para identificar problemas y recomendar estrategias para soluciones de formación
Trabajar en proyectos ad hoc que requieran experiencia en formación
Analizar datos, crear informes y presentar perspectivas para apoyar la toma de decisiones e informar a las partes interesadas de C4B Sales.
Soporte y seguimiento técnicos de herramientas de sales: contratación, documentación, reporting.


¿Qué buscamos?

El candidato ideal para un puesto de analista de Sales Enablement debe tener una experiencia en ventas o marketing B2B, excelentes dotes de organización y comunicación.

Se requiere titulación universitaria o superior. Se prefiere una licenciatura o un grado superior en empresariales, pero se valora más el historial de impacto e impulso de resultados empresariales.
Capacidad de organización, gestión del tiempo y negociación.
Algo de experiencia en sales enablement, sales, trade marketing o commercial planning & activation principalmente en la creación de materiales para su soporte (pitch de ventas, decks de producto, etc.),
Preferiblemente, experiencia en la venta de soluciones B2B
Capacidad para realizar múltiples tareas y gestionar varios proyectos simultáneamente.
Conocimiento de herramientas de diseño y edición básicas como: Power Point , Google Slides, Blogs, etc. Se valorará conocimiento en herramientas específicas de edición y diseño.
Automotivado; muy motivado para obtener resultados.


¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Somos una empresa llena de gente feliz y motivada… ¡y no queremos que eso cambie! Aquí te mostramos algunas razones por las que te encantará formar parte de la familia Cabify.

Contrato indefinido con salario competitivo.
Recharge day: el tercer viernes de mes free para disfrutar de lo que quieras.
Horario flexible y modelo híbrido de trabajo.
Eventos divertidos con todo el equipo.
Crédito mensual en nuestra App de Cabify.
Presupuesto anual para formación y programas de desarrollo personal.
Retribución flexible en tickets restaurant, transporte, seguro médico y guarderías.
Descuentos en diferentes restaurantes, tiendas y gimnasios.
Una sala de mascotas en la oficina para que no tengas que dejar a tu peludo amigo en casa.
Todo el equipamiento que necesites (tú solo tienes que poner tu talento).
Y lo último, pero no menos importante... ¡café gratis!

Strong to advanced knowledge and understanding of sales and sales operations processes, system functionality, sales operations strategy.

Activité de l'entreprise

Daikin France est une filiale de Daikin Europe N.V, elle-même filiale de Daikin Industries LTD. , créée en 1924 au Japon.

Présent partout dans le monde, le groupe commercialise des systèmes de climatisation et de chauffage ultra performants pour tous les secteurs d’activités (résidentiel, commercial et industriel).

L’innovation, la qualité des processus de fabrication et des services offerts à ses réseaux de distribution jusqu'aux utilisateurs, font de Daikin la Marque de référence des solutions de chauffage et de climatisation.

En France, Daikin emploie plus de 600 Daikiniens.




Dans le cadre d’un remplacement, la SBU (Sales Business Unit) Chauffage recherche un.e Sales Analyst F/H en CDI, basé(e) au siège à Nanterre (92)




Descriptif de poste




En charge de l’analyse et de la prévision des ventes, vos principales missions s’articulent autour des axes suivants :




Préparer et présenter les analyses des ventes (sell in principalement) au Manager de la Business Unit Chauffage ainsi qu’aux Chefs de Produits Chauffage, et aux Managers Commerciaux
Préparer mensuellement des présentations d’analyses des ventes en anglais pour différents interlocuteurs (Président Daikin France, Manager de la BU Chauffage…)
Suivre les plans d’actions de la division Ventes de la business unit chauffage : à partir de différentes sources de données (CRM, Le Cercle*, SAP BW…) croiser les différentes informations afin de donner un état chiffré de l’avancée de l’atteinte des objectifs. Présenter une pré-analyse des différents résultats aux managers
Participer à la préparation du Budget des ventes (produits, chiffre d’affaires, marges...) en lien avec le Manager de la SBU Chauffage et le Responsable Marketing Chauffage (gestion des informations dans le SI interne)
Participer de manière bi-mensuelle à la préparation des « Prévisions de Ventes » envoyées aux usines (basées en Europe)
Apporter un support concernant la gestion de la base de données produits et clients (tel que le suivi des fiches articles dans SAP en lien avec le Marketing, …)
Echanges réguliers avec nos interlocuteurs Analystes des Ventes de Daikin Europe : nécessité de maitriser l’anglais
Appuyer les managers de la business unit chauffage dans la préparation de leurs budgets

*Le Cercle est un programme de fidélisation réservé aux installateurs indirects (passant par la distribution)










Profil

Formation : BAC +5 école de commerce ou formation universitaire spécialisée
Expériences : Vous justifiez d’une expérience d’au moins 3 ans en analyse et prévision des ventes, dans un contexte similaire (vente B to B, liens avec des usines et différentes business unit, etc).
Compétences requises : Vous maîtrisez Excel et SAP, idéalement BW. La connaissance de Power BI est un plus. Vous serez aussi amené(e) à échanger en anglais (écrit et oral) avec certains de vos interlocuteurs. Reconnu(e) pour votre rigueur, votre sens de l’organisation et votre orientation clients, vos capacité à communiquer à différents interlocuteurs, vous disposez des atouts pour vous épanouir dans ce poste.
Langue : Anglais : une bonne maitrise de l’anglais tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit

Daikin France s’engage à étudier à compétences égales, toutes les candidatures dont celles de personnes en situation de handicap.

Company Overview:

A privately held international manufacturer of high-performance composite materials with over a 75-year history of providing light weight/high strength materials comprised of honeycomb, sandwich panels, cargo liner, laminates, detailed core components, bonded cores, sub-assemblies and finished parts to the aerospace industry with four divisions.




Summary:

Reporting to the Vice President of Sales, this position will be responsible for managing processes, procedures, tools and the timely updates for SAP Demand Planning and Visual Demand Planning. This position will be responsible for delivery of accurate sales forecast updates, SAP IBP updates and variance reporting that incorporate data from multiple divisional ERP systems, Finance, Salesforce CRM, Sales and Customer Service personnel, Customers and other sources. This position will be an active participant in the SAP IBP process, Sales Inventory Operations Planning (SIOP) process for multiple divisions, monthly Business Reviews, annual Budget planning sessions, Staff Meetings and other activities.







Responsibilities:

Manage SAP Demand Planning, Visual Demand Planning and SAP IBP tools.
Deliver annual sales budgets and rolling monthly forecasts on a timely basis with a high degree of forecast accuracy and providing detailed analysis on variances and revised projections.
Create reports and collate inputs from the global sales and customer service teams to provide sales variance analysis with appropriate plans to meet and/or exceed the annual budget.
Act as one of the sales department vocals in working with IT, Finance and Production Planning to create business intelligence tools that include ERP systems, Salesforce CRM, databases, spreadsheets, reports, metrics, KPIs and dashboards.
Deliver a volume and revenue based rolling forecast with variance analysis and where necessary, incorporate action plans from the sales team that are necessary to attain and/or exceed budgets, forecasts, goals and quotas.
Ensure all quotes are accurately entered, tracked / dispositioned in Salesforce CRM.
Actively participate in the Sales Inventory Operations Planning (SIOP) process for all divisions.
Participate in the development of training tools and provide support to the sales and customer service for the ERP systems, budgets, forecasts, variance analysis, quotations and Salesforce tools.
Perform other duties for the sales department, corporation and divisions, as necessary.







Qualifications (required):

3-5 years forecasting, sales analytics, marketing and/or planning experience required.
Must have experience with SAP, preferably with IBP tools. Experience with Visual would be advantageous.
Must have excellent MS Excel skills with experience, prefer prior experience with Salesforce or other CRM tools, and experience with ERP systems.
Must possess strong data analytical skills to problem solve, manage and measure business, and seek opportunities for improvement while ensure the highest degree of accuracy.
Excellent verbal and written English communications skills; ability to clearly communicate ideas and complex situations working separately and in a large group setting.
Highly effective time management, organizational skills, planning and attention to detail.
Ability to accomplish goals and tasks with teams through teamwork; influencing and leading; negotiation.
Self-motivated, quick learner, comfortable working independently with minimal supervision.




Qualifications (preferred):

Aerospace industry experience with products, kits and/or assemblies.
Bachelor's degree, business, finance, marketing, engineering, technology or science.

Job Description

MORE ABOUT THIS SKILLSET

Helping clients navigate markets to support their investment goals.

Individuals across these teams have strong communication, integrity, time management and problem-solving skills. It is also key for these colleagues to embody a client-first mentality, exercising good judgment, tact and diplomacy when interacting with clients, executives and other levels of management.

If you apply to this skillset, you will be considered for multiple roles across the firm that require this skillset. Please note business and function examples below are representative of opportunities common for this skill-set. The list is not exhaustive, and availability of open roles is determined based on business.

Businesses And Job Functions

Wealth Management Across Wealth Management, Goldman Sachs helps empower clients and customers around the world to reach their financial goals. Our advisor-led wealth management businesses provide financial planning, investment management, banking and comprehensive advice to a wide range of clients, including ultra-high net worth and high net worth individuals, as well as family offices, foundations and endowments, and corporations and their employees. Our consumer business provides digital solutions for customers to better spend, borrow, invest, and save. Across Wealth Management, our growth is driven by a relentless focus on our people, our clients and customers, and leading-edge technology, data and design.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree (2021 – June 2023)
0-3 years of prior work experience in a relevant field.
Proficient to advanced skills with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)
Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Strong ability to manage multiple projects with competing deadlines
Team player with positive attitude and strong work ethic
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Ability to adapt quickly to a variety of industries and businesses
Ability to self-direct, analyze and evaluate and form independent judgments
Ability to effectively interact and build relationships with senior management and global stakeholders
Commercially savvy with ability to exercise discretion with respect to highly confidential/sensitive information

Job Description

In the luxury niche business of Society Awards, the Sales Operations Analyst role will function as an assistant to the Chief of Staff. The COS here is a right-hand woman to the CEO and leaders of each department. The Sales Operations Analyst will support the COS with data analysis for each department, most importantly finding patterns in the sales operations, process and actual revenue figures over time, to find accounts that need attention, to draw the sales department’s attention to opportunities, and to improve efficiency. However, there will be exposure to the functions of technology, marketing support, internal training and recruiting. We need someone who is amazing with spreadsheets and data analysis, who loves doing deep dives to find the answer, and who is open to being involved in more aspects of a luxury creative business like Society Awards.




We are looking for a high-performing sales operations analyst to work with leadership to implement and audit our sales operations, coordinate activities, ensure the smooth operations of the office, and perform various administrative tasks as required. The ideal candidate will be organized, approach tasks with an analytical and strategic mentality, and have enthusiasm to solve any challenge! Ideally this candidate is a very process driven person, with at least an interest in creativity, design, or fashion, to connect the dots between the data and the beautiful work – and beautiful marketing – that we actually produce.




What You’ll Be Doing

Support the activities of one or more senior level employees

Support CRM adoption and handle ongoing engagement with including user management, data management, reporting and auditing.
Gather data using CRM and other data-mining techniques and analyze results.
Perform various data entry and other administrative duties.
Perform various other duties as assigned

1+ years of experience in sales operations, business operations, finance, management consulting, or an analytical/operational role.

Excellent written and oral communication skills

What Makes You Great for This Role

You are intellectually curious. You seek a deeper understanding of how organizations in all sectors perform best. You’re fascinated by business problems and seek ways to connect the dots between practical and theoretical knowledge. You have diverse interests, tied together by a sincere desire to make a difference and be part of large missions.
You love working with numbers and analyzing data with the mentality that identifying trends can unlock a world of information.
You are action-oriented and resourceful. You entrepreneurially seek opportunities to make a difference; you are flexible and comfortable with ambiguity.
You love taking ownership and are highly resourceful, practical, and focused.
You like to get things done and you won’t stop until you’ve succeeded. You have a strong work ethic and demonstrated ability to achieve results.

About Bazaarvoice

At Bazaarvoice, we create smart shopping experiences. Through our expansive global network, product-passionate community & enterprise technology, we connect thousands of brands and retailers with billions of consumers. Our solutions enable brands to connect with consumers and collect valuable user-generated content, at an unprecedented scale. This content achieves global reach by leveraging our extensive and ever-expanding retail, social & search syndication network. And we make it easy for brands & retailers to gain valuable business insights from real-time consumer feedback with intuitive tools and dashboards. The result is smarter shopping: loyal customers, increased sales, and improved products.

The problem we are trying to solve : Brands and retailers struggle to make real connections with consumers. It's a challenge to deliver trustworthy and inspiring content in the moments that matter most during the discovery and purchase cycle. The result? Time and money spent on content that doesn't attract new consumers, convert them, or earn their long-term loyalty.

Our brand promise : closing the gap between brands and consumers.

Founded in 2005, Bazaarvoice is headquartered in Austin, Texas with offices in North America, Europe, Asia and Australia.

It’s official: Bazaarvoice is a Great Place to Work in the US , Australia , India , Lithuania, and the UK !

We are seeking an analytical, process & detail-oriented individual to manage global workflows and optimization efforts for go to market teams. This role will be a part of the Revenue Operations team. In this role, you will be responsible for improving existing processes, establishing repeatable processes and identifying opportunities for increasing sales efficiency. Working in partnership with Sales teams, other business analysts and IT, the successful candidate will bring a curious and inquisitive approach to problem solving and thrive in fast-paced situations that require responsiveness and critical-thinking. There will be an expectation for the candidate to be self-starting and have a keen eye for process improvement opportunities, as well as clearly communicating and project managing any proposed improvements.

What You'll Be Doing

Drive system and process changes that result in improved data accuracy and internal efficiency and optimize workflows
You will establish processes that standardize and enable operational excellence, identify and implement operational improvements that improve efficiency via continuous review of current processes.
Automate processes: Find areas within our sales process that can be automated in order to free up selling time and reduce data entry responsibilities
Lead data quality projects for the go to market teams from project planning through execution and completion. Projects will be focused on improving the quality of data in order to enhance sales account targeting activities, territory building, and customer segmentation
Build Data Quality dashboards and other methods to monitor, measure and report on data quality
Use third party vendors to augment the data available in the CRM and to better improve sales account targeting activities and territory building
Document as-is and to-be business processes and keep these updated and accessible by field
Work with other business analysts to ensure data rules and standards are being implemented and properly maintained


Who You Are

3-5+ years of professional experience in a Sales Ops/financial/business analysis role
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, create & maintain project plans and willingness to quickly pivot into new tasks as needed
Strong communication, data requirements gathering and general questioning skills.
Ability to break down ambiguous problems into concrete, manageable components and think through optimal solutions
Highly positive, collaborative problem solver willing to dive in and find unique, scalable solutions to customer challenges
Attention to detail, a sense of urgency, and relentless follow through
When you find data that doesn’t make sense or needs cleaning up, you can’t wait to fix it
Experience with Salesforce Reports and Dashboards


Bonus Points

Experience working for a SaaS technology or Financial Services company
Strong desire to work in a fast-paced “startup” environment being able to organize and execute on small, medium, and large projects


$90,000 - $115,000 a year

Pay Transparency

At Bazaarvoice, we carefully consider multiple factors when determining compensation, including your background and experience. We also take geography into consideration when we can but are not able to accommodate every location when determining our ranges. These considerations mean that compensation can vary. We are looking for a Sales Operations Analyst to join our growing Commercial team. In this role, you will collect and examine company data, provide key insights, benchmark sales productivity, and identify trends to help determine ways to improve sales performance. The Sales Operations Analyst will play a vital role in permitting our leadership team and sales team be as efficient and productive as possible. Strong Power BI knowledge and experience is highly preferred due to our company objective of becoming a top tier data driven organization. Tips: Provide a summary of the role, what success in the position looks like, and how this role fits into the organization overall.




Responsibilities:

Sales Analysis

Sales performance: Track and report actual performance against targets and metrics.
Deliver key performance metrics, dashboards and reports that enable the Sales leadership team to track, measure and drive performance improvement.
Pipeline analysis: Track pipeline creation, velocity and closure at individual Sales rep, team and regional levels.
Forecast analysis: Track and build insights into the predictability and consistency of our forecast across all regions. Enable effective forecasting by providing sales and management with analytics and guidance.
Opportunity Analysis: Track key opportunities against closure plans, providing trends and insight into where we are succeeding and needing to improve.
Account analysis: Track performance of individual accounts including status against budgeted plan.

Market Analysis

Collect and analyze data regarding customer preferences, demographics, regions active, buying habits and needs to better identify market potential and factors influencing product demand.
Gather, manipulate and analyze internal and external (market) data to evaluate past performance and identify trends to forecast demand.
Gather information on competitors and analyze their sales, pricing and methods of distribution and marketing to thoroughly learn about the competition.

Reporting

In coordination with the Salesforce Admin, develop and maintain standardized operational reports, dashboards, and data sources to monitor overall Sales team health, data integrity, and other key objectives and performance indicator's.
Build and maintain repeatable processes and reporting packages to empower both sales leaders and reps with critical operational data related to sales strategy and execution.
Create and distribute weekly regional reporting packs including Forecast, Key Deals, Pipeline and Analysis to regional managers.
Support monthly and quarterly planning for the Sales team as part of the company's planning process.
Track win/loss reports and provide analysis.
Create ad hoc reports as requested, ex: Competitor Analysis, Target Account penetration, etc.
Build and standardize business reporting for strategic analysis and internal business review.

Process & Tools

Be an expert on core sales tools including Salesforce CRM, Excel, and Power BI.
Maintain documentation for core sales processes, including: analysis, forecasting, key deals and pipeline management. 
Help inspect weekly forecast and work with Account Managers to constantly improve Salesforce data hygiene.
Identify areas of opportunity for continuous improvement, increased efficiency and productivity.
Collaborate with marketing to measure and monitor shared sales and marketing objectives.
Assist in maintaining customer playbooks and the associated library of sales and marketing tools.
Maintains a mindset of continuous process improvement.

Experience Levels

 Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Data Analytics, or similar discipline.
 Must have at least 1+ years professional experience in an analytical position.

Physical Requirements

 Must have excellent Communication Skills, written and verbal.

 Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Data Analytics, or similar discipline.

Required Skills

 Strong in data analysis and data modeling
 Demonstrated analytical, problem-solving, organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills

About Nium




Nium is a next-generation financial services platform that enables companies around the world to unlock new revenue opportunities and improve cash flow economics.



Nium is a leader in its geographical and payment service breadth, owning licenses in the world's largest and fastest-growing economies. Our modular platform allows banks, payment providers, travel companies, and other businesses to collect and disburse funds in local currencies to over 100 countries, plus issue physical and virtual cards globally. Our proprietary set of APIs embeds financial services and can bring to life multiple B2B and B2C use cases in a matter of weeks.



Nium is part of CB Insights Fintech 250, which highlights the most promising Fintech companies globally. Today, Nium serves over 130 million customers and enables platforms to provide access to financial services to over 3 billion people across the world.



Our network is powered by our portfolio of licenses, hard-earned by building trust with financial regulators in over 38 countries. This combination of regulatory and tech assets is unique to Nium and is at the core of our unique value proposition.

Your way to impact

• Conduct Market Analysis for industry and baselines to support best possible margin and strategy

The company operates and wholly owns five factories located along the east coast in China. We own one factory and distribution center in the southeastern US. As a major sheet manufacturer, we currently conduct business with the world’s leading retailers. We are currently looking for a supply chain/sales analyst with experience in a similar industry.




JOB DESCRIPTION:

This role is a sales and inventory management position that analyzes customer sales information to understand changes in customer demand related to factors such as seasonality, pricing, product availability and competition. Analyses are used to impact supply chain decisions, future products placement decisions by providing information to sales and merchandising team, and internal inventory management to control cost and waste. Candidate will work on a cross-functional team responsible for all aspects of supply chain management. Candidate will be responsible for meetings and communications with internal and external customers.




JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Collaborate with marketing, sales, and manufacturing to ensure product supply chain is accurate to service customer requirements.

• Plan and maintain inventory to ensure consistent supply chain performance.

• Plan, schedules, and assist in inventory accuracy including execution of processes, investigating discrepancies and developing corrective actions.

• Coordinate supply planning process to ensure on-time delivery of replenishable and promotional programs ensuring inventory build-up for initial rollouts and accurate forecasts are in place to support ongoing programs.

• Gain working knowledge of customer programs, business rules, and reporting tools for assigned customers preparing to participate in decision making discussions and growing our business.

• Develop supply chain management best practices in areas such as systems integration and maintenance, inventory controls and internal and external reporting needs.

• Understand and communicate supply chain capacities and constraints to insure on-time deliveries.

• Effectively lead and provide clear communications for other team members as well as team members in other departments.

• Work closely with and provides guidance for customer service and warehouse team members.

• Proactively communicate with multi-functional groups and interacts with manufacturing, sales and merchandising teams, customer counterparts and various supply chain support services such shipping companies.

• Ensure system integrity is maintained through management of master data in inventory management and order processing systems

• Maintain working relationships with internal and external business partners.

• Conduct/participate in customer meetings as needed. Limited travel may be required.

• Manage/create website content and order processing

• Learns other department jobs and serve as back-up for other team members.

• Adapt to evolving business conditions and increased levels of responsibility including managerial positions.

SALARY AND BENEFITS:

• Competitive salary dependent on work experience and education.

• Bonus potential based on performance and eligibility.

• Paid time off subject to eligibility including vacation, holidays and sick days.

• Other benefits subject to election and eligibility: Medical, Dental, and Disability insurance, 401K with company match.

• Part-time remote home schedule.

EDUCATIONAL/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

• Bachelor’s degree from four-year College or university.

• Strong Microsoft Office skills required with expertise in Excel with the ability to set up pivot tables and formulas

• Experience in related field a plus

• ERP system experience a plus

• EDI experience a plus

• Website development/maintenance a plus

Description




Everyday Health Group (EHG) is a recognized leader in patient and provider education and services attracting an engaged audience of over 74 million health consumers and over 890,000 U.S. practicing physicians and clinicians. Our mission is to drive better clinical and health outcomes through decision-making informed by highly relevant information, data, and analytics. We empower healthcare providers, consumers and payers with trusted content and services delivered through Everyday Health Group’s world-class brands.




The Opportunity




The Sales Analyst will work closely with the Sales and Operations team in their efforts to make decisions and implement improvements to drive sales results. You’ll provide a control regarding sales contracts and delivery, and translate that into revenue forecasts. You will also identify and champion new analytic opportunities and approaches to support sustainable market growth and sales, i.e. what’s the data telling you about the health of our business and what should we do about it. The ideal candidate needs to be sales compatible and combine good sound judgement, robust organizational skills and a good financial acumen. Comfort with Excel and working with large and multiple data sets a must.




Key Responsibilities:




Identify and champion new analytic opportunities and approaches to support sustainable market growth and sales
Compile and analyze data over time to forecast sales trends, providing weekly business analyses as well as associated ad hoc reporting
Prepare past sales data to determine trends in productivity
Provide reporting and analysis of sales pipeline and develop additional adhoc reports to answer questions from Senior Leadership
Serve as business partner to Operations, Sales, and Finance to ensure smooth execution of sales deliverables and identify potential risks
Present actionable information and insights to team members and management
Serve as a passionate analytics team advocate and sales organization partner to help advance solutions that drive client loyalty, conversion, and retention
Work closely with the Head of Sales to ensure forecasts are accurate
Identify opportunities and implement solutions to improve sales processes through Salesforce optimization
Increase data reliability and metrics utilization for sales and pre-sales process
Work with FP&A to forecast monthly revenue, maintain sales comp plans and calculations
Assist in the preparation of annual budgets for business leaders
Analyze data to identify trends and discover insights to inform future sales strategy
Automate departmental OKR/KPI reports to improve reporting efficiency




The Day-to-Day




Gather and sort data from a number of different sources/platforms and demonstrate the propensity to translate these findings into organized reporting dashboards and meaningful insights.
Understand and effectively measure the KPI’s of several revenue streams including Postings, Syndicated Partners, and on-Site.
Create meaning behind the data; the ability to gather, sort, analyze and present findings in an organized and effectively communicated manner to influence business decisions and grow revenue for the company.
Maintain (or build) several sophisticated reporting dashboards to easily relay key findings on a daily, weekly and monthly basis to inform key stakeholders.
Provide weekly updates to internal clients to maintain relationships and monitor performance against goals and budgets.
Partner with FP&A to calculate and communicate quarterly commission payouts for sales organization
Ability to collaborate inter-departmentally with Sales, Audit, Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable to effectively report revenue for month end close and adhere to contractual agreements.
Must be proficient in Excel, including proven experience with Pivot Tables, Filter Options, VLOOKUP and IF Statements at minimum.
Experience with Google Sheets and GSuite as well as slightly more advanced Excel tools and functions such as CHOOSE, OFFSET, MATCH and ability to audit reporting and financial models a big plus.




Job Qualifications:




Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Marketing or Finance required (Computer Science, Applied Statistics, Operations Research or other Quantitative field a plus)
Familiarity with Salesforce and Tableau
Excellent Excel skills
Minimum 1-3 years of experience in an analytical role with a focus on leveraging data
Advanced problem solving and analysis skills
Superior oral and written communication skills
High level of organization and detail-oriented
Strong work ethic and willingness to take initiative
Good attitude towards teamwork as well as the ability to work independently
Ability to multitask and prioritize




Our Culture and Values




We created our values together to guide our collective purpose and pursuits. We are collaborators and problem solvers. We empower one another to make informed decisions and to be enabled towards action. We embrace success. We recognize that innovation can spark and be born from any of us no matter our individual role or background. We encourage open mindedness and sensitivity to each other and our environment. Our personal and professional passions get ignited, nurtured and supported. We value that doing is greater than talking as the most measurable means of impact. Our collective purpose to deliver enlightened audience experiences with trusted brands is what drives the success of our business and our professional satisfaction.




Life at Everyday Health




At Everyday Health Group, a division of Ziff Davis, we work in a culture of collaboration and welcome those who desire to join our growing global community. We believe in careers versus jobs and people versus employees. We seek enthusiastic individuals with an entrepreneurial spirit looking for an environment that rewards your best work.




Everyday Health offers competitive salaries in addition to robust health and wellness benefits including medical, dental, vision, life and disability benefits, Flexible Spending accounts, 401(k) with company match, an Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Pregnancy and Parental leave, Family Planning Support via Maven, Flexible Time Off, Volunteer Time Off, Fitness Reimbursement as well as employee-focused engagement and education programs, including Employee Resource Groups and company-sponsored events. If you’re seeking a dynamic, flexible work environment where you can see the direct impact of your performance, then Everyday Health is the place for you. Everyday Health Group has employees located in 38 states as well as offices in NYC, Asheville, NC, London, England and Mumbai, India.




Note: Disclosure as required by CO sb19-085 (8-5-20), NYCHRL, and CA SB-1162 and WA SB5761: the salary compensation for this role when being performed in CO, NYC, CA or WA is $80,000to $110,000. Compensation for this business unit specific role is based on a variety of factors including experience, scope of the role, capabilities to perform the role, as well as business & company performance.




Everyday Health Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable environment for all employees.

About The Position




As we work towards our mission of connecting the world to their government, you will be jumping headfirst into helping drive the success of FiscalNote. You will support key priorities across the sales and service organization and execute directly on high-leverage needs.




FiscalNote’s Sales Operations Analyst is a multifaceted jane or jack of all trades who thrives in an exciting environment. The main focus for this role will be using Salesforce.com for reporting and metrics and will include making contributions to territory management, Salesforce.com improvements, the commissions process, and collaborating closely with other teams.




About The Sales & Lead Generation Team At FiscalNote




The Sales Operations team supports and enables our revenue teams to sell and serve more effectively and efficiently. By managing internal systems, technology, and processes, this team ensures our Business Development team has what it needs to be successful. Beyond the day-to-day support of the revenue teams, the Sales Operations team is integral to corporate strategy by providing insightful analysis to inform data-driven decision-making.




About You




Analytical. Driven. Empathetic. Intelligent. You have a sharp eye for detail that allows you to generate actionable data. Your previous managers describe you as a critical thinker, who creates new ways to solve problems and stops at nothing to ensure that information is as accurate as possible. You artfully balance the need to evolve with the changing requirements of the business with the structure necessary to manage sales operations at scale. With these shifting priorities, you are a pro at managing your time and setting expectations with your stakeholders as to appropriate deadlines. Comfortable working cross-functionally, you are able to tailor your communication style and narrative to suit the needs of the audience - be it a front-line representative or a member of the Board.




What To Expect In This Position




Use Salesforce.com to run reports and create dashboards for key stakeholders
Answer questions over Chatter in Salesforce.com to help resolve questions and issues from internal teams
Generate and analyze data, metrics, and reports to deliver actionable insights to Business Development leadership, the executive team, and the Board of Directors
Conduct analysis of sales, renewals, and client consumption data to improve sales cycles, renewals, win rates, and other critical metrics that drive improved sales performance
Manage multiple priorities across the span of sales operations to support sales growth and retention
Support Business Development leadership with strategic and tactical support requests
Partner closely with our finance team to accurately and promptly verify sales data
Verify contracts and customer information as needed for reporting
Own weekly executive reporting to ensure clear communication on sales and account management team performance
Own reporting used to drive day-to-day activities and priorities
Partner with account management to drive reporting and other uses of data to enhance client management efforts




Your First 6 Months




Month 1: Learn FiscalNote
Develop an understanding of the FiscalNote customer lifecycle, sales process, and product suite
Learn our Salesforce infrastructure for reporting
Master FiscalNote’s contracting process
Months 2 - 3: Apply Knowledge & Document Processes
Build reports for operational use
Support contracting inquiries
Develop an understanding of how business development practices align with corporate financial reporting
Months 4 - 6: Manage Projects
Continue support with reporting and contracting
Begin taking ownership of select projects such as commissions calculations, territory management, and/or vendor and partnership management




What Sets You Apart




1-4 years of experience involving sales operations, finance, or data analysis
Deep knowledge of Salesforce.com (required)
Salesforce Certifications are a plus
Experience on a revenue-generating team
Discretion with sensitive material and communications
Advanced Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets capabilities, including but not limited to advanced formulas (lookups, index-match, etc), pivot tables, data analysis, and visualization
Understanding of software/SaaS companies and principles (subscription mechanisms around churn, retention, etc…)

Company Overview

Job Purpose and Role

The Marketing and Sales Analyst is an expert at finding patterns in data and identifying trends. The Analyst enjoys collaborative development, brainstorming, and creating innovative data reporting solutions to improve value. The Analyst is detail-oriented, self-motivated, and intellectually curious.



Job Duties and Responsibilities
Analyzing consumer behavior to meet product demand and preferences.
Performing competitor analysis toward an increased market share.
Aggregating prospective buyers into groups or segments with common needs and who respond similarly to a marketing action.
Seeks to identify targeted groups of consumers to tailor products and branding in a way that is attractive to the group.
Studying market trends, technology progression, and building competitive intelligence.
Analyzes and integrates large amounts of internal and external data (both qualitative and quantitative) for leadership.

Summary




The Cigna Medicare Sales Operations Senior Analyst will be a specialized role to support process improvements to help improve and sustain operational processes across the Sales Operations team. In collaboration with internal constituents, this person will support ongoing and new operational projects identified to improve the quality and efficiency of Sales Operations, ensure partner satisfaction and simplicity of doing business. The Sales Operations Senior Analyst coordinates with business partners to ensure needs are met. The Sales Operations Senior Analyst will need to work in partnership across multiple functional areas, providing specialized operational support to the broker sales team.




Achievements are largely dependent on successfully partnering with multiple constituents, which include enterprise operational teams (including but not limited to Sales Effectiveness, Sales Integrity, Compliance, Sales Enablement, Account Management and Enrollment.




Responsibilities




Implement and sustain process modeling initiatives for operational tasks that impact data integrity.
Create and update training resources in partnership with trainer teams as needed.
Build knowledge resources to document operational process workflows to enable continued process improvements.
Partner to implement best practices as a result of compliance, policy, or business requirement changes to facilitate best solutions and methods which will optimize operational processes and drive efficiencies.
Track and document process improvement projects as needed to champion Sales Operations across Medicare, CSB, PDP and IFP business units.
Complete onboarding/off-boarding processes for our Contracting, Broker Support (CARL) and Research teams.
Prepare and deliver summary reports and/or presentation materials as needed to Sales Operations management teams.
Support FDR onboarding activities as needed.
Support reporting data analytics projects and deliverables.
Partner to centralize team resources for Sales Operations Support on team SharePoint site.

Collaborate closely with the broker sales team to understand and map their process and procedures.
Support operational updates and ongoing initiatives amongst the team to share for transparency across other business partners with the Sales Operations newsletter.
Provide support to multiple constituents, which includes enterprise operational teams (Marketing, Compliance, Sales Integrity and Enrollment, Operations Effectiveness, etc.) and sales teams to maximize partner satisfaction.
Gather and document best demonstrated practices for internal stakeholders to constantly improve and challenge status quo of processes.
Raise concerns/issues to ensure they are properly addressed in a timely manner.
Respond to inquiries, using independent judgment and funneling issues to appropriate teams as needed.
Remain compliant with all company and governmental policies, procedures, and regulations.
Encourage constructive dialogue with others in an inclusive manner, ensuring diverse perspectives are considered to drive innovation.




Qualifications




Bachelors or equivalent, relevant work experience
Proficient knowledge of Excel, SharePoint and Salesforce required.

Presentation skills and ability to speak to different audiences.

Ability to deal with ambiguity and proactively seek opportunities for improvement.
Adaptable, flexible, and able to manage through change in a fast-paced environment.
Goal oriented, resourceful, personally accountable and self-directed.
Innovative mindset for identifying and creating awareness where new approaches/solutions are beneficial.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills preferred.
Process-oriented with organization and planning skills among competing responsibilities and tasks.

Job Title: Sales Ops Analyst: Commissions and Sales Process
Job_Description:
Canva’s Commitment and Mission




At Canva, we celebrate diversity. We deeply believe that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key to building the best product, team and company. We look for many different skills and abilities, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. So, even if you don’t think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes, we’d still love to hear from you!




Our mission at Canva is to empower the world to design and since launching in 2013, we have grown exponentially, amassing over 110+ million monthly active users across 190 different countries and a team of over 3,400 people… and the best bit is that we’ve only achieved 1% of what we know we’re capable of.




Join us and design your future.




The Role And Team




The Sales Strategy & Operations Sr. Analyst will be a member of the Sales Strategy & Operations team in support of Canva’s continued growth. Sales Strategy & Operations sits within the Sales & Success function that is responsible for driving revenue from Fortune 500 as well as mid-market and SMB companies.




The Sales Strategy & Operations function supports Sales & Success in driving revenue in a scalable and sustainable way, through Incentive design and implementation, run the business reporting and analytics, sales tooling, sales process and enablement. This highly visible role is ideal for a motivated individual who can leverage data driven analysis and structured thinking to solve problems. This team member will be expected to develop a deep understanding of Canva’s Sales methodology and the outcomes the business desires to achieve, and use this to develop sales incentives and sales process. In return, this role offers the right candidate the opportunity to help shape the next phase of Canva’s history.




In this role, you will review effectiveness of sales incentive plans, calculate commissions to ensure sales payouts in an accurate and timely manner, provide commission analytics to finance and cross functional stakeholders and provide input to the improvement and refinement of current incentives. In addition, you will be responsible for enhancing the sales process across new, upsell and renewal deals in Canva’s pay as you grow model, working cross functionally with legal, sales, finance and sales systems to advise on the best way to capture standard and non-standard deals keeping in mind efficiency and data integrity.




What You’ll Do (Sales Commissions)




Estimate commissions accruals at the end of each month based on forecast and performance trends in the business.
Partner closely with sales data analysts who maintain sales performance reportings and forecasting
Calculate sales commissions quarterly, and own the messaging and explanation of how commissions are calculated to sales as well as sales leadership
Provide commissions analytics to cross functional stakeholders and sales leadership (e.g. distribution of sales rep performance, commissions paid vs. on target earnings, commissions paid vs. ARR)
Take data driven approach to evaluate the effectiveness of sales incentive plans across AEs and CSMs, and work with finance and sales leadership to iterate and improve on a bi-annual basis
Be the expert on the why, how and what around incentive plans. Build trainings in partnership with sales enablement bi-annually when incentive plans are rolled out
Potentially in the future, evaluate commission tools to scale commissions process




What You'll Do (Sales Process)




Document processes, make recommendations, and assist in systems/process improvements to enhance overall sales reporting accuracy and speed
Create and improve processes around deal amendments, non-standard deals (e.g. multi-year, pilots, de-bookings, extensions, bridge renewals etc.) to ensure efficiency and data integrity
Provide support to sales on best practices on capturing deals in Salesforce, and work with sales systems team on implementing changes needed to the Salesforce instance
Partner with sales enablement team to roll out communication and trainings related to changes in sales process




What We're Looking For




Bachelors in Engineering, Finance, Economics and/or Accounting or related subject area is required
Proven experience (~5 years) in Finance, Business Operations or Sales Strategy & Operations in fast growing technology company, especially working closely with Sales and customer success organizations
Power user of Excel and Google sheets. Deep comfort with using excel formulas to join data across multiple sources (e.g. index/match, vlookups, sumifs, countifs, array formulas etc.)
Prior experience with Salesforce.com CRM is required, particularly around working with Salesforce.com Opportunity data
Prior experience calculating sales commissions or working on sales incentives highly preferred
Understanding of SQL querying nice-to-have
Outstanding analytical/problem-solving skills
Phenomenal communication skills and the able to interact with various stakeholders




Working at Canva




Our culture is unlike anywhere else and we design your #CanvaLife experience to empower you to do the best work of your life.




Whether you’re in the office, working from home or choosing your own adventure, our benefits for permanent Canvanauts include:




Competitive health benefits plans to support you and your wellbeing
Equity packages to truly be a part of the Canva journey
401(k) retirement plan with company contribution to support you
Hybrid work model (in-office & from home)
Flexible leave so you can recharge, give back, support others or focus on your own professional development.
Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents and carers throughout their parenting and caring journey.
An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance. This is for you to spend on whatever will support your wellbeing and development.. because you know what you need to Vibe and Thrive, better than anyone.
Virtual and in-office wellness benefits including Canva University, Employee Assistant Programs and Fitness & Meditation Classes.
Canva For Good program matching your not-for-profit donations, Force for Good leave (3 paid volunteering days) and a range of sustainability and ethical initiatives to get involved in.




We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion. Please note that interviews are conducted virtually. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

Miovision is a global industry-leading company providing agencies and organizations with modern tools to improve today’s traffic problems. We offer solutions that collect multimodal traffic data and uncover actionable insights, helping organizations get more out of their road network. The result: streets capable of moving more people – safely and efficiently – whether in a car, on a bus, on a bike or e-scooter, or walking. Since 2005, our systems have counted or assisted more than nine billion vehicles worldwide. With global headquarters in Ontario, Canada, we have operations in Germany, Serbia and the United States. For more information, visit




Position Summary




Miovision is looking for a driven Revenue/Sales Analyst who excels at building business relationships to help bridge sales strategy with financial results.




Reporting to the Manager, FP&A, the Revenue Operations Analyst will have a proven track record and partner with the Revenue Operations organization to ensure end-to-end planning, revenue risk mitigation and analysis around pipeline and bookings. Strategic thinking around deal structures that carefully balance strategic revenue growth and healthy gross margins will be critical for success in this role, as well as experience building and delivering variable compensation plans that help incentivize RevOps to achieve financial results on target with our strategic plan.




You have a strong systems background and are proficient at working with teams and data sets to turn them into meaningful insights. The successful candidate is always looking for ways to improve the process leveraging our internal systems and teams to ensure timely, accurate and effective data production.




Key Accountabilities
Revenue Operations Partnership
Tight integration with the Revenue Operations and Go To Market Teams. Build a partnership with RevOps and become an integral part of sales strategy, understanding and refining pipeline, forecasting future implications while managing current results.
Driving Predictable Results
Combine quantitative metrics with qualitative strategic input to drive predictable, accurate forecasts and optimize revenue results
Own the “Deal Desk”
Act as a key contributor to the sales strategy by reviewing the deal structure, including margins, discounts and volumes. Partner with sales to provide recommendations and flexible approaches to help achieve the optimal result.
Variable Compensation
Build, administer, forecast and report on the effectiveness of our variable compensation plans. Deliver transparent, understandable and accurate statements for plan participants and recommend opportunities for improvements or incentives to motivate sales to achieve organizational targets.
Supporting revenue forecasts and future implications of today’s decisions.
Assist in the company’s annual operating plan and departmental budgets.
Partner with business leaders to empower them with financial information to inform impactful business decisions.




Skills/Qualifications




3+ years of work experience in a Sales operations or a similar role
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required, preferably in Commerce or Finance
CPA or equivalent designation in progress or completed is strongly preferred
Advanced level competency in Microsoft Office




Additional Assets




Systems experience with CRM (Salesforce), commissions tools and financial planning tools
Experience in both a SaaS and Hardware business
Experience with query languages (MySQL)
Strong people management and communication skills, verbal and written
Able to tailor communication style and approach to different levels in the organization
Strategic mindset with abstract thinking and problem-solving skills
Must be able to recommend alternatives and provide options




Perks And Benefits




Note: We have reopened our Canadian and US offices but will continue to offer flexible onsite and remote work options. Our Benefits are designed to reflect this and include:




Comprehensive health benefits starting on day one
RRSP Matching Plan
Virtual Healthcare Service provides employees and their families access to healthcare providers 24/7
Internet subsidy and a remote work allowance
Enhanced paternity and maternity leaves
Unlimited vacation policy
Virtual fitness classes

Please indicate if you require accommodation on your application, and our team will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Esta función realizará principalmente las siguientes tareas:




Planificación de la Demanda:

• Coordinar acciones especiales, fase de entrada / salida

La planificación del suministro:

• Reposición de inventario en el almacén

• Presión sobre CS / ventas para respetar los recortes y MOQ

• Organizar muestras con servicio al cliente / ventas

Inventarios

SIFOT.
Back Orders

Corporate Overview

Hubbell Incorporated was founded in 1888 and has grown into an international manufacturer of quality electrical, lighting and power solutions with more than 75 brands used and recognized around the world. Our founder, Harvey Hubbell, developed tooling and equipment to serve the growing demand for new assembly and manufacturing machinery during the industrial revolution. An early, and one of many patents awarded, came for the creation of the first practical method to control electricity through the pull chain socket that remains unchanged today. As a market leader in reliable, electrical solutions, we provide more than half a million products delivered through our various business groups. Hubbell is committed to continually innovating solutions that work, transforming old products with new ideas, and ensuring that we Energize, Enlighten and Empower the communities that support us.




Division Overview

Hubbell Lighting (HLI) is committed to elevating the lighting experience. Empowered by lighting solutions that integrate seamlessly into their environment, save energy, provide improved quality of light, deliver return on investment and armed with Hubbell’s unflinching support, its customers are able to think differently about how, where, and when they can use light. As one of the largest lighting fixture manufacturers in North America, it features a suite of brands that provide a full range of indoor and outdoor lighting products serving the commercial, industrial, institutional, and residential markets.




Brand Overview




Progress Lighting, a Strategic Business Unit of Hubbell, is one of the leading sources for residential and retail lighting with thousands of fixtures to meet the needs of any project. Our team is proud of the quality, stylish products that we provide to customers across multiple industries including retail stores, e-commerce stores, single family homes, and multi-family homes.

Culture matters to us at Progress Lighting! We fully support work-life balance and have created an environment with flexible and hybrid work options. We value and welcome individuals with diverse backgrounds and personalities, always encouraging people to bring their whole self to work.

About The Team




At DoorDash, we're redefining the future of on-demand delivery. We're building a team of incredibly talented product leaders to define and execute on our vision of connecting local delivery networks in cities all across the world.




You will report into one of the following pillars: Merchant, Consumer or New Verticals. This role is a hybrid of remote work and in-person collaboration.




About The Role




Product Managers at DoorDash require a sharp consumer-first eye, platform thinking and strong cross-functional collaboration. As a Product Manager at DoorDash, you will own the product strategy and vision, define the product roadmap and alignment, and help drive the execution. You will be working on mission-critical products that shape the direction of the company.




You’re Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will…




Have a massive impact at a large scale
Work on mission-critical projects
Be a leader in the industry




We’re Excited About You Because…




You have 5+ years of Product Management Industry Experience
You have prior user-facing experience in industries such as eCommerce, technology or multi-sided marketplaces
You have proven abilities in driving product strategy, vision, roadmap alignment and execution
You are experience provided business reviews to senior executives
You have empathy for the users you build for
You are passionate about DoorDash and the problems we are solving for




About DoorDash




At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods.




DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.




Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion




We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.




Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce – people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.




Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.




If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.




Compensation




The location-specific base salary range for this position is listed below. Compensation in other geographies may vary.




Actual compensation within the pay range will be decided based on factors including, but not limited to, skills, prior relevant experience, and specific work location. For roles that are available to be filled remotely, base salary is localized according to employee work location. Please discuss your intended work location with your recruiter for more information.




DoorDash cares about you and your overall well-being, and that’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package, for full-time employees, that includes healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan including an employer match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, wellbeing benefits, paid time off, paid parental leave, and several paid holidays, among others.




In addition to base salary, the compensation package for this role also includes opportunities for equity grants.
