Role Summary




Volkswagen Group of America (VWGoA) is the parent company of Audi, Volkswagen, Lamborghini, Bentley, Bugatti, Ducati, and VW Credit, Inc. (VCI) in the US. As the financial arm of Audi, Volkswagen and Ducati, VCI focuses on providing financing, insurance and ancillary products for customers.




This role will be responsible for defining the roadmap and leading the delivery of best-in-class ownership experiences for customers who lease or finance a VW, Audi, or Ducati across the US and Canada. This position requires close collaboration with other departments, both locally and abroad, (Marketing, Sales, Product, Customer Engagement and Tech) and to ensure timely and accurate updates and consistent delivery of customer and business value.




This role sits within the Customer Strategy, Digital and CRM team. We are looking for an experienced, energetic, and entrepreneurial Product Manager (early career). To fit in, you have to go deep on customer needs and data, and be excited about delivering amazingly simple experiences that will set the foundation for their relationship with VCI, the Brands we support, and their vehicle. You have to true everything back to the customer, ensuring you’re both solving a need for them and delivering business value through a technically sound product.




This role will have visibility to the senior management teams of VCI, Audi, Volkswagen, and Ducati so it will be critical to have exceptional communication and influence skills.




Responsibilities Will Include




Developing and managing the product roadmap for ownership experiences; aligning product improvements to support vision, goals and opportunities
Maintaining and growing a deep knowledge of how technology is applied to best-in-class ownership experiences, driving loyalty and repeat customers
Partnering with UX on consumer research and synthesizing it into relevant features and experiences
Building business cases for the product roadmap and features, and continuously trueing back to defined customer and business KPIs
Maintaining strong relationships with key stakeholders to ensure product plans are aligned with objectives/plans
Defining product requirements, rationalizing and managing a product backlog
Defining product KPIs and success metrics; monitoring performance, identifying and driving improvement opportunities




Role Responsibilities




Product Management (70%)




Discover customer and organizational needs, systems and operations requirements, customer rollout requirements, and usability
Take an active role in enabling product enhancements to deliver a seamless customer experience
Partner with users and stakeholders to implement and support agreed upon solutions
Create and manage a product backlog
Partner with team members to define, track and test concepts in an agile development life cycle
Experience building use cases, data flow diagrams, and user flows
Focus on technical elements, including mapping and integrating with multiple systems
Prioritize issues and inquiries. Manage internal escalation and resolution of issues




Product and Growth Strategy (20%)




Gather user input, market trends, and business trends to define product requirements
Work within an Agile compliant framework and collaborate with partners/business owners to convert strategy and priorities into tangible business requirements, prototypes, design concepts, and feasible product roadmaps
Understand business implications of decisions in order to align work with strategic goals
Review customer satisfaction results; recommends, designs, and implements personal and business unit action plans
Review, analyze and prioritize Voice of the Customer feedback to incorporate into improvements




Leadership (10%)




Lead development teams to produce creative solutions that deliver results by connecting them to the business teams and product vision
Organize interdepartmental activities to ensure completion of the project/product on schedule and within budget




Fully Remote




Primary Location




United States-VCI Home Based Position




Other Locations




United States-Home based position, United States-Virginia-Herndon




Experience




Required –




5-7 years of experience in digital and customer experience product management
4+ years of experience leading teams




Education




Required –




Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, or Engineering




General Skills




Blend of strategic and tactical thinking, creative and analytic reasoning, a deep knowledge of human-centered design, a love of data, and an interest in the auto industry
Passion for identifying and solving real consumer and business problems, and proven ability to prioritize high leverage opportunities to deliver to market
A bias for action and a proven track record of delivering both minimum viable products and scaled solutions within a matrixed organization to market at rapid speed
A passion for and experience of not just launching products, but owning their success and growth
Ability to lead and grow direct teams as well as matrixed partner teams and collaborate across brands and organization
Understanding of the full tech stack required to build and launch scaled products using agile methodologies
Ability to empower designers and developers to deliver great products
Strong analytical mindset and ability to use data and qualitative insights to create exceptional digital experiences
A fantastic storyteller who is at ease presenting to, and can influence executives, peers, and partners




Specialized Skills




Required –




Comprehensive understanding of the latest web and mobile product technologies and user experience best practices
Understanding of and appreciation for the vehicle shopping, buying, and financing experience
Success in developing strong working relationships across many layers of an organization, outside agencies and suppliers
Experience managing the development and delivery of direct to consumer web or mobile applications.
Ability to build, manage and monitor business cases and outcomes for experiences and products
Deep understanding of user-centered product development practices, including journey mapping and design thinking.
Knowledge and practice of core principals of Agile methodology and development practices including Scrum, Kanban, Lean software development, etc.
Familiarity and experience using tools such as Jira and Confluence for product user stories and agile development
Comfortable working with tight deadlines; must be proactive, self-directed and able to multi-task




Desired –




Technical background




Work Flexibility




Travel will be less than 20% of the time

About Catch

Catch is a digital experience platform specialist, focused on creating exceptional digital platforms for ambitious organisations including WWF, Sharp, YOTEL, Freeview, University of Salford and more.

About The Role

At Catch, Product Managers are responsible for uncovering, interrogating and solutionising the requirements of a particular project or platform.

They work closely with Project Managers, Experience Design, QA and Development team members to ensure our work is closely aligned with our clients' business needs and platform requirements and to provide the most appropriate solution for both our clients and their users.

Team: Delivery

Reporting to: Product Management Lead

Key responsibilities

Planning and Business Analysis

Ensure all requirements and briefs are interrogated
Chair workshops and ensure outputs are clearly defined and delivered
Author backlogs and review with the team and clients
Work with Project Managers and the team to establish estimates and roadmaps


Project Delivery

Own project scope and ensure backlogs are kept up to date
Brief Experience Design and Development teams on requirements
Ensure requirements are fully fleshed out and met in Delivery


Business Development

Act as an advocate for assigned projects and platforms
Identify and capitalise upon opportunities for business development
Create and take ownership of long term roadmaps for our clients' platforms
Research and identify areas of technological growth

2+ years experience in a product-focused or BA role
Hands-on approach to product development and ownership
A passion for digital products
Track record of strong client and colleague relationships
Positive and confident approach when working with clients
Experience working with open-source web development technologies

Position Summary

Own and drive a product from vision, through design, to requirements, and finally delivery. Facilitate within a larger cross-functional team to solve business problems. Work with significant autonomy and freedom, requiring little oversight. This autonomy, however, will be within a broader strategy set by a Senior Product Manager and/or Group Product Manager. Demonstrate the company's core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion, and safety.




Essential Job Functions

Identify product requirements and future enhancements through collaborative engagements to support product strategies
Create, maintain and communicate product catalog roadmaps, including near-term delivery and 1-2 year product evolution, to engage stakeholders across the organization in aligning and supporting company and business unit strategies
Create highly collaborative cross-functional partnerships across the Kroger matrix organization
Identify, measure and improve key product catalog metrics to enhance the customer/user experience, and create a compelling, relevant product vision using web metrics, customer/user loyalty/insights, customer/user feedback/research and internal operational metrics
Identify opportunities to create best-in-class capabilities by leveraging customer & user feedback and team knowledge/expertise in order to connect company strengths with available resources
Develop a product plan and deliver breakthrough experiences to market by working with technical and non-technical partners; measure output, improve execution and continuously deliver production expectations
Model Agile principles by maintaining a groomed backlog and providing 1-N prioritization for backlog
Set criteria for Minimum Viable Product to increase the speed/frequency with which enhancements and new capabilities are delivered
Travel to work locations to attend company meetings
Travel to interview/observe the users and/or customers
Must be able to perform the essential job functions of this position with or without reasonable accommodation




Minimum Position Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in computer science, business, marketing, management or equivalent practical experience
3+ years of experience bringing customer-facing technology products to market
3+ years of software development, product management or business analyst experience in an technology business with demonstrated success in sales and/or customer use through the delivery of new/evolving products
Excellent oral/written communication skills and extreme attention-to-detail
Demonstrated leadership experience in product management
Proficient Microsoft Office skills
Ability to identify metrics/key performance measures and use data to drive decisions that enhance the customer & user experience




Desired Previous Experience/Education

Any experience with iterative product development (Agile)
Any experience using Atlassian products
Any product management experience with a multi-channel retailer

Job Summary




ClinicalMind is seeking a dynamic product manager who is passionate about building a B2B SaaS business and a solid foundation for growth. This role is both strategic and tactical, as you will be responsible for setting product vision, defining our CMGO product roadmap and ensuring top-notch execution.




You will report to the Vice President, Product and Marketing for the CM Technology business unit. We are a very collaborative company, and in this role, you will work cross-functionally with leaders from Engineering, Client Success, and Marketing teams to understand customer needs and business opportunities.




ClinicalMind is a rapidly growing healthcare communications company known for providing innovative technology solutions, outstanding scientific storytelling, and an exceptional client experience. ClinicalMind combines a diverse portfolio of capabilities into a seamlessly integrated set of solutions for biotechnology and pharmaceutical clients.




Responsibilities




Establish product strategy and roadmap and consistently deliver against success metrics
Lead and influence a cross functional Agile Scrum team to deliver products that meet business needs and generates measurable value to customers
Be the recognized expert in the business on the product, the market, relevant technology and the competition
Facilitate ideation, development and delivery for new products and feature enhancements based on measurable business value and data-driven decision making
Break down and prioritize delivery of products and features by developing and maintaining the product backlog, user stories, and cross-product dependencies
Synthesize research, analysis, and stakeholder feedback into detailed product requirements, from business problems to detailed user stories and acceptance criteria
Keep stakeholders informed of progress and proactively set expectations of product changes and improvements




Job Requirements & Qualifications

Proven track record of identifying customer and business needs and converting them into application and operational requirements

Comfortable interfacing at all levels and maintaining strong working relationships across cross-functional teams
Proven ability to work with executive stakeholders to guide vision and create action from feedback
Excellent project management and prioritization skills
Experience with agile development methodologies including Scrum and Kanban, and Behavioral Driven Development




Travel: Minimal travel will be required to: a) customer research b) major medical conferences both in the US and internationally as identified as important by clients or where CM is conducting a supported function/meeting/activity within the designated specialties as well as other medical education conferences and meetings as required; c) to other locales for training or other corporate meetings




Location: US-Remote

Summary

MediShout is a unique and fast-growing startup that digitises operational pathways in healthcare so staff can deliver best patient care. Our App is the first in healthcare for staff to report and resolve any non-clinical issue that delays them (e.g. faulty IT, broken equipment, missing stock, estates issues) whilst AI-analytics predict issues in advance. Our customers include large hospitals groups, global facilities management companies, and medical device companies with billion pound revenues. MediShout is entering an exciting growth phase and seeking an experienced Product Manager who is passionate about our mission and capable of supporting our rapid growth. You will support this growth phase by working with our product team, product users and the business development team to uphold and improve our development standards, systems and processes.

About MediShout

The world’s first platform aggregating all operational departments and suppliers in hospitals
Hospital staff can report any operational issue using our web/mobile apps or QR codes
Working with the world’s largest medical equipment suppliers and facilities management companies
Backed by renowned investors Episode1 Ventures, Nickleby Capital, KHP Ventures, Atomico Angels
On the NHS Innovation Accelerator and Microsoft for Startups Accelerator
The core values we seek in our employees:
Be Trustworthy (b) Be Impactful (c) Be Empathetic (d) Be Insightful (e) Be Adaptable


The Job Role

You will work within the Product Team as a Product Manager, working closely with your line manager, the other Solutions squad members, the Business Development Team and the Customer Success Team. You will identify user needs and functional contributions toward larger business objectives in order to clearly articulate what success looks like for the new product solution. You will manage the product development lifecycle for the squad, including fulfilling the facilitation role of SCRUM master. You will work closely with others in the Product team, to contribute towards the company vision and plan for how Solutions squad projects will be integrated into the core product. You will be responsible for delivering your project and lifecycle contributions in a timely and efficient manner.

Responsibilities

Conceptualise and Deliver
Contribute to the product roadmap as a member of the Product Team
Focus on enhancing and evolving the MediShout product through the creation of new solutions
Gain and document an immersive understanding of the user personas relevant to solutions squad projects
Meet new customers at hospitals / client sites for project scoping, launches & feedback
Organise and Communicate
Communicate with clients to understand their goals and objectives
Work with the project manager to develop project documentation and manage stakeholders
Lead SCRUM rituals for your squad, including but not exclusively daily standups, backlog refinement and sprint planning
Manage JIRA user stories with clearly defined requirements, considerations and acceptance criteria
Maintain processes for story creation, development and bug/feature reporting from ideation through early iterations through to when the solution is absorbed into the core product
Plan and organise development sprints, partnering with the core squad product manager to deliver core enhancements when capacity is available
Work with the UX/UI designer to define and manage UI components within storybook.js.org
Analyse, Test and Refine
Analyse and produce user insights from platform and analytics data pertaining to solutions projects
Strive to deliver intuitive and user-centred solutions
Pursue the ongoing improvement of the MediShout product, building awareness of latest developments within the technology industry, including new processes, coding languages and approaches to problem solving
Work with the UX/UI designer to usability test UX designs using useberry.com or similar
Analyse and develop insights based on user testing result and other feedback
Refine and iterate based on user insights
Own and Improve
Present solutions to internal and external stakeholders
Support business development in pitching for new work
Work with line-manager to define and refine product team workflows
Pursue the ongoing improvement of the MediShout product, building awareness of bleeding edge technological advancements
Collaborate with other Product Managers and Designers to build and maintain a clear system for language definitions, user personas and user documentation
Contribute towards objective improvements in Product Team KPIs, including Net Promoter Score


Requirements

Experience

Experience: minimum 3 years of experience in client-facing Product Management with evidence of continual improvement through user testing and the interpretation of analytics data for insights
Startups: previous experience working in a startup or agency environment
Industry: experience within the healthcare industry is a bonus, in particular digital health
Communication: experience presenting to stakeholders of all levels, including c-suite


Characteristics

Trustworthy: be dependable and honest, deliver what you promise or communicate if you can’t
Impactful: passionate for improving global healthcare via technology, take pride in work, problem-solver
Empathetic: treat colleagues and clients with respect, listen and understand challenges of the team
Insightful: have insight into your strengths and weaknesses, be open to receiving and giving feedback


Adaptable: manage complex processes in a rapidly changing environment, be flexible, can-do attitude

Benefits

Salary, Benefits and Specifics

£55,000-£65,000 (depending on experience) with annual salary reviews
Employee shares, which vest at intervals
25 days annual leave, not including Bank Holiday
Work Laptop, extra monitor and accessories
Access to Spaces office across the UK
Monday to Friday, 8.30am to 5.30pm
6-month probation period
Travel reimbursement if visiting clients e.g. driving or public transport
Hybrid working (requirement to travel up to 2-3 days per week for office/customer sites)


What We Provide

Tangible impact on hospital efficiencies and patient care
Flexible working where possible
Feel valued and empowered to contribute to core company decisions
Work with a passionate, exceptional and smart group of individuals

About The Team




At DoorDash, we're redefining the future of on-demand delivery. We're building a team of incredibly talented product leaders to define and execute on our vision of connecting local delivery networks in cities all across the world.




You will report into one of the following pillars: Merchant, Consumer or New Verticals. This role is a hybrid of remote work and in-person collaboration.




About The Role




Product Managers at DoorDash require a sharp consumer-first eye, platform thinking and strong cross-functional collaboration. As a Product Manager at DoorDash, you will own the product strategy and vision, define the product roadmap and alignment, and help drive the execution. You will be working on mission-critical products that shape the direction of the company.




You’re Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will…




Have a massive impact at a large scale
Work on mission-critical projects
Be a leader in the industry




We’re Excited About You Because…




You have 5+ years of Product Management Industry Experience
You have prior user-facing experience in industries such as eCommerce, technology or multi-sided marketplaces
You have proven abilities in driving product strategy, vision, roadmap alignment and execution
You are experience provided business reviews to senior executives
You have empathy for the users you build for
You are passionate about DoorDash and the problems we are solving for




About DoorDash




At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods.




DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.




Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion




We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.




Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce – people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.




Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.




If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.




Compensation




The location-specific base salary range for this position is listed below. Compensation in other geographies may vary.




Actual compensation within the pay range will be decided based on factors including, but not limited to, skills, prior relevant experience, and specific work location. For roles that are available to be filled remotely, base salary is localized according to employee work location. Please discuss your intended work location with your recruiter for more information.




DoorDash cares about you and your overall well-being, and that’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package, for full-time employees, that includes healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan including an employer match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, wellbeing benefits, paid time off, paid parental leave, and several paid holidays, among others.




In addition to base salary, the compensation package for this role also includes opportunities for equity grants.




California Pay Range:




$144,500—$282,000 USD




New York Pay Range:




$144,500—$282,000 USD




Washington Pay Range:




$144,500—$282,000 USD

Our Company




The workplace is undergoing a complete transformation. Today with the rise in hybrid working and expectation of employee personal choice, use of the workplace has become completely unpredictable. In order for workplace and real estate leaders to effectively manage space and serve today's employees, they need to fully understand physical space and how people are using it in real-time. This ability is called spatial intelligence, and VergeSense is the leader in providing these insights, which lead to reduced real estate costs, improved employee retention, and better sustainability.




VergeSense is the leading workplace analytics platform used by innovative Fortune 500 companies across the world. These businesses use VergeSense to transform their static office into a dynamic workplace that matches today's employee needs and expectations. Powered by intelligent sensors and AI-driven insights, customers rely on VergeSense to reduce or reinvest real estate, improve building operations, and create spaces that meet today's employee expectations.




The Role




VergeSense is looking for a Product Manager to join our IoT & Connected Devices product team. We help customers measure their spaces so they can use data to transform how they operate, design, manage and use office spaces. Our large customer base and highly engaged users are looking for VergeSense to bring some stability and control to a corporate office real estate industry that is undergoing a massive transformation as companies and employees redefine the purpose of the office. We are already measuring occupancy and more across 60M+ SQFT of spaces and we are in pursuit of every SQFT.







As a Product Manager on the IoT & Connected Devices team, you will help drive the vision, strategy and execution for our AI powered, connected devices and the IoT onboarding and management user experiences. Your impact will help VergeSense scale to millions of devices in the field and ensure our customers are able to measure their spaces quickly, accurately and reliably. You will join a world class product team that is relentlessly living by VergeSense values with the aim to build products that customers love and accelerate growth for our business.

What you will do

Become an expert in our customer use-cases and key problems, our market dynamics, our business, and last but not least our products.
Align with the vision for Connected Devices & IoT products at VergeSense and help evolve it to address the key market trends and customer pains
Drive the roadmap for device onboarding, installation and commissioning workflows, monitoring tools for fleet management and connectivity
Partner with design/UX and engineering leads to perform discovery with customers and lead this empowered team through discovery → delivery → GTM.
Partner with cross functional teams including marketing, sales and support to ensure smooth and successful GTM for your product/features.
Define and continuously measure metrics to monitor the success of our products and features, defined by their impact on our customer needs and business objectives.
Conduct and present market research and competitor analysis to the rest of the product team.

Who you are

You have 3+ years of product management experience
You are hungry and motivated to make an impact and move the needle for our customers and our business
You are a lifelong learner, curiosity is core to who you are, there is always one more “Why?” you look to ask.
You have solid fundamentals in product management, and know how and when to make decisions with imperfect information.
You realize the value of clear, concise and story based communication. You take pride in being able to deliver key takeaways and punchlines in the shortest, most clear way possible.
You understand how to lead via influence, you know how to handle tough conversations with empathy and poise.
You are organized, you do what you say, and say what you do.
You have experience working with IOT and/or large time series data products (Plus)

Benefits




• A high-impact role in an emerging industry leader

• Competitive compensation and equity

• Employer-sponsored medical, dental and vision insurance

• Open Vacation policy: take time off when you need it




We value people from all walks of life who exhibit kindness, curiosity, discipline, humility, and passion to excel at what they do. If you would like to contribute to our team, we encourage you to apply.

About Reed Courses

Reed Courses is a sister company to Reed.co.uk; one of Britain’s most established digital brands. Our mission is to help everyone achieve their goals through learning. We work with hundreds of respected learning providers to advertise over 80,000 courses in a wide range of subjects; from accounting and HR right through to fitness and cooking. We offer courses for both consumers and businesses - helping individuals learn something new and develop their career, whilst also allowing employers to upskill their staff and create a more knowledgeable workforce.

Overview

We’re looking for a self starting, ambitious Product Manager seeking accelerated career development within a highly collaborative, tightly knit cross functional team. Reporting to the Head of Product and working closely with an experienced cross-functional team, you’ll be responsible for the continued development of a high performing ecommerce/marketplace product, delivering key strategic initiatives and taking a leading role in the development and delivery of our product strategy.

Key Responsibilities

Developing a deep understanding of the customer - both B2B (course provider) and B2C (course seeker) - through the gathering & analysis of customer feedback
Championing the needs of both customer sets, in line with the product strategy for the business
Full understanding of our competitors’ offerings within a complex product landscape
Working closely with all members of the development team, as well as the Product Designer, Product Analyst and CRM/Marketing team
Managing stakeholders of different levels of seniority from multiple different functional areas of the business
Use of data to inform decision making, as well as monitoring key KPIs to ensure continued health of the business
Own the roadmap and backlog, ensuring the team is focused on the highest priorities and delivering on schedule
Influence the development of the product & business strategies through idea generation and the identification of future opportunities

Required skills

Strong customer empathy with the ability to fully understand the needs of the user
Highly analytical, with the ability to use data to understand key business drivers and how they underpin strategic and tactical decision making
Strong problem solving skills, with the ability to think critically and creatively to overcome obstacles and get things done
Innovative & full of ideas for new opportunities
Commercial awareness within a complex product with multiple business models
Excellent written and verbal communication, with an ability to document processes
Effective relationship building skills with a desire to be part of a team with a strong identity
Ability to get up to speed quickly with a complex product
Desire to take ownership, develop leadership skills and ultimately represent your area of the product to the wider Reed business
The ability to wear multiple hats and take on additional responsibilities within a small team



Desirable skills

Experience with an ecommerce or marketplace product
Fluency with GA and/or Looker
Experience with AB test planning & delivery, including familiarity with Google Optimise
Experience managing senior stakeholders
Experience with a dedicated, co-located development team
Experience working with other product managers, on the same product
Line Management experience is preferable

What we can offer you:

Flexible working, including core hours and location flexibility.
25 days annual leave plus bank holidays.
Flexible holiday scheme with the option to buy, sell or carry over up to 5 days a year.
Moving home leave.
10% of your time dedicated to personal development.
Financial benefits including pension and health cash plan subscription .
Enhanced family leave policies.
Insurance benefits including life assurance.
Love Mondays events.
Discount scheme including gyms and popular retailers.
Range of wellbeing and mental health support avenues.
Newly refurbished office in an amazing location, with countless bars, restaurants and theatres right on the doorstep.







At Reed.co.uk we’re a team of people who are passionate about creating an inclusive culture. We want Reed.co.uk to be a place where everyone feels they truly belong, and we want to work with people who place the same level of importance on this as we do.

Reed.co.uk is an equal opportunities employer meaning that everyone is welcome to apply for our roles. We offer a guaranteed interview for disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria, and we are a proud signatory of the Armed Forces Covenant, meaning that we welcome applications from ex-services personnel and reservists.

If you apply for one of our roles and want to speak to someone confidentially about any additional support you may need to help you be the best you can be during your interview process, then just let one of our Talent Acquisition Partners know when they reach out to you – they will be happy to help!

Please note: All job offers are subject to satisfactory references and compliance with our vetting requirements.

We’re looking for a Data Center professional. Someone who understands the ins and outs of traditional network designs and where they fall short. Someone who knows there is something better out there and wants to be part of the team driving the future. Someone who isn’t afraid to push the boundaries of what’s possible. This is a San Jose Edge / Hybrid position. You must be able to attend meetings in San Jose as needed.

Sounds like you? Then we have the right opportunity for you!

How You'll Make Your Mark:

You will lay out the telemetry and analytics direction for the data center portfolio, manage the feature requirements and definition, and work with engineering and PLM leads to turn it into reality
You will identify the right technology partners, both internal and external, to maximize the adoption of these features and capabilities.
You will be the recognized authority on relevant subject matter including technologies, theories, and techniques.
You will successfully operate in the most complex disciplines.
You will manage cross-division functional teams or projects that affect the organization's long-term goals and objectives.
You will routinely exercise independent judgment in developing methods, techniques, and criteria for achieving objectives.
You will assist in developing strategy and direction, including creating high level and detailed presentations.

About You:

You are a highly motivated product management professional with 10+ years of Data Center/Product Management experience.
You have a Bachelor of Science degree or equivalent in computer science, engineering, or related field of study.
You have working knowledge of Data Center virtualization technologies, protocols, containers, network applications, and cloud/multi-cloud environments.
You have a deep understanding of telemetry and analytics, what aspects of the same are most valuable to run large data centers - planning/troubleshooting/etc.
You have 4+ years of experience with Data Center technologies from VMware, HPE, Cisco, Dell, Arista, Juniper, etc.
You have the ability to synthesize market data and customer requirements into a Product Requirement Document (PRD) and Business Case to bring innovative and disruptive products to market. Including the art of narrowing features down to target specific customer segments.
You have the ability to distil complex ideas/concepts into concise value propositions.
You will guide key stakeholders on the portfolio strategy across all phases of the lifecycle (e.g., planning, development, launch, management, exit).
You have the ability to identify, collaborate with, and on-board external vendors whose products are complimentary to our solutions and provide value-add to our customers.
You have extensive team skills and ability to cross functionally drive/influence work through others, ability to mentor teams to achieve results for complex, ambiguous projects.
You have extensive skills in cost efficient solution building, financial performance metric creation.
You have an MBA or advanced degree in computer science or engineering preferred.

Role Purpose:

The Product Manager is responsible for supporting on developing our Analytics Delivery and Insights product vision and roadmap, in close collaboration with our functional leaders, data scientists, data engineers and application developers who are spearheading the Advanced Analytics transformation across Majid Al Futtaim. The role holder is also responsible for aligning the project sponsor and the leadership team with the value offered with the solution, and leading a team of Analytics Business Partners across countries to implement the solutions and drive value.




Majid Al Futtaim Retail is continuing to develop and build its analytics talent to support its advanced analytics agenda. The various analytics use cases launched by the Retail Analytics Unit on a start-up mode will establish the unit’s foundation to develop a powerful product portfolio following it’s sustainable growth. As such, team members are given the latitude to shape the trajectory of the unit and bring their ideas and visions into fruition.




He/she will be at the forefront of enhancing the Advanced Analytics value proposition, in line with the long-term digital and non-digital objectives of Majid Al Futtaim.

Role Details – Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:




Product Vision and Roadmap Strategy

Drive the full product lifecycle, working closely with the team to drive new feature development from start to finish - define requirements, write user stories, solve problems, make decisions during development, and lead ongoing improvements
Drive the overall product management and governance for analytics use-cases
Work closely with the head of analytics and other functional leaders to create the analytics product vision and strategy
Gather business needs and feed into the development process, ensuring deliverables are aligned with the original goals and objectives of the project
Manage 2-3 products across one or two functions; review existing prototypes and plan future portfolio
Manage the metrics that make the product offering and value proposition ahead of the curve and ensure that the budget allocated is spent towards the realization of these metrics
Gather input from a variety of internal and external sources to define product concepts; analyze competitors and market trends; evaluate technologies; develop detailed requirements, feature definitions, implementation plans, and internal communications
Educate business stakeholders on product solutions and benefits including knowledge transfer and training for on-going management of features




Coordination and Communication

Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and business teams and other key stakeholders as their business partner during the entire lifecycle of product development, including deployment and post-deployment activities. Proactively identify problems that arise in the project, outlining options, recommending solutions, and escalating as needed
Work with the development team to build robust impact measurement methodology and align with the leadership
Interact with 3rd party product, business and technology counterparts; develop productive relationships to facilitate delivery from start to finish.
Keep up-to-date with latest tech trends and remain at the forefront of an ever-advancing analytics domain
Educate business stakeholders on product solutions and benefits including knowledge transfer and training for on-going management of features
Ensure regular information exchange with all relevant stakeholders and update them on the development progress across projects
Build relationships and maintain strong partnerships with key personnel to help achieve organizational goals
Collaborate with key stakeholders to ensure clarity of the specifications and expectations of the Retail Analytics Unit




Audit and Reporting

Develop presentations on advanced analytics and performance in key areas of the business and communicate results across the organization
Responsible for the preparation of business presentations and reports related to Retail Analytics for various stakeholders, on periodic and ad hoc basis as and when required
Perform regular audit of various processes and databases for the Retail Analytics Unit in order to identify gaps and risks, and propose corrective actions




Policies and Procedures

Develop and review the Retail Analytics policies and procedures and ensure it is implemented and reported on as a part of the policies and procedures for the Retail Analytics Unit
Develop and implement relevant policies and procedures




Human Capital Responsibilities

Ensure the implementation of the performance management process
Provide mentorship for the purpose of developing a continuous talent pipeline for key roles
Identify training needs and coordinate with the HC department to ensure facilitation of training requirements
Oversee the development and implementation of on the job-training
Ensure constant availability of the required competent staff to support the organization in meeting all its responsibilities, plans, and objectives
Provide inputs while developing MAF Retail’s corporate policies and relevant procedures, and monitor the implementation




Personal Characteristics and Required Background:




Minimum Qualifications/education:

Bachelor’s Degree in an IT-related field or Computer Engineering
Master’s Degree in a similar field is preferred




Minimum experience:

7+ years in a managerial Product Management role in an international environment; creating and building complex analyses and evaluation tools for assessing/tracking performance and learning associated user behaviors with the ability to demonstrate value and track record
2+ years in the retail/FMCG business and GCC experience is preferred




Skills:

Strong leadership and people management capabilities with proven ability to develop strategic relationships with senior leadership stakeholders
Expert in developing analytics solutions and products using machine learning and statistics

The Product Manager is the magic in the middle of our product teams. Understanding what our customers want, what the business wants, and what is technically possible is no easy challenge! You’ll be able to understand these (sometimes conflicting) needs and synthesise them into something tangible.



We have 7 teams that build our products, and you’ll manage the end-to-end delivery of products coming out of either Payments or Safe Play teams. You don’t need to know too much about what these are just yet, we have plenty of domain expertise already that will only be too keen to help you learn.



What you’ll bring is that innate inquisitiveness, innovation and intelligence to see where value can be added, and which ideas are worth pursuing (and which ones aren’t).



The reality is that priorities change, some things will work better than anyone expected, and some won’t. You’ll need to be constantly looking at what’s being done and what needs to be done, asking “How are we helping our players?”



You don’t need to be a Product Manager right now. If you can talk to us about how you can manage these competing priorities, always bringing fresh solutions to the needs of customers, then we’d like to chat.







Stuff you’ve possibly done in the past:



Listened intently to customers; understood what they want and what’s possible
Come up with new ways of delighting customers.
Changed your viewpoint. If the information changes, so does your opinion.
Stood up for what you believed in and took people with you.
Influenced others, especially those with fancier job titles than yours.
Spun plates! (If you can keep your head when all about you are losing theirs…)





Any nice perks?



How about free food? Breakfasts, lunches, snacks, coffee? It's on us. (Our chefs will make you something special if you don't fancy what's on the menu) 🥘
Pension - we'll match your contribution and add 2% 💰
Bonus - paid quarterly 💸
Healthcare from day 1 🏥
On site gym (to work off that free food) 😅

Hi, we're Oscar. We're hiring a Product Operations Manager to join our Product Operations team.

Oscar is the first health insurance company built around a full stack technology platform and a focus on serving our members. We started Oscar in 2012 to create the kind of health insurance company we would want for ourselves—one that behaves like a doctor in the family.

About The Role

The Product Operations team unlocks Oscar’s ability to ship more products better and faster, which is critical to Oscar’s overall mission to use technology and design to refactor healthcare. The primary function of Product Operations is to execute and continuously improve processes leading up to product launch, as well as ongoing processes that have not been automated.

As a Product Operations Manager in the Communications and Automations domain, you will be embedded with 3 of our engineering pods, working in partnership with a talented team of Product Managers, Engineers and Designers. You’ll become an expert in your domain area and become the “go to” person for questions about the current functionality of our configurable engagement and automation tools. You’ll own key product delivery processes, such as campaign reviews, stakeholder support and training, campaign troubleshooting and issue resolution, synthesis of stakeholder feedback, QA Planning, Launch Readiness, and Bug Triage -- both ensuring that they’re executed well and continuously improved.

You will report to the Product Operations Manager II. This is a hybrid role. You will work part of the time in the New York City office and part of the time work-from-home/remote.

The base pay for this role is $120,000 - $157,500 per year. You are also eligible for employee benefits, company equity grants and annual performance bonuses.

Responsibilities

Define best practices for usage of configurable engagement and automation tools, and train and empower stakeholders to adhere to these best practices.
Execute on operational tasks, such reviewing and approving drafted Campaigns and Automation scripts to ensure they drive intended business outcomes.
Dive into data and systems using SQL to understand trends and troubleshoot issues.
Aggregate and synthesize stakeholder feedback to influence roadmap development.
Build and maintain effective relationships with Product Management, Design, Engineering, Marketing, and Operations to collaborate and discover solutions as a team.
Facilitate internal communications around project status, feature launches and dependencies.
Ensure that bugs are being escalated and triaged appropriately.
Create and maintain documentation to make processes sustainable and scalable.
Design and implement new processes while anticipating potential future use cases to ensure long term scalability in solution design.

Qualifications

5+ years of work experience in a cross-functional role in technology or operations
At least 3+ years of that experience involves working directly with engineers and designers
Previous experience partnering closely with marketing or operations teams
You’ve demonstrated your ability to pick up technical concepts; while SQL is not a requirement for the role coming in, you will need to learn and use SQL regularly in this role.

Bonus Points

SQL skills are strongly preferred.

Pay Transparency

Final offer amounts, within the base pay set forth above, are determined by factors including your relevant skills, education, and experience.

Full-time employees are eligible for benefits including: medical, dental, and vision benefits, paid holidays, paid vacation and sick time, paid parental leave, 401(k) plan participation, life and disability insurance, and paid wellness time and reimbursements.

Browns Shoes is Canada’s leading independent shoe retailer. The company is known for its top brands and international designer collections as well as its exclusive street savvy fashion for women, men, and kids. Now with 70 stores, the Montreal-based company is looking to further its lead in the market through continued innovation and disruption in the digital and omni spaces.




Job Description




Reporting directly to the Head of Digital and Marketing, The Product Manager will take ownership of some critical new e-commerce products and help lay the foundation for the newly formed Product Team. You’ll be working very closely with our Product Designers, Engineers, and other cross functional partners.




The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in fashion and emerging trends in e-commerce, a sharp business mind, and a true empathy for our customers.




Responsibilities




Product Discovery

· Work with Business Manager and Director of E-Comm Technology considering usability, demand, and LOE

· Define KPIs that ladder up to OKRs

· Work with stakeholders (Finance, Marketing, Tech teams) to align on roadmap and gain their buy-in




Delivery and Execution

· Own the Product roadmap including prioritization, opportunity costs, timing, KPIs, wireframes, etc. in partnership with Product Designers and Director of E-comm Technology

· Own product launches and coordination with cross functional partners (e.g., Marketing launch)

· Assist in writing requirements for the engineering team, lead the Agile ceremonies (including weekly sprint reviews), and maintain product backlog in Jira for each initiative

· Partner with other Product Managers, Engineers, cross functional partners, and internal stakeholders through end-to-end implementations

· Run product roadmap meetings keeping Leadership and key stakeholders informed




Product Strategy and Vision

· In partnership with the Head of Marketing and Digital and Director of CRM, share vision for overall Digital Experience

· Serve as a product evangelist, thought leader, and subject matter expert to other PMs and rest of company

· Stay abreast of latest trends in tech, e-comm, UX, retail, fashion, buying, planning and competitive landscape




Requirements

Bachelor’s degree; Master’s degree a plus but not necessary
Minimum of 3 years’ experience as a Product Manager
Minimum of 5 years total relevant work experience
Experience working in Agile environments and running sprint ceremonies
While an engineering background is not necessary, a strong fluency in technical requirements is important
Strong and demonstrated sense of customer empathy




More about us

As cliché as it sounds, we really put our people first. We put the highest emphasis on building a nurturing, supportive and fun culture that supports both individual growth and team spirit. As a family-owned company since 1940, we amplify our teams through a culture of openness and support. We celebrate our wins, learn from our failures, and are always on the lookout for people that share a similar ethos. If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you!




While we appreciate your interest in this role, please note that only selected candidates will be contacted




Thank you for your interest in Browns




Chaussures Browns est le principal détaillant de chaussures indépendant au Canada. Il est connu pour ses grandes marques et ses collections de designers internationales, ainsi que pour sa mode exclusive et branchée pour femmes, hommes et enfants. Comptant aujourd'hui 70 magasins, l'entreprise montréalaise cherche à consolider son avance sur le marché en poursuivant l'innovation et la diversification dans les secteurs numérique et omnicanal.




Description de tâches




Sous la responsabilité du chef du digital et du marketing, le responsable de produit se chargera de nouveaux produits essentiels pour le commerce électronique et contribuera à la mise en place de la nouvelle équipe de produits. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec nos concepteurs de produits, nos ingénieurs et d'autres partenaires interfonctionnels.

Responsabilités

Découverte du produit

· Travailler avec le directeur commercial et le directeur de la technologie du commerce électronique en tenant compte de la convivialité, de la demande et de la perte d’exclusivité (LOE)

· Définir les indicateurs de performance clés (KPI) qui s'échelonnent jusqu'aux objectifs et résultats clés (OKR)

· Travailler avec les parties prenantes (finances, marketing, équipes techniques) pour s'aligner sur la stratégie et gagner leur approbation




Livraison et exécution

· Gérer la stratégie produits, y compris la priorisation, les coûts d'opportunité, les délais, les indicateurs de performance clés, les maquettes fonctionnelles, etc. en partenariat avec les concepteurs de produits et le directeur de la technologie du commerce électronique

· Assurer le lancement des produits et la coordination avec les partenaires interfonctionnels (par exemple, lancement marketing)

· Participer à la mise au point des exigences pour l'équipe d'ingénieurs, diriger les cérémonies Agile (y compris les réunions de sprint hebdomadaires) et tenir à jour le carnet de produit dans Jira pour chacune des initiatives

· Collaborer avec d'autres responsables de produits, ingénieurs, partenaires interfonctionnels et parties prenantes internes pour la mise en œuvre de bout en boutRun product roadmap meetings keeping Leadership and key stakeholders informed




Stratégie produits et vision

· Partager, en partenariat avec le chef du numérique et marketing et le directeur de la gestion de la relation client, une vision globale de l'expérience numérique.

· Agir en tant qu'évangéliste du produit, leader d'opinion et expert en la matière auprès des autres chefs de projet et du reste de la compagnie

· Rester à la pointe des dernières tendances de la technologie, du commerce électronique, de l'expérience client, du commerce de détail, de la mode, des achats, de la planification et du marché concurrentiel




Exigences

Baccalauréat ; la maîtrise est un atout mais n'est pas exigée
Minimum de 3 ans d'expérience en tant que responsable de produit
Minimum de 5 ans d'expérience professionnelle pertinente
Expérience de travail dans des contextes Agile et de gestion de cérémonies de sprint
Une formation d'ingénieur n'est pas nécessaire, mais la maîtrise des exigences techniques est essentielle

· Un sens aigu et démontré de l'empathie envers le client




Plus d'informations sur notre compagnie

Aussi cliché que cela puisse paraître, notre personnel passe avant tout. Nous accordons la plus grande importance à la mise en place d'une culture enrichissante, positive et conviviale qui favorise à la fois la croissance individuelle et l'esprit d'équipe. En tant qu'entreprise familiale créée en 1940, nous renforçons nos équipes grâce à une culture d'ouverture et de soutien. Nous célébrons nos victoires, nous apprenons de nos échecs et nous sommes toujours à la recherche de personnes qui partagent la même philosophie. Si vous vous reconnaissez dans ces caractéristiques, nous serions ravis de vous rencontrer !




Nous avons hâte de recevoir votre candidature; notez que nous communiquerons seulement avec les personnes retenues.




Merci de l’intérêt que vous portez à Browns!

We’re Slyp. And we’re on a mission to eliminate paper receipts for good. Founded by former PayPal executives in 2017 and now backed by the four major banks, Slyp is an award-winning retail-fintech transforming the world of receipts.

In Australia alone, we are printing over 1 billion meters of non-recyclable paper receipts each year. But this is just the start of the problem – we believe receipts are also a missed opportunity to understand and engage shoppers’ post-purchase.

Slyp automatically delivers a revolutionary smart receipt right inside your banking app to create a seamless customer experience. With Slyp, customers pay as normal and can immediately view and interact with their smart receipts in their mobile banking app, anytime.

Our values (‘the Slyp six’) form the heart of everything we do and are apart of why Slyp is an award-winning Fintech backed by all four major banks.

This is your chance to join as we shape the future of customer experience.

Position

As a Senior Product Manager, you will be responsible for shaping, driving and executing on the product, working across consumer, merchant and bank experiences. You will interact with our customers to understand their needs, and partner with our internal stakeholders to articulate or identify opportunities for growth.

Your ability to balance strategic thinking, stakeholder requirements and execution will be critical to success. You will be working in an agile environment with cross functional teams including sales, marketing, data, design and an exceptional engineering team to build large product initiatives from concept to delivery.

We are looking for a passionate person with experience in taking complex and differentiated solutions to market in user centric products.

What You Will Be Doing …

Develop and deliver on product roadmaps that align with Slyp’s vision, product strategy and commercial targets
Understand customer needs through research, market analysis, data, and customer feedback
Translate requirements into product specifications
Prioritise and coordinate delivery schedules and ensure consensus
Scope and manage planned, existing or ongoing major and minor product releases
Coordinate with internal teams to produce marketing materials that speak to Slyp’s unique product experiences
Provide support to the Sales/Business Development teams to respond to product-related feedback and improvement requests
Be responsible for engaging and delivering with our high performing Engineering team


Requirements

Your experience and knowledge …

A minimum of 5+ years’ experience in product leadership, including experience in either B2BC or B2B SaaS
Experience leading a diverse team in the Fintech space, including Designers and Engineers
Strong communication skills and public speaker, with an ability to negotiate and engage diverse internal and external stakeholders
Proven ability to manage changing priorities and working in a fast-paced growth environment
Demonstrated ability working with agile methodologies, requirements gathering, prioritisation, identifying and addressing constraints, dependencies and risks
An ability to balance customer satisfaction as well as commercial outcome
You use analytics and data-driven measurement to inform decision making
You are customer driven and have a passion for speaking directly to customers
Highly desirable that you have experience in delivering data and insights-based products
Proven experience working with new products or new categories and have had exposure to loyalty, payments, data, e-commerce or a unique combination of these


Benefits

Competitive salary + equity
Wellbeing perks
Generous L&D program
Flexible work life balance: work from our Sydney office, from home, or from anywhere (for a time)
Regular team lunches and give back days (Slyp Gives)
Sweet (pet friendly) office
Always-on team fun

Meet Upside

We created Upside to help communities thrive! Our retail technology uses the sophistication of online retail—profit measurement, attribution, and incrementality—to provide users with more value on their everyday purchases and brick and mortar businesses with new, profitable customers. We’ve helped millions of users earn 2 to 3 times more cash back than any other product, and tens of thousands of brick and mortar businesses earn measurable profit. Billions of dollars in commerce run through the Upside platform every year, and that value goes directly back to our local retailers, the consumers they serve, and towards important sustainability initiatives.

Upside was named on Deloitte's 2021 & 2022 list of Fastest Growing 500 Tech Companies and #308 in Inc.’s America’s fastest growing private companies of 2022. Upside’s Series D funding round was led by General Catalyst with a $1.5 billion valuation in March 2022. Other notable investors include Bessemer Ventures and Formation8.

Our mission, values, and commitment to inclusivity guide our team of more than 350 people worldwide, and the quality of our culture is reflected in the impact we’ve had on communities nationwide. But don’t just take our word for it! In 2023, Upside was included as a Top Workplace in the USA, received six Best Places to Work awards from Built In, and was named a Top Workplace for Perks & Culture by The Muse.

Meet The Product Management Team

The Product team at Upside is composed of results-oriented individuals with a diverse set of experiences, all working diligently to ensure that our product delivers as much value as possible for our merchants and consumers. Whether partnering with Engineering, Design, Marketing, or Sales, the Product team is committed to taking an experiment oriented approach to guarantee that data drives decisions.

About The Job

Upside has over 45,000 merchants on the platform spanning gas stations, convenience stores, restaurants, and grocery stores. Having solidified our position in the fuel industry, we’re looking to take our fuel products to the next level. Upside is in search of a Product Manager to automate our billing and invoicing pipeline to support a rapidly growing merchant base. You'll use your skills and build tremendous value for our Consumer users, Merchant clients, and the business.

What You’ll Do

Collaborate with a dedicated engineering team to scale Upside’s billing applications.
Use domain driven design to map systems and workflows, and document clear, consistent vocabulary across the organization.
Maintain the product roadmap, cascading business goals and market opportunities into product priorities
Prioritize features for releases and maintain frequent incremental approach to improvements
Work closely with engineering; accountable for quality of user stories and other product management results
Partner with Finance and Operations to ensure our billing process is accurate, detailed, and scalable.

What You Need

3+ years of Product Management experience.
BA/BS degree.
Experience building B2B products in retail or ecommerce.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and influencing skills, with proven track record to take initiative and build strong, positive relationships.
Strong user empathy, with an ability to transform complex data and customer insights into product vision and a prioritized roadmap.

The Fine Print

Location: This is a fully-remote role that may sit anywhere in the United States. You're welcome to work from our DC, Austin, Chicago or New York office if you're in-region!
Notice to recruiters and placement agencies: This is an in-house search with a dedicated recruiter. Please do not submit resumes to any person or email address at Upside. Upside is not liable for, and will not pay, placement fees for candidates submitted by any party or agency other than its approved recruitment partners.

At Upside, we believe that diversity drives innovation. Our differences are what makes us stronger. We‘re passionate about building a workplace that represents a variety of backgrounds, skills, and perspectives and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Everyone is welcome here. Come join us!

Summary

The Apple Media Products team creates services and experiences across video, music, books, podcasts and news products spaces. We are seeking a product manager to work on our personalization program, work closely with engineering teams to develop new strategies and techniques to personalize the experience of our customers both within services and across the Apple ecosystem.


As part of a wider Services Platform team, you would be working with teams across the company to develop personalization efforts that work across services. This will feed into long-term strategic plans and help drive the next generations of our features and product lines. We face unique challenges, dealing with 100M+ films, TV shows, songs, podcast episodes, books, and news articles, which impacts the experience of over 1 Billion customers.


Come be part of a team innovating and collaborating closely with teams across Apple!


Key Qualifications

Excellent presentation and communication skills in presenting strategies and features, pitching to leadership and gaining support across the company from teams in engineering, design, privacy and R&D.

5+ years of product management or experience building working products in machine learning, personalization, recommendation or similar.

Deep understanding about privacy, particularly around personalization.

Drive to innovate experience driven algorithmic products.

Understanding of complex data management problems, and related machine learning techniques.

Analytical skills in product analysis, insights and performance metrics from data.

Deep understanding of the opportunities and limitations of machine learning.

A strong interest in digital media products and services.

Ability to influence diverse teams to adopt best practices and models, working towards the delivery of long-term strategy.

Self-motivated and proactive, with demonstrated creative and critical thinking capabilities.


Description

Work on product strategy for personalization, and relevant impact on search, recommendations, analytics, etc across our services and products.

Developing features and strategies for multi-service personalization and recommendations.

Communicate and evangelize to executive and collaborator teams.

Work closely with data science and engineering teams on research and development for new features.

Analyze project performance, constantly finding new ways to improve and apply content knowledge in innovative ways.

Design performance metrics centered on accuracy and experience.

Work closely with other machine learning and algorithmic product managers to align with Apple strategies.

Collaborate with other Apple teams to promote cross-team technology sharing.


Education & Experience

BA, MS or Ph.D or equivalent


Pay & Benefits

At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $150,000 and $269,000, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

Hi, we're Nuts.com!

Nuts.com is a self-funded, profitable, rapidly growing multi-channel DTC specialty food and wellness company with over 550 people on our team. We're changing the landscape of snacking on nuts, dried fruit, chocolate and more! We planted our roots in Newark, New Jersey during the Great Depression, selling premium nuts on Mulberry Street's open-air market. We've come quite a long way since then, taking our multi-generational family business online in 1999. Even after 94 years, we continue to pride ourselves in expertly sourcing the highest quality foods and treating our customers like family.

What's our team like? We're driven, collaborative and entrepreneurial. Energy and passion power our business and we look for candidates who share in that excitement to help us continue to build something special.

About the team:

We're driven, collaborative and entrepreneurial. Energy and passion power our business and we look for candidates who share in that excitement to help us continue to build something special.

Product teams at Nuts.com are cross-functional, working across the whole gamut of our organization, principally partnering with design and engineering and collaborating very closely with marketing, merchandising, data, customer experience, operations, and divisions, like Gifting and B2B. We're a small but nimble bunch that exercises significant influence over the entirety of our customer experience. Product teams are responsible for the entire lifecycle of product development, from discovery to delivery and on through iteration. We're data-driven, prioritize performance over vanity metrics, and focus on real impact to both our customer and the company.

The role:

We're looking for a Senior Product Manager to lead our Gifting and B2B squads. As the name suggests, this team is responsible for our digital shopping experience for gifting and businesses, accounting for a significant portion of company revenue. These two segments share a tremendous amount of overlap and serve as key pillars in our strategic roadmap, having seen significant revenue and profitability growth, and investments into our team, platform and strategy.

This role reports to the Head of Digital Product and partners extremely closely with our Gifting & B2B business units. It's a high impact position with the opportunity to help craft vision and strategy while simultaneously executing meaningful, metric moving initiatives.

Example projects in our roadmap may include the 0-1 launch of new brands, the development of customized, innovative gift building workflows and the launch of a unique and full-featured business shopping program & experience.

What you'll do:

Develop an impact-driven roadmap, aligning with your partners in the Gifting & B2B business units as well as other key stakeholders
Obsessively identify new growth opportunities via quantitative and qualitative research, size them for impact versus investment and prioritize them against all of your other great ideas
Define the scope for both features & initiatives, clearly articulating customer problems, solutions, driving stakeholder alignment, success metrics and testing plans
Plan and ruthlessly execute on the product lifecycle, prioritizing and managing both engineering and design sprints to ensure our teams spend their effort creating value
And anything else that will ensure your products are successful!


What You'll Bring:

At least 4 years of relevant product management experience and leading a cross-functional product squad, delivering meaningful impact, defining compelling strategy and both aligning and inspiring partners along the way
A track record of building, shipping or managing consumer-facing digital products in the e-commerce or marketplaces space; bonus if you you've done it for both the D2C & B2B segments
The ability to quickly pivot from strategic planning to efficient, tactical tactical execution
The aptitude to prove yourself analytically; if you can't quantify it, it didn't happen
An aptitude for collaboration, communication, relationship building and the ability to inspire others
A strong customer empathy and a passion for delivering delightful experiences


What We Offer

We have a hybrid work environment in our beautiful and state of the art office in Jersey City**
A high-growth and rewarding role in a foundationally strong and rapidly evolving business
Competitive compensation, benefits, and 401K Match
Paid Maternity, Adoption and Paternity leave
And all the Nuts.com snacks your heart desires + a 40% employee discount


EEO STATEMENT

Nuts.com is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

Successful record of setting and meeting timelines and goals
Practical solution mindset
Ability to interface with all types of stakeholders, & partner with every single department

Company Description




i3D.net is a leading provider of high-performance, low-latency hosting through a vast, privately-owned global network. As gaming veterans, we know what it takes for a network to withstand heavy demand, and as of 2019, we are a member of the Ubisoft family. Now we’re growing faster than ever, keeping some of the world’s biggest games and WebRTC services online, and their users connected.




Job Description




As Product Manager joining Platform Pillar, you will own and execute the product roadmap for the customer-facing part of our Platform. Our Platform is designed to be a single point of access to a wide range of our products and it includes a front-end application and back-end APIs. Our goal is to provide a frictionless and consistent user experience across a growing product portfolio, and it’s up to you and your team to own the way our users consume our products via the Platform. Working in your cross-functional team, you will build and own your product roadmap, facilitate the execution, manage the stakeholders, and – most importantly – delight our users.




In your mission to expose and connect all our products via the Platform, you will be supported by our young, talented, and ambitious Product department. Your team will be a part of the Platform Pillar, and you will be working closely with a Product Manager responsible for the core technology and internal users of our Platform, as well as collaborating with the teams from our two other pillars – Infrastructure and Game Services. Group Product Managers responsible for the pillars will also provide guidance, direction and overarching Product Vision.




Your Responsibilities




Owning the team’s roadmap and strategy, while keeping it aligned with an overarching Product Vision
Acting as Product Owner for your scrum team to help them maximize the product value
Driving the discovery process to continuously seek improvements and new opportunities for impact
Managing stakeholders and collaborating with other teams to integrate their products into the Platform
Qualifications




At i3D.net, who you are is just as important as what you can do. You can be your own master and relish the opportunity to structure your own days and interconnect with a multitude of people both in and outside the company. You can balance user-focus with business needs and have both strong analytical and communication skills. Most importantly, you’re a team player who can stand your ground in a fast-paced but fun working environment.




Your Skills




At least 2 years of demonstrated experience in Product Management
Hands-on experience working in cross-functional teams and shipping great products
Able to influence people without direct authority
Love solving problems, and you see opportunities for impact when presented with difficult challenges
Can make strategic choices, taking into consideration user, technical and business needs
Comfortable balancing day-to-day tactical choices with the long-term vision and strategy, ensuring we meet our strategic goals
Fueled by curiosity, always on the lookout to learn how something works and what can be improved
Fluent in written and spoken English




Additional Information




What does i3D.net offer you?




A challenging and dynamic job in an international company
A competitive salary (depending on education, knowledge, and experience)
25 vacation days (excluding national holidays)
Travel allowance & work-from-home budget
Collective pension scheme
All the hardware and software you need to perform, including a laptop
Career guidance including remuneration of relevant education, courses, and training
A modern office in a prime location with open workplaces
Free access to Ubisoft games through Ubisoft Connect
Free use of the in-house gym




i3D.net is an equal opportunity employer. At i3D.net, we believe in a fair and equal workplace for all and foster an environment that is inclusive as well as diverse. We do not discriminate based on color, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender (identity), age, mental or physical abilities, or other characteristics. We believe that employees thrive when they can be comfortable and be themselves! We encourage candidates to apply knowing that they will be considered solely on their merits and qualifications.
