At Billy we help small businesses focus on what they do best, by providing simple business administration software. We want to make the world a better place by reducing the effort needed on boring administration tasks 😉 On our platform they can create invoices, subscriptions or integrate their e-commerce platform through our platform API’s. We let them manage their expenses via our web-app or mobile app, and even manage their payroll via our deep integration with Salary. More than 40.000 companies are registered and growing every day.

Who are we looking for?

We're looking for a senior product manager/superhero, with several years of product management experience. You will be part of an open and social team of 4 other product managers and 5 designers, who all want to enable success of small business’ in Denmark and beyond.

We’ll teach you how we roll, but are totally open to new ideas and best practices. If you wanna be part of the team slang, read up on Margy Cagan: INSPIRED before interviewing. You’ll need a passion for understanding customers, by talking with them, observing what they do and then collaborating with great product designers and tech leads. You’ll be part of both product discovery and deliver for your team.

The product manager will, depending on the experience, take responsibility for our mobile app efforts across countries or our accounting features and automation.

Who You Are

You find yourself interested in a lot of things. Marketing, UX, design and technology. We don’t care what background you have, as a product manager with us, you’ll need to understand all parts.

We expect you have a broad toolbox consisting of analytics, customer involvement, stakeholder management and commercial skills. Since Billy is about accounting, you’ll have a head start if you know something about VAT and tax, but else we’ll teach you.

What we do expect from you:

Collaborative: You want to learn from others and see the value of teamwork
Driven: You are self motivated and driven to improve your product skills. You probably already acknowledge that it takes time to become great at your job.
Responsible: We give a lot of responsibility to our team members, and therefore you like to take responsibility for what you are doing. You also let others do what they do best.
Commercial mindset: Very few product teams run out of ideas, you won’t experience it here either, so understanding that life is full of choices and how they impact the business is an important skill.


What You'll Do (or Learn To Do)

Own the end-to-end process of bringing new awesome software to our customers. From research over ideation, development and launch. You’ll be part of a strong development team and do your part of the team work.
Collaborate with designers, other product managers and engineering to do awesome things.
Define and evaluate OKR’s (if you don’t know it, look it up, before applying, as this is how we work). We analyze what worked and what didn’t.
Collaboration with our cool Product Marketing team to develop go-to-market strategies with core messaging.
Contribute to the shared vision of the Ageras Group ecosystem where we and our partner companies in the group work together. Don’t worry, you’ll learn this as we go.
Never participate in “agile release trains” or any other words which really means waterfall development. We release 3-5 times per day, and yes we do coordinate when it’s needed.


Why join us?

We take pride in our work, but we are also serious about fun. Grab a drink with your colleagues in our MicroHeroBar on a Friday, take a little break in our gaming area on a rough Monday or join one of our many social events.

We aim to give you the opportunity and freedom to develop your skills in the direction you want. Our business is on growth journey that creates ongoing opportunities for your further career development.

Moreover, our office has possibly the best location in the city. We are located in the heart of Copenhagen with a view over Tivoli, close to both Copenhagen Central Station and Rådhuspladsen.

Interested?

Now that we have caught your attention, it is time for you to catch ours. Please send us your English resume or Danish. All applications are continuously evaluated, but you can expect to hear from us within 1 week.

Please apply directly or give our CPO Bastian Jerichow a call on +45 27 90 23 64.

About Ageras Group

At Ageras Group, we enable success for small businesses by building the best ecosystem around their financial needs. With a well-preserved start-up spirit, we are today an ambitious group of fintech-companies with around 300 employees operating across 12 markets in Europe and the US. As the home of Billy, Tellow, Salary, Zervant, Ageras Marketplace and Ageras Finance, and being financially backed by Investcorp, Rabo Frontier and Lugard Road Capital, we are on a mission to revolutionise the financial industry and conquer the world - nothing less.

We’re looking for a Product Manager to join the Ivy Product team as the Product Manager for our Resident Experience Team. In this role you will be responsible for developing innovative solutions that provide tangible value to customers, the business, and deliver outstanding user experiences. The Resident Experience Team has ownership of Ivy’s tenant-facing products and services including Ivy Solar Billing, Ivy Solar EV Billing, and will lead the development of our Tenant Portal and App. This position reports to the Senior Product Manager and works closely with the UX Design Manager and the Tech Lead to guide product discovery as well as supporting product development.

What You’ll Be Doing

You will be leading the product team by developing a product vision and strategy using quantitative and qualitative data to drive decisions and by developing a deep understanding of the product, users, internal stakeholders, and the external market. You will be working with the larger product management team to establish product roadmaps and prioritize the product backlog in alignment with team and company OKRs. You will be documenting and communicating requirements to the team through user stories, supporting documentation, and acceptance criteria. You will also work with the UX manager to develop, execute, and analyze customer research, both qualitative and quantitative, to ensure we are providing value to end users and the business.

Leading the Resident Experience Team in developing and driving short and long-term vision, strategy, and roadmap that ladders up to the company’s OKRs.
Guiding the Resident Experience Team through the product development lifecycle, including the discovery, planning, design, development, and launch and learn phases.
Developing a deep understanding of your product area by listening to the voice of your customers to understand what problems we need to solve and delivering solutions that provide value to end users and the business.
Evangelizing the needs of our customers, leveraging quantitative and qualitative data to share key insights that inform product direction.
Communicating tradeoffs and align cross functional partners and business stakeholders on priorities to help meet business goals.
Communicating progress against objectives and key results, making recommendations to pivot or change course as needed.
You will write business requirements and acceptance criteria laying out user stories and then work with the software engineers to prioritize and deliver features that provide value to our customers and business.
Assist team in overcoming blockers and providing recommendations based on trade-offs to optimize customer experience, time-to-market, and to clearly communicate goals, roles, responsibilities, and desired outcomes to internal stakeholders and remote teams.
Create Product Documentation as necessary including technical requirements, acceptance criteria, roadmaps, and feature availability.
Support the marketing team in translating product specs and documentation into sales and marketing materials used with customers.
Meeting with customers and developing insight gathering processes with the customer as necessary for roadmap prioritization.


Requirements

You have 4+ years of product management experience working with digital product teams and have successfully launched innovative high impact products that drive meaningful growth for the business.
Demonstrated ability to define, analyze, and prioritize requirements across multiple stakeholder teams.
Have an innate urge to leverage quantitative and qualitative data to guide your strategy and create a compelling narrative.
Demonstrated qualitative and quantitative analytical skills to apply data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, develop .
Care deeply about users and seek to understand their problems, needs, and desires
Thrive on collaboration and you know how to rally and align your team.
Communication skills are on point and you feel comfortable regularly presenting to execs, keeping peers and stakeholders informed, and jumping into Slack threads as needed
Resourceful self-starter with a bias toward action
Feel comfortable digging into an unknown problem space to understand better and craft an execution plan
Bring humility, empathy, and a desire to learn
Experience working at a tech company during rapid growth is a plus
Experience working within an Agile project methodology and participating in Scrum ceremonies, including stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives, demos, grooming, and release planning.

Salary

$80,000- $160,000 annually

Compensation is commensurate with various factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, qualifications, skills, training, licensure, certifications, geographic cost of labor, and other business and organizational needs.

Description




What’s the story?




Nium is a next-generation financial services platform  that enables companies around the world to unlock new revenue opportunities and improve cash flow economics




Nium is a leader in its geographical and payment service breadth, owning licenses in the world’s largest and fastest-growing economies. Our modular platform allows banks, payment providers, travel companies, and other businesses to collect and disburse funds in local currencies to over 100 countries, plus issue physical and virtual cards globally. Our proprietary set of APIs embeds financial services and can bring to life multiple B2B and B2C use cases in a matter of weeks.




Nium is part of CB Insights Fintech 250, which highlights the most promising Fintech companies globally. Today, Nium serves over 130 million customers and enables platforms to provide access to financial services to over 3 billion people across the world.




We are looking at a product manager for Payments (Payouts/Payins), the major revenue contributor amongst Nium’s product suite with immense growth potential.




Managing the payments product needs a product manager to solve problems along 3 separate and intertwined areas:




Product – Customer discovery and experience
Network – Growing and optimising coverage in terms of geography, currencies, payment methods, customer segment needs
Technology – creating and optimising technology platforms to deliver a seamless payments experience across customer segments in multiple geographies




Responsibilities




Discover and solve for opportunities to increase revenue as well as adoption of the product through market/customer research and experience
Liaise with sales and account management teams to gather market feedback and share regular updates to leadership team
Be on top of market trends across different markets and payment methods, e.g. accounts, wallets, cards, cash
Own payout/payin features as a product to deliver experience, coverage, speed and efficiency goals
Create roadmap based on inputs about markets, customer segments, use cases, scalability, etc.
Work with Partnership development teams to translate roadmap into pipeline of banks and payment partners
Work with global banks and payment partners to finalise contours of the partnerships
Create functional requirements and technical requirements/user stories to get these delivered through an Agile tech team as well non-technical stakeholders
Adopt a technology and data driven approach to measuring and delivering efficiency goals across STP rates, error handling and returns




Requirements




Strategic thinking – develop payments strategy in alignment with the company’s financial infrastructure strategy, target customer segments and revenue goals
People skills - This would be a global role and would require the person to work across geographies, time zones, cultures and competencies as well as internal teams who might not be very familiar with global payments and its intricacies
Be willing to get your hands dirty – from writing Jira stories, drawing swim lane diagrams to running sprint meetings
Being articulate – communicate and justify your strategy behind the roadmap to domain experts/leaders in a crowded and evolving payment space
Knowledge of payments – with the range of payment methods, clearing and settlements, currencies, regulations, automation challenges that you will deal with, knowledge and understanding will be key to success
Comfort with technology – dealing with engineers and architects to design new flows, adapt systems to new market innovations while maintaining integrity and scalability of the platform is vital




Ideally, You Would Have
4-6 years experience in payments product development/management
Experience working with a global payments company
Developed global payment products across banking/alternate payment methods
Worked with banking and payments partners
An engineering degree (a management degree is a bonus)

Company Description

Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together.

To solve this problem, we expanded into software and built integrated solutions to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.

Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.

Job Description

We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to join the International domain in Melbourne or Sydney; with a core focus on cross-border trade and foreign exchange (FX) services.

The cross-border business in Afterpay has been growing at a rapid rate of over 2x annually and our ambitions are to 10x the business in less than 3 years. It’s at an interesting juncture with the product-building momentum and new opportunities of scale on the horizon. It’s an exciting space that covers consumers as well as merchants from different geographies, cultures, and hence commerce behavior whether that’s shopping or selling. The cross-border team lives in this space creating experiences to further the vision of Afterpay being the global platform of choice where anyone can truly shop or sell anywhere.

Develop a deep understanding of the cross border trade business, money movements, regulatory and competitive landscape as well as an empathetic knowledge of the merchants and consumers needs
Lead the product development work of a dedicated engineering and design team (e.g., ideation, scoping, product roadmap, sprint planning, prioritization, etc.)
Identify significant opportunities, and drive product vision, strategies and roadmaps in the context of broader organizational goals and new market dynamics
Drive data informed decision-making and solution localization through user insights, market research, quantitative analysis and AB testing
Collaborate and build strong partnerships with your peers across Afterpay to solve challenging multi-disciplined problems that accompany building products for new markets
Influence key stakeholders throughout Afterpay in order to align resources and prioritization
Lead and motivate a team of engineers and other cross-functional stakeholders


Qualifications

5+ years product management or related experience
Track record of impact - you've been in the trenches and have a proven track record of driving significant, company-wide impact
"Customer obsession" product instinct with experience shaping product direction and execution based on customer needs paired with an ability to balance multiple users' needs and business impact
A humble and get-it-done mindset; you’re resourceful and in your element going from 0 to 1
A hunger to tackle complicated and impactful product & business problems
Experience driving complex, cross-functional product initiatives in a successful way
Strong strategic thinking, problem solving, and logical structuring abilities
Comfort with ambiguity; the ability to independently lay out and test clean hypotheses, and solve problems without well-defined direction
Excellent verbal and written communication skills


Additional Information

We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, based solely on the core competencies required of the role at hand, and without regard to any legally protected class.

We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Healthcare coverage
Retirement Plans

Learning and Development resources


Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

Groupe SEB Nordic is a subsidiary of Groupe SEB International, global leader in the manufacturing of small domestic appliances and cookware. Groupe SEB Nordic develops, distributes, and sells innovative and exciting products under the brand names OBH Nordica, Tefal, Emsa, WMF, Krups, and Lagostina. Its turnover has multiplied ten-fold since its first listing on the stock market in 1975 and two-fold over the last 10 years (turnover 2022: €8 billions).




Groupe SEB Nordic’s turnover amounts to approximately 800 million SEK and has about 130 employees based across Nordics, of which over a third are working at the headquarters in central Sundbyberg outside Stockholm.




JOB DESCRIPTION:

Groupe SEB is looking for a Product Manager to join our Marketing team in our Nordic Headquarter in Sundbyberg, Stockholm.




In this role you will be the owner and expert of the product category, manage and drive the business through adapting and applying the international product strategy for the international brands (Tefal, Krups, etc.) and develop and implement a strategy for the local brand OBH Nordica, in the Nordic market with financial responsibility. You will develop and implement marketing strategy plans in the Nordics under Groupe SEB guidelines, investigate new business/product opportunities as well as driving the commercial strategy of the assigned product portfolio in close collaboration with sales.




The Nordic Product Marketing department is structured by category and plays a key role in developing the business through being the link between the Group marketing functions and the local markets when it comes to products and marketing activities.




The market is intensively competitive on both the supplier and retailer side and puts profit pressure on “brands” due to many players and high level of “private label” penetration. Our key business drivers are launch of new products, innovations, and marketing activities and it is key to have an “entrepreneurial” approach to marketing and sales.




THE ROLE:

For this position it is key to have a passion for products, a strong commercial sense and interest, as well as a strong performance oriented attitude.




The role will include:

Analyze consumer insights, market trends, market shares and shopper behavior
Implement the product and brand strategy in the Nordics based on international guidelines
Build the category roadmaps by identifying the local need gaps and how to best address them with the global portfolio or through local development
Manage assortment (permanent + promo + channel management + customer management) and pricing (RSP/NSP) together with Business Units, Continental Marketing, EMEA commercial team and sales teams.
Own P&L of the category, analyze business results on monthly basis, identify issues and opportunities and propose and implement corrective actions and improvements to sales and management
Localize international products into the Nordics by adapting the different marketing elements and in some cases support the local communication team in developing local assets
Manage product launches and activations with graphic, digital and commercial teams
Drive commercial strategy of the category by defining channel and customer management together with sales, and build the selling story to use by KAMs
Develop overall marketing strategies, and define key communication using international or local guidelines
Partner with KAMs on building assortment/promo plan with key customers, and participate in meetings when appropriate
Support in category management projects with Continent Marketing and local KAMs
Manage full product life cycle from launch to phase out, in close collaboration with supply team




YOUR BACKGROUND:

2-3 years experience in a similar role within product marketing
Experience in an international environment is a plus, eager to work in a commercial environment in charge of marketing and sales
Good analytical and quantitative skills, and easily communicates through numbers and business cases for various stakeholders
Combination of strategic thinking with high attention to detail and structure
Entrepreneurial drive, agility and ability to act in a Nordic team and international group with many different actors
Fluent in Swedish and English
Good presentation skills
Good level of MS Office package




WHO ARE YOU:

You thrive in a challenging environment where change is the only constant factor. You are passionate about products, have a strong commercial sense and interest, as well as a strong performance oriented attitude. You enjoy learning new things and take your own initiative. You are self-driven, communicative and want to work in a role where you have daily contact with various stakeholders. You enjoy the creative thinking and can easily switch between the shorter-term operative tasks and the longer term strategic horizon.




This role is based in Sundbyberg, Stockholm.




We look forward to receiving your application!

Please apply via LinkedIn, with your CV and personal letter in English.

GoodRx is America’s healthcare marketplace. Each month, millions of people visit goodrx.com to find reliable health information and discounts for their healthcare — and we’ve helped people save $35 billion since 2011. We provide prescription discounts that are accepted at more than 70,000 pharmacies in the U.S., as well as telehealth services including doctor visits and lab tests. Our services have been positively reviewed by Good Morning America, The New York Times, NBC News, AARP, and many others.

Our goal is to help Americans find convenient and affordable healthcare. We offer solutions for consumers, employers, health plans, and anyone else who shares our desire to provide affordable prescriptions to all Americans.

The GoodRx Provider team is looking for a customer-centric Product Manager to drive engagement with our Provider product, built specifically for healthcare providers. This PM will be responsible for creating valuable new experiences on the GoodRx platform for prescribing healthcare providers including doctors, physicians assistants, nurse practitioners, and more. Our mission is to empower providers by creating a single place where they can go to see all drug access and affordability solutions together, so providers can focus on what they do best – treat their patients.

Working closely with designers, researchers, data analysts, and developers, you’ll identify, prioritize, and build tools to solve real provider pain points – both on our platform, and through partner integrations.

The ideal candidate is empathetic, detail-oriented, and strong with data and customer insights. A passion for providers, patients, and improving the healthcare system is a must. We’re looking for a strategic thinker who can leverage quantitative and qualitative data and work well with engineers, designers, researchers and data analysts to inform the team’s roadmap. This individual will work closely with cross-functional teams as well as internal and external stakeholders, and great communication and collaboration skills are required. Candidates need to be comfortable working with industry partners while also representing the needs of the customer to create great experiences. Experience working in healthcare and with providers is strongly preferred.

Responsibilities

Own the vision and strategy for your product area
Define goals and success with clear, measurable objectives and key results
Drive engagement with existing customers by building and delivering thoughtful tools and features to solve real provider pain points.
Partner closely with cross-functional teams to drive product strategy and vision, define requirements, and guide the team through the development process
Create well-scoped requirements and prioritize work for teams of engineers, designers and data analysts Execute product commitments effectively to consistently deliver meaningful impact to the business
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and execute go-to-market plans.
Work with data and business intelligence analysts to perform deep data dives to generate actionable insights that inform your product roadmap
Continuously experiment to validate new hypotheses and drive towards your product’s goals
Communicate project updates and results to key stakeholders, including executive leadership.
Collaborate with customer researchers to identify new opportunities.

Skills And Qualifications

3+ years of product management experience, with a track record of delivering successful projects.
Healthcare and provider related experience is strongly preferred.
Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills.
Excellent execution skills, and an ability to navigate around complex problems
Demonstrated ability to deliver large-scale product features and improvements
A passion for impact and the grit to solve problems in order to drive faster results
Data-driven by default, with demonstrated proficiency using analytics and testing best practices
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and work effectively with cross-functional teams and leadership.
Willingness to explore and own initiatives outside the scope of your product area
Proven ability to clearly present your team’s work to management
A humble, collaborative, and team-first spirit
Passion for healthcare and the GoodRx mission
Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g. business, engineering, computer science).

Nice to Have

Experience working with healthcare providers, insurance companies, or retail pharmacies.
Experience working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Experience working on new, zero to one initiatives
Technical background

Compensation decisions are determined using a variety of factors such as skill set, experience, and education or certifications. If we extend an offer for employment, we will consider all individual qualifications. Below are our salary ranges for this position based on office location:

San Francisco Office: $119,000 - $179,000

New York Office: $109,000 - $164,000

GoodRx also offers additional compensation programs such as annual cash bonuses and annual equity grants for most positions as well as generous benefits. Our great benefits offerings include medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) with a company match, an ESPP, unlimited vacation, "Take Care of Yourself" days, 11 paid holidays, and 72 hours of sick leave. GoodRx also offers additional benefits like mental wellness and financial wellness programs, fertility benefits, supplemental life insurance for you and your dependents, company-paid short-term and long-term disability, and more!

At GoodRx, we deeply value in-person connection and collaboration and feel that is key to our company culture. GoodRx is a hybrid work environment and we ask employees to be in the office a minimum of twice a week to one of our hubs in Santa Monica, San Fransico and New York City.

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company and industry. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has a seat at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunities to excel.

With that said, research shows that women and other underrepresented groups apply only if they meet 100% of the criteria. GoodRx is committed to leveling the playing field, and we encourage women, people of color, those in the LGBTQ+ communities, and Veterans to apply for positions even if they don’t necessarily check every box outlined in the job description. Please still get in touch - we’d love to connect and see if you could be good for the role!

GoodRx is America's healthcare marketplace. The company offers the most comprehensive and accurate resource for affordable prescription medications in the U.S., gathering pricing information from thousands of pharmacies coast to coast, as well as a telehealth marketplace for online doctor visits and lab tests. Since 2011, Americans with and without health insurance have saved $35 billion using GoodRx and million consumers visit goodrx.com each month to find discounts and information related to their healthcare. GoodRx is the #1 most downloaded medical app on the iOS and Android app stores. For more information, visit www.goodrx.com .

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $97,600 -- $187,500 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.




At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).




In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

The individual will work to generate insights and create novel analytical products for Pharma, Biotech, and the Healthcare sector in the Precision Medicine space, using de-identified health care data from Electronic Medical Records, health claims, pharmacy claims and genomics data for Oncology, Urology, and other patients. This to generate insights that help drive Value-Based Care for Cancer & Urology Patients by lowering cost and improving outcome: Come join one of the hottest companies that is revolutionizing healthcare!

Responsibilities:

The Product Manager will drive the creation of analytical software products for Pharma, Biotech, and healthcare providers in the cancer space.
Collaborate closely with the Software teams to transform data from electronic health records, healthcare claims, patient (reported) outcomes and other data into high value insights for pharmaceutical, diagnostics, device manufacturers.
The Product Manager will attend key scientific/medical conferences like ASCO to identify emerging trends, meet customers and present abstracts and stay up to date.
The Product Manager needs to be hands-on, self-driven and able to directly contribute while leading projects within agile sprint processes.




Qualifications:

2+ years of Product Management experience, ideally in the oncology/healthcare software space
Familiar with Software Development, ideally experience with Agile Methodology.
Experience with healthcare data, ideally EMR and Claims.
General understanding of data warehousing, structured & unstructured data.
Familiarity with Business Intelligence and other visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau etc.).
Effective presentation and communication skills
Modest travel required to attend conferences (up to 10%).

Preferred Qualifications:

Oncology expertise from a clinical, scientific, or pharmaceutical background.
Experience at or with pharmaceutical or biotech companies.
Analytical, Scientific, Medical, (Computer) Science or Healthcare related degree preferred.
Ability to statistically analyze health care data, ideally with statistical and/or programming tools e.g. R, Python, SQL.
Preferred qualities: pro-active, collaborative, creative, energetic, positive, curious, open.

Integra Connect, LLC provides a comprehensive benefits plan.

Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance beginning the 1st of the month following your date of hire

WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS JOB

We believe that what a brand does is more important than what it says—we want you to help brands do amazing, unprecedented, wild things, creating experiences that people never forget.




WHY YOU’LL LOVE DOING IT AT MOMENTUM

Because the idea that a brand’s action is more important than its rhetoric is the key to our entire approach. It is all about the experience and we can—hands down, bar- none—create that better than anyone else. That’s not jargon or ego—it’s truth. Experience creates the connections that lead to loyalty, advocacy and sales. So we imagine and create those things here, in what we call the total brand experience. And how we do it is with genius, dedication, strategic thinking and working together as collective groups. Before you get any ideas, it’s important you know we’re serious about taking care of each other here. So think on that. We work too closely not to have fun together. We work too smart not to make the world better. And we work too well not to continually push for more. Think on all that, too.




WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR

We are seeking a talented and motivated Product Manager to join our global technology team. In this role, you will be responsible for the development and management of both internal and client-facing products that align with our business goals. The ideal candidate must have a proven track record of creating clear roadmaps and documents and be comfortable dealing with ambiguity and adapting to change. Effective project management skills are essential for success in this Product Manager role. The ability to manage multiple priorities, balance the needs of internal and external stakeholders, and ensure the delivery of high-quality products on time and within budget.




HERE’S WHAT YOU’LL DO (RESPONSIBILITIES)

Develop and execute product strategy and roadmaps that align with our business goals.
Define and prioritize product requirements based on business goals and customer needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to launch and deliver high-quality products.
Analyze and evaluate market trends, competition, and feedback.
Communicate product vision and plans to stakeholders, including clients, partners, and internal teams.
Manage product backlogs and sprint planning to ensure delivery of products on time and within budget.
Contribute to the realization of our business goals, including:
Develop systems and refine workflow to deliver operational and financial rigor that creates scale and smarter, faster, and more profitable decision-making.
Power the Experiential Commerce tool with the right data to outsmart our competition and reach double-digit Commerce growth.
Deliver against our unique positioning “The Experiential Agency for Web 3.0".
Travel to support experiences as client contact on the ground as needed.
Supporting Momentum's Values
All other duties as assigned.




HERE’S WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR (QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS)

Experience in product management, with a strong understanding of technology and software development.
Strong project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence cross-functional teams.
Ability to handle ambiguity and effectively cope with change.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
Experience with Agile software development methodologies is preferred.




This is a unique opportunity to work on a variety of exciting projects and plays a key role in shaping the future of our agency. If you're a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is driven by the challenge of helping us achieve our business goals, we'd love to hear from you.




The salary range for this position is $70,000 to $100,000. Where an employee or prospective employee is paid within this range will depend on, among other factors, actual ranges for current/former employees in the subject position; market considerations; location and region; budgetary considerations; tenure and standing with the company (applicable to current employees); as well as the employee’s/applicant’s background, pertinent experience, and qualifications.




At Momentum Worldwide, we value diversity and the uniqueness of all people. We thrive in an inclusive environment, and we recruit, hire and promote without regard to race, gender, age, color, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, ethnic or national origin, citizenship, religion, sexual preference, military or veteran status, marital status, family status, physical or mental disability – or any other legally protected categories as set forth in the applicable state, federal or local laws. This policy applies to all aspects of employment including training, compensation, benefits and all other privileges of employment.

GoodRx is America’s healthcare marketplace. Each month, millions of people visit goodrx.com to find reliable health information and discounts for their healthcare — and we’ve helped people save $35 billion since 2011. We provide prescription discounts that are accepted at more than 70,000 pharmacies in the U.S., as well as telehealth services including doctor visits and lab tests. Our services have been positively reviewed by Good Morning America, The New York Times, NBC News, AARP, and many others.

Our goal is to help Americans find convenient and affordable healthcare. We offer solutions for consumers, employers, health plans, and anyone else who shares our desire to provide affordable prescriptions to all Americans.

The GoodRx Provider team is looking for a customer-centric Product Manager to drive engagement with our Provider product, built specifically for healthcare providers. This PM will be responsible for creating valuable new experiences on the GoodRx platform for prescribing healthcare providers including doctors, physicians assistants, nurse practitioners, and more. Our mission is to empower providers by creating a single place where they can go to see all drug access and affordability solutions together, so providers can focus on what they do best – treat their patients.

Working closely with designers, researchers, data analysts, and developers, you’ll identify, prioritize, and build tools to solve real provider pain points – both on our platform, and through partner integrations.

The ideal candidate is empathetic, detail-oriented, and strong with data and customer insights. A passion for providers, patients, and improving the healthcare system is a must. We’re looking for a strategic thinker who can leverage quantitative and qualitative data and work well with engineers, designers, researchers and data analysts to inform the team’s roadmap. This individual will work closely with cross-functional teams as well as internal and external stakeholders, and great communication and collaboration skills are required. Candidates need to be comfortable working with industry partners while also representing the needs of the customer to create great experiences. Experience working in healthcare and with providers is strongly preferred.

Responsibilities

Own the vision and strategy for your product area
Define goals and success with clear, measurable objectives and key results
Drive engagement with existing customers by building and delivering thoughtful tools and features to solve real provider pain points.
Partner closely with cross-functional teams to drive product strategy and vision, define requirements, and guide the team through the development process
Create well-scoped requirements and prioritize work for teams of engineers, designers and data analysts Execute product commitments effectively to consistently deliver meaningful impact to the business
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and execute go-to-market plans.
Work with data and business intelligence analysts to perform deep data dives to generate actionable insights that inform your product roadmap
Continuously experiment to validate new hypotheses and drive towards your product’s goals
Communicate project updates and results to key stakeholders, including executive leadership.
Collaborate with customer researchers to identify new opportunities.

Skills And Qualifications

3+ years of product management experience, with a track record of delivering successful projects.
Healthcare and provider related experience is strongly preferred.
Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills.
Excellent execution skills, and an ability to navigate around complex problems
Demonstrated ability to deliver large-scale product features and improvements
A passion for impact and the grit to solve problems in order to drive faster results
Data-driven by default, with demonstrated proficiency using analytics and testing best practices
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and work effectively with cross-functional teams and leadership.
Willingness to explore and own initiatives outside the scope of your product area
Proven ability to clearly present your team’s work to management
A humble, collaborative, and team-first spirit
Passion for healthcare and the GoodRx mission
Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g. business, engineering, computer science).

Nice to Have

Experience working with healthcare providers, insurance companies, or retail pharmacies.
Experience working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Experience working on new, zero to one initiatives
Technical background

Compensation decisions are determined using a variety of factors such as skill set, experience, and education or certifications. If we extend an offer for employment, we will consider all individual qualifications. Below are our salary ranges for this position based on office location:

San Francisco Office: $119,000 - $179,000

New York Office: $109,000 - $164,000

GoodRx also offers additional compensation programs such as annual cash bonuses and annual equity grants for most positions as well as generous benefits. Our great benefits offerings include medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) with a company match, an ESPP, unlimited vacation, "Take Care of Yourself" days, 11 paid holidays, and 72 hours of sick leave. GoodRx also offers additional benefits like mental wellness and financial wellness programs, fertility benefits, supplemental life insurance for you and your dependents, company-paid short-term and long-term disability, and more!

At GoodRx, we deeply value in-person connection and collaboration and feel that is key to our company culture. GoodRx is a hybrid work environment and we ask employees to be in the office a minimum of twice a week to one of our hubs in Santa Monica, San Fransico and New York City.

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company and industry. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has a seat at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunities to excel.

With that said, research shows that women and other underrepresented groups apply only if they meet 100% of the criteria. GoodRx is committed to leveling the playing field, and we encourage women, people of color, those in the LGBTQ+ communities, and Veterans to apply for positions even if they don’t necessarily check every box outlined in the job description. Please still get in touch - we’d love to connect and see if you could be good for the role!

GoodRx is America's healthcare marketplace. The company offers the most comprehensive and accurate resource for affordable prescription medications in the U.S., gathering pricing information from thousands of pharmacies coast to coast, as well as a telehealth marketplace for online doctor visits and lab tests. Since 2011, Americans with and without health insurance have saved $35 billion using GoodRx and million consumers visit goodrx.com each month to find discounts and information related to their healthcare. GoodRx is the #1 most downloaded medical app on the iOS and Android app stores. For more information, visit www.goodrx.com .

About Us:

MediaMath helps the world's top brands deliver personalized digital advertising across all connected touchpoints. Over 9,500 marketers in 42 countries use our demand-side platform every day to launch, analyze, and optimize their digital advertising campaigns across display, native, mobile, video, audio, digital out of home, and advanced TV formats.

MediaMath is the leading technology pioneer on a mission to make advertising better. We deliver outstanding results through powerful ad tech, partnership and a curiosity for what’s next. We help more than 3,500 advertisers solve complex marketing problems so they can deepen their customer relationships across screens and around the world.




US Proposed Salary Range: $103,000-123,000 (Annual)

key Responsibilities

MediaMath seeks a Product Manager to join our Activate team. The Activate product team builds optimization and bidding products that inform how our clients spend their marketing budgets in our platform. We're responsible for both the UI and backend components of these features and are at the center of MediaMath's commitment to performance, transparency, and automation.

You will apply machine learning across various areas of the MediaMath Platform. This includes algorithms that drive business outcomes for advertisers, algorithms that help predict supply pricing and performance, as well optimization tools that simplify and automate ongoing campaign management in the MediaMath platform. Recently, this role has released a machine learning driven automation layer that has significantly saved time for programmatic media buyers while driving better KPI performance for advertisers.

You will:

Illuminate and drive MediaMath’s strategic vision for our proprietary algorithmic and optimization products and align our product offering around that vision

Partner with the Data Science team to harness cutting edge research in machine learning

Collaborate with product, engineering and cross-functional teams on the development, QA, and release of products and balance of resources to ensure success for the entire organization

Monitor and optimize team progress on a regular basis to ensure delivery of committed functionality

Work collaboratively with internal stake holders to launch, market, and support new products and features

Work with user research to collect product feedback and then use that feedback to advance the product offering

Partner with product marketing to create product documentation and demos new product features

Manage support issues for both internal and external stakeholders to ensure client satisfaction

You have:

BA/BS; MS preferred - ideally within Mathematics or Economics

3+ years of product management experience

Understanding of machine learning and digital campaign optimization

Demonstrated ability to lead, design and execution of a multi-faceted product strategy

Demonstrated ability to coordinate with multiple parties involved in intricate, fast-moving projects with tight deadlines, and setting priorities

It is beneficial if you have:

Experience in Ad-tech/digital media/ advertising agency

Strong understanding of the programmatic tech landscape including ad serving technology, RTB, DSP, SSP a plus




You are:

Experienced with Agile software development / Scrum methodology

True self-starter - motivated by the need to get to an answer

Highly analytical including the ability to use data to drive product decisions

Exceptional communicator with strong presentation skills

Why We Work at MediaMath:

We are restless innovators, smart, passionate and kind. At the heart of our culture are three values that provide a framework for how we approach our work and the world: Win Together, Obsess Over Growth, and Do Good, Better. These values inform how we energize one another and engage with our clients. They get us amped to come to work.

Founded in 2007 as a pioneer in "programmatic" advertising, MediaMath is recognised as a Leader in the Gartner 2020 Magic Quadrant for Ad Tech and has won Best Account Support by a Technology Company for two years in a row in the AdExchanger Awards.

About Charlie

We’re Charlie and we exist to Make Work Better. We believe the best way to do this is by equipping progressive <100-person companies with effortless HR tools to deliberately craft a happy, high-performing culture every day.

We’re looking for a Senior or Lead Product Manager to join our Product team on a 3-6 month contract – and help us start to reach the next level of maturity in our product function. You’ll be responsible for the leadership, strategy and execution of a product squad within this time. You’ll train current team members and implement data-led decision making frameworks.

Come on and join us to make work better!

This is a 3-6 month contract role. We cannot offer visa sponsorship and you must be able to work in the UK.

In this role you will have the following key responsibilities:

Product strategy – develop and execute a squad strategy that aligns with our product strategy
Customer focused – conduct market research and customer analysis to understand customer needs and core JTBD
Data driven – follow a data driven approach, using both qualitative but also quantitative data to inform decisions.
Communication – communicate product vision, strategy, and updates to stakeholders and cross-functional teams for area of responsibility and within the squad’s scope
Leadership – lead cross-functional team in the development of a JTBD roadmap and manage its execution
Best practice – define product requirements and create detailed specifications, user stories, and wireframes to guide development.
Collaboration – collaborate with design and engineering teams to bring the best out of collaborators and build high-quality products
Experiments – launch experiments, gather and analyse qualitative and quantitative data to validate product hypotheses
Go to market – define clear go to market strategy in collaboration with Customer Success, Marketing and Sales teams
Iteration – monitor and analyse product performance and make recommendations for improvements
Lead implementation of data-led decision processes – we have a new quantitative tool at Charlie and we need to get started using it to collect the right data and use it for daily decision making
Train other PMs - to grow according to strongest PMs best practices, methods and frameworks (aligned with reforge is a plus)


Requirements

You must have:

8+ years of experience as a product manager in a technology company
A proven history of success in product management roles, where you currently own or have owned a large scope of consumer-facing products and features
Strong experience with data analysis and customer research technique, especially the quantitative tool Amplitude
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills
Deep analytical, prioritisation, and problem-solving skills
Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience leveraging experiments and data to inform product decisions.
Aptitude for translating complex technical topics into simple product solutions.
Relentlessly focused on customers’ needs
Self-awareness and humility – you know that honest feedback is how you grow, and you’re not afraid to ask for help.


Behaviours we look for:

Self-starter with a bias towards action
Results-driven mindset, focused on execution and with a hands-on approach
Ability to work in a fast-paced, cross-functional team environment
Strong ability to motivate and inspire people to do their best work
Possess a deep sense of ownership and responsibility
Exceptional interpersonal communication and relationship management


We will still consider applications even if you don't meet every single one of the above requirements, so don't be put off if you don't match them absolutely perfectly!

The Way We Work

How we're crafting ownership, belonging and structured flexibility:

A team of around 40 that genuinely enjoy spending time together, with regular in-person and remote events to foster connection
9 day fortnights — our adjusted work week. We have every other Friday off work and have a meeting-free Wednesday on the five-day weeks to give time for deep work
Hybrid-first approach; we optimise for office and remote working to be valued equally, and to be equally valuable
Live anywhere in the UK; we have 6 set days per year that we require the team to be together in our London office, but you have the flexibility to live anywhere in the UK
90 bookable "nomad working" days outside of the UK each year (pro-rated)
No fixed working hours; you take ownership over how you get your work done
An amazing office space in East London's pet-friendly Second Home, and membership access to their wider London, Lisbon and LA locations.


You can find out more about the way we work at Charlie by checking out our Handbook here

Benefits

These will all be pro-rated

A huge focus on mental health; access to Spill, offering six 121 counselling sessions, and much more
4 bookable “Personal days” per year for when you can’t bring your full self to work
£30 monthly wellbeing budget
Enhanced Equal Parental Leave policy
£550 yearly learning budget
£500 yearly flexible working budget
25 days annual leave + public holidays


Equal Opportunities Statement

We are an equal opportunity employer and believe in the power of a diverse, inclusive team.

We welcome all applications from all suitably qualified people, regardless of race, sex, disability, religion / belief, sexual orientation or age.

Please let us know if you require anything which would enable your success throughout our interview process.

At Feeld, we are creating a world where where everyone is more intimately connected to each other and themselves. We are building an inclusive, human-centered product and are looking for a Data Products PM to become part of our remote team and our mission to elevate the human experience of sexuality and relationships.

Feeld is a data-driven company that allows humans in the community to build meaningful and unique connections using proprietary algorithms and innovative flows in our Discover stack. Data insight powers many other in-app experiences, and Feeld is looking for a creative and passionate product leader with a strong quantitative background to create an innovation roadmap for our suite of data products and experiences.

What you will do:

Dive deep into the desires, motivations, and outcomes Feeld users exhibit during various points of their journey
Serve as the lead evangelist for Discover, and strive to optimize user outcomes within the context of Feeld’s strategic goals.
Partner with technical and design teams to understand the existing Discover experience, both front-end design and back-end algorithms.
Engage in design thinking initiatives with research and design partners to ideate on feature enhancements and innovation to improve engagement with the stack.
Design and launch user research initiatives to better understand the “idealized user journey” via Discover with research and design teams.
Test and implement strategies to increase the chat conversion rate for new Connections.
Collaborate with Revenue teams to understand how Discover drives consumables and Majestic subscriptions.
Ideate and execute on enhancements to deliver greater value to users via consumables and bespoke upsell opportunities.
Manage a test and learn agenda targeted at balancing positive engagement signals with other topline performance metrics.
Identify opportunities to better leverage data insight in presentation and organization of connections, chat messages, and other in-app experiences.
Constantly analyze performance data of various markets and cohorts and report insights and next steps to executives.
Establish a vision for Discover 2.0, demonstrate how innovation ties to company goals in 2023, and execute on the plan with engineering, design, data, and program management.


Requirements

7+ years of experience in product management, preferably in social media, traditional media, entertainment, or gaming industries.
5+ years experience working with data scientists, data engineers, and backend developers to define and optimize user experiences.
Strong data analysis skills with ability to derive actionable insights from imperfect data sets. Knowledge of SQL and other technical languages a plus.
Passionate about experimentation, A/B + multivariate testing, and able to encourage a culture of testing among designers, marketers, and executives.
Ability to create detail-oriented product documentation and requirements, make adjustments to scope on the fly, define success metrics, track delivery and report on outcomes in a timely manner.


Benefits

About us:

Feeld is an independent, experimental and fully remote organisation reshaping the dialogue on dating and sexuality. The company was founded in 2014 and has evolved since to become the open, distributed structure it is now. We have a naturally agile and fluid culture. The whole team is fully remote, which means you work where and when helps you perform at your best. We regard autonomy highly and treat our organisation as a product – we iterate, improve and test things internally to see what works best for everyone.

Our culture:

We believe in creating a safe work environment through humanity, fluidity, safety, transparency and progressiveness. When hiring, we look for culture add rather than culture fit.

Because we are a fully remote team, it’s especially important that we create an environment where our colleagues feel included and connected as humans.

Diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging at Feeld:

Feeld promotes open-mindedness, inclusion, diversity and kindness, both in the world and among our own workforce.

We encourage and welcome applications from people with a history of marginalisation, whether because of race, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability (seen or unseen) or any confluence of intersectional identities.

Our goal is a barrier-free application process and working environment. If you require further details or assistance or have any questions about this process, please let us know at hr@feeld.co.

Compensation and perks:

We are conscious of how our work and decisions impact other humans and the environment. We design our product and organisation with consideration for the wellbeing and happiness of our members and colleagues. We believe in technology and working environments that enable people to live a meaningful, fulfilled life.

Therefore, we offer our staff:

Flexible working hours
Unlimited paid time off
A fully remote working situation
$3,500 USD annual expense budget
$4,000 USD equipment and home office budget
Learning & development budget
On demand therapy sessions and mental health support via Spill
Company retreats


Feeld’s way of working is designed to proactively prevent burnout and an “always on” culture.

One of our Core Values is: Transparent. We strive for complete openness of information within the organisation and for enabling honesty on our platform. Internally, we keep decision-making transparent to keep each other accountable and make sure all voices are heard.

That is why we offer:

Open and transparent salaries
Baseline Freedom Salary of $80,000 or £60,000 per year for all roles
The base salary for this role is determined by Level and Step, as well as geographic location.


Our interview process:

Your first conversation with Feeld will be a screening call with our recruiter, where you’ll be able to ask - and receive answers - regarding any general questions you have and to confirm the role is a fit for what you’re seeking.
Your second conversation will connect you directly with the hiring manager for the role you’re applying to. Here, you’ll have a chance to ask more questions about the work you’ll be doing. This conversation will also focus on your past work experiences.
The next step for most of our roles is a candidate challenge. This is an evaluation of the skills relevant to be successful in this role and generally takes about an hour to complete.
Your third conversation allows you the opportunity to meet the team members you might be working with on a daily basis. Here, you’ll be able to ask questions about team processes, workflow, and the employee experience at Feeld.
We generally make an offer within 2 weeks of our final call, and offer a flexible start date that can begin as early as the next Monday after you sign our offer documentation.
Of note: all of our interviews are conducted remotely, and our interviewers will work with you to find an agreeable interview time based on mutual availability.


We understand we're asking you to invest your time and best efforts in our process, and are appreciative of getting the chance to better know who you are as a person and candidate. In return, we’re committed to offering transparent communication and prompt feedback as you navigate this application with us.

To find out more about Feeld, download our app on iOS or Android.

Who We Are:

Fareportal is a travel technology company powering a next-generation travel concierge service. Utilizing its innovative technology and company owned and operated global contact centres, Fareportal has built strong industry partnerships providing customers access to over 500 airlines, a million lodgings, and hundreds of car rental companies around the globe. With a portfolio of consumer travel brands including CheapOair and OneTravel, Fareportal enables consumers to book-online, on mobile apps for iOS and Android, by phone, or live chat. Fareportal provides its airline partners with access to a broad customer base that books high-yielding international travel and add-on ancillaries.

HIGHLIGHTS:

Fareportal is the number 1 privately held online travel company in flight volume.
Fareportal partners with over 500 airlines, 1 million lodgings, and hundreds of car rental companies worldwide.
2019 annual sales exceeded $5 billion.
Fareportal sees over 150 million unique visitors annually to our desktop and mobile sites.
Fareportal, with its global workforce of over 2,600 employees, is strategically positioned with 9 offices in 6 countries and headquartered in New York City.




Role Description

The Senior Product Manager Car Rental and Cross Sell at Fareportal will have full product ownership of Car Rental and Cross Sell (post booking attachment for cars, hotels, activities) Bookings. The Product manager will align the business vision, market and competitor trends, customer feedback and business analytics to create, prioritize, and execute a roadmap that delivers sustainable business growth and meets the financial goals and targets for the Car Rental, and Cross Sell products. The Senior Product manager will work with various stakeholders to combine different needs and goals to support the creation of a coherent product strategy

Responsibilities:

Ownership of the Car Rental & Cross Sell Products, including P&L responsibility.
Own and optimize customer journey for Car Rental & Cross Sell Products.
Go-to person to explain movement of key Car Rental & Cross Sell KPI’s.
Hands-on participation to create and improve attachment and revenue KPIs for Car Rental, & Cross Sell by working with development, design, marketing, data science, analytics and other teams as needed.
Work directly with the dedicated development team, run scrums, plan their sprints and participate in routine discussions to address questions on the proposed user stories.
Team with Supplier Relations team to negotiate favourable partnerships with suppliers of Car Rental to negotiate partnerships.
Lead research, metrics gathering, competitive and performance analyses of products listed above, and communicate results across the company.
Author and publish requirements, identify, and outline the needs to increase attachment, convert findings to clearly defined user stories so they are easily executed by the technology team
Become a key member of the Fareportal Product team, ensuring our Car Rental & Cross Sell offerings align with customers' needs and overall company strategy.
Complete ongoing competitive analysis to ensure that we are providing top-tier products and customer experiences for our customers.
Prioritize mix of minor necessary enhancements and new innovations/revenue/cost opportunities
Identify and communicate status, blockers, risks, and mitigation strategies to appropriate teams as needed
Improve accuracy and the quality of data on internal reports and google analytics around Car Rental and Cross Sell, products. Improving data collection, utilizing big data, and providing requirements to develop custom reports.
Build products that rated highly by customer (NPS > 75) and deliver commercial growth for Fareportal.
Lead daily Product quality checks (price checks, customer experience, site speed and functionality, content quality, customer feedbacks, etc.)
Collaborate with pricing team and oversee Car Rental, pricing analysis with Fare Data Analysis team.
Ensure NPS, DOT, NAD, BBB, AG and all Legal compliance for the Car Rental & Cross Sell product portfolio.
Collaborate with operations and call center teams, and act as the Business Lead/owner for the Car Rental/ and post-booking attachment operation teams.




Required Qualifications

Masters in Comp Science/ Industrial Engineering or MBA in IT/ Ecommerce is preferred
At least 7 years’ experience in a Product Management role preferably in Car Rental Product ownership that includes P&L responsibility.
Strong Business Intelligence, analytical, data interpretation and problem-solving skills.
Well versed in scientific method and hypothesis-based AB Testing and product development.
Mastery with A/B testing and tools, with a strong understanding of data-driven decision-making
Good product innovation skills
Must be a champion of new innovative ideas that drive competitive parity and superiority
A strong understanding of current web technologies, standards, and how the web ecosystem is evolving.
Experience and success with Agile development concepts.
Strategic and holistic thinking to balance and prioritize short-term solutions with the long-term vision
A strong entrepreneurial spirit and the ability to rally internal support for ideas
Excellent leadership and communication skills
A strong design and usability sense driven by the ability to step into a user's shoes and advocate for them
Be an advocate of customers and create/improve existing customer service processes to improve post-booking experiences for Car Rental and Cross Sell products to achieve NPS > 75.
Excellent writing, organizational, and time management skills
Enthusiasm for working collaboratively on cross-functional teams and coordinating between them
Proven experience with full product SDLC, from concept to launch
Implementation experience across desktop, mobile and app development, and alignment in a B2C environment
Proven ability to define and execute a successful product and development roadmap
Ability to break high-level concept/projects into sprint deliverables.
Create well-defined user stories with clear requirements for development team and detailed acceptance criteria for QA engineers,
Excellent hands-on analytical skills, with a proven ability of multi-tasking with minimal oversight
Develop and manage ongoing business relationships at multiple organizational levels, and work in a dynamic environment.
Demonstrated ability to design and deliver both formal and informal presentations to groups of all sizes

SmartRecruiters was recognized by Forbes as one of the Best Employers in 2020. Job Description

About Grass Valley?




With our award-winning technology and trusted expertise, Grass Valley enables and empowers creators, broadcasters and media organizations to produce brilliant content that captivates audiences and connects people through the magic of media.




As the industry’s R&D powerhouse, we offer the widest and deepest range of best-in-class solutions in the industry. We are the trusted partner to many of the biggest and most creative names in the media and entertainment business as we help our customers to build successful media businesses and navigate the rapidly shifting mediascape.




As the world continues to evolve, Grass Valley is also transforming: Creating innovative breakthrough solutions to serve customers’ changing needs and realities. We are proud that for over 60 years, our innovations have enabled content creators, broadcasters and media organizations to produce rich, compelling content that brings the viewer even closer to the action; more engaged with the story and more connected to others.




Our people are creative, knowledgeable, passionate and dedicated, working together to deliver high quality solutions and services to customers all over the world. We are looking for our future ambassadors, technologists, thought leaders and innovators to continue this beautiful journey with us. This is your opportunity, join us!




For further information, please visit www.grassvalley.com




The Role




The Product Manager is responsible for building differentiated and defensible product and market segment positioning and go-to-market strategy based on an understanding of market dynamics and buyer needs –– in relation to Grass Valley products. Collaborates with the respective Business Units to determine customer requirements, product positioning and key drivers for use in demand generation activities. Other strategic contributions may include sales training, developing analyst relations, helping to manage third-party alliances and market sizing & analysis. Works with marketing communications to translate positioning into sales tools and market-facing materials and ensure that sales and marketing teams are aligned. Attention to detail and the ability to grasp and translate technical capabilities into customer benefits are essential.




The Main Responsibilities




Product responsibilities include Standalone, Modular and SW Processing Products
Develop product positioning, descriptions and highlight specific problems solved by each respective solution in order to create messaging that differentiates your offerings to the market
Investigate and understand customer requirements and maintain detailed, on-going knowledge of customer expectations related to your assigned products/applications via cross-functional interactions with sales, service and other departments, as necessary
Plan and manage market launch of new products and releases and manage the cross-functional implementation of the plan
Communicate the value propositions of the products to the sales team and reseller channels and manage the implementation of the sales tools that support the selling process of your products
Analyze competitors and their value propositions to create competitive analyses and competitive positioning profiles for use collateral materials and sales tools
Analyze market data and conduct market and product research in order to contribute to market analysis and market sizing activities within assigned Business Unit
Create Thought Leadership content relevant to assigned solution areas for use in public relations and branding activities
Represent the company at tradeshows/events and in customer-specific meetings in conjunction with sales team activities




Requirements




Experience in a broadcast or media content-related field
Bachelor’s degree in business or marketing or equivalent
4+ years of software or hardware product marketing experience
Very strong written communication skills
Excellent people and management skills to interact with staff, colleagues and cross-functional teams, as well as third-parties.




Working Conditions




Travel up to 30%




Grass Valley offers competitive compensation packages in an energizing and supportive work environment.

Product Manager




Are you an experienced Product Manager ready to join a solid and rapidly growing company in Italy?




Are you an ambitious individual with a marketing and commercial background?




Can combine this with a knowledge of antipsychotics?




Fraser Dove International is partnering exclusively with an established global pharmaceutical organisation specialising in the development, manufacture and marketing of pharmaceutical products.




Our client is seeking is a highly motivated, hard-working, and customer focused individual to be part of a new team of specialists who will be responsible for launching and selling Okedi® in Italy.




Your objectives:

1) In collaboration with Marketing HQ and the Business Unit Director, to deliver effective annual operational marketing plans using customer and market insight to maximise the brand’s short, medium and long- term growth sales objectives.

2) To play an active part the development and implementation of the organisations cross functional strategic / tactical plans and company culture at a local, national, regional and global level as required. This will involve participation in cross functional meetings with the global marketing, medical and sales team.

3) To act as first support to the brand champion to share learnings and success with global teams.

What you will do:

· To identify, successfully maintain and develop relationships with key prescribers, decision makers and stakeholders at regional and national level, in collaboration with the Senior PM.

· To design appropriate targeting, positioning, and messaging across all customer segments to promote the product’s clinical attributes/benefits and value propositions to positively influence prescribing behaviour.

· Support in hospital formularies to achieve appropriate positioning in formularies / protocols.

· To train and communicate effectively with the field team to ensure implementation of the strategy and achievement of targets & objectives for the brand.

· Support with marketing agencies to ensure integrated marketing communications strategy is reflected in all activities and that communication goals are met.

· To be compliant with the AIFA compliance code as well as the organisations policies, SOPs and procedures.




What you will bring:

· University degree is essential

· Pharmacy or Medical qualifications is essential

· Pharmaceutical Industry (3 years +)

· At least 2 years’ experience as a Product Manager in pharmaceuticals working with

RX brands. Experience in Antipsychotics will be a plus

· Proficiency English level

· Good understanding of the schizophrenia field

· A quantifiable experience & understanding of the mental health

· Excellent communications skills are a must, both verbal and written

· Ability to interact with and educate healthcare professionals.

· Capable of working on own initiative

· Good communication and presentation skills

What you will get:

These are the perks and benefits that will complement your generous base salary:

· Permanent position in a steadily growing company

· Active participation and contribution to a start-up-affiliate

· A comfortable and loyal teamworking

· An attractive salary
