Job Description

CINC is a fully integrated cloud-based homeowners’ association accounting and property management software system. The organization develops accounting and management software solutions that support the running of the day to day activities of Homeowner and Condominium Associations.

CINC Systems is a fully integrated cloud-based association accounting and property management software system. It’s the largest SaaS player in its space and is growing rapidly.

In Fall 2019, CINC received significant investment from Spectrum Equity, a well-respected growth equity fund that has invested in the likes of Ancestry.com, SurveyMonkey, Origami Risk, Grubhub, Lynda.com and GoodRX.

Following that investment, CINC has bolstered its executive team and made significant hires across the company.

CINC is seeking a Product Manager to join the growing team at our Duluth office. The Product Manager is responsible for planning, executing and finalizing solutions related to new and existing products, modules and services. The candidate will manage the product development life cycle from start to finish.

Job Duties:

Works collaboratively with the Executive team to define, develop and manage a vision, strategy, and product roadmap for the CINC and AI platforms that supports the goals and strategy of the business and reflects market intelligence and customer needs.
Works collaboratively with all client-facing teams to ensure the product meets the needs of the customers and to source new product ideas/requirements.
Manages the product lifecycle of new products, features or enhancements in an agile development environment.
Manages backlog and sprints to deliver on commitments in the product roadmap.
Works with internal and external stakeholders to bring structure to complex project-based processes and bring increased efficiency in the delivery of features and enhancements and in turn, enhanced client satisfaction.
Participates in the development of requirements and user stories/acceptance criteria that outline revisions or additional features of existing products, and the conception of new products. Completes market research to identify trends and/or needs of targeted clients/customers.
Analyzes and compares competitor's product lines in relation to the organization's current offerings. Develops strategies for competitive positioning to increase sales and promotions.
Works with a cross-functional team to ensure fulfillment of product requirements, evaluates product performance and transition products from development to commercialization.
Works with sales and marketing to develop go-to-market strategies that ensure successful launch and commercialization of new products and features.
Assists in determining product delivery and deployment dates for new product releases.
Works with Development to research and prototype innovative technologies and products.
Serves as a liaison between other departments for the purposes of gathering client/customer feedback and disseminating information pertaining to the status of product development.
Leads major releases and ensures feature enhancements respond to customer requests.
Responsible for product delivery, managing schedules and tasks related to all aspects of product development.


Requirements

Qualifications:

Ideal candidates will possess a bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, business, accounting, or similar fields, and have 4 or more years of SaaS product management/product owner experience. Must have experience succeeding in an agile development environment. Experience managing accounting software, banking software, property management software, mobile apps, and/or payments is a plus.

Competencies: Ability to foster teamwork and build collaborative relationships. Management skills. Self-starter. Oral and written communication skills. Problem-solving skills. Analytical thinking and strategy development skills. Project management skills. Scrum Master or Scrum Product Owner certification is a plus. Experience managing sprints with Jira is a plus.


Benefits

Benefits:

Great working environment
Work/life balance
Medical
Dental
Vision
Life Insurance
Short-term & Long-term disability insurance
AFLAC
Flexible Spending Plan (childcare & healthcare)
401K (matching available)
136 hours of paid time off per year
10 paid holidays per year
Free snacks (when in office)

DMI is a global professional services company that specializes in digital strategy, design, transformation, and support. More than your basic systems integrator or big-box advisor, we are a new breed of partner that blends human-centric consulting and design with agile engineering, delivery, and global scale. We believe that digital transformation is an end-to-endless evolutionary process that requires technology solutions and partners that meet organizations where they are. Consultants at the core, DMI has been delivering mission-critical, enterprise grade solutions since 2002 for more than a hundred Fortune 1,000 enterprises, various state and local government agencies and all fifteen U.S. federal departments. DMI has grown to 2,100+ employees globally and has been continually recognized by top industry analysts as well as a Top Workplace in the USA and Remote.




DMInc.com | Careers | Twitter | LinkedIn | Facebook




About The Opportunity




DMI is looking for a Product Manager for our managed services business unit to manage the development and launch of new SaaS products as well as each iteration. They serve as the focal point from the product strategy phase through the go-to-market phase of the product lifecycle.




They will create a product roadmap that covers the entire product team, guarantees seamless product functionality, decides upon how to prioritize the backlog, and advances the product vision.




Duties And Responsibilities




Create, maintain, and communicate product vision, strategy, and roadmaps, including near-term delivery and long-term product evolution.
Develop strategic product plan and deliver breakthrough capabilities by working with technical and non-technical partners; measure output, improve execution, and continuously deliver customer value.
Define product strategy, features, and success criteria for evaluating vendors/partners to make ongoing buy-build-partner-acquire decisions.
Identify opportunities to create best-in-class platform capabilities by leveraging customer/developer feedback, monitoring/analytics, and team know-how/ know-why in order to connect company strengths with available resources,
Model Agile principles to increase speed and frequency of product delivery by maintaining and communicating groomed backlog, providing requirement prioritization for backlog, and set criteria for Minimum Viable Product,
Provide leadership direction to direct and/or matrixed core team members, incorporating feedback from across all functions, product leadership, and company's senior leadership.




Qualifications




Education and Years of Experience:




Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering or Computer Science.
5+ years of agile product management.




Required And Desired Skills/Certifications




Because this Product Manager will be working directly with development teams, a background in Ruby software development or AWS infrastructure is required.
Mobility, Managed Services, and or expense management experience
Experience in a digital/eCommerce company with demonstrated success delivering new products, platforms, and experiences to markets.
Exceptional communication, organization, and analytical skills.
Experience leading and managing a team with direct and indirect reports.
Demonstrated experience creating and using strategy to solve complex problems that span across multiple divisions and groups within company.
Ability to identify metrics and key performance measures and use data to drive decisions which enhance the customer experience.




Additional Requirements




Regular and reliable attendance.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Multitasking skills and ability to keep up in a fast-paced work environment.
The ability to utilize critical thinking to complete tasks.
Ability to contribute to the team culture.




Location: Remote




Hours: 8am-5pm, Monday-Friday




Working At DMI




DMI is a diverse, prosperous and rewarding place to work. Being part of the DMI family means we care about your wellbeing. As such, we offer a variety of perks and benefits that help meet various interests and needs, while still having the opportunity to work directly with a number of our award winning, Fortune 1000 clients. The following categories make up your DMI wellbeing:




Community – Blood drives, volunteering opportunities, Holiday parties, summer picnics, Tech Chef, Octoberfest just to name a few ways DMI comes together as a community.
Convenience/Concierge - Virtual visits through health insurance, pet insurance, commuter benefits, discount tickets for movies, travel and many other items to provide convenience.
Development – Annual performance management, continuing education and tuition assistance, internal job opportunities along with career enrichment and advancement to help each employee with their professional and personal development.
Financial – Generous 401k match for both pre-tax and post-tax (ROTH) contributions along with financial wellness education, EAP, Life Insurance and Disability help provide financial stability for each DMI employee.
Recognition – Great achievements do not go unnoticed by DMI through Annual Awards ceremony, service anniversaries, peer-to-peer acknowledgement through Give-A-Wow, employee referral bonuses.
Wellness – Healthcare benefits, Wellness programs, Flu Shots, Biometric screenings, on-site lactation rooms provide employees with several wellness options.




Employees are valued for their talents and contributions. We all take pride in helping our customers achieve their goals, which in turn contributes to the overall success of the company.

Our Company




Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.




We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!




The Opportunity




We are looking for a collaborative Product Manager to join our team. We are building strategy for next-gen Digital Experience solutions, identifying, and executing on the key products between Adobe and our technology partner solutions; including Microsoft. You will drive product integration requirements to deliver real customer value. The focus will be to deeply understand Adobe partner products and strategies; and identify areas where product integration would create new value and competitive offerings for both companies. Are you interested in learning more about the Adobe and Microsoft strategic partnership? Learn more about it here.




What You'll Do




Build out partner strategy for growth products/next-gen services of Digital Experience business unit at Adobe
Help evaluate new partnerships with technology partners
Work with partners to identify better together solutions to deliver customer value. Define product integration requirements and work with partners on the development of joint solutions
Help drive and define product messaging and better together use cases for Adobe and technology partners
Stay abreast of partner products and strategic investment areas
Identify new areas for integrations with Microsoft technologies in by analyzing customer requirements, market trends, competitive gaps and business impact. Champion and present opportunities to management and key stakeholders for consideration
Develop product requirements based on data-driven approach and inputs from stakeholders across the business (e.g. executives, other product teams etc.), integrate requirements into the product roadmap
Work with partner and Adobe product teams to validate integration concept
Work with Adobe solution product team to hand off the integration requirements for their backlog prioritization
Work with product marketing teams to communicate key messages and customer value for field and customer facing collateral
Work with field teams, customers, and partners to represent product integrations and roadmap
Act as a consultant to Adobe solution teams who are investigating integrations with Microsoft products




What You'll Need To Succeed




Strong product management and technical background with a good understanding of what products do, how they are architected, and how they integrate with others
BA/BS degree in Computer Science preferred
3+ years working with product management in a technical area
Sound business judgement to be able to identify areas of opportunity and priority
Curiosity and ability to see and consider out-of-the-box ideas
Present opportunities and influence management and stakeholders
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $97,600 -- $187,500 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.




At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).




In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We're looking for a Product Manager to join our growing Product team. After a year in this role, you will have launched our new Mobile App, evolved the pathways into our product for students seeking care, built a roadmap of integrations with other products in the higher ed software market, and explored/tested at least one expansion of our offering for the Higher Education market that gives us competitive advantage.

We're excited to meet PMs who have a background building for a complex ecosystem of buyers, stakeholders, and end-users— ideally in the educational market— in close collaboration with Product Marketing. We're interested in candidates from all backgrounds who are passionate about our mission to make mental healthcare accessible and available to young adult students in the U.S.

About The Role

The Product Manager will:

Report to the Head of Product.
Own the digital pathways into Mantra's student offering, e.g. sign-up and referral flows, in close collaboration with Product Marketing.
Expand our suite of integrations with the higher education software ecosystem.
Launch the first version of our Mobile App on both iOS and Android.
Explore, assess, and test concepts that will drive competitive advantage within Mantra's offering.
Conduct customer and user research and integrate it into our development processes.
Define activation, conversion, and mobile KPIs and actively analyze data and user feedback.
Serve as the PM in sprint planning; manage the roadmap to ensure on-time delivery and overall product quality, and proactively remove roadblocks to support your team.


About You

You have 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager at a startup
You have 2+ years of experience building a B2B2C product, ideally for the educational market
You have experience building from 0-to-1, either through entrepreneurship, or building something new within a startup organization
You're a savvy navigator of the end-user vs. customer dichotomy
You've collaborated closely with a strong Product Marketing / Marketing function
You've built a mobile app that existed on both the Android and iOS platforms


About Us

Mantra Health is a digital mental health clinic on a mission to improve access mental healthcare for young adults through clinical services, software, and design. Since our founding in 2018, we've built a comprehensive treatment service for young adults with mental health conditions. We've raised over $27 million to work with students at universities and colleges across the country such as MIT, Cornell, and the University of Minnesota. Our students see clinically differences in their mental health during treatment with us, with nearly two-thirds of students stating that Mantra's program helped them stay in school.

Company Description

Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together.

To solve this problem, we expanded into software and built integrated solutions to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.

Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.

Job Description

The restaurant industry is at an inflection point where technology is becoming more important than ever in shaping a restaurant's success. The Square for Restaurants team is helping restaurants build and grow smart businesses that can shapeshift to adapt to evolving diner demands, all while maintaining a sense of hospitality.

You will report to the Head of Product, Restaurants and focus on helping restaurants start, run and grow their businesses through building products that automate and elevate every part of the flow of their service.

To be successful in this role, you should be able to transform a deep empathy of a restaurant's needs and pains into elegant software, to think tactically and strategically, to manage deep cross-functional collaboration and execution. You must also be able to drive growth metrics and own the details of the solution from deep in the stack through the end-user experience.

If you're looking to work at a high-growth company, drive impact on widely used products and change the way the restaurant industry works on a global scale you will find this role compelling, challenging, and rewarding.

You Will:

Work closely with restaurant owners and staff to deeply understand their needs, what keeps them up at night and how they run their business and serve their diners
In collaboration with design, engineering, marketing, and analytics partners, lead the end-to-end success of projects from discovery to launch
Identify new growth opportunities through quantitative research, UX studies, and reviews of industry standard methodologies
Influence and inspire key stakeholders and cross-functional peers and executives throughout Square to align intent, resources, and prioritization and deliver excellent products and services


Qualifications

You Have:

Minimum of 3 years of consumer-facing product management experience
Passion for our purpose of economic empowerment and helping sellers succeed
Strong customer empathy and experience shaping product direction based on customer needs
Create solid relationships that shine when you're talking with a customer, cross-functional partner, or engaging a diverse audience
Natural curiosity and growth mindset, obsession with the details
Navigated product scale challenges in a high growth environment
Proven experience delivering results


Additional Information

Block takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.

Zone A: USD $152,100 - USD $185,900

Zone B: USD $144,500 - USD $176,700

Paid parental and caregiving leave
Paid time off
Learning and Development resources
Paid Life insurance, AD&D. and disability benefits
Perks such as WFH reimbursements and free access to caregiving, legal, and discounted resources


This role is also eligible to participate in Block's equity plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies, and may be eligible for a sign-on bonus. Sales roles may be eligible to participate in a commission plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies. Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time, consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans.

Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

Overview

When you think of InComm Payments, think of Innovative Payments Technology. We were founded 30 years ago and continue to be a pioneer in the payment (FinTech) industry. Since our inception, we have grown to be a team of over 3,000 employees in 34+ countries around the world. We own over 400 global technical patents and a network that includes over 525,000 points of retail distribution that points to our industry expertise.

InComm Payments works with the most recognized and valued brands in the world, and we are partnered with most of the world’s leading merchants. InComm Payments is highly focused on our people and their growth, and we work hard to make a career at InComm Payments meaningful and rewarding. We value innovation, quality, passion, integrity, and responsibility in all that we do, and we are looking for great people to join our team as we move forward towards a very bright future.

About This Opportunity




We are seeking a highly motivated and driven Product Manager to join our Financial Services eCommerce team. As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for developing and executing product strategies that deliver best-in-class user experience and drive revenue growth. If you are excited to collaborate with other Product Managers, Marketing Managers, and development teams to analyze and deliver e-commerce initiatives, then you've found the right opportunity. Daily activities include leading cross-functional team meetings to dive into use cases, create user stories, prioritize backlogs, and analyze site data to determine purchasing behavior and trends.

The successful candidate will have experience leading cross-functional teams to deliver complex products, a deep understanding of e-commerce trends and technologies, and a passion for creating innovative solutions to customer problems. The ideal candidate will be able to think beyond specific functions and take a full end-to-end view. This role is for someone who is excited to work on major initiatives, aggressive enough to drive projects and an influencer to work with cross-functional teams.




Responsibilities

As the Product Manager, you will be responsible for owning our 2nd largest eCommerce gift card site and work to develop and prioritize features that will drive revenue. You will work closely with cross-functional teams such as marketing, engineering, card production and customer service teams to manage and enhance our gift card products on time and within budget. You will be a key contributor to the growth and success of our e-commerce business.

Knowledge of agile product development methodologies, including experience with sprint planning, prioritization, and product roadmap development.
Lead the development and execution of the e-commerce website strategy, defining the product roadmap, and ensuring alignment with the company's overall strategic goals.
Develop a deep understanding of the e-commerce market, competitors, and emerging trends, leveraging this knowledge to identify opportunities and drive innovation.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to leverage data to inform product strategy.
Strong documentation skills, with familiarity working with writing use cases, flow diagrams, and user personas.
Define and track key product metrics to measure product success and identify areas for improvement.
Ability to write clear and concise user stories that accurately capture the user's needs, wants, and expectations.
Self-starter who takes initiative in solving problems and can self-manage commitments and deadlines.
Ability to influence and negotiate with stakeholders to achieve buy-in and alignment on product priorities and strategies.
Ability to maintain a strong customer focus and user-centered approach to product development.






Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering, or a related field.
2+ years of product management experience in e-commerce, digital products, or related industries.
Experience building use cases and business requirements and translating them into user stories and acceptance criteria.
Strong communication skills to understand the needs of users and stakeholders, as well as to clearly articulate the requirements in a concise and effective manner.
Proven track record of executing strong understanding of e-commerce technologies, including payment gateways, shopping carts, and product search.
Demonstrated success in developing and executing e-commerce strategies that drive growth.
Experience with Agile/Scrum development methodologies and tools such as Jira.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Passion for creating innovative and user-friendly products that drive business growth.
Ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously and prioritize competing demands.
eCommerce experience with SEO knowledge and content marketing strategies is a plus.
Strong analytical skills with experience utilizing data analytic tools such as PowerBI, Google Analytics, and Adobe Analytics to analyze site metrics and user engagement.

If you have a passion for e-commerce and a proven track record of managing successful products, we'd love to hear from you!

At Sonos we want to create the ultimate listening experience for our customers and know that it starts by listening to each other. As part of the Sonos team, you’ll collaborate with people of all styles, skill sets, and backgrounds to realize our vision while fostering a community where everyone feels included and empowered to do the best work of their lives.

“This role can be done from home

Building the world’s leading sound experience starts with the experience we provide for our people. That’s why we’ve been distributed from the start: initially between offices in Boston & Santa Barbara, and now with additional offices in Seattle, San Francisco & Paris. This role can be done from anywhere in the United States or Canada- any of our offices, or remotely from home. It’s about impact, not location.”

Here you’ll be at the leading edge of product discovery for Sonos integral with our Exploration Team. You’ll be a part of a cross-functional, cross-Sonos, and forward-thinking team tasked with exploring where the Sonos experience should play and win. You’ll bring your passion for product creativity, iterating and failing fast, customer-oriented prioritization and relating the work to company mission and goals. You’ll energize the entire company around discovering what our customers love about Sonos today and the world of possibilities in the future. You are able to traverse customer data and insights, business, experience design and technology and can rapidly simplify complex topics and communicate effectively at all levels of the organization.

What You’ll Do

You will lead collaboration with product discovery from investigation through socialization.

You will bring a point-of-view and an approach to discovering green spaces and new product opportunities.

You will internalize customer research insights and analyze and communicate portfolio gaps and opportunities.

You will establish data-informed hypotheses for product/market fit, market sizing and deep understanding of challenges and how to reduce opportunity risks.

You will lead the creation of a framework and evaluation methodology for emerging market opportunities, clearly articulating where Sonos should play and how it can win in the context of our company strategy and our product experience principles.

You will champion for areas of exploration to all layers of the organization and gain support and commitment across diverse teams.

You will establish and manage a pipeline of opportunities for consideration by planning leadership. . You’ll establish how concepts enter the pipeline, continuously evaluate them for viability, and determine when they’re ready for consideration by leadership and the Sonos Product organization.

This role includes co-creating product concepts with product managers, designers, and engineers across hardware, software and services in support of our overall experience vision.

You will work with an inspiring team of exploration-focused individuals in an iterative, human-centered approach to establish assumptions and refine ideas.

You will share your passion for assessment and prioritization principles to guide opportunity mapping across viability, feasibility and desirability. You’ll shepherd buy-in across stakeholders.

You will leverage data-informed hypotheses around product/market fit, market sizing and deep understanding of how to reduce product risks, leveraging customer insights and communicating portfolio gaps and opportunities.

You will determine when and how to collaborate with external agencies to support and extend the exploration team’s mission.

What You’ll Need

You thrive in ambiguous, fast-paced, and ever-changing environments, building new processes and improving existing ones.

You find working with a team of globally distributed, multidisciplinary practitioners with varying reporting structures fuel to drive innovation and product discovery.

You employ design thinking methods and a human-centered design lens for opportunity discovery and development

You have a knack for bringing the right people and right conversations together at all levels of the company.

You have an inclusive mindset; an appreciation for lived experiences and points of view outside of your own and experience bringing varied perspectives together to create better outcomes.

You have a demonstrated capability to facilitate cross-functional, design-oriented idea generation and prioritization across research, testing, and market/trend analysis that informs product opportunities.

You are highly collaborative, and celebrate fast failure as valuable learning.

You are drawn to tough problems and can articulate challenges and opportunities in simple terms.

Basic Qualifications

5+ years experience in product management

3+ years experience working within early product discovery

Strong collaborator who enjoys inspiring, and helping empowering teams across product management, audio / sound development, go to market, design and user experience

Passion and curiosity about people, behaviors, and technology with attitude to jump in

Understand how product discovery can engage with product roadmaps and ability to influence others effectively

Technical mindset and enjoy working with engineering teams on creative, elegant technical solutions working as a product team

Effective leadership with distributed, remote teams, and remote collaboration

Preferred Qualifications

2+ years working in business development, experience design teams and strategy planning

Hands-on experience with rapid prototyping

Previous experience in consumer electronics industry

Masters Degree in Business Administration

Company Description




SmartRecruiters is a values-driven, global-minded, and well-funded tech employer on a mission to connect people to jobs at scale. As a global leader in enterprise recruitment software, SmartRecruiters offers a cloud-based global Hiring Success platform that allows teams to attract, select, and hire the best talent. 4,000 companies worldwide rely on SmartRecruiters to achieve hiring success—including brands like Bosch, LinkedIn, Skechers, and Visa—using recruitment marketing, CRM, AI, ATS, and a marketplace of 600+ connected vendors all within one scalable platform.




SmartRecruiters was recognized by Forbes as one of the Best Employers in 2020. We are proud to offer a collaborative, diverse, and remote-friendly work environment, as well as competitive salaries and generous equity. We believe in promotion from within, so high performance can lead to upward mobility. Needless to say, we make sure you’re taken care of. Our inclusive office environment welcomes and respects all.




Job Description




Whilst this is a remote role, we are focusing our recruitment efforts on considering Candidates who are based in a country where we have a legal entity such as the UK, Germany, France, and Poland.




Reporting to our Product Lead, we're looking for a curious & collaborative Product Manager, who is passionate about driving the evolution within our product suite, to join our Ecosystem Group. This group consists of teams that are working on API Platform, Developer Experience, Integrations, and Identity Management. We are building the technology that enables SmartRecruiters to learn quickly and scale easily to enable rapid business growth.




This is an interdisciplinary role: you will work with Design, Engineering, Product Analysts, and Product Marketing. You will own your product domain from conception to implementation and beyond, by applying continuous features improvement frameworks, as well as the rigorous measurement of their impact on our users.




This is an exceptional opportunity to build innovative products at a global startup with plenty of market traction and customer love. Your product will be used at scale: recruiting teams at thousands of companies worldwide and millions of candidates will benefit from your work. If you enjoy tackling both strategy and day-to-day execution and are ready to roll up your sleeves on day one, come work with us.




You’ll join a supportive, diverse group of talented product managers, designers, and engineers in the US, UK, Germany, and Poland.




What You Will Do




Working cross-functionally with engineers, designers, and product marketing to deliver a world-class product
Driving the product discovery together with your product triad (engineering and design)
Collaborate on a strong product strategy to foster our growth by using qualitative and quantitative research to operationalize it
Working with data to identify opportunities and drive measurable outcomes
Creating an experimental mindset with product teams to allow fast product knowledge generation
Be the voice of your product area; inspire team members and stakeholders of the impact and opportunity ahead




Qualifications




1+ Experience as a Product Manager working with Engineers and Design in an agile environment
Fluent in English with excellent verbal and written communication skills; Comfortable communicating with a wide range of stakeholders
Experience in driving the whole product lifecycle – research, prototyping, iterative development and testing, launch, and continuous improvement is an advantage
Passionate for data-informed decision-making; passionate about metric definition and able to use qualitative and quantitative insights to set and prioritize initiatives while collaborating with internal and external stakeholders
Pronounced technical interest and pleasure working on innovative products
High level of initiative and ambition to understand complex problems and develop innovative solutions
Dedication and ability to learn independently and as part of a team
A self-starter with an appetite for taking ownership of a large part of the product.

About MoCaFi:




is committed to building a financial services platform that helps America’s marginalized communities create wealth through better access to public, private, and social capital. We are a fintech built for government and non-profit organizations committed to creating finance for all. Our platform is a turnkey digital banking solution for delivering cash payments, deposit accounts, and wealth empowerment tools at the city, state, and federal levels.




MoCaFi has distributed over $100M in guaranteed basic income, cash assistance, emergency rental assistance, and emergency utility payments in over a dozen municipalities. We are led by a diverse team of finance, engineering, and startup professionals committed to closing America’s racial wealth gap. We offer FDIC-insured bank accounts, municipal-funded disbursement cards, and financial empowerment services directly to consumers and through our public and private sector partners




Job Description:




MoCaFi is looking for an experienced Product Manager to help us define and design our B2B product offering, the Immediate Response Card (IRC) portal and the Admin portal, to optimize growth and drive revenue. In addition, the candidate will evaluate both new and existing tools to enhance the existing product offering.




This role reports to the Head of Product. While MoCaFi is headquartered in New York City, this position can be based remotely anywhere in the US. The range for this role is $115,000-145,000.

Define the Immediate Response Card (IRC) and Admin portals product vision & strategy, including but not limited to personas, target market, target state, and impacts on our business

Develop and continue to update the business case for the IRC portal product
Lead sales and operations training on the IRC and Admin portals
Partner with the marketing team to develop a Go-to-Market plan
Develop customer journeys and partner with internal teams and external vendors to understand and enhance the journey
Partner with operations to develop process maps/flows
Hire, develop and lead at least one junior Product Manager
Research and maintain a working knowledge of competitor products and trends
Collaborate cross-functionally to deliver end-to-end product solutions

Customer focused
Business/strategy planning and competitive analysis
Cross-functional collaboration

An empowering workplace that values initiative and critical thinking
Work on achieving our financial inclusion mission

The Company

They started out by introducing reliable, clean, electricity to people living in some of the most remote places on earth - this has been a huge success and life changing for those previously struggling without.




Over time they noticed that energy theft from the likes of large organisations was becoming an issue. The people they initially set out to help were finding that energy was becoming increasingly scarce and expensive.




Their new product, an advanced IoT platform that helps stop energy theft in the off-grid sectors of Africa and South East Asia has been combating this problem. About Kinetik




Kinetik is a growing Healthcare Technology Startup based out of Long Island City, NY, and we are reshaping the healthcare transportation industry! We equip health insurances, brokers, and transportation providers with our suite of products and solutions to increase efficiency, transparency, and interoperability.




At Kinetik we strive to grow in a collaborative, inclusive, and innovative environment. We encourage each team member to combine efforts and express curiosity about new possibilities to help millions of underserved patients in the NEMT industry get the care they need.




Product at Kinetik




The healthcare transportation industry is highly fragmented. The coordination of healthcare transportation is an essential yet overlooked component of delivering care to patients. Patients, Transportation Providers, Brokers, and Health Plans all lack the visibility and interoperability they desire to facilitate the care they need. To help provide this care, we need to create an ecosystem of products and services which all of these stakeholders cannot live without.




The product team is the glue that unites all aspects of our product under a single, cohesive vision. We build products to solve our customers' most challenging problems. We partner closely with our sales, marketing, customer success and engineering teams to champion our customers’ needs. We innovate quickly and ship products at the right time to best support our growing community of transportation providers, brokers, and healthplans.




We’re looking for a product manager to join our team that designs and builds our SaaS Enterprise products.




What You’ll Do




Define and launch products that meet and exceed business objectives.
Synthesize information received to create clear deliverables that accurately reflect Product value prop and drive the needed development in the suite of products.
Write well and document existing and new Product processes and change management flows.
Create epics and user stories that are inclusive of company initiatives and goals.
Maintain and prioritize roadmap based on changing company and user needs.
Closely partner with Design and Engineering to execute on sprints and releases.
Partner with internal and external users to understand where traction is occurring and where iteration is needed.
Drive execution and prompt decision making influencing cross-functional teams in some instances without formal authority.
Perform other related duties as assigned.




Qualifications and Skills:
Proven strategic decision-making; can prioritize and make tough calls in ambiguous situations.
Results-driven; objective and metrics-oriented, relentless about the pursuit of excellence on behalf of our users.
Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to synthesize large volumes of information and data; bring simplicity and structure to complexity, hypothesis-driven.
Enjoy the push-pull of passionate debate to get to decisions.
Superb leadership, active listening, and communication skills (writing, speaking, presenting); influential with a wide variety of stakeholder including team, users, prospects/customers and partners.
Empathetic and curious about what makes people tick; customer-obsessed, energized by being in the field and talking with users.
Eye for great design; collaborative partner with design/research and marketing.
Comfort with data and technology; ability to translate and explain value of technical concepts to the business and vice versa; credibility with engineers and architects.
Self-directed and confident in a fast-paced startup environment. Calm under pressure.
Experience in healthcare is a plus.
Valid work authorization required.




What to Expect:
Must be willing to travel if needed.
Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.
Must be willing to work extended hours if needed.

Who We Are

At Cisco Meraki, we know that technology can connect us, empower us, and drive us! By simplifying powerful technology, we can free passionate people to focus on their mission. As the fastest-growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products, and technology architecture are changing the face of enterprise networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality.




You will lead and build a small, hardworking team. You have unlimited funding, a global brand, 25,000 salespeople, and you have a launch date. What do you do now?

This is an outstanding opportunity to develop the frontend interface for the physical security experience for our MV product family. You will enjoy the benefit of Meraki’s agile startup culture while gaining the scale and resources of a global corporation such as Cisco. In this role, you will be accountable for bringing a simple concept or early prototype to market as quickly as possible. You will protect the idea of a Minimally Viable Product (MVP) while performing with the hunger of a small company seeking its next round of funding.

By using many market-leading technologies and infrastructure components already in use at Meraki, you will have the opportunity to build at a scale that would be impossible on your own. All of this is possible by working with a diverse and dedicated collection of people. From developers to marketers, salespeople to executives, you will influence, empower, and lead a wide variety of resources to achieve the collective goal.




What you will be doing:

Becoming an industry expert in your field.
Taking a product from MVP to a market leading complete solution
Shipping your first new feature within 3 months of joining.
Defining, owning, and implementing a 3-year roadmap for our dashboard strategy.
Ultimate responsibility for everything related to the MV dashboard experience, and Meraki Vision Portal.
Be involved in everything. Your mission is to work out what will make the difference at any given time and focus on positively impacting that outcome when there isn’t time to do everything.
Spending up to 20% of your time traveling to see customers and industry events.




What we're looking for:

An entrepreneur, a risk taker, someone who looks beyond tomorrow.
A leader with outstanding interpersonal skills capable of motivating a diverse team.
Someone with a curious nature with a love of new and emerging technologies.
Customer compassion, but with the critical thinking needed to ask tough questions.
An abstract problem solver who can spot the patterns of high-value customer problems.
A storyteller with a natural passion for the product, a salesperson in disguise with the ability to distill complicated ideas into just the right number of words.
MVP execution. Complete timely shipping to ensure customer satisfaction.
Experience in a customer-centric, cross-functional role such as product management, consulting systems engineer, technical marketing engineer, or founder.
Experience working with an app as the only product interface, or as the product itself.




Bonus Points:

Experience as a developer/user experience designer
A passion for smart video security.

Hi, we're Oscar. We're hiring a Product Operations Manager to join our Product Operations team.

Oscar is the first health insurance company built around a full stack technology platform and a focus on serving our members. We started Oscar in 2012 to create the kind of health insurance company we would want for ourselves—one that behaves like a doctor in the family.

About The Role

The Product Operations team unlocks Oscar’s ability to ship more products better and faster, which is critical to Oscar’s overall mission to use technology and design to refactor healthcare. The primary function of Product Operations is to execute and continuously improve processes leading up to product launch, as well as ongoing processes that have not been automated.

As a Product Operations Manager in the Communications and Automations domain, you will be embedded with 3 of our engineering pods, working in partnership with a talented team of Product Managers, Engineers and Designers. You’ll become an expert in your domain area and become the “go to” person for questions about the current functionality of our configurable engagement and automation tools. You’ll own key product delivery processes, such as campaign reviews, stakeholder support and training, campaign troubleshooting and issue resolution, synthesis of stakeholder feedback, QA Planning, Launch Readiness, and Bug Triage -- both ensuring that they’re executed well and continuously improved.

You will report to the Product Operations Manager II. This is a remote / work-from-home role. You must reside in one of the following states: Arizona, California, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Virginia, Washington, or Washington, D.C. Note, this list of states is subject to change.

The base pay for this role is $120,000 - $157,500 per year. You are also eligible for employee benefits, company equity grants and annual performance bonuses.

Responsibilities

Define best practices for usage of configurable engagement and automation tools, and train and empower stakeholders to adhere to these best practices.
Execute on operational tasks, such reviewing and approving drafted Campaigns and Automation scripts to ensure they drive intended business outcomes.
Dive into data and systems using SQL to understand trends and troubleshoot issues.
Aggregate and synthesize stakeholder feedback to influence roadmap development.
Build and maintain effective relationships with Product Management, Design, Engineering, Marketing, and Operations to collaborate and discover solutions as a team.
Facilitate internal communications around project status, feature launches and dependencies.
Ensure that bugs are being escalated and triaged appropriately.
Create and maintain documentation to make processes sustainable and scalable.
Design and implement new processes while anticipating potential future use cases to ensure long term scalability in solution design.

Qualifications

5+ years of work experience in a cross-functional role in technology or operations
At least 3+ years of that experience involves working directly with engineers and designers
Previous experience partnering closely with marketing or operations teams
You’ve demonstrated your ability to pick up technical concepts; while SQL is not a requirement for the role coming in, you will need to learn and use SQL regularly in this role.

Bonus Points

SQL skills are strongly preferred.

About Us

Traveloka is a technology company based in Tangerang, Indonesia. We were founded in 2012 by ex-Silicon Valley engineers and we aim to revolutionize human mobility with technology. Today we are expanding our reach by operating in six countries and experimenting with new endeavours that will create a large impact in the markets and industries we touch.

At Traveloka, the Product Management role is at the heart of our company. We are looking for an Associate Product Manager who is passionate about driving innovation and helping to build a product that customers love! You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, develop and roll out the product that delivers the company’s vision and strategy. This role will be expected to handle multiple projects independently, work through large amounts of data, add structure to complex problem statements and manage multiple stakeholders at the same time while ensuring quality deliverables.

Don’t have prior experience in product management? Don’t have a technical background? Don’t worry. Our product management team comes from diverse backgrounds, and you will have the opportunity to learn the best practices from various product managers. What matters most are strong problem-solving skills, communication skills, attention to detail, and willingness to learn and grow with the team.




Job Description

Take ownership & have a deep understanding of the user behaviour and product behaviour, as well as supply partners' systems and processes.
Responsible for end-to-end product development process (with mentorship from various product managers), starting from identifying the opportunities to address, defining the possible initiatives, and orchestrating the execution of initiatives with the team
Working together with technical, operations, and partnership teams to ensure smooth integration between Traveloka and international partner systems
Assist in developing go-to-market strategy to help achieve the company’s objectives, liaising with other teams (Market Management, Operations, Product, Data, etc)
Assist in developing pricing strategy to help achieve the company’s objectives
Leading the resolution of any issues/problems to ensure system stability and operational metrics are met. This involves troubleshooting, finding & analyzing root causes, and implementing suitable solutions.




Requirement

At least 2 years of experience at top-tier multinational companies, or a credible and strong track record in building or growing a business
At least Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, Design, Actuarial, or other business and technical fields from top local or overseas universities with strong academic results
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and strong intuitions of user behaviours
A strong drive to make things happen, charisma, and ability to influence in a multicultural setting.
Able to read, write, and speak in English
Team player with proven abilities to navigate stakeholders to deliver outcomes
Passion for making the world better through technology
Prior experience in product management is not necessary but will be a plus

Role Description



Airswift is looking for an exceptional Product Manager, to join our internal development team, we are looking for a strong candidate with significant experience of product development, with a strong background within the recruitment sector



The product manager will be responsible for the quality of their products. In this role, you will be expected to use your knowledge of user needs and business goals to frame problems and set priorities for your delivery teams.



You will need the following skills for this role:



Agile working:You can demonstrate knowledge of Agile methodology. You can apply an Agile mindset to all aspects of your work. You can work in a fast-paced, evolving environment and use an iterative method and flexible approach to enable rapid delivery. You can appreciate the importance of Agile project delivery for digital projects in government. You can be unafraid to take risks and willing to learn from mistakes. You can ensure the team knows what each other is working on and how this relates to practical government objectives and user needs.
DDaT perspective:You can demonstrate an understanding of user-centred design, technology and data perspectives. You can understand the range of available technology choices and can make informed decisions based on user need and value for money. You can understand the variety and complexities of digital and data contexts, and can design services to meet them. You can demonstrate knowledge of the wider digital economy and advances in technology.
Financial ownership: You can secure funding for Agile delivery through a business case and by making a good pitch in government. You can prioritise spending based on return on investment (ROI) and strategic intent. You can be responsible for contract ownership and accountable for the realisation of benefits.
Life cycle perspective:You can understand the different phases of product delivery and can contribute to, plan or run them. You can maintain a product or process through the delivery phases, into live and then into retirement. You can lead a team through the different phases of the product delivery life cycle. You can maintain and iterate a product over time to continuously meet user needs. You can understand incident management and service support to ensure that products are built effectively.
Operational management:You can manage the operational process of designing and running a product or service throughout its entire product life cycle. You can implement best practice in new product or service development. You can plan and put into operation the stages of new product or service development. You can overcome operational constraints to deliver a successful product or service. You can work closely with other operational delivery teams.
Problem management:You can understand and identify problems, analysing and helping to identify the appropriate solution. You can classify and prioritise problems, document their causes and implement remedies.
Product ownership:You can use a range of product management principles and approaches. You can capture user needs and translate them into deliverables. You can define the minimum viable product (MVP) and make decisions about priorities. You can write user stories and acceptance criteria. You can effectively work with a range of specialists in multidisciplinary teams.
Strategic ownership:You can effectively focus on outcomes rather than solutions. You can develop ambitious visions and strategies. You can get the organisation and team to buy in. You can translate the vision into prioritised deliverable goals.
User focus:You can understand users and identify who they are and what their needs are, based on evidence. You can translate user stories and propose design approaches or services to meet these needs. You can engage in meaningful interactions and relationships with users. You can show that you put users first and can manage competing priorities.
Working within constraints:You can understand and work within given constraints (such as technology, policy, regulatory, financial and legal constraints). You can challenge constraints that can be changed. You can ensure compliance with constraints by adapting products and services where needed.

The successful candidate must possess well-rounded business knowledge and experience, along with strong interpersonal skills. This person will lead the organization to achieve continued operational excellence and drive continuous improvement.



Skills/Qualifications:



Relevant Business Degree / Professional degrees in the correct
5+ years’ experience in job-related roles showing progressive growth in responsibilities
Strong Project management skills within Agile and experience with Azure Dev/Ops
Experience in managing global deployments and implementing best practices
Strategic and analytical thinker with superior problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Ability to work autonomously and balance direction from several stakeholders
Excellent time management skills and organization
Ability to work cross-functionally and with global teams.
Highest level of integrity and good judgement, with the ability to effectively deal with extremely sensitive and confidential information.
Proactive, possess written and oral communication skills to summarize conclusions and observations clearly and concisely to management.

Description

BorrowLenses (part of the Shutterfly family of brands) is where professional photographers and videographers come to rent premium gear online. They fulfill the photographic and cinematic dreams of our customers by delivering superior, cutting-edge gear and providing exceptional customer service.

We are looking for an experienced Product Manager, with a combination of technical product, project, and business analysis skills, to manage and direct the day to day product roadmap for the BorrowLenses business. We are seeking someone to serve as the business-wide PM for an entire SME, working across teams to execute on and manage the technology roadmap, supporting planning and strategy. This is a cross-functional position, partnering with all functional areas including Operations, Customer Service, Marketing, and the GM day to day.

The Product Manager will closely support internal engineering and external development / system integrator teams, understanding organization-wide product needs and developing prioritization and tradeoffs such as between strategic initiatives and short-term needs. This is a unique role, working across a business in a smaller team but with enterprise level technology systems. The ideal candidate has experience in mid-sized rental, marketplace, or e-commerce business with an interest in working across a wide variety of product needs with direct visibility to business performance.

What You’ll Do Here

Collaborate with business leadership to understand BL’s product vision, managing roadmap for our SAP Commerce (Hybris) platform including prioritization, metrics, and operations for both our customer-facing and operations/CCT facing requirements.
Continually manage the overall product and project roadmaps including project management tasks such as sprint planning, capacity planning, daily status updates, removing blockers, and general problem resolution across internal engineering and external development partners.
Gather business / user requirements and success KPIs to build stories for Engineering managing between internal and external resources based on business need. Work with the engineering team and develop and continually manage a well-groomed backlog.
Develop an understanding of BL’s customer, the professional photography & videography equipment rental market, and category competitors, to support in developing the product roadmap.
Identify product features, enhancements, and review SAP roadmap / upgrades to grow the business or create operational efficiencies in line overall business strategy.
Anticipate and resolve resource gaps, obstacles and timing issues. Ensure efficient use of company’s resources cross-functionally.
Build out A/B testing plans and measure key projects to inform future roadmap planning and continued development efforts, growing to inform product strategy and roadmap planning.
The Skills You’ll Bring:

3-5 years of Product Management experience required supporting or managing a roadmap.
Strong analytical skills and ability to clearly communicate analysis to a broad audience.
Highly proficient with JIRA or related project management systems and highly proficient in creating user stories for an agile development environment.
Proficient with various System Development Life Cycles (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Iterative, Spiral, Safe, etc.)
Familiarity with SAP Commerce (Hybris) at an enterprise level is strongly desired. Experience with other SAP enterprise products, Salesforce Marketing & Service Clouds, Salesforce Commerce Cloud (SFCC) and/or related suites is a strong plus.
Experience with web analytics (Adobe, Google or related suites), A/B testing engines (Test & Target, Optimzely, etc) and basic analysis as a part of feature-decision making.

Supporting a diverse and inclusive workforce is important to Shutterfly not only because it directly reflects our value of Embracing our Differences, but also because it’s the right thing to do for our business and for our people. Learn more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Shutterfly DE&I.

Job Description




Join a fast-paced, goal-oriented team to drive delivery of valuable connected vehicle features to our retail and fleet customers. The Product Manager – Safety & Security will lead the development and implementation of innovative connected products, from conceptualization through production release. You will work collaboratively to drive the future of the Safety & Security Product Line and translate the defined strategy into product experiences that will be implemented by development teams. You will partner with balanced product teams within Model e to design, develop, test, and demonstrate product MVPs & feature releases across the product lifecycle.




Responsibilities

Own the Product Manager role in the software development methodology, including creating user stories and acceptance criteria, documenting experiences, creating use cases and flow diagrams.
Create assets to guide product development work (Discovery + Framing documents, opportunity trees, user stories for implementation).
Facilitate product research and discovery with product team.

Entrepreneurial, independently driven, resourceful, and able to deliver results with minimal direction

Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple projects
Strong facilitation and follow-up skills

Hybrid: 3 days in the office (Sunderland)

Salary: £30-58k




The Product Manager is the magic in the middle of our product teams. Understanding what our customers want, what the business wants, and what is technically possible is no easy challenge! You’ll be able to understand these (sometimes conflicting) needs and synthesise them into something tangible.




We have 7 teams that build our products, and you’ll manage the end-to-end delivery of products coming out of either Payments or Safe Play teams. You don’t need to know too much about what these are just yet, we have plenty of domain expertise already that will only be too keen to help you learn.




What you’ll bring is that innate inquisitiveness, innovation and intelligence to see where value can be added, and which ideas are worth pursuing (and which ones aren’t).




The reality is that priorities change, some things will work better than anyone expected, and some won’t. You’ll need to be constantly looking at what’s being done and what needs to be done, asking “How are we helping our players?”




You don’t need to be a Product Manager right now. If you can talk to us about how you can manage these competing priorities, always bringing fresh solutions to the needs of customers, then we’d like to chat.




Stuff you’ve possibly done in the past:

Listened intently to customers; understood what they want and what’s possible

WHAT WILL I BE DOING?

Product Operations Managers at Airtel are obsessed about customer experience, are curious, creative problem solvers who are highly collaborative, and drive to delight customers.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for end-to-end product deliverables, which includes beta testing, customer journey experience testing.

Proven ability to show resiliency and be able to priorities key activities within the business while managing stakeholder expectations

Company Background

Amitree is a SaaS startup leveraging state-of-the-art machine learning to enable professionals to do what they do best, better by automating the tedious parts of their jobs so they can focus on delivering value.

Our core technology analyzes and extracts critical data from email, deriving unique insights and enabling professionals to drive the best outcomes. Our initial product Folio utilizes this technology to compress the email workflow of over 100,000 real estate agents, enabling them to stay organized and close more deals. Building on Folio's success, we are currently focused on expanding our offering using our proprietary technology to improve outcomes for B2B sales teams.

Job Overview

We're looking for an experienced, self-driven product manager who is passionate about agile product development and wants to contribute to the company and product success with our amazing team. You'll be joining at a big moment for us, as we expand our focus and pursue ambitious new opportunities. We're looking for "drivers" -- passionate product people who are proactive, thrive when they own the outcome, shape the way we work, and look ahead to the next set of challenges.

The Product Manager will report to the VP of Product and work closely with designers, engineers, marketing and customer care managers.

What You'll Be Responsible For

You will be the owner of our product development process and the backlog. You will make sure that user stories are clear and detailed so that the engineering team can focus on developing technical solutions. You'll be responsible for acceptance testing, ensuring that the stories are delivered according to specification and working to resolve any discrepancies. You'll work with the VP of Product, the engineering team and other stakeholders to define and review our agile process and ceremonies. You'll work closely with the VP of Product and leadership team to make sure our backlog and prioritization is aligned with our strategic priorities.

Gather requirements and transform them into clear, detailed User Stories
Manage the backlog
Shepherd stories through the development process from inception to delivery
Collaborate with VP of Product, engineers, designers, customer care managers to improve the user experience and MRR of our product
Deeply understand users and discover future opportunities by talking to them and participating in user research
Develop and maintain a quantitative understanding of how users are using the product in aggregate by defining and monitoring key metrics
Own acceptance testing of features and bugs


What We're Looking For

4+ years of experience as product owner or product manager for a B2B SaaS product
Excellent English writing skills; you write clearly and concisely
Sharp analytical skills and exceptional attention to detail
Technical understanding of how software is built (ex. front-end, back-end, APIs)
Experience with Kanban and Scrum Agile methodologies
Excellent understanding of UI/UX best practices, design principles, and current web standards
Expert in breaking down complex feature requests into small, measurable components and accurately document them by creating User Stories
Proven ability to work remotely with engineers, designers, executives, and other team members
Proficiency with Jira and analytics tools such as Mixpanel, Fullstory, or similar
The ability to use data to provide actionable insight about our users
The ability to work independently but enjoy collaborating with a team
Experience working in start-up environments


Preferred Experience

Experience working with US B2B customers
Experience with Sales Intelligence / sales automation products
Experience with AI/ML solutions


What We Offer

Freedom and flexibility. We're a 100% distributed team working from around the world in asynchronous fashion. We don't have fixed office hours.
Autonomy and ownership. Working on a distributed team means you own the outcome and don't have someone looking over your shoulder. We're a team of "drivers" who take full ownership and accountability for the results we create.
Fast iterations and opportunity to quickly see the outcome of design work. We work in quick development cycles, giving everyone the possibility to learn and improve.


Amitree is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Company Description

About Freshworks

Freshworks makes it fast and easy for businesses to delight their customers and employees. We do this by taking a fresh approach to building and delivering software that is affordable, quick to implement, and designed for the end user. More than 50,000 companies -- from startups to public companies -- around the world use Freshworks software-as-a-service to enable a better customer experience (CRM) and employee experience (ITSM, HRSM).

Headquartered in San Mateo, California, Freshworks has a dedicated team operating from 13 global locations to serve 50,000+ customers including Bridgestone, Chargebee, DeliveryHero, ITV, Klarna, Multichoice, OfficeMax, TaylorMade and Vice Media.

Freshworks transforms the way world-class organizations collaborate with customers and co-workers. The suite includes Freshdesk (omni-channel customer support), Freshsales (sales automation), Freshmarketer (marketing automation), Freshservice (IT service desk), Freshteam (HR management system).

Freshworks has received numerous accolades including 2019 Startup of the Year form Economic Times, #16 ranking on the Forbes’ Cloud 100 list and #22 on the Battery Ventures/Glassdoor Best Places to Work in 2020. Our suite of products has also been recognized by analysts including the Gartner Magic Quadrants for CRM Customer Engagement, IT Service Management and Sales Force Automation.

While Freshworks has had incredible organic growth over the last few years, the company also has made targeted acquisitions that add critical capabilities to the portfolio including Natural Language Processing, Chatbots, Machine Learning, Social and Messaging Transformation. Freshworks has raised over $400 million in capital and is funded by Accel, CapitalG, Sequoia Capital and Tiger Global Management. More information is available at www.Freshworks.com.

At Freshworks, we are creating a global workplace that enables everyone to find their true potential, purpose and passion, irrespective of their background, gender, race, sexual orientation, religion or ethnicity. We are committed to providing equal opportunity for all and believe that diversity in the workplace creates a more vibrant, richer work environment that advances the goals of our employees, our communities and our business.

About Velocity: -




Velocity is building the future of financial services for new-age businesses in India. Our vision is to build products that empower new age businesses by solving multiple growth problems for them.

Through revenue based financing, we provide the easiest and fastest way out there to raise growth capital to fulfill marketing and inventory spends of online businesses
Through Velocity Cards, we’ve built the country’s first cash flow based credit card, providing 10x limits as compared to traditional cards
Through Velocity Insights, we unleash the power of your data to drive better business decisions
Through Velocity Payments, we are building the future of business payments and invoice management




We are a series-A funded start-up, building new fintech products for small businesses. Founders are IIT-IIM alumni, with prior experience across management consulting, venture capital and fintech startups. We are driven by the mission to empower small business owners with technology and dramatically improve their access to financial services. We have raised a total of $30M across 2 rounds of funding and are backed by some of the most marquee global investors including Peter Thiel's Valar Ventures.

Responsibilities:

Work with leadership to define product strategy and roadmap
Gain a deep understanding of customer experience, identify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas that grow market share, improve customer experience and drive growth
Own product lifecycle from idea, design, research , competitive analysis, positioning, roadmap, development, go to market, launch and success
Prioritize and plan features for development. Come up with a prioritization framework suited to company needs, balancing impact vs effort.
Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes. Execute the product vision and ship high quality product in least possible time
Understand internal processes and tools used by sales, operations, support, customer success and inculcate product led growth
Build strong customer empathy and incorporate same while working with UX and Design teams
Define and measure success metrics for the product
Talk to customers, gather business insights and come up with new product ideas for a multi-product strategy
Be a product evangelist inside and outside the organization. Represent company in product or domain specific conferences and events




Qualifications:

2-5 years of hands on experience in Product Management
Good understanding of web based architecture and APIs and preliminary understanding of databases and SQL
Good understanding of UX framework and experience on UI design
Good analytical and problem solving skills
Proven history of working independently and drive product with minimal direction
Collaborative approach with clear communication
Familiar with agile product development processes
Background in Fintech is a plus
Good communication skills in verbal and written English.







Velocity culture




It doesn't matter what your last name is or what you scored in English in class 5, but if you are creative, crave difficult problems, can work in teams, are obsessed with customer feedback and own your shit, we would love to talk to you. What we can assure you is a workplace that’s fun, cares about your growth, challenges you and bestows great responsibilities to those with great powers.







Other details

Team management: You will be working individually or with a few APMs depending on the maturity of the product
Reporting manager: SPM/Director of Product
Location: Our HQ in HSR Layout, Bengaluru




Process

Process:
Screening Round: This will be a short 30 mins call to understand about your recent projects and see if there are synergies to work together. We will also take questions regarding the role and the company
Assignment: An assignment will be shared with you containing a product problem statement. Same needs to be submitted in 3-5 days. There would be a assignment discussion round once you have submitted it
Product Solutioning Round: This round would test your product skills. Focus would be on product sense, problem solving, customer centricity and business acumen
Technical round: You are not expected to code in this round but required to have basic technical acumen to work with engineering teams. Basic knowledge of SQL is a must. You should also be well versed in agile processes of development
Culture Fit Round: Evaluation on some values and principles which are core at Velocity.
Total duration: We’ll try and fit in our entire process into a two week window, not including the time you might need for the assignment
Interview content: The discussions typically test functional expertise, potential team dynamic, ownership levels, problem solving and creative thinking. Sometimes we ask open ended hypothetical questions, other times we just talk about your approach to solving problems. Irrespective, all discussions have a defined framework for success. By doing so we try to rule out the impact of personal biases on hiring decisions.




Benefits

Comprehensive medical insurance for your family
Cult-fit Membership
Employee friendly ESOP Policy
Free Lunch and Snacks
Monthly brand vouchers worth INR 1,000
Relocation allowances

Must haves :

2+ years of demonstrated Product Management experience area using Agile methodologies.
Familiarity with Enterprise Procurement processes and automation applications like SAP, Ariba, Celonis, Aera.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to quickly establish credibility and trust with a variety of stakeholders.
