Day to Day :




As part of the IT Supply Chain Value Team, you will join a group of product managers who are responsible for managing products that support our client's enterprise processes across the Supply chain including Procurement, Quality, Science & Technology. In this role, you will act as the product lead for applications within the Procurement space that serve their business colleagues across the globe. The role will require the ability to technically understand the platforms and will be responsible for "product management" of products which fall into the Procurement product line. You will work with technology vendors, support resources, delivery partners, our stakeholders, and apply emerging and traditional technologies for improvements in support of their Procurement organizations. You will own and manages a product through the duration of the product lifecycle, define the overall product vision and strategy, with a keen focus on value, business outcomes, and user experience. You will also make product decisions, and ensures decisions align with product strategy and drive continuous product discovery to understand user needs and translate that solutions and product backlog. You will play an integral part of a project that is focused on creating a user interface for client's internal employees and external vendors to communicate and share data. This person will need to be a good communicator, ability to work in a fast-paced environment, and be flexible to travel to either NJ or PA location.

For millions of teams working in dozens of industries, day-to-day business gets done on the phone. So why—despite the huge leaps we've taken in design and usability—does most business phone software still look, feel, and act like it was born in the 90s? OpenPhone is changing that.

We're a new type of business phone with a mission to help people communicate better and be more productive.

We're backed by Y Combinator and some of the best venture firms around including Tiger Global, Craft Ventures, Slow Ventures, and others. We take pride in providing an exceptional customer experience and a product people love, which is why we're excited that our customers have rated us the #1 VoIP Provider on G2.

OpenPhone is the modern, sophisticated answer to the clunky, outdated phone systems that have been slowing down businesses for years. And after earning over 20,000 happy customers and $56 million in funding in just four years, it's safe to say we're onto something big.

About The Role

We're looking for someone passionate about empowering small businesses and who can help us expand from phone solutions to revolutionizing how businesses communicate.

As an early member of the Product Management team, you'll play a key role in crafting the OpenPhone experience. You'll work closely with the founders and in collaboration with our product, engineering, design, research, and go-to-market teams to develop and deliver new products, features, and enhancements.

Here are some things you'll do:

Evangelize the product and vision across our company and industry and obsess over delivering the value customers expect from our product
Analyze customer feedback and data to help drive Product decisions
Create product specs for customer-facing features and tasks related to our backlog that moves the needle for our customers and the business
Streamline our product development process, manage product releases, and enhance product quality and efficiency
Establish cross-functional partnerships with development teams, user research, marketing, and sales to drive organizational alignment around requirements, design, and process
Whatever it takes to keep your team shipping and successful


About you:

You have 1+ years of experience in product management in SaaS, and have helped ship products or features
You are self-motivated, hungry to learn and work both fast and smart
You have excellent written and verbal interpersonal skills
You are analytically minded and love solving ambiguous problems
You are organized and can manage multiple projects
You have passion for revolutionizing the way small businesses communicate
You are located remotely in a North American timezone


Join our team to revolutionize how small businesses communicate, help impact their success, and disrupt the $100B VoIP global market.

We're a fully remote team distributed across the world, from San Francisco to Manila, from Milan to Sydney. We thrive asynchronously as a team that is curious, ambitious, and dedicated to their work. We value trust above all else, and have a strong bias for action. If you're looking for a place to do your life's work, please get in touch. We'd love to hear from you.

And remember, there's no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. We're looking for optimists with grit and determination, who are excited to face the challenges of a growing startup. OpenPhone is the type of company where you can grow, and we encourage you to apply for this role even if you don't think you meet all the requirements.

We are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. It is important that you are able to bring your authentic self to work every day. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We created Upside to help communities thrive! Our retail technology uses the sophistication of online retail—profit measurement, attribution, and incrementality—to provide users with more value on their everyday purchases and brick and mortar businesses with new, profitable customers. We’ve helped millions of users earn 2 to 3 times more cash back than any other product, and tens of thousands of brick and mortar businesses earn measurable profit. Billions of dollars in commerce run through the Upside platform every year, and that value goes directly back to our local retailers, the consumers they serve, and towards important sustainability initiatives.

Upside was named on Deloitte's 2021 & 2022 list of Fastest Growing 500 Tech Companies and #308 in Inc.’s America’s fastest growing private companies of 2022. Upside’s Series D funding round was led by General Catalyst with a $1.5 billion valuation in March 2022. Other notable investors include Bessemer Ventures and Formation8.

Our mission, values, and commitment to inclusivity guide our team of more than 350 people worldwide, and the quality of our culture is reflected in the impact we’ve had on communities nationwide. The Product team at Upside is composed of results-oriented individuals with a diverse set of experiences, all working diligently to ensure that our product delivers as much value as possible for our merchants and consumers. You will enable the flow of significant volume ($) and transactions through our ecosystem, enhance how our Users interact with the places they love to shop, and how our Merchants view the profit brought to them by Upside.

What You’ll Do

Lead a cross-functional team through strategic vision, defining a roadmap, prioritizing solutions based on business and user impact, and building and delivering products
Build and update the appropriate documentation and/or reporting to maintain alignment across all partners (e.g., PRDs, Product Roadmap, etc.)
Coordinate and run sound experiments to test and validate hypotheses

What You Need

6+ years of product management experience, preferably in a FinTech, Payments, e-commerce, or marketplace startups
BA/BS degree
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and influencing skills, with ability to take initiative and build strong, positive relationships
Strong user empathy, with an ability to transform complex data and customer insights into product vision and a prioritized roadmap

Company Overview

ActiveProspect is the industry-leading SaaS platform for consent-based marketing.

Our comprehensive product suite empowers companies across industries to take real-time action on their leads, protect themselves from litigation by documenting proof of consent, and save money by providing new levels of data insights and control.

Our mission is to make consent-based marketing the best channel for customer acquisition.

Job Summary

ActiveProspect, an Austin-based SaaS company, is seeking a Product Manager to join our fast-growing company. You will join a talented and hard-working Product Management team leading the growth and maturity of our products. We're a collaborative organization with an emphasis on iteration and learning. We’re looking for someone who’s excited to work with interesting technologies in a startup culture, and is passionate about creating value for our customers. Sound like you? Keep reading!

Responsibilities And Duties

Product Strategy: Serve as a product expert combining market analysis, end-user feedback, and technology expertise to establish clear priorities, and manage performance against these objectives. Demonstrate expertise on identifying patterns and communicating research results in an actionable way.
Product Roadmap: Own the creation and articulation of the product roadmap that pushes the product strategy forward. Work with Product Owner to translate roadmap into user stories within the engineering backlog.
Client Engagement: Interface directly with our clients to ensure that we are creating the best solutions for them
Deliver: Own the successful rollout of new features, including gathering feedback from early customers to validate the value of new releases; reporting progress against roadmap to cross-functional stakeholders.
Collaboration: Work closely with engineers, designers, client success, sales, and marketing to create new and improved features for our products. Be a reliable point-of-contact for the client success and sales teams, fielding feature requests, feedback, and coordination across teams.
Revenue Retention: Obsess to keep the voice of the customer heard. Demonstrate experience navigating discovery research aiming to focus on identifying needs and opportunities.
Employee Engagement: Extend a winning culture at ActiveProspect where team members are engaged, challenged to succeed and rewarded appropriately.
Communication and Organization: You will be an ambassador for the Company, our technology and the thought leadership that we are creating in the industry. You will exemplify our core values: Always Be Curious, Competence Creates Confidence, Transparency Drives Trust, Together Is Better, Own The Outcome, Time To Shine, Leads ARE People

Qualifications And Skills

5+ years of work experience in product management/scrum product ownership of SaaS B2B products.
Excellent product sense, including good UX and design skills.
Excellent communication skills, strong interpersonal skills to motivate and inspire the team, and time management skills.
Ability to write concisely to be understood rather than just heard.
You are passionate about user experience & design thinking.
Bachelor’s degree in a related field (computer science, information architecture, business administration) preferred
Experience in the performance marketing industry

Benefits and Perks

A financially stable company, with the freedom and opportunities of a startup culture
Flexible work environment; remote, in-office, etc.
Flexible vacation time
A remote-friendly culture with monthly virtual happy hours and team-building events
Retirement plan matching up to 3% of your salary
Health, dental, vision, disability and life insurance

AXS connects fans with the artists and teams they love. Each year we sell millions of tickets to thousands of incredible events – from concerts and festivals to sports and theater – at some of the most iconic venues in the world. Since our founding in 2011, we've consistently pushed the industry forward and improved experiences for fans, making it easier than ever to discover events, find the perfect seats, and enjoy unforgettable live entertainment, and we continue to lead the evolution of our industry today.

We're passionate about improving the fan experience and providing game-changing solutions for our clients, and we're always looking for smart, motivated people to help make it happen. Bring your enthusiasm, your big ideas, and your desire to team up with some of the best and brightest in technology and entertainment. Together we keep the world cheering.

The Role

AXS is looking for a talented and motivated professional to join our Product Management team as a Product Manager.

In this highly visible role, you will provide product expertise for our global consumer facing suite of applications. Working closely with your peers, you will participate in the product and feature discovery process, help elicit requirements and ensure what we build aligns with our strategic initiatives and business goals. Furthermore, you take great care to ensure what we build is ultimately delivered through product development and into the hands of our clients. Your extensive product management knowledge and understanding of the industry provides the best recipe for execution and guidance across our development teams.

What you'll be doing:

Understand the opportunities that our business and our fans desire through research and interaction with stakeholders and consumer data.
Turn input and feedback into solutions that make our suite of applications even better.
Work closely with internal teams (Tech, Sales, Finance, Client Services) to identify features for the roadmap.
Participate in planning and execution of strategic initiatives and tactical activities throughout the product life cycle.
Excellent analytical skills with an understanding of Web Analytics, engagement KPI's and a mature understanding of how to build business cases, measure benefits and communicate results
Use your product management knowledge and experience to juggle multiple projects with competing priorities.
Evangelize and communicate the value of our products and services.
Demonstrate our three pillars to success - Trust, Influence and Impact.


Skills and experience we're seeking:

Minimum 3 years' experience in Product Management is required.
Bachelor's degree required. Earning an MBA is a plus.
Experience managing B2C products is required.
Demonstrate the product management discipline when working on projects.
Discovery experience collecting qualitative customer feedback and quantitative data to inform decisions.
Proven success in building products that scale and meet customer needs.
Demonstrable experience collaborating with cross-functional teams, across geographies, including executive management, product management, operations, sales and marketing
Excellent presentation, written, and verbal communication skills, with an eye for quality and attention to detail
Comprehension of the product marketing / launch process.
You are outcome vs output oriented.
Positivity is part of your being.
Familiarity with standard development tools such as Jira, Trello, etc
Ability to stay organized in a highly demanding environment.
Bonus: You have built features for a live entertainment ticketing system.
Bonus: You have strong technical acumen and comprehension of architecture.
Some travel may be required depending on location.


Pay Scale: $89,241 - $117,129

What's in it for You?

An opportunity to provide product expertise for our global consumer facing suite of applications
Extraordinary People – we're not kidding!
Meaningful Mission - Helping revolutionize an industry and deliver better experiences for fans and clients around the world.
Opportunities for learning and leveling up through training and education reimbursement.

Stage 1: 20-min Recruiter Zoom Interview
Stage 2: 30-min Hiring Manager Zoom Interview
Stage 3: Product Management (Take home) Exercise
Stage 3: 60-min Peer Zoom Interview
Stage 4: 30 min SVP Zoom Interview
Stage 5: 30-min COO Zoom interview


Why AXS?

AXS, a subsidiary of AEG, sells millions of tickets every year for 500+ partners across North America, Europe, and Asia, from venues like the O2 in London and the Red Rocks Amphitheatre in Denver to teams like the Los Angeles Clippers, Minnesota Timberwolves, and Houston Rockets. Headquartered in Downtown Los Angeles, California, AXS employs more than 500 professionals in multiple locations worldwide, including Charlotte, Cleveland, Dallas, Denver, Las Vegas, London, Tempe, Stockholm, and Tokyo. At each location you'll find a team of dedicated, diverse employees (we've dubbed ourselves "Fanatix") who create groundbreaking products and services in a fun, fast-paced environment.

To learn more about our culture and values, visit: https://solutions.axs.com/careers/

More About AEG

For more than 20 years, AEG has played a pivotal role in transforming sports and live entertainment. Annually, we host more than 160 million guests, promote more than 10,000 shows and present more than 22,000 events around the world. We are committed to innovation, artistry, and community, and leverage the power of our 300+ venues, leading sports franchises, marquee music brands, integrated entertainment districts, premier ticketing platform and global sponsorship activations, to create memorable moments that give the world reason to cheer.

Our business is interwoven with the human mind and heart, and we strive to build a diverse and inclusive company that reflects the artists, athletes, and fans that we host; reach beyond traditional boundaries to support the communities in which we operate; and minimize our impact on the environment by adopting sustainable practices throughout our business operations.

The Customer Care Area at Betsson Group focuses on 3 key pillars Player Protection, Global Market Expansion, and Voice of Customer. Our vision is to “Become the most caring operator in the industry by offering transparent, trustworthy, and seamless experiences for our players and internal teams that allow us to grow into new markets and jurisdictions.”




Summary




As our Product Manager in Customer Care, you will be a part of a cross-functional development team where you will be primarily responsible for collecting customer feedback, and defining, organizing, and prioritizing requirements..




Together with your team, you will take ownership of several customer journeys and/or capabilities where you will be one of the key people expected to drive and lead the delivery of new functionality as well as improvements of existing functionality. This will often require you to collaborate with other development teams and engage with a number of stakeholders to ensure a successful rollout. We operate in a fast-paced and challenging industry, and you will have several opportunities to work on complex and cutting-edge products and contribute to Betsson Group’s success.




A taster of what you will be involved with




Working closely with the Head of the area and product managers to define strategy and work towards Betsson Group’s vision of providing the best customer experience in the industry.
Analyzing customer feedback, identifying potential opportunities, highlighting issues that might impact the player experience, & coming up with hypotheses based on findings.
Conducting user experience research and experimentation such as A/B testing or MVT with the UX research team to collect more insights and validate ideas.
Partnering with UX designers, architects, developers, and other stakeholders to define the customer experience, product specifications, and acceptance criteria.
Working together with different areas to plan, prioritize and execute product improvements.
Prioritizing user stories according to customer experience and business value.
Analyzing improvements and deliverables retrospectively to evaluate the impact on business KPIs.
Traveling occasionally to meet team members in various offices.




YOU’RE GOOD AT




Being product and data-driven – having a good understanding of what our customers expect from our products, how it is performing, and how to improve them continuously.
Shipping products and functionalities by partnering with engineers, designers, and other product leaders.
Problem-solving using data- and hypothesis-driven approaches.
Analyzing legal and regulatory requirements to ensure product compliance.
Giving demos and presentations to a broad audience
Communicating and negotiating with stakeholders of various backgrounds
Working with cross-functional distributed teams
Working with Jira, Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Data studio, Google Optimize, or equivalent.
Agile. Not just processes but a true agile mindset where all members of the cross-functional development team are involved and where changing requirements based on business needs and market opportunities are embraced.
Working with UX researchers to conduct A/B testing and leverage different research methodologies.
Facilitating workshops and leading meetings. You will be expected to facilitate design sprints, user story mapping sessions, and lead discussions about customer feedback and product requirement.
Working in a fast-paced industry, where there are several moving targets and flexibility is expected.
Understanding the iGaming industry and player's behaviours (2+ years in a similar role in iGaming ).




What We Offer




Hybrid working policy where you have the luxury to work from the office and from home on different days.
Leadership development, we invest in our teams and give them the necessary training to become great leaders.
Health & Life Insurance
Wellness Allowance, we value the health of our people and want to make sure they take good care of their health.
Time off to celebrate your major life events; we surely don’t want you to miss them!
Fun Stuff! We plan fun company-wide and team events that people keep talking about for months after!
Flexitime, we offer a flexible working week so you can have maximum flexibility for your work-life balance.
Breakfast and smoothies once a week and after work drinks on Fridays




Much like riding a rollercoaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1700 strong, spread across 7 offices with 900 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognize it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and adrenaline junkie, always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.




We offer numerous challenges where your skills will be put to good use! We encourage innovation, independence and celebrate success where you will be part of multi-cultural and diverse company, with people from all over the world.

About us:

Based in Melbourn, near Cambridge, UK, SPT Labtech makes products that transform the way scientists work. For nearly two decades, our expert scientists, engineers and business innovators have provided scientists with world-leading, innovative solutions for liquid handling, sample preparation, and sample management that help accelerate research and make a real difference to human health. Want to be part of a team that’s truly making a difference?

“This is a really exciting time for us. We’re making a measurable impact on human health around the world – and that’s incredibly motivating. As we continue to innovate and grow, I can’t think of a more dynamic, exciting place to be.” David Newble, CEO, SPT Labtech.

About the role:

This extremely varied role requires good communication skills and the ability to work across multiple teams.

Supporting the sales team and working closely with customers to provide expert guidance is a critical part of the role and vital in maintaining market knowledge and trends to maximise current offerings as well as drive future product line direction.

Additionally, management of product line maintenance and the product development pipeline are also critical functions, requiring strong relationships with the service and development departments.

Ownership of go-to-market strategy and development of required content.
Maintain market knowledge to drive future direction and sales strategies.
Main key customer relationships.

Maintain competition knowledge and competitive strategies/positioning.

Provide regular management updates on sales performance and pipeline, marketing activities, market trends and progress of new product developments.


About you:

Minimum BSc (Hons) in Life Science discipline (preferable).
Minimum 3 years’ experience in life science sales and/or product management (preferable) or marketing of automated systems.
Market knowledge and strong network in drug discovery, automation or liquid handling (preferable).
Experience of leading commercial negotiations on large capital projects.
Excellent presentation skills and able to present at all levels from face to face customer visits to podium presentations at conferences and sales pitches at board level.
Ability and willingness to travel globally (up to 40%).
Hybrid working 2/3 days in the office and from home when not travelling.

We are recruiting a Senior Product Manager responsible for the development of Our Future Health's digital products from conception to launch, and into a cycle of continuous improvement. In this role you will be responsible for the development of products or services, taking ownership and presenting solutions to some of our more complex challenges. You'll work alongside multidisciplinary teams of designers, technologists, scientists and operations experts to design, test, iterate and improve our product suite.



We are moving at pace and you'll be helping us solve some of our tougher challenges, applying a product mindset to balance a laser-focus on our users with a need to learn quickly and ensure delivery to support our programme goals. You'll be someone who champions a user-centred and agile approach to developing products and services, while remaining pragmatic and outcome focused.



At Our Future Health, our mission is to transform the prevention, detection and treatment of conditions such as dementia, cancer, diabetes, heart disease and stroke.  We're looking for people to join us on our journey. If you're looking for a new challenge where you can contribute to helping future generations live in good health for longer, then we're keen to speak with you.

What you'll be doing:



Working with teams across the organisation to design, deliver and improve our digital services, products and platforms, often having to balance competing priorities.

Leading on the development of more complex or interdependent services that touch multiple product or platform teams, bringing people together towards a shared goal, developing a clear vision and roadmap that helps people see how everything fits together.

Keeping laser-focused on our users, while remaining continually mindful of our business goals and wider mission to support the improved tracking, prevention and treatment of disease via our research programme.
Working with internal and external delivery partners to explore emerging opportunities.
Championing user needs and evidence-based decision making.

The environment:



We're a rapidly scaling team who've come from startups, tech companies, universities, the NHS and health charities. We've got a vast amount experience building and scaling big consumer products and working with different kinds of health data. We're creating something that will be used to transform the prevention, detection and treatment of disease - something that has never been done before on this scale.






Requirements

Experience of working in product manager roles developing complex products or services that either have significant consumer reach or deal with data at scale.

Experience of developing and implementing complex products or services aligned to a wider organisation or company-wide vision/goal.
Experience of coordinating cross-functional teams to achieve a shared goal, ideally in a challenging stakeholder environment with competing business priorities.
Demonstrable technical/software development background and experience of delivering complex platform and product solutions to an agreed schedule, ideally with distributed teams.

Data-driven approach, with experience establishing mechanisms to track qualitative and quantitative metrics to measure and monitor product success and impact on end users.

Excellent stakeholder management skills, with an understanding about how to influence and facilitate decision-making and bring people together to align on a shared goal or objective.

A tenacious and collaborative approach to problem solving with the curiosity and intellect to explore ideas and opportunities, and inspire product teams to achieve delivery targets.

Ability to work in an environment of change - comfortable navigating shifting priorities and requirements.
Passionate about taking a user-centred approach to product development.
An appreciation of compliance requirements, ideally with experience of developing digital products in a highly regulated environment.

Experience of bringing new products to market.
Experience in service design or working on services that have online and offline touchpoints.
Experience in a health domain would be extremely valuable. This could be clinical, wearables, consumer apps, genomics, pharma/life sciences or NHS.
Experience working within platforms or products that process complex datasets.



Benefits

Generous company pension package with employer contributions of up to 12%.
30 days annual leave (plus bank holidays.)
Continuous career development with regular appraisals and learning and development opportunities.

NAOS is a major player in skincare, thanks to its three brands: Bioderma, Institut Esthederm and Etat Pur. Beyond its brands and their missions, the ambition of NAOS is to become a company that is internationally recognized for its unique and value-creating approach. Going against the flow of mainstream cosmetics, NAOS has stood out, right from its beginning, by putting biology at the heart of its innovations.

Today, its three brands follow this cohesive vision:

Bioderma, Biology at the service of dermatology – www.bioderma.com

Esthederm, Biology at the service of aesthetics – www.esthederm.com

Etat Pur, Biology at the service of everyone – www.etatpur.com

NAOS has made bio-ecology a philosophy that is common to all its brands. This approach has led to the development of 80 active patents. It considers the skin as an ecosystem interacting with the environment and defends that teaching the skin to live in that environment is better than just healing it. This positive approach leverages biology to protect and restore sustainably the health and the beauty of the skin. It also considers ecology as a duty to truly respect the interactions between the skin, human beings and our planet.

NAOS has been founded in France by Jean-Noël Thorel who is a pharmacist-biologist by training. The company is present in more than 100 countries worldwide and has experienced a 20% growth per year over the past 5 years. Its products are developed and manufactured in Aix-en-Provence, France, at NAOS Les Laboratoires where is located the factory and a leading-edge research center.

NAOS,

Inspired by life, Driven by the heart.

Walmart Data Ventures is focused on productizing Walmart’s rich data assets to better serve customers. Walmart Luminate is a suite of data products that deliver actionable, customer-centric insights to help merchants and brands make better business decisions.




Walmart Data Exchange is an extension within Walmart Data Ventures focused on providing a key partnership between supplier subscribers and Preferred Service Providers. Walmart Data Exchange is committed to driving value through a disciplined approach which creates new ways to driving sales, profits, and revenue across the Walmart Data Ventures eco-system.




We are looking for a talented Senior Manager I to help drive business growth by developing and maintaining multiple internal and external business relationships with supplier subscribers of Walmart Luminate and Walmart Merchants and cross-functional teams. The ideal candidate will be someone that can understand and manage mutual value propositions, risks, and benefits, while supporting engagement and dialogue with stakeholders to mitigate risks, resolve issues, and realize value proposition and subsequent business objectives with Walmart Luminate.




In this role, you will be responsible for cross department partnerships accelerating supplier partnerships through store level execution, while handling internal and external discussions focused on planned store level project work. Understanding of store-level merchandising, operational insights, system management while being flexible in managing multiple projects simultaneously across all levels of the organization. You will drive metric development and measurement for customer satisfaction across Walmart Luminate. You are responsible for internal collaboration, with continual feedback to our product teams and research teams, all while driving the voice of the customer. You will also be propelling consistent engagement with Walmart




Merchandising leadership, executing all aspects of client onboarding, and maximizing value with supplier clients and upselling new features and enhancements across the PSPs (Preferred Service Providers) and SRTs (Supplier Retail Teams).




This individual must have the ability to get things done through influencing and persuading people across a wide range of teams within Walmart and with external counterparties.




We are looking for someone with a passion for leveraging data to identify insights that can positively impact the Walmart customer experience and supplier / brand performance to drive customer and category growth through tactics and strategies across omni channels.




You’ll be successful in this role if:

You have a track record of managing supplier and retailer relationships to achieve mutually beneficial outcomes through data / insights services, SaaS, or other B2B engagements
You approach all responsibilities required to develop and maintain a B2B partnership including managing projects within Walmart’s organization (Product, Merchandising, Operations, Insights, Legal, Corporate Communications, Walmart Connect, etc.)
You drive the execution of multiple business plans and projects by identifying customer and operational needs
You are customer-focused with an ability to understand, communicate, and manage mutual value propositions, risks, and benefits
You are comfortable being a client ambassador internally and a Walmart ambassador to partners / clients to strike compromises and unblock forward progress
You are a strategic thinker, can look at the long term and are comfortable making tough decisions
You have a track record of coming up with inventive solutions for our biggest problems and opportunities




You’ll make an impact by:

Identifying, nurturing, and renewing key partnership or client opportunities in a B2B setting
Owning supplier and key strategic partner relationships to drive value, insights and bring a disciplined approach to enhancing results
Concurrently managing multiple relationships and deals expeditiously and efficiently
Orchestrating collaborative workplans with 3rd party consultants, merchants, operations, and suppliers to recognize supplier AND Walmart value and ROI from investment with Walmart Luminate
Capturing and packaging success stories, case studies and other examples of utilization and implementation of insights derived from Walmart Luminate
Providing the “voice of the customer” to product teams with a supplier and merchant mindset
Building and managing cross-functional relationships with key partners within Walmart that power the business forward

About Data Ventures:

Data Ventures exists to unlock the full value of Walmart’s data by developing and productizing B2B data initiatives that empower merchants and suppliers to make better, faster decisions for the business. As part of this transformation, we’re seeking entrepreneurial individuals to help drive data productization from concept to deployment.

Looking for a job where you can be part of a team that is revolutionising the short-term accommodation industry? Look no further! We are a professional management service that helps homeowners and landlords enjoy more freedom by taking care of the hassle of hosting their properties. Our mission is to leverage the latest technology to make hosting a property as effortless as possible and increase revenue for our hosts. Join us in our quest to disrupt the industry and make hosting a breeze!

⭐Our journey:

Since our launch in 2015, we have experienced tremendous growth, even in the face of a pandemic, and have recently acquired our biggest competitor. Our team has partnered with thousands of satisfied hosts, helping them earn income from their homes while pursuing their passions. With operations in over 20 cities worldwide, from Auckland to Lisbon, and plans for even more expansion, there's no shortage of opportunities to make an impact with us. At the heart of our business is host happiness, and our team is dedicated to ensuring that every host is satisfied and successful. ⭐About the role (£26k - £29k):

The Account Manager will optimise host revenue through proactive management of their property portfolio, including performance management and retention of a group of full-time hosts. You will conduct regular business reviews and develop differentiated management strategies using data analysis and build case studies to inform and influence hosts. Your strategic problem analysis and resolution will help optimise property listings and provide feedback on how to improve processes, technology, or training for full-time hosts.

Manage a portfolio of client accounts, ensuring their properties are marketed effectively and performing optimally on Airbnb and other short-term rental platforms.

Analyse market data and industry trends to inform pricing strategies and identify opportunities for growth.
Collaborate with our operations team to ensure smooth and efficient property management.
Act as an ambassador for our brand, representing our company with professionalism and enthusiasm.
Act as a point of contact for commercial clients, ensuring a high level of customer service at all times.
Build and maintain relationships with clients, including conducting regular check-ins and addressing any concerns or issues they may have.
Identify opportunities to expand your portfolio.
Provide regular reports on the performance of the commercial portfolio, including financial and occupancy metrics.
Stay up-to-date on market trends and developments in the short-term letting sector, sharing insights with the team and applying them to our business strategy.

At least 3 years of experience in account management, preferably in the short-term rental industry.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with clients and colleagues.
Strong analytical skills and proficiency in using data to inform decision-making.
Experience with Airbnb or other short-term rental platforms.
Proven track record of meeting and exceeding performance targets.Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Job Title: International Account Manager, APAC Sephora & LATAM
Job_Description:
Overview



Work under the direction of the Director, APAC/Sephora INTL to develop, plan and execute the sales strategy for APAC, Sephora Mexico, and Sephora Brazil. Drive retail promotional programs, analyze sales and business data, and meet profitability goals while striving to optimize efficiencies and capture additional sales opportunities. Anticipate and analyze retail sales trends to implement strategic action plans in favor of the business. Maintain strong relationships with both external partners and internal cross-functional teams to ensure success and accomplishment of target goals.







Essential Job Functions



Sales Planning & Inventory Management



Work closely with retailer buying and planning teams to ensure monthly replenishment orders are placed by month-end cutoffs.
Assist Customer Service in order follow up making sure all accounts pick up orders before month-end cutoffs.
Communicate all new launch dates, pricing, allocations, OOS statuses to retailers.
Help manage and update retailer buy sheets to collect new launch forecasts for each account.
Track newness orders to ensure accurate forecast quantities are placed by retailers and are delivered on time to meet global launch dates.
Help resolve stock concerns and requests from the field as appropriate.

Account Management



Assist Director in day-to-day communication with retailer buying and planning teams.
Manage retailer assortments and ensure data cleanup is performed regularly to communicate brand new launches + discontinuations.
Partner with Director to build and execute retailer promotion strategy.
Assist Director in putting together monthly financial accruals for promotions, sampling, and marketing programs to contribute to the P&L.
Partner with INTL Sales Coordinator to ensure SKUs setup forms, comps, and assets are delivered by retailers’ due date.
Continuously improve processes and ways of operating to drive productivity and effectiveness of International Business.

Marketing & Merchandising



Stay current on seasonal fixture update plans as carried out by Merchandising Department, helping to build assortment templates per retailers.
Communicate gondola update dates, assortment files and planograms to all accounts.
Work closely with internal Marketing team on retailer side-by-side calendars and partner with Director to strategically schedule promotional activity to drive YOY growth, especially at times with high LY liabilities.
Help manage shipments of all sampling and gratis programs in relation to the calendar.





Requirements



Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Business Administration, Sales, or related field.
Minimum 4 years of experience in a corporate Account Management position in the Beauty or Consumer Products Industry.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Strong attention to detail with exceptional follow-up skills.
Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
A problem solver, self-starter, and solution-minded.
Ability to efficiently manage and prioritize multiple projects.
Must have strong analytical skills with ability to think and perform creatively.
Proven ability to make deadlines.
Flexible and adaptive attitude to changing business needs and a fast-paced work environment.

This will be an excellent opportunity to enjoy the dynamism of market growth phase of a world well-known brand!

Bring your sales expertise to the table to help us extend our reach to more children!


Core Responsibilities

Handle key accounts and participate in joint business planning, promotion and assortment planning and daily work with the account with the following main tasks




Negotiation and selling.
Preparing customer business plans.
Preparing forecast/sales plan.
Consumer sales tracking and analysis.
Prepare customer meetings
Preparing, analyzing and following up on planograms.
Preparing monthly reports.
Participate in customer meetings and independently drive chosen projects.
Carry out shop visits.
Participate in forecasting/sales plan process – at both country and customer level.
Interact with functions like Marketing & Operations both within Singapore and regionally.



Primary Goals




Deliver an accurate sales forecast for a 12-month horizon for each specific customer
Accurate business planning to deliver on detailed budgets and selling in targets.
Long term strategic customer business planning to achieve future growth expectations.



Key Deliverables




Sell In & Consumer Sales – Detailed in estimating and delivering on our sales objectives.
In Stock – Selling and achieving the sell through forecasted to keep an always healthy stock in the stores.
Customer Pulse and Customer business planning - Understanding the customer business and using that knowledge to build and implement a customer business plan that is fully aligned to the overall BU strategy and marketing objectives.



Play your part in our team succeeding

The Key Account Manager (KAM) will be part of the new SEA organization which includes Singapore, Malaysia and 10 Emerging Asia Markets.

KAM will lead Toys Specialist accounts that contribute to a significant portion of the turnover of LEGO South East Asia and develop strategic plans that will drive sales growth. The incumbent will maintain an accurate and healthy sales forecast over a 12-month horizon that meets the demands of the customers/consumers and be proactive to changes in actual demand. This will be achieved by having a holistic understanding of market trends, a proven relationship with key partner accounts and driving trade initiatives to optimize sales opportunities.

The KAM will get the opportunity to work in a new and dynamic organization – securing world class implementation of Sales & Marketing plans and campaigns and, learn how to work with a large team – internally and externally.

Do you have what it takes?




Prior experience working with Key accounts, preferably within FMCG or Branded Retail industry in SEA.
Experience working in cross-functional environment; selling and negotiation skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office and analytical skills
Ability to prioritize, curiosity about learning & growth mentality
Adaptability and change readiness. Seeing new situations and changes as opportunities and crafting positive momentum around these



What’s in it for you?

Here Are Some Of What To Expect




Family Care Leave – We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.
Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.
Wellness – We want you to be your best self, so you'll have access to the Headspace App and lots of wellbeing initiatives and programmes run by local teams where you are based.
Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.
Bonus – We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.
Your workplace – When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. The hiring team will discuss the principles of our hybrid work model 'Best of Both', role eligibility and frequency with you during the recruitment process.



Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of e.g. race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

THE COMPANY

GlobalData has been the fastest growing Market Intelligence company of the past decade. Now boasting 27 global offices and 4500 employees worldwide we are now one of the largest. Our story is one of tremendous growth and expansion – from a start up to a billion-dollar corporation in just 10 years.

That growth has been a combination of organic coupled with an aggressive period of acquisitions that has seen us snap up some of the biggest names in our space – BioPharm Insight, PharmSource, I.H.S Life Sciences on the Healthcare side. Canadean, ERC and Datamonitor for Consumer. And Current Analysis and the Pyramid Group for our Technology business unit

We provide 18 Intelligence Centers / Industry platforms, enjoyed by over 4000 clients, but our core offerings are in 4 main area’s. Healthcare which breaks down to Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices each of which has their own platform. Consumer which covers Consumer Products, Retail, Packaging, Travel & Tourism and Foodservice. Industrials which segments to Oil & Gas, Power & Utilities, Mining and Construction. And finally Technology.

Each platform is designed to provide a tool covering the entire industry value chain through a series of modules & services. Each covers a separate part of the value chain, can stand alone in its own right, has its own unique competitors but interlinks with the other modules. Meaning that rather than subscribing to a multitude of research vendors and trying to mesh their results together, you could use one provider, with strong data and analysis in its subject area, all on one site with a consistent methodology at the back end.




OVERVIEW

As a successful, growth company our emphasis is on subscription sales of market analytics, databases, syndicated reports and consulting services to the world’s largest companies. Our suite of market leading products spans the value chain and success is dependent upon the ability to manage and position the portfolio effectively aligned to strategic client opportunities.

Key Account Managers assume responsibility for expanding our sales presence within defined major clients and typically carry a book of business in excess of $2 million. They must have in-depth knowledge of our complex and technical product offerings in order to be able to deliver tailor made bespoke solutions to a wide range of clients




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

Facilitate both on-site and virtual meetings with senior management level decision makers and deliver relevant, impactful client presentations to successfully place our full range of services as meaningful solutions to our clients.
Prepare high quality proposals and successfully negotiate to win profitable new business and grow renewals.
Work with major clients to achieve and/or exceed quarterly sales revenue targets based on new business & growth of existing subscriptions in defined accounts.
Identify new business and revenue growth opportunities within the client base matched to real client need to deliver sustainable growth.
Prepare detailed strategic account plans for defined accounts with short and longer term revenue goals and action plans which leverage the full potential of our range of products and solutions.
Work proactively and positively with the wider teams including Senior Sales Management, Analysts, Client Services, Marketing and Consultancy to ensure adequate resourcing is in place to support the Account plans to drive the full value of our solutions for our clients.
Provide accurate sales forecasts and account updates to management as required.
Contribute to the larger business by providing relevant client feedback and intelligence to the product development and marketing teams.
Manage the pipeline book of business from opportunity initiation through the delivery lifecycle.




SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

A proven track record of exceeding sales goals both personally and through teamwork.
Experience of building and managing revenues in excess of $2m within accounts.
Strong account management skills with a focus on managing and deepening major relationships.
Strong hunting skills to find new divisions to sell into and a demonstrated ability to find and sell bespoke / consulting deals.
Strong commercial acumen combined with a deep interest and knowledge of the sector.
Proven ability to engage with C-level decision makers and coordinate activity on major accounts.
Excellent communicator combining interpersonal relationship building with meeting facilitation and a high level of presentation skills.
Strong quantitative skills, comfortable with financial data, corporate and market statistics, and other aspects of company & market analysis and consulting.
Ability to work independently based on strong organizational, planning and time management skills.




BENEFITS

High growth, ambitious environment that offers unlimited opportunities for success
Collaborative, entrepreneurial environment that will offer personal and professional development
Competitive base salary
Generous PTO policy
Health, Dental and Vision insurance
Company sponsored Life insurance, AD&D, STD, and LTD
401k Match

About Us:




Paytm is India’s leading digital payments and financial services company, which is focused on driving consumers and merchants to its platform by offering them a variety of payment use cases. Paytm provides consumers with services like utility payments and money transfers, while empowering them to pay via Paytm Payment Instruments (PPI) like Paytm Wallet, Paytm UPI, Paytm Payments Bank Netbanking, Paytm FASTag and Paytm Postpaid - Buy Now, Pay Later. To merchants, Paytm offers acquiring devices like Soundbox, EDC, QR and Payment Gateway where payment aggregation is done through PPI and other banks’ financial instruments. To further enhance merchants’ business, Paytm offers merchants commerce services through advertising and Paytm Mini app store. Operating on this platform leverage, the company then offers credit services such as merchant loans, personal loans and BNPL, sourced by its financial partners.

Coordination with various internal teams to ensure a timely and smooth onboarding experience for merchants/app owners

Device and execute growth strategies for increasing revenue from acquired accounts
Plan and finalize Merchant funded campaigns on premium/ paid properties of Paytm ecosystem to help merchants get the maximum out of the Paytm ecosystem
Manage Paytm Health Merchants and aggregator relationships for the specified category in that region





Superpowers/ Skills that will help you succeed in this role:




5-9 years of relevant experience in Sales, Business Development, and relationship building
Familiarity with Hospital Management systems and hospital ERPs
Good communication skills
Good understanding of MS Office tools
Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales
Willingness to travel frequently within assigned territory





Education - Graduation




Why join us




A collaborative output-driven program that brings cohesiveness across businesses through technology
Improve the average revenue per use by increasing the cross-sell opportunities
A solid 360-degree feedback from your peer teams on your support of their goals
Respect, that is earned, not demanded from your peers and manager





Compensation:




If you are the right fit, we believe in creating wealth for you




With enviable 500 million+ registered users, 21 million+ merchants and depth of data in our ecosystem, we are in a unique position to democratize credit for deserving consumers & merchants – and we are committed to it. About TrueCover

TrueCover is an MGU partnered with an A.M. Best A-rated carrier. Today we are a monoline entity focused exclusively on workers' comp. We are cash-flow profitable and have bootstrapped past $160m in run-rate revenue in 3 years.




The account manager position has two goals: onboarding new clients, and relationship management with those same clients throughout their customer lifecycle with TrueCover.




This is a custodial position, not a 'hunter'. We have broad channel distribution, so this is not a direct sales or revenue role. Our channel partners submit business to us, and for accounts where we are the winning quote, you will be the first interaction the client has with a party unfamiliar to them: TrueCover.




The overarching aim is to promote awareness of our product offering, ensure adequate compliance with reporting requirements, and begin and sustain the client relationship with TrueCover in a positive and constructive way.




You will:

serve as the customer’s first interaction post-sale and the face of TrueCover throughout onboarding and ongoing client communication (not including claims activity)
ensure customer records are kept up-to-date and documents on file are accurate and in compliance with reporting requirements
execute a highly organized onboarding experience with explicit goals, timelines, and expectations for ongoing processes including claims submissions
work closely with Claims to ensure all steps in the handoff between Accounts and Claims are complete and thoroughly documented
guide customers on proactive risk mitigation methods available through TrueCover resources
partner with executive leadership to provide insights into improving the customer experience
evaluate customer claims data to recommend safety programs that improve customer's business practices
build consistent rapport with customers by conducting scheduled account reviews and updates on account progress
formulate and execute plans to provide consistent customer updates to the relevant channel partner(s) that sourced the relationship for TrueCover and determine if additional support is needed
support customer retention by partnering with Underwriting to provide competitive pricing throughout the customer lifecycle
partner with management as needed to reduce account risk by escalating account concerns




We hope to find someone who has:

three or more years of account management experience
a track record of skillful negotiation, persuasion, organization, and problem-solving
experience demonstrating considerable tact, diplomacy, discretion, and judgment with the ability to build and maintain effective interpersonal relationships
comfort communicating in both small-talk and high-pressure scenarios
excellent time management skills and the ability to assume ownership on projects while juggling other tasks
the ability to learn and work effectively in a virtual environment
a fast pace of learning and a facility with or ease of working in a dynamic, imperfectly predictable environment
strong alignment with our values (shared below)




TrueCover is committed to a culture of responsibility and collaboration. We know that how people treat each other is the key determinant of success. Certain principles enable our culture of thoughtfulness and high performance:




Respect: we value diversity and treat everyone with dignity and respect, regardless of their background or role at the company.
Collaboration: we encourage open communication and sharing of ideas, and work together to achieve common goals.
Accountability: we expect team members to have sticky fingers for responsibility and to take ownership of their work. (Examples of this include meeting deadlines, following through on commitments, being accountable for any mistakes made, and communicating proactively at all times.)
Critical thinking: we prioritize strong problem-solving skills and look for people with a natural habit of reflection or innate drive to improve their skills.
Adaptability: we welcome change, embrace new ideas, and practice intellectual honesty; there is no need to always be right.




We believe that by living these values, we enable a positive and supportive work environment that empowers both people and strong business performance.

The ideal candidate has forward-thinking mindset which allows to push boundaries and build game changing cross functional relationships; proven experience working as an independent National Account Manager, will be highly numerate; target-driven, retail sales savvy, keen to find creative solutions to challenges and passionate about working in the beauty industry.




Responsibilities




Retail Partner Relationships

Build strong working relationships with Retail team, utilizing insight from the field and engaging the team in the execution of the sales, events and merchandising plans.
Spend 10% of your time in the field reviewing execution & competitive opportunities.




Driving Performance

Manage, monitor and optimize sales performance.

About The Role

We’re looking for a customer centric and commercially astute Account Manager to join our team and help drive our customers forwards, maximising their opportunities with Vouch and making them lifelong advocates!

Working as part of our Account Management Team you will get to know our customers inside and out, ensuring we are always one step ahead of their needs. This is a fast-paced role where on any given day you’ll be troubleshooting customer queries, taking care of customer escalations, supporting customers to improve the Vouch experience, offer training and support to maximise income and support the launch of new product features.

The Day to Day Stuff

No two days are ever the same at Vouch so the need to be agile and a fast decision maker is a must. The pace we move at also means priorities will change and you’ll need to be comfortable with this (we’ll support you!). This is a great opportunity where you're encouraged to take on as much responsibility as you can. Your drive and imagination is your limit, not your job title. We’re constantly evolving and growing and you’ll need to embrace change. On a day to day basis, these are the things that will be keeping you busy.

Working with and managing a pool of mid level accounts, who are changing the way they do business by using Vouch’s products and services.
Working proactively on solving challenging external and internal issues to identify and implement creative solutions for our customers.
Working cross-functionally within the company to develop processes and improve customer experience.
Work closely with customers to understand how we can improve key products.
Immersing yourself in the company and building knowledge of our evolving product, ensuring feedback flows from Account Management to the relevant support and development teams.
Stay on top of competitor and industry changes to ensure we stay ahead in an ever changing industry.
Up-selling additional product features to existing clients.
Supporting internal team training to ensure we upskill together.
Utilising data to ensure that Vouch is maximising the commercial return from their customers by monitoring the continual use of our products and services.


About You

You should apply if:

You’ve got experience managing and leading customer relationships.
You’re super organised and have proven your ability to prioritise effectively and meet deadlines whilst juggling a mixture of customer and project work.
You have commercial experience that allows you to provide a consultative approach to upsell and product adoption.
You have been involved in customer strategy, helping to develop success plans, voice of customer projects or improved advocacy programmes.
You are energetic, creative, curious and confident. You get on with everyone and anyone and adapt your style to communicate most effectively with them.
You work well under pressure, and are able to problem solve when sometimes having to think outside the box.


And it would be super great if:

You have experience working in a Letting Agency OR previous experience from a Project management, Customer Success or Account Management role working in SaaS company
Experience working with one of or all the following softwares: Gainsight, Salesforce, Google Business
You know what it’s like to work in a young company and love the vibe (and sometimes chaos!)


About Us

Vouch was created by husband and wife duo Simon and Jaime Tillyer. Their vision was to create an innovative, tech driven solution to the existing, clunky and time-consuming referencing services in the lettings industry. They wanted a system that actually worked, and didn't cost the earth.

Today that vision is a reality, and our business has grown from strength to strength. Based in the heart of Sheffield city centre, we have grown incredibly quickly (thanks to the hard work of our brilliant team of almost 30 people) and have turned a vision into a profitable, successful company that supports our 1500+ customers across the country.

And in true Vouch fashion, we are not stopping there. We have lots we still want to achieve and we are growing the team to help us do that. Regardless of the role you do or the team you're in, these are the things you'll need to thrive here:

A desire to learn and develop new skills
A positive attitude
Self-motivated
A good problem solver
So, if that sounds like you and you want to be involved in building something special and the opportunity to work in a fun, people first culture, we'd love to hear from you.


WHY YOU'LL LOVE WORKING AT VOUCH:

Let’s be honest, start-ups aren’t for everyone. If you work best in a company where processes are established, rules are set and there is a ‘standard’ way of doing things, we’re probably not the place for you.

But, if you love being creative, have a knack for creating opportunities from what others see as challenges and want to work somewhere where you can be yourself and are trusted to do what you do best, then Vouch is the place for you. You’ll be part of a young, successful team with a relaxed atmosphere that allows you to both deliver and grow and expand your skills.

On top of that, here’s a few of the things that our existing team loves about working for Vouch:

🌴 23 days annual leave, plus bank holidays, plus your birthday off!

🚀 Learning and Development budget via Learnably

✨ Pension scheme

And some other perks are:

💻 Flexible working & hybrid working

🐶 Dog friendly office with our most regular fluffy visitors Oscar and Bruno

🍿 Office snacks

🎉 We work hard but enjoy letting our hair down with plenty of team socials

🤗 Exposure to the Goodlord group and the opportunities to progress that come with that

Vouch wants applicants from all backgrounds and walks of life, we are an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive environment. If there is anything you need to participate fully in the interview process we'd like to hear about that too, please just include it in your application. Come and join us!

Unfortunately Sponsorship is not available for this role

** Please note, as we are regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority, you are required to pass a thorough referencing check via Experian before joining the team. We will only ask for references at the point of making an offer **

Who We Are




Founded in 2010, we started RevenueWell because we saw a way to use the latest marketing automation technology to help dentists build better, more connected relationships with their patients and communities. We think it’s a problem worth solving, and thousands of dental practices across the country seem to agree. The company has grown very quickly over the last few years, and we’re now a team of about 200 diverse people that are committed to our mission, super-focused on our product, and fanatical about helping our customers succeed.




In December 2019, we partnered with Marlin Equity Partners to help us aggressively expand our vision in healthcare. Since then, we have more than doubled our footprint (through strong organic growth and acquisition of PBHS) to over 12,000 customers, and we are just getting started! If you are excited about healthcare, working with talented people, aren’t afraid to roll up your sleeves, and want to help build a healthcare technology company that makes a real difference for providers and patients – this opportunity might just be for you.




Why We’re Looking




RevenueWell is seeking an energetic, driven Account Manager to join our incredibly successful Sales team. As an Account Manager in our fast-paced environment, you will be responsible for the growth and upsell to our current clients in a given territory. This Account Manager’s daily approach will be a good mix of prospecting and building on those existing relationships to increase upsell revenue, to increase program adoption, and to provide dental practitioners with other facets of our product offerings to help their office run more efficiently and effectively .




What We Are Looking For

Experience working a book of business within a Territory Model is highly desirable

Experience performing in-depth online demonstrations
Proficiency in all Microsoft Office applications
Strong exposure with Salesforce CRM
Successful track record of meeting and exceeding revenue targets in a similar field
Demonstrated understanding of Value Selling in a high velocity environment
Proven ability to build a strong pipeline while closing business

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Most important, someone driven with the go-getter attitude and an entrepreneurial spirit to become 1% better every day




What’s In It For You

Entrepreneurial Culture: You manage your business. We strongly encourage our Employees to leverage their skill sets and creativity to provide the best service and solutions to our current clients.

We believe in working hard, for our clients every day while ensuring satisfaction in your role and ample time to enjoy activities outside of work. Along with having remote flexibility.
YOU Make the Difference: You’ll spend your days building and maintaining relationships with new and existing customers. You will be consulting with health professionals to help them be more profitable, to be more present for their patients, and to make office life easier!

Paytm is India’s leading digital payments and financial services company, which is focused on driving consumers and merchants to its platform by offering them a variety of payment use cases. Paytm provides consumers with services like utility payments and money transfers, while empowering them to pay via Paytm Payment Instruments (PPI) like Paytm Wallet, Paytm UPI, Paytm Payments Bank Netbanking, Paytm FASTag and Paytm Postpaid - Buy Now, Pay Later. To merchants, Paytm offers acquiring devices like Soundbox, EDC, QR and Payment Gateway where payment aggregation is done through PPI and other banks’ financial instruments. To further enhance merchants’ business, Paytm offers merchants commerce services through advertising and Paytm Mini app store. Operating on this platform leverage, the company then offers credit services such as merchant loans, personal loans and BNPL, sourced by its financial partners.




About the team: This sales team at Paytm Health is responsible for onboarding of new medical institutions (Labs, Clinics, Hospitals) for the Offline Enterprise team.




About the role: This is a B2B Sales role which requires high level of key account management and acquisition expertise. One should have excellent skills in managing medical institutions along with excellent territory knowledge.




Expectations/ Requirements:




Hunt for new accounts that can be introduced to Paytm Payments
Coordination with various internal teams to ensure a timely and smooth onboarding experience for merchants/app owners
Own and Manage Merchant relationships at post Live stage
Device and execute growth strategies for increasing revenue from acquired accounts
Plan and finalize Merchant funded campaigns on premium/ paid properties of Paytm ecosystem to help merchants get the maximum out of the Paytm ecosystem
Manage Paytm Health Merchants and aggregator relationships for the specified category in that region





Superpowers/ Skills that will help you succeed in this role:




5-9 years of relevant experience in Sales, Business Development, and relationship building
Familiarity with Hospital Management systems and hospital ERPs
Good communication skills
Good understanding of MS Office tools
Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales
Willingness to travel frequently within assigned territory





Education - Graduation




Why join us




A collaborative output-driven program that brings cohesiveness across businesses through technology
Improve the average revenue per use by increasing the cross-sell opportunities
A solid 360-degree feedback from your peer teams on your support of their goals
Respect, that is earned, not demanded from your peers and manager





Compensation:




If you are the right fit, we believe in creating wealth for you




With enviable 500 million+ registered users, 21 million+ merchants and depth of data in our ecosystem, we are in a unique position to democratize credit for deserving consumers & merchants – and we are committed to it. India’s largest digital lending story is brewing here. It’s your opportunity to be a part of the story!

Summary

Apple Advertising Platforms is redefining advertising on mobile devices while reaching hundreds of

millions of iPhone and iPad users around the world. With Apple News and Search Ads, advertisers and

publishers get access to the most engaged consumers in the market. We're looking for a key contributor

to join this exciting and fast-paced organization. We are seeking an experienced digital advertising expert

to join our strategic partnership team for Apple News.


Key Qualifications

Must have Advertising Sales experience

Prior experience in strategic partnerships

Strong relationship building and diplomatic communication skills

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Must be detail oriented and have exceptional organizational skills

Proactive self-starter with a professional, positive demeanor

Must have strong analytical and problem solving skills, and a solutions-oriented focus

Ability to work independently and with a team in a fast paced, rapidly-changing environment

High level of technology experience, with an understanding of the latest advertising technology


Description

The Account Manager will be responsible for supporting the partnership team in maintaining business

relationships, sourcing opportunities for the partnership to thrive, monitoring success, developing and

executing plans for strategic growth for Apple News. Additionally this role involves significant

collaboration with various groups across Apple including: Product Development, Business Operations,

Legal/Finance, Business Development, and Publisher Monetization.


Specifically, the role will be responsible for leading efforts in the following areas:

• Manage the day-to-day interactions with the partner

• Understand the technical and operational requirements of our partners and work closely with the

internal teams to support execution and troubleshooting

• Collect partner and overall market feedback to guide Apple News strategy

• Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress, successful

initiatives and roadblocks

• Analyze data and provide data-driven insights to improve our partnership opportunity


Pay & Benefits

At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $107,000 and $161,000, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

Job_Description:
As a Key Account Manager, you will define and execute the overarching sales strategy and execution to maximize business opportunities across the Modern Off Trade (Supermarket & CSPM) in alignment with segment sales activities with the overall company’s business plan. Sales Management

Responsible for Top-line target / budget through management of sales activities and projects for the Modern off Trade. Ensure effective budget is in place to optimize sales opportunities and defend/gain market share.
Develop / define retailer’s short and long-term strategic plans in line with channel strategy, prepare and review business plans to ensure overall plan is commercially focused in revenue and profits.
Formulate strategies to drive sales based on market developments, management feedback, manufacturing output, and ensure inventory forecast is accurate and healthy.
Partner with Marketing and Trade Marketing to ensure brands are preserved and segment activities are relevant and impactful to drive sales.
Optimize distribution for all APB brands and opportunity at each segment and ensure to have the right partnership to drive sell-out and enhance customer focus in key markets.

Develop solid and long-term influential relationships with retailers and key decision makers at all levels in the assigned customer base.







Market / Customer Insights and Communication
