Overview

Roboflow is the fastest way to use computer vision in production. Over 100k engineers build with our tools. Helping our users get the most out of Roboflow is essential to their success.We’re hiring our second Solutions Engineer to partner closely with our sales team and drive new customer wins. You’ll have an immense impact on shaping the future of not only this role, but our company. A large portion of the Roboflow sales process is technical, ensuring customers understand how to incorporate computer vision into their products. Building successful relationships with our potential customers -- many of whom are engineers -- as well as showcasing what the Roboflow product is capable of is a key component of the role, so you will leverage both your engineering background and user-facing mindset to be successful.

What You’ll Do

Because our customers use computer vision in so many different industries (accelerating cancer research, improving manufacturing processes, enabling automated checkout, and so much more), your workday will always include an engaging variety of challenges. You will work with sales on delivering demos, building proofs of concepts and prototypes with prospects, and in answering technical questions, assisting in closing deals. You will use your knowledge gathered through sales motions and work with our Customer Success team to determine ways to best drive adoption and successful implementations of computer vision within their products. You will also contribute to the post-sales process (Customer Engineering) in an engineering capacity to ensure our customers are successful throughout their journey with Roboflow. We don’t just stop at signature and onboarding. We want our customers to be life long partners with Roboflow and ensure they are receiving the ROI they envisioned when they first signed on. If you think, “I’m an engineer that loves sharing my work with others,” you’d be in great company in this role.

Who You’ll Work With

As an early first Machine Learning Solutions engineer hire, you’ll be partnering directly with our co-founder/CEO, Sales leadership and Customer Success leadership to not only do great work in the role, but shape how this function works for the future of Roboflow.

In This Role, You’ll

Support Sales team to assess technical fit
Demo Roboflow to potential customers, answer questions about Roboflow, ultimately convincing them Roboflow is the correct solution
You will collaborate with Sales and Engineering teams to develop POCs and propose solutions that best fit a customers needs
Talk with potential customers, understand their problems, and assess whether or not Roboflow is a good fit
Give presentations to potential customers on why Roboflow is the perfect platform for their computer vision use cases.
Create technical content to demonstrate best practices (e.g. sample apps, documentation, videos, etc.)
Dive into our codebase to understand technical limitations in Roboflow that need solving via code (e.g. a bug, a missing feature, etc.) to help close a deal
Work with sales to develop strategy and building roadmaps for our potential customers
Help potential customers in performing analysis on their image data to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement through computer vision
Test and validate new product features with usage and consumption in mind
Create a repository of reusable artifacts as you build out demos and POC’s, that can be used by customers to accelerate their Roboflow journey
Work with Customer Success team to improve processes, documentation and the overall customer experience
Assist our Customer Success team with customers onboarding, adoption and engineering efforts.

The Skillset You’ll Bring

An enthusiastic, strong, technical generalist
A background in computer science or a related field
Technical experience in a professional environment, ideally a startup
Strong knowledge of APIs, building webapps with JavaScript and/or Python
An awareness of the machine learning development lifecycle (and eagerness to learn more)
Previous experience talking with customers, working sales motions and solving their problems
Ability to think on your feet, and solve problems during calls with technical customers
The ability to speak to potential customers about their vision and turn this vision into Roboflow use case
The sales mindset where it comes naturally and you are sharing your passion for Roboflow with those around you, rather than just “selling.”

Company Description




THE BRAND




Since 1828, Guerlain - an iconic luxury French Perfume & Cosmetics brand, part of the LVMH Group - has explored, innovated and perfected its Fragrance, Skincare and Makeup thanks to its daring creators of mythical creations with timeless know-how. All with Nature and Art as inspiration and the Culture of Beauty as a signature.




In Fragrance, Guerlain Master Perfumer, Thierry Wasser, embodies the fifth generation of Guerlain Perfumers. As a figure within the contemporary fragrance world, Thierry Wasser has put his name to many of the House’s creations. He contributes to an olfactory legacy of some 1100 fragrances and explores the world in search of the most exclusive raw materials. In Makeup, newly appointed Guerlain Creative Director of Makeup, Violette, seemed destined to join the house synonymous with French beauty and constant innovation. With her creativity, Parisian chic and eye for high standards, she knows better than anyone else that makeup is nothing if not the art of bringing out the beauty in each and every one of us.




The House is committed to preserving biodiversity, innovating sustainably, acting for the climate and creating a positive social impact. Above all, Guerlain seeks to protect one of Nature’s most precious wonders: bees, sentinels of the environment and symbol of the House.




Job Description




POSITION OVERVIEW (FULL-TIME)




You will spearhead and drive the Makeup axis & Retail Excellence animations in the US market while guaranteeing the company’s strategy & brand image. You will lead the Operational & Trade Marketing planning including strategy, 360 marketing activation adaptation, forecasting, budget, marketing presentations, toolkit & collateral development, and coordination with Supply & Field teams to ensure flawless implementation and to elevate the brand. You will deliver recommendations for your axis and provide support to the US teams, as well as reporting to HQ teams.




This position works in the Marketing team, in close collaboration with two Marketing team members in charge of Skincare and Fragrance. The role requires the ability to liaise and communicate internally with the HQ teams based in Paris and with various departments such as Merchandising, Education, Digital, Retail, Legal and Finance.




Principal Duties And Responsibilities




Makeup Category Management:
Adaptation of the 360 Makeup action plans for the US market.
Monitoring of the annual marketing calendars to ensure alignment with HQ and US launch synergies.
Novelty forecasts & product allocations.
Definition of the launch distribution, assortment, and follow-up with Supply teams.
Local production of tools (eg retailtainment activities, leaflets, retailer booklets, visuals, local sets).
Internal communication about new launches, novelty performances, animation plans & pricing.
Preparation of the Makeup retailer presentations.
Retail Excellence:
Spearhead the Sampling & Gifting (GWP) strategy.
Responsible for budget and follow-up of samples & GWP expenses.
Participation in the preparation of Retail events with the Retail & Education teams.
Production of Clienteling tools (SMS, MMS, Collaterals etc).
Visual Merchandising:
Provide the Visual Merchandising team the input on franchise priorities, Makeup planograms and visuals, as well as guidance for any Trade animation designs and tool development.
Close collaboration with the Merchandising and Supply teams to ensure the right forecasts and implementation of the festival designs and displays in stores.
Reports & Analyses:
Weekly: HQ newsletters, Competition newsletters.
Monthly: HQ Sell-out reports, Ad-hoc post-launch reports, Reports to the HQ Head of Retail Marketing.
Quarterly: Competition reports and analyses.
2x per year: Budget preparation.
Others:
Set clear, achievable KPIs and stay laser-focused on ROI.
Follow up the budget spending and planning with the Finance team on a regular basis.
Maintain a strong understanding of competitor activity within the competitive Beauty landscape.
Conduct all other job-related activities.




SUPERVISION RECEIVED




VP of Marketing & Communications.




SUPERVISION EXERCISED




None




Qualifications




QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS REQUIRED




Bachelor’s degree, MBA preferred.
3+ years of experience in marketing within beauty, luxury, or consumer products industry.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; able to communicate across the organization.
Planning and organizational skills with a sense of priority and attention to details.
Quantitative and analytical skills with the ability to link numbers to recommendations and results.
Hard-working, self-motivated, and passionate about the Beauty industry.
Ability to work autonomously.
Fluency or working knowledge of French is a bonus.




NOTE: This job description is intended to cover the core accountabilities of the position and is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.




Additional Information




All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Marketing Analyst

Location: Remote

Reports to: Director, Insights & Analytics

The Role

The candidate should be comfortable working with data and performing analysis to assess the impact of creator-facing roles, with a focus on creator acquisition. Marketing Analysts are adept at communicating a range of technical and marketing concepts to internal groups and the executive-level team. The candidate should possess a driving curiosity as to what important insights will help LTK influencers grow to their full potential.

Along with a keen sense of curiosity, this Analyst will deliver the most important updates to different audiences to inform decision-making.

Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities

Perform qualitative and quantitative research
Collect data and deliver reports from data analysis
Create clear and useful reports and recommendations for organizational use
Develop a keen understanding of LTK and other rewardStyle products


Professional Characteristics

The ideal candidate will have a passion for helping people and a driving curiosity to explore problems and questions of all types. The candidate should be analytical and possess the critical thinking skills necessary to have conversations with direct reports and executives. Most importantly, the candidate will be skilled in oral and written communication across any number of mediums (email, phone, face-to-face, digital platforms) and will be relentless in pursuing valuable insights that can benefit the business.

Curious
Ability to work individually and in a team environment
Can communicate with almost anyone at any time across any channel
Advanced Excel and analytical skills
Comfortable reading data visualizations
A willingness to consistently research new trends


Requirements

Bachelors in Marketing, Business, Communications, Analytical, Data or a related field
3-5 years of related work experience doing analysis for sales and/or marketing
SQL experience required
Advanced Excel skills required (data modeling, data analysis, advanced Excel formulas)
Ability to review your own work and determine effective and ineffective tactics
Ability to use complex metrics to understand influencer behavior and make recommendations
Knowledge of standard LTK business software (Periscope, Excel, Hubspot)
Knowledge of affiliate marketing and influencer marketing best practices
Excellent organizational skills
Excellent analytical skills
Understanding of influencer marketing best practices
Advanced understanding of digital and social media marketing
Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group: clients, executives, managers, and coworkers
Ability to understand influencer touchpoints and understand the influencer lifecycle
Adept at finding creative solutions to influencer problems


What's in it for you as a team member at LTK?

At LTK, we believe in taking care of our team members and offer competitive compensation and benefits including medical, dental, and vision, paid maternity and paternity leave and a 401k retirement plan with a LTK matching contribution. To make sure our employees stay healthy and balanced, we also offer wellness benefits such as a flexible work schedule plus Summer Fridays (Workday ends at 3pm). We don’t forget to have fun either with virtual company happy hours and virtual team events! And last but not least, you get to work on interesting problems that will help disrupt the retail industry!

What you have to look forward to when you work or visit for team huddles at a LTK Office:

Fully stocked bars and kitchen (free snacks all day!)
Catered meals weekly
Monthly Chair massages
Laidback office environment
Monthly themed Happy Hours!
Free access to state of the art gym while working in or visiting our Dallas HQ
Free Covered Parking on-site while working in or visiting our Dallas HQ


About Us

As the founder of creator guided shopping, LTK is the trusted and effective platform for creators and their businesses by powering the connection between content and commerce. Founded in 2011 by Amber and Baxter Box, the LTK mission is to empower creators to be as economically successful as possible. World premium lifestyle creators in 150+ countries drive more than $3.6 billion in annual retail sales through their LTK Creator Shop profiles. Today, more than 18 million consumers turn to LTK Creator Shops in the LTK shopping platform each month to find inspiration and instantly shop the styles recommended by their favorite creators. And, more than 6,000 brands partner with LTK to gain access to its global creator network for content that converts against performance-driven, cross-channel KPIs. A three-time honoree on Fast Company’s list of Most Innovative Retail Companies, LTK is headquartered in Dallas, TX and currently operates on five continents. To download the LTK shopping app, search for LTK in the App Store or Google Play.

For the latest LTK Creator updates, follow LTK.HQ, and for the latest shopping trends and updates from LTK, follow Shop.LTK.

For US-Based Roles: We are not offering new sponsorships opportunities at this time for persons requiring employment visas, such as an H-1B; authorization to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment.

Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of LTK are considered the property of LTK and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

LTK is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Spring are creating a shift in the way we buy and sell tech, creating a more sustainable way of enjoying our devices.

Spring is a green mission-led start-up with currently a team of 40+ brilliant people.

Our mission is to change the way we all use technology as everyday thousands of forgotten tech devices waste potential, lose value, and add pressure on the planet. The world currently generates 50 million tonnes of e-waste each year and that figure is set to double by 2050.

We want to allow everyone to give old tech a new life while saving the environment by reducing e-waste going into landfills and CO2 emissions. You can now easily sell, recycle, and trade in your old tech, through our self-service machines (Pods).

We have secured Series A private equity funding and contracts with major national retailers, Morrisons & Co-Op.

We are really proud of the astonishing results we have achieved so far but this is just the beginning! With an exciting future ahead there wouldn't be a better time to join us as we have great projects for the future, and we are really determined to succeed! We want someone who shares our values, who breaths our culture, and who is willing to leave a mark on a more sustainable future.

Come and join our vibrant and passionate team who are looking to transform the world of consumer electronics: Let's make a difference together!

Find out more about us at spring.co.uk

The Role

As a Marketing Analyst, you'll be analysing data from online and our Spring Pods situated in stores across London, harnessing your findings to devise reports which will prioritise our budgets and the direction of our campaigns. You'd be analysing sign-ups, which pods are being under-utilised, and drop-off times for the user journey. You will connect the dots between our existing data and utilise your insights to drive effective marketing campaigns.

On a day-to-day basis, you'll be using Google Analytics to generate heat maps and analyse customer journeys and the conversion funnel. You'll provide support for strategic plans to increase marketing efficiency. You'll get to work in a collaborative, cross-functional team across Marketing and Data where your insights will make a real impact on the world around us.

As a Marketing Analyst, you'll be directly impacting the success and growth of Spring as a sustainable, green mission-led start-up! You'll be part of the drive to change consumer behaviour and help our planet.

You'll love this role if you:

Have experience using Google Analytics tools including Tag Manager, and visualisation tools such as Looker Studio
Have used HubSpot or a similar CRM platform as a marketing tool to track the impact of campaigns, automate, and generate leads
Have experience working in various areas of a business, with a great understanding of both operations and product
Are a highly organised self-starter, who can own the process and drive best practices to find new opportunities for growth
Are well-versed in using Excel to analyse and visualise data
Have scripting experience in Python, although this is not a necessity!


Benefits

A collaborative and unique office space in the heart of Shoreditch
unlimited holiday each year
matched pension scheme
speedy career progression on offer, where you’ll contribute towards creating products that make a better world for all of us
discounted gym memberships through GymPass for you and the fam
an opportunity to join an ambitious and growing tech start-up, centered around sustainability


At Spring, we want to strive for a world of inclusivity and diversity. We thrive on a culture of creativity where individuality is valued. We approach our work fearlessly, learn quickly, improve constantly and celebrate our wins at every turn. As an inclusive workplace, our team are comfortable bringing their authentic whole selves to work. Be you.

Responsable de que se ejecuten todos los acuerdos de publicaciones compartidas en RRSS y PR.

Ingles avanzado

Our client, a consumer engagement agency that believes in the power of experience to build brands, is looking for a marketing analyst to join their team. The marketing analyst team works to help bring client data to life, measuring and interpreting complex data sets, delivering actionable insights to their clients. As a marketing analyst, you are a creative problem-solver by trade and have outstanding organizational skills, able to manage multiple responsibilities and deliverables simultaneously. Responsible for proactively developing insights and building business cases to drive optimized or new tactics and strategies, which will move business performance and customer experience forward. This role will support the development and execution of strategic programs that deliver results against client goals through analytical assessments, insight generation, and measurement designs.




Responsibilities:




Work with large, complex data sets to derive actionable business insights and optimization opportunities for key clients
Support the communication of results to clients through the preparation of reports, dashboards and presentations, in conjunction with other decision scientists and managers
Assist in the definition, setup and execution of omnichannel measurement plans, including digital tagging of websites and mobile apps
Manipulate, query and extract data from relational databases to answer ad-hoc client queries
Work with and present results to stakeholders in multiple areas and levels of the agency
Design multivariate experiments, while ensuring statistical significance of results
Translate analysis and insights into actionable business recommendations
Coordinate BI reporting for clients as instructed including weekly, monthly and quarterly reports and summaries, and augment reports by researching and pulling data queries.
Work closely with the database team to ensure program needs are being maintained, continuously improved and to address any areas of risk.




Skills & Experience:




Minimum 1-3 years’ experience in digital or promotional marketing strategy/analytics
Innate curiosity and ability to connect insights and gain inspiration from disparate sources Experience with CRM, digital or promotional strategies and analytics across channels, including digital engagement and database growth
Experience with relational database languages (e.g. SQL)
Demonstrated experience using business intelligence software such as Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc.
Expertise in Microsoft Excel, Word and intermediate PowerPoint
Experience cleansing, manipulating and transforming datasets
A team-first attitude and willingness to do whatever it takes to accomplish goals
A desire to learn new techniques and share knowledge with others




And we would love you to have:

Post-secondary education in a quantitative discipline, (Math, Statistics, Political Science, Economics or Computer Science, etc.) or equivalent experience
Experience with digital tagging using Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and/or Adobe Analytics
Passion for understanding behavior, influence, and marketing
Examples to show of analytic initiatives in their career tenure




*Employment Requirements*

US based employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by the date of hire to be considered. Proof of vaccination is required.

Marketing Analyst




One of The Sage Group’s clients is looking for a Marketing Analyst strong with web campaign experimentation and automating templates with Python. The Client’s product portfolio provides the foundations for team collaboration and productivity, and through rich integrations with leading SaaS vendors and 3rd party apps, teams can streamline their work, automate tedious tasks, and connect in real-time on critical issues.




Do you have a passion for learning through experiments? Do you love helping teams find the next big ‘aha’ insight which changes the way a business thinks about its customers? Would you like to help drive a culture of experimentation across a global SaaS company?




Client is seeking world-class analytics and data science professionals to join our Experimentation Center of Excellence (ECOE) team. We’re looking for people with business instincts, team mindset, creativity, and analytics, who are passionate about applying their skills to help teams learn from experiments.




In the ECOE team, you'll get to:




Identify ways to enable analysts and data scientists to experiment faster and more rigorously than today. Put in place tables and dashboards to speed the experimentation process
Measure the impact of our experimentation center of excellence strategy; designing and analyzing the launch of experimentation tools and frameworks
Assess the current state of experimentation through analyses and needs assessments
Share your high-quality insights and recommendations to peers and leadership in order to influence or drive faster business decisions
Foster a world-class analytics culture, through education and the creation of self-service tools, to make a lasting change in how your analysts use experiments to make decisions




On your first day, we expect you to have:




Experience applying your analytics skills to contribute to projects or programs which have had a proven impact on business performance and process
3-5 years marketing analytics with heavy web campaign experimentation experience
5-7 years with Python (doing automation and setting up templates) and SQL
An agile development mindset, appreciating the benefit of constant iteration and improvement. A very high bar for output quality, while balancing “having something now" vs. "perfection in the future"
Expertise in data manipulation and some history with statistical programming languages (SQL/Python). Mastery of telling stories with data and proficiency in visualizations tools (e.g. Tableau, Redash), R is a plus
Strong ability to communicate. Explaining complex concepts to diverse audiences, and crafting compelling stories




Duration: 6-12 months to start plus contract to hire possibilities

Location: 100% remote, living in PST is strongly preferred

Compensation: $60-70/hr Depending on Experience

Join a team of more than 30,000 team members, comprised of our Club Support Center and over 230 clubs and 7 distribution centers. We’re committed to delivering value and convenience to our Members, helping them save every day on everything they need for their families and homes. BJ’s Wholesale Club offers a collaborative, team environment where all team members can learn, grow and be themselves.




The Benefits Of Working At BJ’s




BJ’s pays weekly
Generous time off programs to support busy lifestyles*
Vacation, Personal, Holiday, Sick, Bereavement Leave, Jury Duty
Benefit plans for your changing needs*
Three medical plans**, Health Reimbursement Account (HRA), Health Savings Account (HSA), two dental plans, flexible spending
eligibility requirements vary by position
medical plans vary by location




Job Description




BJ’s has a great opportunity on the Member Acquisition team for an individual who is looking to leverage their marketing and project management skills to help BJ’s acquire new members, primarily in new club pre-open and post-open campaigns. Membership is the lifeblood of BJ’s and new club/new market expansion is central to continued growth and success.




This newly established role will be an integral part of the Member Acquisition team and will help produce marketing acquisition campaigns through collaboration with internal cross functional teams and external media agencies. The team moves quickly and has many projects in play at once. Therefore, the individual should have great energy, a strong eye for detail, and can confidently manage dozens of campaigns at once. The right candidate will also have a strong thirst for learning and a desire to be part of a dynamic team.




Responsibilities:




Collaborate with teams to develop, execute, optimize, and innovate marketing programs to acquire new BJ’s members in pre and post-open clubs. Ensure that all programs remain on budget and communicate with various teams to manage updates.
Formulate and communicate new club cost per acquisition and signup goals
Manage reporting and insights for performance of the marketing programs, which is shared with senior management
Coordinate new club events with agencies and internal partners
Identify new channels and marketing partners that will generate new member acquisition
Develop internal club communications to ensure successful campaign executions
Partner with cross functional teams including Creative, Analytics, Digital Marketing, Legal, etc. to execute membership strategies
Collaborate to manage an offer strategy roadmap, working with various teams to ensure a consistent strategy across new clubs in all markets
Support the overall management of the Member Acquisition budget to ensure expenses are kept in line with BJ’s financial plan. Grow to fully own this strategic and high-profile project.
Support other acquisition projects as needed




Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Management, or related subject
2+ years relevant work experience in a marketing role with a focus on digital, social, and traditional direct marketing channels
Strong communication skills and comfortable presenting concepts and deliverables to internal and external teams and vendors at various levels. Ability to build productive relationships with cross functional partners.
Strong business acumen and comfortable making data driven decisions
Excellent project management and organizational skills. Able to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
Positive attitude with a willingness to work on projects beyond your immediate scope of responsibility. A strong desire to learn and achieve professional growth.
Experience managing large financial budgets
Intermediate Excel and PowerPoint skills

ICR, one of the most respected and fastest growing corporate communications firms, is looking for a Senior Associate, Marketing Analyst to join our new Growth Marketing practice, an innovative practice redefining the B2B GTM playbook. The Growth Marketing practice builds end-to-end growth strategies for high-growth technology companies to help them systematically create a repeatable, predictable revenue engine efficiently. We are looking for someone who will help us build world-class analytics capabilities to allow us to take a data-lead approach to serve clients.




You will support creating a data-first approach for growth for our clients. In this role, you will be responsible for evaluating the impact of our integrated campaigns, measuring end-to-end marketing funnel performance, producing dashboards to monitor our critical metrics and programs, and performing advanced analyses to optimize marketing performance for business operation, planning, and budgeting purposes.




You will play a critical role in spearheading and shaping how analytics will be used to grow and optimize our clients' growth strategies. You will work closely with the SVP and VP of Growth Strategy to connect tactics to results and inform future activities, as well as partner with client Product and Sales analytics teams to build predictive models that help drive growth.




You rely on the numbers to unlock systematic growth for companies and help clients build a modern data-lead revenue engine in-line with the way today’s B2B customers buy.




You’ll be advising a diverse lineup of leading high-growth tech companies across ICR’s key verticals, focusing on helping ICR always lead the conversation with data to inform recommendations and decisions.




Responsibilities:

Ability to distill data effectively to tell a clear narrative and make a business case
Proficient in data analysis and data visualization with the ability to create executive as well as operating team dashboards. Work with the team to build dashboards to regularly monitor experiments, KPIs, and other key metrics
Partner with the Leadership team to develop data-driven go-to-market strategies and implement operational improvements across the organization to drive revenue growth
Own all growth analytics and our quantitative growth model tied to spend
Build a culture of and infrastructure for experimentation and data inspection across clients
Implement best practices for testing frameworks and reporting methodology
A history of building systems
Run frequent analyses to uncover insights on sales productivity and new revenue opportunities
Build scalable processes and tools that drive predictable revenue growth
Analyze funnel metrics to develop insights our clients’ sales pipeline and the efficacy for their business development efforts
Ruthlessly prioritize selecting and retaining third-party tools for clients for current use cases that will scale as our clients grow
Work cross-functionally with client teams including customer success, sales, business operations, finance, product, marketing teams, and other stakeholders to share insights and help clients centralize information across the entire client lifecycle
Manage dashboards with key KPIs and build revenue forecasts so teams can easily understand business health, compensation attainment and goals




Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in a similar role
Proven experience in using data to drive marketing strategy and decision-making, preferably working directly with business leaders and wider marketing teams
Strong communication and presentation skills, including the ability to translate data-related concepts and results for leadership and less technical stakeholders
Experience creating dashboards and visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Looker, Mode, Periscope, Microsoft Power BI, etc.
Ability to start, own, and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance, including setting goals/OKRs
A clear understanding and demonstrable experience in experimentation design and process development, including comfort with A/B testing and cohort analysis.
Proficient with marketing analytics metrics and tools like Salesforce, 6Sense, Marketing automation tools, Google Adwords, Google Analytics, Microsoft Ads, Optimizely
SaaS experience is a big advantage for this role
Familiar with data challenges and adept at overcoming them
Excited about discovering and delivering insights to the marketing team that will drive growth and increased rate of adoption
Prior experience working with or within marketing teams
Analytical, evidence-based, able to understand and utilize data from multiple sources to formulate reports and presentations that communicate marketing insights
Deep understanding of demand generation, revenue attribution, and customer lifecycle
Strong analytical skills, proficiency in marketing measurement and reporting
Demonstrated expertise in defining, implementing and maintaining reports and analytics to track lead flow, conversion revenue attribution and related KPIs.
Critical thinker, you don’t take directives at face value, you consider the task at hand, offering constructive feedback to improve processes
Collaborative and friendly, and comfortable working in a remote environment

Job Title: Assistant Marketing Manager - Global Travel Retail
Job_Description:
Description

We are looking for a driven, hands on & passionate superstar to join our newly formed Travel Retail (TR) division based in London as an Assistant Marketing Manager for Global Travel Retail reporting into the Head of Marketing for TR.

As you will be joining a newly formed division & function, you will be part of the founding members of this new team and therefore involved in all areas of marketing including: new retailer launch planning & execution, unlocking trade visibility & maximising retail opportunities, campaign activation, exclusive product set development & category management and more to building ground-breaking, disruptive plans across all our TR retail partners.

As one of our Travel Retail marketing guardians, we are looking for someone that is ready to join a fast paced & creative environment where you can collaborate effectively with all regional and global teams and inspire our retail partners with your attitude to excellence, your unstoppable creative flair and passion for getting things done!

Key Responsibilities

SUPPORT AND LEAD THE LAUNCH OF NEW RETAILERS: acting as the core brand guardian, developing exceptional, legacy building & strategic launch plans in close collaboration with Global, VM, Store Design, PR, Commercial, and Retail teams, tailoring plans to the retailers/market needs on time, on target and within budget whilst ensuring the smooth management of key internal & external stakeholders. Collaborating with regional counterparts to ensure a robust sustain plan is in place to accelerate growth, maintaining ranking & brand awareness.
DELIVER INTEGRATED MARKETING CAMPAIGNS: work closely with all departments from Commercial, Retail, Digital, Education, PRO Artistry, Global Marketing, NPD plus external partners to deliver 360 marketing campaigns, launches and events that push industry boundaries and break records. You will be accountable for attending weekly global marketing meetings, curating launch ideas, content ideation and briefing, digital and print artwork briefing, leading on virtual and in store events seeking opportunities to maximise engagement and conversion, managing launch communications, general activation support and post campaign analysis.
DIGITAL NATIVE: bring thought-leadership and digital excellence to innovative and disruptive brand activities within your retailers, raising total brand awareness & creating memorable brand moments; challenging the status quo by identifying best practices across the industry and opportunities to increase Charlotte Tilbury’s share of voice and ranking in your regions, retailers & doors with a strong lens on driving the best omnichannel customer experience.
RADE MARKETING RETAIL STRATEGY: aid the planning and delivery of retailer marketing plans across the region, working closely with commercial teams and engaging retail partners to secure exceptional marketing support delivered with flawless attention to detail.
CATEGORY & PRODUCT EXPERT: date driven & product obsessed! You will be responsible for understanding the TR market and product/customer dynamics to uncover product opportunities & gaps; briefing new products/sets in collaboration with NPD, portfolio & commercial on time & in budget.
MARKETING CALENDAR: responsible for driving & developing your retailer/regional marketing calendar/ JBP; leverage the full marketing mix to deliver plans that drive our NPD whilst also accelerating the growth our core franchises.
BUDGET MANAGEMENT: Demonstrate high attention to detail when budget planning and PO raising in partnership with the HOM.
PROCESS: Support in establishing clear processes within the TR team to ensure a best-in-class delivery is achieved across the region and function, particularly focusing on cross functional & regional collaboration. Drive the planning, approval & follow-up of key projects to gain alignment from all key internal & external stakeholders.
THOUGHT LEADERSHIP: be a visionary, be creative, be disruptive – we’re looking for bold, big thinkers who will propel our business forward.


Requirements

We Are looking For:

Must be open to regional and international travel
Previous experience in a Marketing Executive position or similar
Experienced in devising and implementing strategic plans with creative flair
Incredible visual and verbal storyteller – your presentation & delivery needs transfix your audience
Digitally native and good knowledge of all digital marketing channels
Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines in a timely manner and ruthlessly prioritise
Have a flexible, positive, and professional attitude
Exceptional organisational skills showing great attention to detail
Adept managing multiple stakeholders
An excellent communicator comfortable presenting, able to influence and effectively articulate your point of view
Have exceptional organisational and prioritising skills and show great attention to detail and be results-driven
Excellent English written and verbal skills
A natural curiosity, passion, and love/obsession for the beauty industry


Benefits

Generous staff discount
Generous monthly product gifting
25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Hybrid, flexible working with core hours between 10am and 4pm
Dog friendly office on Monday and Fridays.
Access to Tilbury Treats - discounts on everything from gym memberships to cinema tickets.
Other fabulous benefits such as life assurance, birthdays off work and pension contribution.


At Charlotte Tilbury, our mission is to empower everybody in the world to be the most beautiful version of themselves. We support this by encouraging and hiring people with diverse backgrounds, voices, beliefs, and perspectives into our growing global workforce. By doing so, we better serve our communities, customers, employees - and the candidates that take part in our recruitment process.

WE WOULD LOVE TO WELCOME YOU TO OUR DREAM TEAM…APPLY TODAY
Show more

As a marketing analyst you will be responsible for studying market conditions to assess the potential sales of products and services. The successful candidate will be able to analyse qualitative data, trends, strategies, and competition aiming at increasing competitiveness. Your goal as marketing analyst is to assist companies to determine what products are in demand, who will purchase the products and the price they are willing to pay. Working as a Marketing analyst you can expect to work with vast amounts numerical information about market campaigns, trends, volume of sales, customer experience and competitors’ activities. We expect you to gather data, write detailed reports on findings, identify new markets, and advise senior management on tactics and strategy.

Key Responsibilities:

Prepare reports on findings while illustrating data with graphs and translating complex results into written texts that are clear and understandable
Devise and assess procedures and methods for data collection, including opinion polls, surveys and questionnaires
Gather information on competitors, and conduct analysis on their sales, prices and methods of distribution and marketing to thoroughly learn about the competition
Conduct research regarding marketing strategies and consumer opinions while collaborating with statisticians, marketing professionals and pollsters
Track and forecast trends in sales and marketing, and analyse in detail the data collected to provide management with thorough reports and results
Collect and analyse data regarding customer preferences, demographics, buying habits and needs to better identify market potential and factors influencing product demand
Attend staff conferences in order to provide management with proposals and information on the distribution, promotion, pricing and design of products and services
Measure the effectiveness of advertising, marketing and communications strategies


Requirements

Posses search engines, web analytics, and business research tools acumen
Excellent knowledge of statistical packages (SPSS, SAS or similar), databases and MS Office
Strong communication and presentation skills
Deep knowledge of data warehousing, and mining
Adequate knowledge of data collection methods (polls, focus groups, surveys etc)
Working knowledge with CRM programs
Strong analytical and critical thinking
Advise clients or senior management on the best ways to use provided data
Show more

Talent Point are partnered with Spring, a green mission-led start-up with a current team of 40+ talented people.




Their mission is to change the way we all use technology, as everyday thousands of forgotten tech devices waste potential, lose value and add pressure on the planet. The world currently generates 50 million tonnes of e-waste every year and that figure is set to double by 2050.




They want to encourage everyone to give old tech a new life while saving the environment by reducing e-waste going into landfills and the CO2 emissions. You can now easily sell, recycle, and trade in your old tech, through their self-service machines (Pods).




They have already gained some serious Series A private equity funding and secured contracts with national retailers, Morrisons & Co-Op.




Spring are really proud of the astonishing results they have achieved so far but this is just the beginning! With an exciting future ahead there wouldn’t be a better time to join them as they have several great projects due to kick off later this year and they are expanding the team to help guide those projects, from iteration through to delivery.




They want to hire someone who shares their values, who breaths our culture, and who is hungry to leave a mark on a more sustainable future.




Come and join their vibrant and passionate team who are looking to transform the world of consumer electronics: Let’s make the difference together!




Find out more about as at spring.co.uk







The Role:

Spring need a Marketing Analyst to join their rapidly growing team to connect the dots between our existing data and utilise your insights to drive effective marketing campaigns.




As a Marketing Analyst, you'll be analysing data from online and the Spring Pods situated in stores across London, harnessing your findings to devise reports which will prioritise their budgets and the direction of their campaigns. You'd be analysing sign-ups, which pods are being under-utilised, and drop-off times for the user journey.




On a day-to-day basis, you'll be using Google Analytics to generate heat maps and analyse customer journeys and the conversion funnel. You'll provide support for strategic plans to increase marketing efficiency.




You'll get to work in a collaborative, cross-functional team across Marketing and Data where your insights will make a real impact on the world around us.




As a Marketing Analyst, you'll be directly impacting the success and growth of Spring as a sustainable, green mission-led start-up! You'll be part of the drive to change consumer behaviour and help our planet.




You'll love this role if you:

Have experience using Google Analytics tools including Tag Manager, and visualisation tools such as Looker Studio
Have used HubSpot or a similar CRM platform as a marketing tool to track the impact of campaigns, automate, and generate leads
Have experience working in various areas of a business, with a great understanding of both operations and product
Are a highly organised self-starter, who can own the process and drive best practices to find new opportunities for growth
Are well-versed in using Excel to analyse and visualise data
Have scripting experience in Python, although this is not a necessity!




Benefits:

A collaborative and quirky space in Shoreditch
Unlimited holiday each year
Matched pension scheme
Discounted gym memberships through GymPass for you, family and friends
A real opportunity to create products that have a high impact on the environment




If you're interested in working with digital products that impact the environment, apply for this role now or get in touch at lizzy.attwood@talentpoint.co for more info and to discuss the role.

Title: Marketing Analyst

Location: Remote

Reports to: Director, Insights & Analytics

The Role

The candidate should be comfortable working with data and performing analysis to assess the impact of creator-facing roles, with a focus on creator acquisition. Marketing Analysts are adept at communicating a range of technical and marketing concepts to internal groups and the executive-level team. The candidate should possess a driving curiosity as to what important insights will help LTK influencers grow to their full potential.

Along with a keen sense of curiosity, this Analyst will deliver the most important updates to different audiences to inform decision-making.

Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities

Perform qualitative and quantitative research
Collect data and deliver reports from data analysis
Create clear and useful reports and recommendations for organizational use
Develop a keen understanding of LTK and other rewardStyle products


Professional Characteristics

The ideal candidate will have a passion for helping people and a driving curiosity to explore problems and questions of all types. The candidate should be analytical and possess the critical thinking skills necessary to have conversations with direct reports and executives. Most importantly, the candidate will be skilled in oral and written communication across any number of mediums (email, phone, face-to-face, digital platforms) and will be relentless in pursuing valuable insights that can benefit the business.

Curious
Ability to work individually and in a team environment
Can communicate with almost anyone at any time across any channel
Advanced Excel and analytical skills
Comfortable reading data visualizations
A willingness to consistently research new trends


Requirements

Bachelors in Marketing, Business, Communications, Analytical, Data or a related field
3-5 years of related work experience doing analysis for sales and/or marketing
SQL experience required
Advanced Excel skills required (data modeling, data analysis, advanced Excel formulas)
Ability to review your own work and determine effective and ineffective tactics
Ability to use complex metrics to understand influencer behavior and make recommendations
Knowledge of standard LTK business software (Periscope, Excel, Hubspot)
Knowledge of affiliate marketing and influencer marketing best practices
Excellent organizational skills
Excellent analytical skills
Understanding of influencer marketing best practices
Advanced understanding of digital and social media marketing
Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group: clients, executives, managers, and coworkers
Ability to understand influencer touchpoints and understand the influencer lifecycle
Adept at finding creative solutions to influencer problems


What's in it for you as a team member at LTK?

At LTK, we believe in taking care of our team members and offer competitive compensation and benefits including medical, dental, and vision, paid maternity and paternity leave and a 401k retirement plan with a LTK matching contribution. To make sure our employees stay healthy and balanced, we also offer wellness benefits such as a flexible work schedule plus Summer Fridays (Workday ends at 3pm). We don’t forget to have fun either with virtual company happy hours and virtual team events! And last but not least, you get to work on interesting problems that will help disrupt the retail industry!

What you have to look forward to when you work or visit for team huddles at a LTK Office:

Fully stocked bars and kitchen (free snacks all day!)
Catered meals weekly
Monthly Chair massages
Laidback office environment
Monthly themed Happy Hours!
Free access to state of the art gym while working in or visiting our Dallas HQ
Free Covered Parking on-site while working in or visiting our Dallas HQ


About Us

As the founder of creator guided shopping, LTK is the trusted and effective platform for creators and their businesses by powering the connection between content and commerce. Founded in 2011 by Amber and Baxter Box, the LTK mission is to empower creators to be as economically successful as possible. World premium lifestyle creators in 150+ countries drive more than $3.6 billion in annual retail sales through their LTK Creator Shop profiles. Today, more than 18 million consumers turn to LTK Creator Shops in the LTK shopping platform each month to find inspiration and instantly shop the styles recommended by their favorite creators. And, more than 6,000 brands partner with LTK to gain access to its global creator network for content that converts against performance-driven, cross-channel KPIs. A three-time honoree on Fast Company’s list of Most Innovative Retail Companies, LTK is headquartered in Dallas, TX and currently operates on five continents. To download the LTK shopping app, search for LTK in the App Store or Google Play.

For the latest LTK Creator updates, follow LTK.HQ, and for the latest shopping trends and updates from LTK, follow Shop.LTK.

For US-Based Roles: We are not offering new sponsorships opportunities at this time for persons requiring employment visas, such as an H-1B; authorization to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment.

Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of LTK are considered the property of LTK and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

LTK is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

En The Estée Lauder Companies estamos buscando a un nuevo Marketing Analyst para las marcas MAC y Bobbi Brown.




Dentro de sus principales funciones se encuentran:

Foco en Direct to Consumer & E-Commerce

Analizar la colocación de colecciones de acuerdo al potencial de cada tienda.
Identificar oportunidades de colecciones exclusivas por canal, como Kit exclusivos, Kit locales en navidad, analizando e implementando precios competitivos para este canal.
Proponer kits locales, dinámicas comerciales creativas y eficientes para desarrollar el canal digital
Revisión y definición de lineario de canales online

Foco en Basic Business, Newness y Hero Products

Importante trabajo de colaboración con el área de DP, Supply y Sell In, para asegurar el correcto abastecimiento.
Monitorear el MOB mes a mes, para identificar oportunidades y velar que estemos alineados a la estrategia.
Analisis de Hero Products tanto en forecast como en resultados Sell Out. Revisión de Hero Products en forecast.
Ajuste bimensual del forecast, analizando categorías según el foco mensual.
Construcción y revisión del calendario de Marketing, para tener cada mes categorías acordes a las necesidades del mercado, impulsado las colecciones, pero a su vez, dando foco a los hero products.
Entrega de inputs sobre categorías y productos de basic business a destacar por mes para las reposiciones de sell in.
Entrega mensual de reportes de MOB, Top 10 y Performance de Hero Products, además de análisis trimestral del reporte de Segmenta.
Revisión de linearios de acuerdo a VM de cada tienda, coordinación de solicitud de testers.
Calcular del mix de productos para la colocación inicial de sell in para cada una de las aperturas.
Ajustes de linearios, agregando productos de relevancia local.
Velar por la salud de nuestro inventario tanto en el stock de nuestros clientes, nuestro CD y transitos.

Reclutar Out of Store:

Trabajar de la mano con consumer, ONLINE & events para brindar la estrategia de potenciar ciertos productos en determinados momentos, según sea conveniente, alinearlo previamente con Sellin.
Revisión, ajuste e implementación manteniendo una estrategia de precios consistente al mercado y a la estructura de marca. Protegiendo categorías según convenga para acelerar categorías y seguir reclutando
Colocación de colecciones de acuerdo a la relevancia de cada tienda, para cubrir de esta forma la individualidad de cada tipo de público y seguimiento y reporte de SellThru
Velar por la distribución junto con sellin y comercial, solicitar testers y displays de novedades (coordinando con el área de trade marketing y VM)

Promotional Calendar: Value Sets Creation and TOAS implementations.

Colaboración en la preparación del promo calendar.
Análisis de Skus y precios de Kit Locales, apoyo en la implementación, seguimiento del performance.
Revisión de excesos, apoyo en creación de acciones para licuar unidades.
Apoyo en la implementación de entrega de muestras, definiendo cantidad de unidades por relevancia de cada tienda, en base a transacciones.
Análisis de futuras acciones de Samplings, revisando objetivo de la acción, transacciones y proyecciones de venta, para asegurar la correcta disponibilidad de unidades.
Entrega de listado de productos para licuar a través de Outlets.
Selección y revisión de listado de productos a descontinuar, preparando plan de acción para licuar con acciones promocionales previamente.

Otros

Reportaría local y regional
Administrar el tiempo y establecer prioridades trabajando en equipo para lograr los objetivos y metas.
Asegurar el accuracy de los gastos por línea de P&L, y hacer seguimiento a estimate mensualmente
Asistir a todos los entrenamientos que dicte la marca.




Requisitos:

2 años de Experiencia en Marketing
Título en Ingeniería Comercial - afín
Excel Avanzado

Overview

Seventh Generation is looking for an Analyst to join our Digital Hub. This role will help coordinate and optimize the growing marketing budget across teams, channels and tactics while delivering on our marketing objectives. The mission of Seventh Generation is to inspire a consumer revolution that nurtures the health of the next Seventh Generations. By establishing a talent powerhouse that brings our principles, practices, and partnerships to life we will build the most trusted brand in the industry. This roll will uniquely touch every part of the Marketing department and will have exposure to senior leadership as we make strategic decisions to support our long term objectives.

Five Core Values At Seventh Generation

Care Wholeheartedly. We have big hearts: they are full of our love for the planet, our consumers, our people, our partners, our products, and our brand. Collaborate Deliberately. It takes a village right? Together we can achieve things that we could never have done by ourselves. Not to mention it’s a lot less lonely. Nurture Nature. Nature got it right. We know it. That’s why we aspire to design products from plants not petroleum, from fields not factories. Innovate Disruptively. If you always do what you have done you will always get what you always got. We think innovation and creativity can change the world. Be a Trusted Brand. Can a company be a friend? We like to think so. We love our consumers and we hope they love and trust us.

Responsibilities
Lead holistic budget management for Marketing, partnering across the department and Finance to deliver the year.
Guide the annual budget planning process, integrating guidance from Unilever and internal brand expectations
Coordinate the monthly budget process across the marketing budget holders
Execute budget changes in multiple systems across the home care categories
Identify risks & opportunities in the budget & work with stakeholders to adjust accordingly
Identify process improvements or automation opportunities to improve ease or accuracy in the budget process
Partner with the Media lead to build & syndicate best in class strategies for online Search across platforms and retail partners.
Coordinate with key third party vendors & agencies, including project briefings and negotiation, timeline management, budget management, project delivery and reporting.
Partner with Shopper Marketing to assure digital campaign performance, pacing, and accountability.
Work alongside Retailer Media, Email and Social Media buyers to turn marketing strategies into effective & efficient programs that unlock real value for Seventh Generation.
Generate marketing program reporting & insights to enable continuous improvement
Forge strong working relationships with key internal teams including: Finance, Brand, PR, CTI, Creative, Social Mission, and Web.

Knowledge & Skill Requirements

Excellent practical Excel skills (i.e. pivot tables, vlookup, etc.) required.
Stellar project management skills and initiative are required.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required.
Bachelor’s degree in relevant subject or the equivalent combination of education and experience with 2+ years of experience in marketing or project management role with demonstrated success.
Demonstrated understanding of and experience in digital and social media platforms and technologies preferred.
Demonstrated understanding of Seventh Generation & Unilever company mission, goals and objectives.
Must be flexible in high stress situations and be able to effectively troubleshoot.
Experience working in values-led organizations preferred
Must be able to work independently, to accomplish multiple tasks with limited direct supervision.

Key Competencies Desired

Growth Mindset: A strong focus on growth through a winning, competitive mindset. Understanding key competitors and how we would win through differentiating our mix.
Consumer & Customer Focus: Putting our consumers & customers first is a must. Distilling consumer understanding into key insights as well as understanding the customer proposition are instrumental to success.
Bias for Action: A heightened emphasis on speed and urgency in all our actions. In order to ensure our continued category leadership, the successful candidate will have to think outside the box and challenge traditional ways of working in order to ensure quick delivery.

Pay: The pay range for this position is $67,000 to $100,500. Unilever takes into consideration a wide range of factors that are utilized in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, qualifications and education, and other business and organizational needs.

Bonus: This position is bonus eligible.

Long-Term Incentive (LTI): This position is LTI eligible.

Benefits: Unilever employees are eligible to participate in our benefits plan. Should the employee choose to participate, they can choose from a range of benefits to include, but is not limited to, health insurance (including prescription drug, dental, and vision coverage), retirement savings benefits, life insurance and disability benefits, parental leave, sick leave, paid vacation and holidays, as well as access to numerous voluntary benefits. Any coverages for health insurance and retirement benefits will be in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable plans and associated governing plan documents

Unilever is an organization committed to diversity and inclusion to drive our business results and create a better future every day for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.For more information, please see Equal Employment Opportunity Posters

Employment is subject to verification of pre-screening tests, which may include drug screening, background check, credit check and DMV check.

If you are an individual with a disability in need of assistance at any time during our recruitment process, please contact us at NA.Accommodations@unilever.com. Please note: This email is reserved for individuals with disabilities in need of assistance and is not a means of inquiry about positions or application statuses.

Marketing Analyst




Multi-Million Consumer Brand

London – 1 day per week

£50,000 + Package







The Package:

Competitive salary and regular reviews
Extremely competitive benefits package, including:




- Bonus

- Enhanced Pension

- 30 days holiday (+8 BH), ability to buy 5 additional days

- Private Medical Insurance

- Commute cost support

- Enhanced parental leave

- Enhanced sick pay

- Huge discounts across multiple brands

- Fantastic office environment

- Hybrid 2 days in/ 3 WFH.




The Brand:




Heritage brand. Iconic brand name
Multi-million turnover brand
Private equity backed, multi-million continued investment
Double digit growth YOY
A team that are genuinely enthusiastic, driven and risk takers




The role:




Deliver actionable insight based on data analysis of all marketing activity and channels (CRM, Social, Paid Search, Display, SEO, Affiliation etc).
Support the Marketing teams to achieve their goals and objectives through the effective design and delivery of insight-led marketing campaigns.
Work with CRM team to deliver audience data selections.
Provide effective analysis and interpretation of campaign effectiveness.
Deliver data visualisation and dashboarding to maximise self-service.
Support the Marketing department’s lead management process for all central enquiries into the business including, tracking, reporting, analysis, and stakeholder management.
Assist in data management, governance, attribution rules, and data quality with other member of the Data team to ensure data integrity & single source of truth across the company.
Performance initiatives analysis
Create and improve existing dashboards and reporting (Outside of Marketing) allowing colleagues and board members to be informed in terms of KPIs and specific concerns for their areas.




Previous experience:




Degree or equivalent (preferred).
Relevant experience, i.e., marketing analytics, with a strong background in marketing and an understanding of the role data-led insights can have in improving the effectiveness of campaigns.
Knowledge of BigQuery and/or Redshift.
Experience developing measurement frameworks and dashboards, utilising appropriate software (e.g., Tableau, Data Studio).
Strong understanding of Google Analytics, GTM, SA360 and other related MarTech
Strong SQL Skills
Demonstrable experience (Execution or analysis) of paid media, Email/CRM and SEO
Interpersonal communication – comfortable and skilled at communicating complex insights to non-data-oriented stakeholders.
Ability to take large data sets and identify trends.
Data manipulation through tools such as Microsoft Excel.
Management of workload across ad-hoc requests and deadlines.
Application of statistics in the context of performance and trends analysis (Desired)

Our client, a non-profit dedicated to preserving and celebrating Central Park, is seeking a temporary Marketing Analyst! This role is set to run now through June with possibility of extending or potentially becoming permanent. In office time will be required but they are open to considering a hybrid option!




*MUST have 3-8 years of professional marketing experience. *




Rate: $35-50/hr




Responsibilities:

Assist in development of organizational analytics strategy, mapping out priorities, processes, tools, and goals for broader analytics program.
Act as a resource for stakeholders to analyze and understand campaign performance against KPIs and larger business goals. Share data-driven insights, including areas of success and opportunity based on performance and strategic goals.
Bring together reporting from web, email, social and other channels to generate regular reports around campaign performance, audience growth, consumer journeys, and revenue generation.
Provide regular, executive-level analysis and/or customized dashboards for top-level analysis against business objectives.
Build out processes around reporting and analytics across departments – work with teams for better alignment and understanding of analytics practices and goals.
Create automated dashboards for teams that provide updated metrics and measurement against strategic goals.

Description

About WS Development

Massachusetts-based WS Development is a mixed-use developer with a singular mission: creating places people want to be. With an approach that values art, science, innovation and, above all else, people, WS strives to engage each community it serves with best-in-class installations and activations. Established in 1990, WS is a vertically-integrated company that conceptualizes, owns, operates and leases more than 100 properties that range from cutting-edge urban spaces to lifestyle and community centers. With over 22 million square feet of existing space and an additional nine million square feet under development, it is one of the largest privately-owned development firms in the country.

WS is where great ideas and great people come together to design, build, and operate some of the best loved real estate projects in the country. We live at the intersection of entrepreneurship and establishment. We have the infrastructure of decades supporting a culture of free-thinking excellence.

We expect every WS employee to feel welcomed and valued irrespective of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, marital status, parental status, cultural background and life experiences. Or for any other reason.

Overview

The Brand & Marketing team at WS is looking for a hero to blend our disparate data into useful collections, analyze it, and tell us how we can improve our overall performance. Our retail developments provide a premium experience for our guests, and we want to use data to ensure that every email, ad, and social post is well received. Your work will lead the way here. In this role, you will have the opportunity and tools to bring structure to our data and processes to ensure its complete and accessible for analysis. Your colleagues on the marketing team and at each of the shopping centers are eager to learn and will gladly support your efforts.

Responsibilities

Integrate data from our CRM, paid media, web analytics, social media, sales, and location data services to develop meaningful insights that inform each of these programs individually and our marketing strategy as a whole.
Create per-property reports at various cadences and present insights to marketing and property management
Regularly transfer learnings from individual properties to the full portfolio of properties to ensure best practices are adopted
Develop meaningful digital KPIs and assist properties in forecasting and tracking their progress
Develop automated data audits and quality assurance systems to ensure data accuracy
Create automated reports in Meta Ad Manager, Google Ads, Google Analytics and Iconosquare for use by you, management, and the field teams
Generate new dashboard platform requirements for our Microsoft BI dashboards
Manage UTM library and ensure adherence from media and field marketing teams

Requirements

Bachelor’s (or Master’s) degree in a technical field such as Business Analytics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Stats, etc.
3+ years of professional experience in a business analysis or data analyst role
A data storyteller, experienced with data visualization software and dashboard building (e.g., Microsoft BI, Tableau, Domo, Excel - preference for experience with Google Data Studio)
Experience with consumer CRM and email systems such as Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Constant Contact or Mail Chimp.
Experience working with UTM codes, Google Tag Manager and the Facebook tracking pixel
Experience with paid media performance data from Meta Ad Manager, Google Ads and DSPs (Trade Desk, Mediamath, Xaxis, etc.)
Strong data manipulation and analysis skills (e.g., Excel, SQL) and web analytics (GA360 preferred)
A desire to learn data automation and insights tools/processes such as ETL, SQL, Python, and R

Overview

Seventh Generation is looking for an Analyst to join our Digital Hub. This role will help coordinate and optimize the growing marketing budget across teams, channels and tactics while delivering on our marketing objectives. The mission of Seventh Generation is to inspire a consumer revolution that nurtures the health of the next Seventh Generations. By establishing a talent powerhouse that brings our principles, practices, and partnerships to life we will build the most trusted brand in the industry. This roll will uniquely touch every part of the Marketing department and will have exposure to senior leadership as we make strategic decisions to support our long term objectives.

Five Core Values At Seventh Generation

Care Wholeheartedly. We have big hearts: they are full of our love for the planet, our consumers, our people, our partners, our products, and our brand. Collaborate Deliberately. It takes a village right? Together we can achieve things that we could never have done by ourselves. Not to mention it’s a lot less lonely. Nurture Nature. Nature got it right. We know it. That’s why we aspire to design products from plants not petroleum, from fields not factories. Innovate Disruptively. If you always do what you have done you will always get what you always got. We think innovation and creativity can change the world. Be a Trusted Brand. Can a company be a friend? We like to think so. We love our consumers and we hope they love and trust us.

Responsibilities
Lead holistic budget management for Marketing, partnering across the department and Finance to deliver the year.
Guide the annual budget planning process, integrating guidance from Unilever and internal brand expectations
Coordinate the monthly budget process across the marketing budget holders
Execute budget changes in multiple systems across the home care categories
Identify risks & opportunities in the budget & work with stakeholders to adjust accordingly
Identify process improvements or automation opportunities to improve ease or accuracy in the budget process
Partner with the Media lead to build & syndicate best in class strategies for online Search across platforms and retail partners.
Coordinate with key third party vendors & agencies, including project briefings and negotiation, timeline management, budget management, project delivery and reporting.
Partner with Shopper Marketing to assure digital campaign performance, pacing, and accountability.
Work alongside Retailer Media, Email and Social Media buyers to turn marketing strategies into effective & efficient programs that unlock real value for Seventh Generation.
Generate marketing program reporting & insights to enable continuous improvement
Forge strong working relationships with key internal teams including: Finance, Brand, PR, CTI, Creative, Social Mission, and Web.

Knowledge & Skill Requirements

Excellent practical Excel skills (i.e. pivot tables, vlookup, etc.) required.
Stellar project management skills and initiative are required.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required.
Bachelor’s degree in relevant subject or the equivalent combination of education and experience with 2+ years of experience in marketing or project management role with demonstrated success.
Demonstrated understanding of and experience in digital and social media platforms and technologies preferred.
Demonstrated understanding of Seventh Generation & Unilever company mission, goals and objectives.
Must be flexible in high stress situations and be able to effectively troubleshoot.
Experience working in values-led organizations preferred
Must be able to work independently, to accomplish multiple tasks with limited direct supervision.

Key Competencies Desired

Growth Mindset: A strong focus on growth through a winning, competitive mindset. Understanding key competitors and how we would win through differentiating our mix.
Consumer & Customer Focus: Putting our consumers & customers first is a must. Distilling consumer understanding into key insights as well as understanding the customer proposition are instrumental to success.
Bias for Action: A heightened emphasis on speed and urgency in all our actions. In order to ensure our continued category leadership, the successful candidate will have to think outside the box and challenge traditional ways of working in order to ensure quick delivery.

Pay: The pay range for this position is $67,000 to $100,500. Unilever takes into consideration a wide range of factors that are utilized in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, qualifications and education, and other business and organizational needs.

Bonus: This position is bonus eligible.

Long-Term Incentive (LTI): This position is LTI eligible.

Benefits: Unilever employees are eligible to participate in our benefits plan. Should the employee choose to participate, they can choose from a range of benefits to include, but is not limited to, health insurance (including prescription drug, dental, and vision coverage), retirement savings benefits, life insurance and disability benefits, parental leave, sick leave, paid vacation and holidays, as well as access to numerous voluntary benefits. Any coverages for health insurance and retirement benefits will be in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable plans and associated governing plan documents

Unilever is an organization committed to diversity and inclusion to drive our business results and create a better future every day for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. We are looking for a razor-sharp Marketing Analyst to review and interpret market trends, customer experience, competitors’ activities, and marketing strategies for our company. Excellent research, analytical, and data interpretation skills.

Encouraged to ask questions and challenge the assumptions before starting to look for data

What You’ll Bring:

Curiosity and a passion for connecting the data dots
Enjoy working in teams to help solve brand and business challenges
A mastery over analysing data from various sources

Builder mindset who plays well with the team. We have a culture of camaraderie among our teams here at Transmission

Benefits & Perks

Company Culture Committee covering wellness, D&I, CSR and social – lots of initiatives.
Working with a young, vibrant team in a globally renowned co-working environment







We’re smart.

And have a constant urge to learn more. We encourage questions and innovative mindsets. At the same time, we value empathy and collaboration over ego. The most rewarding outcomes are achieved together.




We’re fearless.

We celebrate the diversity of thought and experiences. We push boundaries. We’re not afraid of failure. We welcome it because learning from mistakes is how we grow as people and as a company.




We’re transparent.

We earn trust by showing respect and being honest. We value the breadth and depth of each person and their story. We form a happier, healthier, more confident team because we’re open with each other and have unique ways of thinking.




This is how we drive your now and define your next. Come join us.

We are looking for a razor-sharp marketing analyst to review and interpret market trends, customer experience, competitors’ activities, and marketing strategies for our company. In this role, you must gather data, write detailed reports on findings, identify new markets, and advise upper management on marketing tactics.

To ensure success as a marketing analyst, you should have at least two years of experience in marketing, excellent mathematics and language skills, and outstanding analytical insights. Ideal candidates will have a proven aptitude for interpreting data and strong research abilities.

 

Responsibilities

Research consumer and market trends, target demographics, and competing brands.
Designing and implementing market and consumer surveys.
Gathering, analyzing, and interpreting marketing data.
Preparing detailed reports on consumer behaviour, competitors' activities, outcomes, and sales.
Monitoring customer bases and identifying new ones.
Forecasting future market, consumer, and sales trends.
Working with the marketing team to inform and develop marketing strategies.
Communicating with customers, competitors, and suppliers.
Monitoring the efficacy of marketing trends through analytical tools and software.
Keeping abreast of technological advancements, market trends, and consumer behaviour.




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, social sciences, marketing, or a similar field.
2+ years experience working in marketing.
Additional related short courses are beneficial.
Good knowledge of analytical software, such as SAS, SPSS, and Google Analytics.
Proficiency with computer programs like MS Excel, Access, and PowerPoint.
Excellent research, analytical, and data interpretation skills.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
Familiarity with survey tools, CRM programs, and databases.
Strong organizational and time-management skills.
Ability to communicate complex information in an easy-to-understand format.
