Role Purpose




Reporting to the Head of Marketing Analytics, the Marketing Analyst is responsible for providing vital insights to help drive business decisions through quantitative and qualitative analysis.




You will be joining the organisation from its infancy and therefore play a key role in creating a complete reporting suite consisting of dashboards and visualisations that will enable our marketing teams to monitor & optimise their acquisition & retention activities across paid and owned media.




The successful candidate will work closely with a number of stakeholders across marketing, including acquisition managers, regional marketing leads, CRM, product & proposition managers. You will have the ability to identify opportunities for growth and clearly document and communicate performance, insight, and recommendations to key stakeholders.




Key Responsibilities




Understand the full acquisition journey and provide visibility of each stage of the funnel, identifying areas of opportunity and waste.
Support various members of the acquisition marketing team to make informed decisions through the provision of timely, relevant, and practical insight and analytics
Create and maintain a complete reporting suite consisting of dashboards, visualisations, and regular automated reports on engagement, channel health, and other key performance indicators.
Understanding long term customer behaviour looking at factors such as customer lifecycle, RFM and segmentation based on both internal and external data
Working on analysing digital channels such as PPC, Paid Social, Display, SEO etc as well as traditional CRM channels
Support the identification of marketing wastage (e.g. through poorly performing campaigns, or through bonus abuse).
Assist in the development of targeting and segmentation models
Identify opportunities for profitable growth
Optimise marketing and bonus spend to support maximum ROAS
Take complex analysis and present insights and recommendations to senior stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Manage timelines to ensure your senior stakeholders are aware of key deliverables
Working with the wider business you’ll help improve the quality and variety of our data, where applicable.




Specialist Skills and Experience Required




Experience with web analytical and reporting tools including Google Analytics4, Adwords, Tag Manager, Meta Ads Manager, etc.
Data manipulation and modelling tools such as advanced Excel skills, SQL/MySQL, Big Query. Python an advantage but not required.
Experience with data visualisation tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker/Data Studio
3-5+ years of data analytics experience, marketing analytics strongly preferred.
Deep knowledge of digital marketing across website, app and owned media as well as search (natural & paid), social, display, and programmatic platforms
Highly analytical, strategic, and detail-oriented, with a commitment to excellence and a passion for understanding the business.
Excellent understanding of the various attribution methodologies (eg: LT, MTA)
Strength in storytelling and sense-making, demonstrated ability to transition seamlessly from complex analyses to simple/precise business implications.
Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills
Strong communication and presentation skills
A proactive approach with the ability to work in an ever-changing environment.

Credit Karma is a mission-driven company, focused on championing financial progress for our more than 110 million members in the U.S., Canada and U.K. While we're best known for pioneering free credit scores, our members turn to us for tips as they work on their financial goals, including helping them monitor their credit, identity monitoring, searching for credit cards, shopping for loans (car, home and personal), and growing their savings* -- all for free. Credit Karma has grown significantly through the years: we've added more than 70 million members in the last five years alone and now have more than 1,100 employees across our offices in Oakland, Charlotte, Los Angeles and London.

Banking services provided by MVB Bank, Inc., Member FDIC

We're seeking a driven, results­-oriented, problem solver to join the Analytics team. In this role, you will use your analytical and strategic experience to create data-driven business recommendations that drive key product and marketing decisions or deepen relations with our partners (startup fintechs to the largest financial institutions in the world). This role has high­ visibility and will contribute meaningfully to Credit Karma's growth in delivering value for our members and partners.

What You'll Do

Leverage internal and external data to develop business recommendations that generate value for Credit Karma and our partners
Conduct analyses and design tests to support new launches, drive improvements to existing features, and inform the product and marketing roadmaps
Partner with engineering and business intelligence to ensure proper tracking instrumentation of new products and tests
Develop learning agendas and test plans to support agile, data-driven decision-making
Perform exploratory analysis to generate hypotheses, identify gaps, and size opportunities for new features or partner strategies
Unlike some analytics functions, you are not a service provider. You're a thought leader to the business, owning end-to-end analytic work streams, defining success and performance metrics, and delivering actionable insights and recommendations for cross functional groups and partners

Minimum Basic Requirement

4+ years of analytics experience and BS/MS in Math, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Data Science, Marketing, or Finance
2+ years of experience with SQL
2+ years of experience with A/B testing and/or statistical analysis
2+ years of experience with data visualization tools such as Looker/Tableau for insight synthesis and presentation

Preferred Qualifications

Fintech, financial services, consulting or a similar strategic or analytical experience
Exposure to Python and/or R
Experience with software development, especially in building automation
Ability to communicate qualitative and quantitative results clearly, succinctly and confidently in verbal and written communications
Strong problem-solver able to identify opportunities for growth or improvement to advance the goals of our both our partners and our business
Ability to independently thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and often ambiguous work environment
Ability to work cross functionally and assert influence internally/externally

Pay Transparency Notice: Credit Karma’s mission of championing financial progress for all starts from within. That’s why we implemented role-based compensation, which ensures people who are in the same role receive the same pay with variations for geographic location only. It’s all part of a more comprehensive DEI strategy that helps level the playing field. The base salary range for this role is $95,604 to $164,232, plus equity and benefits.

Credit Karma is also committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment because it is the right thing to do. We believe that such an environment advances long-term professional growth, creates a robust business, and supports our mission of championing financial progress for everyone. We offer generous benefits and perks with a single eye to nourishing an inclusive environment that recognizes the contributions of all and fosters diversity by supporting our internal Employee Resource Groups. We’ve worked hard to build an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and the opportunity for professional growth. As part of the Credit Karma team, your voice will be heard, your contributions will matter, and your unique background and experiences will be celebrated.

Play a critical role in the Group’s customer acquisition strategy in Asia.
Support the building and delivery of emails for Qantas and Jetstar in Southeast Asia and Greater China.
Permanent, full time opportunity based in Singapore.




While we operate in an unpredictable industry, we thrive on uncertainty and are always ready for a challenge. We take a commercial mindset to all we do, ensuring we make strategic decisions that live up to customer expectations. To be different, we need to create. It’s our willingness to try new things and our commitment to learn from mistakes that gives us the courage to push the boundaries.




As an Email Marketing Analyst, you will report to the Manager, Marketing Channels and support the building and delivery of emails for Qantas and Jetstar in Southeast Asia and Greater China.




This role is critical to the Group’s customer acquisition strategy in Asia, working closely with the regional Marketing team to grow active subscribers, deliver sales and marketing messaging via our email channels, and optimise both audience and channel performance.




In the role, you will be required to:

Build, contribute to, and deliver specific email and digital activity across the Asia Marketing team including retail, trade, airline loyalty and ancillaries for Southeast Asia and Greater China as relevant.
Work closely and collaborate with the Marketing team and agencies to integrate approved creative/content.
Monitor and support the ongoing delivery of new email tech and functionality for both airlines in Asia.
Develop new processes and optimise existing process to ensure continuous improvement and effective delivery of email and content.
Ensure that all tasks and responsibilities comply and conform to relevant regulatory and quality requirements and Company policies and standards.




To be successful in this role, you will have:

Sound experience and knowledge in the marketing/advertising field, including up to 3 years digital or email experience.
Strong interpersonal, communication, problem solving and time management skills.
The ability to work under pressure, prioritise tasks & meet deadlines.
Take ownership of, and personal accountability for decisions and actions.
A high level of computer literacy & proficiency in company approved software and applications.
Some knowledge on HTML, relational databases and email marketing platforms would be a bonus
Strong attention to detail and a passion for delivering superior customer experiences through email.
Enthusiasm for insights and data marketing together with the ability to work in a collaborative and dynamic audience led marketing environment.




Why Qantas?

You’ll join a team where creativity and passion are encouraged. Our people come together to allow us to dream big and deliver successfully.




There are many different opportunities across our team, which means you’ll be able to grow both personally and professionally at Qantas. Your development is a priority for us – so that you can maintain the high standards our customers have come to expect and can continue to develop over time. You’ll be supported from day 1 with on the job training and coaching as well as our formal training opportunities. While you may start in this role, we’ve got a great track record of supporting our people to take their career in so many different directions, the destinations are endless.




The Qantas employee benefits program offers amazing benefits that extend well beyond travel.

We love to travel: Enjoy heavily discounted air travel within Australia and across the globe, both for you and your family and friends, as well as exclusive deals on accommodation and holidays.
We have flexible leave options: Make use of leave and flexible working opportunities including 14 weeks paid parental leave and the option to purchase additional paid leave for eligible employees.
We’ll give you access to thousands of rewards: Through our partnerships we can offer you discounts across shopping, food and wine, insurance, health and wellbeing, leisure and entertainment. You can also take advantage of our salary packaging program including motor vehicles, eligible portable electronic devices and professional memberships.
We’ll support your wellbeing: Whether it’s learning to better support your own and others’ mental health, our interactive wellbeing app or your very own tailored nutrition plan.

Maserati produces a complete range of unique cars with an amazing personality, immediately recognizable anywhere. With their style, technology, and innately exclusive character, they delight the most discerning, demanding tastes and have always been a global automotive industry benchmark. A tradition of successful cars, each of them redefining what makes an Italian sports car in terms of design, performance, comfort, elegance, and safety, currently available on more than seventy markets internationally.




Powered by Passion. Unique by Design. Innovative by Nature. Masters of Italian Audacity.




With an Italian History and as Global Icon, Maserati is now looking for new talents to join the #Maserati Family.










MISSION




Maserati is looking for a proactive and self-organized Product Marketing Pricing Intern that, supporting the Pricing Responsible, will take part in the pricing approval process in order to meet the requested deadlines, ensuring the interaction between the involved departments (Product Planning, Finance, Sales Operations, Regions).







MAIN ACTIVITIES




Preparing the pricing papers for all the markets, while being involved in discussing the pricing proposals with the Regions and supporting Finance team in the analysis for approval
Ensuring, during the pricing approval process, the accomplishment of the Pricing Power and profitability targets
Preparing and releasing the price lists for New Models, MYs, product updates, Special Series
Providing support in the definition of commercial parameters (prices, optional take rate, sales incentives) for Program Approvals
Monitoring the Pricing Power and competitiveness of Maserati models and main competitors' pricing activities and support the Product Managers in the definition of the Quarterly actions to achieve commercial and financial targets
Monitoring prices and options take rate by Region







REQUIREMENTS




Degree in Economics, Business Administration or Engineering
Fluency in English and Italian
Proficiency with MS Office (especially Excel and PowerPoint) and/or the Google Suite
Excellent analytical skills and a sharp eye for details
Being timely and data-driven
Personal interest for Automotive industry, Luxury world, and Digital evolution will be considered a strong plus










WHAT WE OFFER




This is a paid Internship with a duration of 6 months.




Being part of the Maserati family will give you the chance to work within an international work environment, contributing to several projects in cooperation with different teams. You’ll be able to work remotely and by a flexible schedule.










OUR RECRUITMENT PROCESS




As a first step, your CV will go through our screening: feel free to customize it to express who you are and to tell us about your most relevant experiences and characteristics but remember that we do appreciate clarity and synthesis.




We will also be glad to read any cover letter you wish to submit.




In case your profile is aligned to the position, the Talent Acquisition team will get in touch with you for a first call where we will know each other; you will tell us something more about yourself and your interest in Maserati, while we will be available to answer your questions.




If there seems to be a good fit between your characteristics and the job, you will be asked to take part in Maserati Digital Assessment, our last step: an exciting day, held online, of group activities in the morning and an interview with your hiring manager in the afternoon. No need to prepare, just get ready to show your true self.




We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our employees. We aim to encourage a culture where people can be themselves and be valued for their contribution. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process as required. Please add any adjustment requests to your application.







Join Maserati World.

The world of esports is growing and so are we!

Our Digital Platform Marketing team needs your passion for optimization, your one-team spirit, and your analytical skills. We are looking to hire an SEO & Marketing Analyst to join us in shaping the future of gaming.

We value individuals who bring their unique capabilities, flair, and desire to the table, all while being a true team player. We believe that your attributes can make a difference in the EFG blueprint of esports and only hope that while on that journey, you continue to learn and develop with the tools we provide.

At EFG (ESL FaceIt Group) we create worlds beyond gameplay, where players and fans become a community. We pride ourselves in having a corporate social responsibility which is that “IT’S NOT GG, UNTIL IT’S GG FOR ALL”. Our passion, craft, and DNA are aligned to create and shape the world of esports, gaming tournaments, leagues, events, and holistic ecosystems through our millions of players, fans, and heroes, as well as through our people, and culture. This is one of many reasons why EFG is a magical workplace, where anything is possible, and where you will thrive and experience a game-changing career.

As an SEO & Marketing Analyst, you will be responsible for driving relevant traffic to FACEIT through SEO activity and analysis of digital behaviour. You will be the driving force behind our SEO approach and come equipped with knowledge, enthusiasm and passion to build a strategy that impacts marketing objectives. You will also work across other channels to analyze effectiveness of activity and campaigns, providing insight and recommendations to further our digital marketing strategy. The ideal candidate is someone who not only has strong SEO, analytics and reporting skills; but someone who also goes above and beyond to be proactive and show how analytics can help the big picture when it comes to achieving wider objectives.

What you’ll do:

Create, manage and execute the FACEIT SEO strategy
Monitor and optimize on-going activity accordingly, based on analysis of behavior
Analyze sales funnels and customer intent to help wider marketing decision making
Collaborate with the digital platform and product marketing teams to optimize FACEIT for search purposes
Collaborate with the data team to ensure our tracking tools are set for purpose for marketing analysis
Be a key stakeholder in the management of our Google Analytics 360 account
Monitor and report on performance of paid search campaigns
Communicate updates and reports efficiently for internal stakeholders
Keep up to date with new trends and best SEO practices


Hypothetical breakdown of the role and responsibilities:

30% Coordination and implementation of search engine optimisation tactics
30% Insight analysis of all performance marketing tactics
20% Reporting for internal stakeholders
10% Management of our Google Analytics account
10% Management of third party agencies


Application information:

Do you feel ready for the challenge of working at @EFG? Join us for a game-changing career where we will be shaping the journey of esports together with diversity and inclusion. We encourage you to apply by filling in our application form including your earliest starting date and your desired salary.

Please apply by adding the requested documents CV or your cover letter in English language and preferably in PDF format.

Our Recruitment Process – What to expect?

Our recruitment team is committed to carefully reviewing and evaluating your application for this role. We will look at your past studies, work experience, overall passions, as well as your personal relationship with games, to help us gauge the connection between these points and the criteria set forth by our hiring manager for this role.

You can expect to be invited for an interview if your experience matches and/or an email notification containing feedback if you didn’t qualify for this round. Either way, you will hear from us!

About us @EFG:

EFG is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Each of our brands play a significant role in creating worlds beyond gameplay.

They build, connect and nurture beyond game ecosystems to unlock more fun, fame, and fortune for gamers across the globe.

At ESL we create worlds where everybody can be somebody
At FACEIT we create a world where the community has the power to shape video games

Maserati produces a complete range of unique cars with an amazing personality, immediately recognizable anywhere. With their style, technology, and innately exclusive character, they delight the most discerning, demanding tastes and have always been a global automotive industry benchmark. A tradition of successful cars, each of them redefining what makes an Italian sports car in terms of design, performance, comfort, elegance, and safety, currently available on more than seventy markets internationally.




Powered by Passion. Unique by Design. Innovative by Nature. Masters of Italian Audacity.




With an Italian History and as Global Icon, Maserati is now looking for new talents to join the #Maserati Family.




MISSION




Maserati is looking for a proactive and self-organized Product Marketing Pricing Intern that, supporting the Pricing Responsible, will take part in the pricing approval process in order to meet the requested deadlines, ensuring the interaction between the involved departments (Product Planning, Finance, Sales Operations, Regions).




MAIN ACTIVITIES




Preparing the pricing papers for all the markets, while being involved in discussing the pricing proposals with the Regions and supporting Finance team in the analysis for approval
Ensuring, during the pricing approval process, the accomplishment of the Pricing Power and profitability targets
Preparing and releasing the price lists for New Models, MYs, product updates, Special Series
Providing support in the definition of commercial parameters (prices, optional take rate, sales incentives) for Program Approvals
Monitoring the Pricing Power and competitiveness of Maserati models and main competitors' pricing activities and support the Product Managers in the definition of the Quarterly actions to achieve commercial and financial targets
Monitoring prices and options take rate by Region




Requirements




Degree in Economics, Business Administration or Engineering
Fluency in English and Italian
Proficiency with MS Office (especially Excel and PowerPoint) and/or the Google Suite
Excellent analytical skills and a sharp eye for details
Being timely and data-driven
Personal interest for Automotive industry, Luxury world, and Digital evolution will be considered a strong plus




What We Offer




This is a paid Internship with a duration of 6 months.




Being part of the Maserati family will give you the chance to work within an international work environment, contributing to several projects in cooperation with different teams. You’ll be able to work remotely and by a flexible schedule.




OUR RECRUITMENT PROCESS




As a first step, your CV will go through our screening: feel free to customize it to express who you are and to tell us about your most relevant experiences and characteristics but remember that we do appreciate clarity and synthesis.




We will also be glad to read any cover letter you wish to submit.




In case your profile is aligned to the position, the Talent Acquisition team will get in touch with you for a first call where we will know each other; you will tell us something more about yourself and your interest in Maserati, while we will be available to answer your questions.




If there seems to be a good fit between your characteristics and the job, you will be asked to take part in Maserati Digital Assessment, our last step: an exciting day, held online, of group activities in the morning and an interview with your hiring manager in the afternoon. No need to prepare, just get ready to show your true self.




We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our employees. We aim to encourage a culture where people can be themselves and be valued for their contribution. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process as required. Please add any adjustment requests to your application.




Join Maserati World.

We're on the lookout for a passionate Senior Marketing Analyst to join our Analytics & Insight team. You'll be working with data from different sources to provide insights that'll help us make better business decisions. From generating reports to carrying out research projects, you'll be providing the Marketing team and CMO with the info they need to stay ahead of the game. You'll be using tools like Google Analytics and SQL to extract data from various sources and also be dealing with tag management and event tracking.

This is a remote, UK based role and the hours of work are 40 hours per week. The salary range will be £40,000-£50,000 per annum dependent on experience, plus discretionary bonus.

Responsbilities

Analyse data, create reports and dashboards
Acquire and maintain data from various sources and the reports that come with them
Identify patterns and trends within complex data sets
Share insights with the team to help them make data informed decisions
Work with the CMO to gather data requirements for new marketing activities
Seek out new process improvement opportunities


Requirements

3-5 years of experience in a marketing-specific environment (agency experience is a bonus)
Detailed knowledge of digital marketing channels and associated metrics
Ability to produce high-quality automated reports and dashboards
Experience with BI tools and web analytics packages
Knowledge of statistics, econometrics, and data science is a plus
Strong analytical skills with great attention to detail and accuracy
Eagerness to learn new systems and analytics tools
A degree in Mathematics, Economics or Statistics would be useful, but it's not required.


Benefits

As well as 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays, pension scheme and bonus scheme, we invest in:

Your Learning and development

Keen and curious? From conferences to courses, you’ll be guided and cheered on to grow personally and professionally.

House and pet sitting

We actively encourage all of our team members to go Housesitting whenever possible, offering stipends and flexible working opportunities to help make this happen.

Part of the family

Find a rescue pet to join your family and we'll cover the adoption fees, as well as pawternity to help any pet settle into their new home.

Health and wellbeing

We offer "Simply Health" to all employees, offering paid cover for a variety of medical appointments and treatments including dental. Our team are trusted, we all work remotely, and flexibly, to times that suit us.

Tech and Tools

At TrustedHousesitters, there’s a MacBook Pro for every team member and an annual budget for improving your home office.

Fun and games

We have regular company and team social events, both online and in-person, which gives our remote team an opportunity to connect and celebrate our successes.

About TrustedHousesitters

TrustedHousesitters is a global marketplace that is disrupting the pet care and travel industries. We connect a community of home and pet owners with sitters to solve a common two-sided problem - pet care and cost-effective travel. Customers join for one annual fee. After that, sits take place as a trust-based, money-free exchange that sees owners enjoy worry-free travel while our sitters enjoy the company of pets and unlock a world of unique accommodation.

We enjoy exceptional customer retention rates driven by the fact that our owners and sitters realise the amazing value and incredible experiences we can facilitate.

We're fully in scale-up mode and have grown to be the only global platform of its kind. In the last few years, we’ve consistently achieved high year-on-year growth, and have remained resilient throughout the COVID-19 crisis. The USA has become our biggest market, followed by the UK and Australia.

We made the transition to a remote-first business in March 2020 and haven’t looked back. We now have a distributed team across the UK and Brazil. We host quarterly, all expenses paid, company events in Brighton.

We are transforming the pet care and travel landscape. We believe we offer the best solution and our team is united by our commitment to delivering an enriching experience for our customers and having a positive impact on the lives of their pets.

This is Worldline

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland. We are in every corner of the world, in every part of commerce. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.










The Opportunity




As Marketing reporting analyst, you will become part of the Benelux Business Intelligence Team, to lift our data analysis and the quality of it to the next level, and to support the different departments within the Sales & Marketing organization in the best possible way with qualitative and accessible data.




You will join a team of experienced colleagues, for whom the complex systems and the rapidly growing world of electronic payments hold few secrets, and who are ready to share their experience with you.










Day-to-Day Responsibilities​




Provide database and analytical support for multiple initiatives, projects, and programs.
Design, implement and deliver reports and analyses to support customer-focused, data-driven analysis.
Perform data analyses using appropriate Business Intelligence tools and graphical display standards.
Retrieve and analyse data and communicate reports for use in supporting operations and business objectives.
Analyse, summarize and present information and data for discussion and decision making.













Who We Are Looking For




Higher education, preferably related to business intelligence, information analysis, economics or similar
An advanced level in Microsoft Excel is required, experience with PowerQuery is a strong plus
A first experience with/knowledge of BI Tools (eg Cognos, Webfocus, Power BI,…), and an understanding of SQL is a very strong plus
You are fluent in English and Dutch or French
You enjoy working with data and you have an interest on how data analysis can help to make quality decisions that will change business results.
You have strong listening skills and know how to understand the expectations and the needs of the end users. You can translate their needs into clear reportings, understandable and accessible visualisations and tables.
You have very strong analytical skills, but also a commercial mindset. You can make connections between collected data, and know how to identify opportunities.
You are result oriented and critical, but also client oriented and communicative.
You are eager to learn, with a proactive attitude to improve personal skills and competences.
You are not afraid of deadlines.













Perks & Benefits




At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:




Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career.
Receive an attractive salary package with extra-legal benefits like meal vouchers, a collective bonus, group and hospitalisation insurance, transport allowance, flexible working hours and remote working possibilities (hybrid model), etc…













Shape the evolution




We are on an exciting journey towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers, people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. With an empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career - wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of 18,000 innovators and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.




Learn more about life at Worldline at careers.worldline.com

In this varied role, you will be responsible for evaluating the impact of digital channel activations on Village footfall, providing insights to support the optimisation of Bicester Village’s digital presence. There’s no one quite like us

The Bicester Collection are the worlds’ leading luxury shopping destinations, and we are committed to creating magical and memorable experiences for our guests. Taking the name of the founding Village, The Bicester Collection distinguishes the 11 Villages in Europe and China as one collection of destinations for our guests, our brand partners, our travel and tourism partners, our corporate and financial media, and our internal teams.




What you will be doing




Analysing, dashboarding and ad hoc queries using Google Analytics
Reporting of web analytics
Preparing weekly/monthly/quarterly performance reports, analysing site trends, improvements, weaknesses, as necessary to support key stakeholders
Building and maintaining dashboards for business leaders to effectively monitor the performance in real time
Coordinating more formalized reporting structure and calendar of deliverables
Summarising insights from analysis and clearly communicate analytical findings in a cohesive story and articulate an argument to be presented to the business
Analysing a wide range of historical data and presenting findings as trend analyses which inform the business, forecast forward where appropriate
Real-time analysis on external market trends and brand performance
Working in partnership with the CRM analytics team, Retail analytics team, and Central analytics team to develop online attribution and customer segmentation models to improve our online marketing effectiveness
Providing support to the Deputy Digital Director and channel Managers (Social, Website, Paid Media) to drive key optimisations

What makes you special

Integrating digital marketing, digital and CRM metrics







Why we’re exceptional

The key to our success is the quality and commitment of our people. To work in one of the teams at any of the Villages is to play an active role in redefining both the art and the science of retail. This creates a dynamic approach that underpins our ability to anticipate future trends in a fast changing world. In return for your Authenticity, Critical Thinking, Innovation, Passion and Vision, you’ll receive a generous salary and we’ll also reward you by:




Looking after you: You’re entitled to extra leave if you are moving or if it’s your birthday. We provide above industry average life assurance cover, personal travel insurance, private healthcare and flu vaccinations.




Treating you: discounts throughout our villages, discounts with other retailers (known as My Choices) and a very generous employee referral bonus







Championing you: you’ll be working within a creative and collaborative environment like no other, with the opportunity to develop your professional and personal skills while advancing your career.




Come and live your story with us

NO EXPERIENCE NEEDED
Hungry: Must be excited about learning new skills in digital marketing

The role




In this new and exciting role of Senior Marketing Analyst, you’ll play a vital role in supporting our Direct Business team through enhancement and optimisation of our customer contact strategy with targeted customer profiling and selections.




Working across the key business areas of Small Business and Enterprise, you’ll collaborate with our Sales and Marketing teams, supporting new acquisition sales growth and our in-life customer base management strategy.




As a Senior Marketing Analyst, this is your chance to make a real difference, where great performance will take you far. It’s an exciting and challenging role which promises a high level of autonomy and great opportunities for you, and our business, especially if you’re ready to be part of our hugely exciting journey to develop a best-in-class data team here at TalkTalk.




The team




You’ll be joining a highly skilled and expanding team, with a diverse range of specialisms using cutting-edge technologies and techniques that offer a great opportunity to learn and develop within our Data community.




We’ve created a working environment where you can be yourself and give your all, where you’ll be called upon to outthink the competition and work closely with your colleagues to come up with new ideas and deliver great results for our customers.




Key responsibilities




You’ll understand complex data sources and turn these into meaningful and actionable contact strategies, whilst analysing datasets against campaign criteria and performance to identify continuous improvement opportunities.
Improving ROI and CLV through targeted segmentation that supports both New Acquisition Strategy and our customer in-life Base Management strategy, you’ll incorporate Next Best Action and propensity modelling whilst quantifying business impact.
You’ll optimise marketing automation and integrate lead nurturing journeys across our Prospect and Customer Bases, particularly where overall engagement to sales lead time is longer, and adopt a test-and-learn approach, using the data to guide you to strategic recommendations.

Proven as Senior Campaign Analyst, Senior Marketing Analyst or similar, and confident using SQL to create, query and utilise datasets for delivery in marketing campaigns.
Proactive and analytical, with a fine eye for detail, understanding how campaigns are set up and how data can be refined and utilised to make strategic recommendations.
Strong commercial acumen to understand how data impacts on marketing ROI/campaign results.
Thrives in a fast-paced, high-energy environment, whilst being calm under pressure without compromising on quality standards.
Excellent communication and listening skills, high levels of emotional intelligence and recognising the value of collaboration.




Desirable:




Marketing and/or telecoms experience.
Exposure to Microsoft Azure & Databricks
PowerBI.
Python / R / SAS.
Digital Analytics capability (GA360, Adobe etc).

Who We Are

As a part of the broader marketing organization, the Wayfair Integrated Marketing team is responsible for increasing awareness and establishing deeper connections with our consumers through omni-channel campaigns and key storytelling moments, further fueling our marketing flywheel. Within this team sits Marketing Campaign Strategy, tasked with bringing to life omni-channel strategies for promotional events, brand campaigns, and seasonal go-to-market plans. We aim to create consumer interest, increase brand awareness, drive traffic, and build brand affinity.

This role will report into the Manager, Marketing Campaign Strategy to support the end-to-end production of omni-channel campaigns across Wayfair North America. In addition, you'll work cross-functionally with Marketing, Creative, Brand, and Promotions teams.

Along with driving seamless project execution in a fast-paced, fiercely prioritized environment, the role will also include an element of performance analysis to inform future project and business decisions. The Marketing Campaign Strategy team has a robust list of exciting, impact-driving initiatives on their roadmap for the year and is looking for someone equally as enthusiastic about the opportunity to hit the ground running.

What You’ll Do

Project management & day-to-day execution for multiple campaigns - responsibilities include, but are not limited to: clear, timely and effective progress on campaign planning, consolidating feedback for creative delivery, organizing campaign assets for efficient and on time launches, and running dashboard communications and recap creation to have a holistic campaign view.
Creative management, providing creative feedback and consolidating creative feedback from multiple stakeholders.
Collaborate effectively with numerous internal and external partners to stand up omni-channel campaigns; this includes but is not limited to: Marketing teams, Creative, Creative Operations, Merchandising, Promotions, and Brand.
Drive operational efficiencies and process improvements for the team.
Performs a variety of production-related and project-management-related coordination tasks in support of online advertising, including gathering creative elements needed for campaigns, updating budget tracking, analyzing results, and providing suggestions based on working knowledge of advertising and marketing fundamentals.
Share learnings with relevant cross-functional leaders by compiling campaign-specific recaps.
Conduct market research to stay abreast of market and competitor trends and tactics.

What You’ll Need

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field with a strong academic record.
2+ years prior work experience in a marketing / project management / business environment; retail or home decor space preferred.
Strong written and verbal communication; excellent collaboration skills.
Detail-oriented mindset.
Experience managing and coordinating projects start to finish.
Savvy, quick & creative thinking - comfortable in a dynamic, sometimes ambiguous, fast-moving environment.
Flexibility - can adapt to changes in priorities nimbly and manage multiple projects/tasks simultaneously.
Attitude of a true team player – positive, enthusiastic, willingness to learn and self-motivating/self-starting.

Job Description Overview




Why OCTA:




Discover work that moves you in a dynamic and innovative setting. Be part of a team delivering Orange County’s transportation network of today and creating a vision for the future.




OCTA is the county’s transportation planning commission and public transit operator. With a focus on safety and accountability, we plan, fund, and implement countywide projects that include bus and rail transit, freeways and express lanes, rideshare, microtransit, paratransit, active transportation, and environmental programs.




We’re passionate about creating a balanced, equitable and sustainable transportation system that reflects the diverse travel needs of the county’s 34 cities and 3.2 million residents.




Our employees rated OCTA as a top workplace in Orange County. Come join us on our mission of keeping Orange County moving.




Overview




Under general direction, assists in driving the development, administration, research, analysis, and reporting of various marketing programs. Supports continuous improvement of OCTA’s innovative, multi-channel marketing and outreach programs at all stages: by pre-campaign research of opportunities, audiences and market segmentation, establishment of campaign objectives and goals, supporting campaigns during implementation with both regular and real-time reporting, and assisting in developing post-campaign analysis of results, effectiveness and return on investment.




This is a non-exempt position in Salary Grade M: Min $30.35 – Mid $36.48 – Max $42.60 per hour. The starting salary will be within this range based on qualifications.




The application deadline for this position is March 8, 2023.




Responsibilities




This list is intended to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification and is not designed to be interpreted as an exhaustive listing of all tasks required of employees assigned to this job.




Displays High Integrity & Honesty: Takes personal responsibility, acts with honesty and consistency.




Has Technical and Professional Expertise: Has the technicial skills, product knowledge and professional skills to the job.




Conducts market and customer research, data analysis, and reporting for marketing and outreach projects in support of OCTA’s transportation programs and services. Assists in the development of survey instruments.
Under general direction, prepares analytics reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data from various sources including website analytics, customer data reports, and OCTA-specific data sources for pass sales and ridership.
Conducts research identifying market trends and supports targeted marketing content creation.
Presents findings, results and recommendations to customers, management, and executive leadership.
Ensures accuracy and integrity of findings and reports by confirming data source accuracy using sampling, exception reporting, comparison to historical trends, and discussion with key staff.




Takes Initiative: Initiates new programs, processes, relationships, or technologies to accomplish goals.




Works as part of a team to evaluate/suggest either new or existing data sources, software, technologies, and techniques to continue to improve the insights, accuracy, or development speed of program reporting.




Drives for Results: Operates with speed and intensity, translates long-term goals into immediate actions.




Participates in ongoing optimization of marketing program performance including development of market analysis and insights and identification of opportunities for growth.
Prepares, reviews, and maintains a variety of records, reports, and dashboards to track ongoing performance for programs and services. Analyzes data to identify statistical and trend information and makes recommendations to management to help optimize marketing programs.




Solves Problems & Analyzes Issues: Has and applies problem analysis and problem-solving skills on a technical and interpersonal level.




Solves problems, addresses analytical issues, and examines large data sets.




Qualifications




Any combination of education and experience equivalent to a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Communications, Marketing, Data Science, Statistics or related areas and a minimum of three years of experience in data analytics and marketing. Two or more years of data analytics/quantitative field work experience is preferred. Experience with public transportation or marketing analytics is highly valued.




Working Conditions/Physical Activities




(The physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by the employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. OCTA provides reasonable accommodation to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions).

Requires ability to understand verbal communication and to respond effectively.

Compensation And Benefits




OCTA offers an attractive compensation and benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision health insurance programs, flex time (may be available), paid sick leave, paid vacation and holidays, short-term and long-term disability, life insurance, flexible spending accounts, retirement, deferred compensation plan, educational reimbursement, excellent in-house training programs, free transportation passes for the employee and dependents, wellness and ergonomic programs, and much more. OCTA has a hybrid remote work program. Eligibility is dependent on manager’s approval.

The candidate is responsible for being commercially-minded and driving room bookings and covers in the hotel’s restaurants and bars through online and offline marketing activity, partnerships and social media.




Key Areas




Marketing

The Shangri-La Hotel London is located in the Shard, Western Europe’s tallest building. We are the first elevated luxury hotel in the city, bringing our roots in Asian hospitality to the West. Company Description: PT Serasi Autoraya ( SERA ) adalah anak perusahaan PT Astra International Tbk yang saat ini telah dikenal luas sebagai salah satu perusahaan layanan transportasi dan logistik terbesar di Indonesia. SERA yang pada awalnya perusahaan jasa penyewaan kendaraan, kini telah menjelma menjadi perusahaan penyedia transportasi yang terbesar dan terdepan. SOLUSI DALAM BIDANG PENYEWAAN KENDARAAN SERA yang merupakan salah satu perusahaan transportasi terbesar di Indonesia kini menawarkan solusi transportasi yang berintegrasi dengan TRAC-Astra. Melalui lini bisnisnya ini, SERA menawarkan solusi terbaik bagi para pelanggannya dalam bidang transportasi dengan memberikan jasa penyewaan kendaraan untuk korporasi maupun perorangan. Melalui TRAC, tersedia pula layanan sewa kendaraan yang akan memudahkan para pelanggannya yang ingin menyewa mobil untuk mobilitas mereka. Selain itu, tersedia pula fasilitas pelayanan pengemudi yang akan bekerja secara profesional dan berkualitas sehingga memungkinkan Anda untuk menikmati perjalanan yang aman dan nyaman. SOLUSI JUAL-BELI KENDARAAN BEKAS SERA juga memberikan solusi bagi para pelanggan yang ingin jual-beli kendaraan bekas melalui mobil88. mobil88 adalah pemegang pimpinan dalam bisnis jual-beli kendaraan bekas di Indonesia. Terbukti dengan hadirnya 21 cabang perusahaan yang tersebar di banyak kota di Indonesia membuat mobill88 berhasil menjual ribuan unit kendaraan setiap tahunnya. mobil88 memberikan jaminan bagi para pelanggannya dengan menawarkan fasilitas buyback sehingga para pelanggan merasa aman saat melakukan transaksi jual-belI. Anda tak perlu khawatir saat akan melakukan proses penjualan maupun pembelian kendaraan bekas karena para staff yang handal dan berpengalaman akan memandu Anda secara profesional. SOLUSI DALAM LELANG KENDARAAN Sebagai satu perusahaan transportasi besar di Indonesia, SERA juga membuka kesempatan bagi Anda yang ingin membeli kendaraan dengan cara lelang. Berintegrasi dengan IBID-Balai Lelang Serasi, yang merupakan balai lelang yang akan memberikan solusi terbaik bagi Anda yang ingin membeli kendaraan roda empat serta berbagai macam produk otomotif lainnya melalui proses pelelangan. SOLUSI TRANSPORTASI SECARA KOMPREHENSIF DENGAN ASTRA FMS Melalui Astra FMS, SERA memberikan solusi transportasi yang menyeluruh dengan berbasis pada penggunaan teknologi dan informasi yang canggih. Pengelolaan proses transportasi akan semakin efektif, efisien, dan aman. AstraFMS telah teruji secara efektif dalam berbagai lini bisnis yang dijalankan SERA, yang mana di dalamnya terdapat fitur-fitur yang membuat para pelanggan mudah dalam mengelola transportasi, memantau kendaraan secara real time, meminimalkan waktu downtime, menganalisa kinerja pengemudi, serta membuat biaya operasional kendaran lebih efisien. At Kelly® Professional & Industrial, we’re passionate about helping you find a job that works for you. If you ask us, this job looks pretty great.




We are seeking a Product Planning Marketing Analyst V for a company based in Columbus, IN!




Schedule: Hybrid (1 day in office/4 days remote)

**Candidate must be local to Columbus, IN to be considered**




Assignment: 9-month contract with possibility of extension/conversion




Pay: $50.46/hour




Travel: none




OBJECTIVE




Define the aftermarket product strategy for the New Power Business Unit and develop the aftermarket product plan/roadmap. Balance competing current day needs vs long-term investments.




RESPONSIBILITIES




Develop strong partnerships with NRP and NPBU functional teams (commercial product management, product engineering, manufacturing, quality, purchasing, finance, plant operations) to build the business case for remanufactured products.




Participate in the annual Roadmap to Reman (R2R) process to develop the multiyear plan of remanufactured product introductions.




Maintain and update the multi-year remanufacturing plan, and communicate the plan across the NRP and NPBU organizations, including plants and functional leaders.

Be the aftermarket representative/voice across functions with the New Power Business unit, including an active participant in PPP/PPT/VPI projects as an extended core team member.




Drive awareness and execution of aftermarket requirements per the Life Cycle Mentality (LCM) process into New Power Business Unit PPP/PPT/VPI programs to ensure new products are designed with a life cycle perspective to maximize aftermarket entitlement and customer satisfaction. Specifically remanufacturing, branding, IP, and purchasing strategies. This may include but not limited to the following:Partner with NRP and NPBU Engineering to assess manufacturability of proposed New Power product architectures and define requirements and changes as necessary.
Ensure proper use and execution of Cummins branding for critical aftermarket parts in NPBU PPP/PPT/VPI programs.
Identify gaps and risks on supply agreements of critical aftermarket parts during VPI and provide the aftermarket voice to Purchasing function as they negotiate those agreements with suppliers.
Support the Parts Consumption Model team on building models for new VPI programs and ensure those models are included in the VPI program financials.

Proactively seek customer, channel, and competitive data to identify future product gaps and product trends.




Lead ad hoc business case analyses for new salvage opportunities and provide recommendations to NRP Product Review group on those opportunities.




QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum of Bachelor's Degree in related field
MBA preferred
10 plus years of experience
Demonstrated skill in managing projects with significant complexity/ambiguity and global stakeholders.
Demonstrated financial acumen and ability to build business cases.
Ability to translate commercial/marketing language into technical requirements and vice-versa.
Ability to quickly form networks, gaining engagement and support from those not reporting to you.
Fast learner who is able to quickly gain conceptual understanding of NPBU products, appreciation for differences vs ICE products, and familiarity with aftermarket needs/processes from company and customer points of view.
Prior process improvement experience (e.g. Six Sigma, Lean) is preferred.




What happens next

Confluent is pioneering a fundamentally new category of data infrastructure focused on data in motion. Have you ever found a new favorite series on Netflix, picked up groceries curbside at Walmart, or paid for something using Square? That’s the power of data in motion in action—giving organizations instant access to the massive amounts of data that is constantly flowing throughout their business. At Confluent, we’re building the foundational platform for this new paradigm of data infrastructure. Our cloud-native offering is designed to be the intelligent connective tissue enabling real-time data, from multiple sources, to constantly stream across the organization. With Confluent, organizations can create a central nervous system to innovate and win in a digital-first world.




We’re looking for self-motivated team members who crave a challenge and feel energized to roll up their sleeves and help realize Confluent’s enormous potential. Chart your own path and take healthy risks as we solve big problems together. We value having diverse teams and want you to grow as we grow—whether you’re just starting out in your career or managing a large team, you’ll be amazed at the magnitude of your impact.




About The Team




Marketing Strategy and Insights is a newly formed team within the Marketing Operations organization at Confluent. This team serves as internal consultants to all parts of the Marketing organization, focusing on delivering targeted insights into key components of the marketing engine including marketing campaign effectiveness, attribution and ROI, lead scoring, lead management, and more.




What You Will Do




As a Marketing Analyst at Confluent, you’ll apply your strategic and analytical skills to drive improvements in major marketing programs including marketing campaign measurement and effectiveness, pipeline attribution and ROI, lead scoring, lead management and funnel analysis, marketing pipeline forecasting and monitoring, and more
Analysis: Drive measurement and forensics across our marketing funnel to inform optimization of lead management and Sales Development conversion rates. Be proactive in identifying opportunities for improvement within your area of ownership, scope and prioritize projects, and spearhead the execution of analytically-driven recommendations in support of key business objectives
Partnership: Work closely with colleagues across Confluent including Marketing Operations, Data Science, Sales Development, Growth & Marketing, Finance, and more to drive the execution of strategic or tactical recommendations




What You Will Bring




3+ years of experience in an analytics role supporting a go-to-market organization
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, or quantitative field such as Analytics, Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering
1+ years of experience in SQL querying
Experience with data visualization such as Tableau
Highly proficient in Excel or Google Sheets
Familiarity with modern marketing and sales technology stacks (Marketo, Salesforce, Segment, BigQuery/Data Warehouses)
Be able to drive and execute an agenda in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment
Strong business judgment: Be a tenacious decision maker, able to assess priorities and execute to drive key business outcomes
Strong communication skills: Impeccable written and oral communication credentials, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills
Clear results orientation: display the ability to scope and execute on projects in service of both short and long term goals




Come As You Are




At Confluent, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Vention helps some of the most innovative manufacturing companies automate their production floor in just a few days. Vention's online-first manufacturing automation platform (MAP) enables its clients to design, automate, order, and deploy manufacturing equipment directly from their web browser.




Vention is headquartered in Montreal, Canada, with offices in Berlin and Boston, and is used in over 3,000 factories on 5 continents. In May 2022, with 300 employees (and growing), Vention announced the closing of US$95M in Series C financing, which will be used to grow Vention's go-to-market strategy, expand the company's global distribution footprint, and accelerate the development of its hardware and software platform.

Drive continuous analysis of campaign performance relative to specific KPIs, and maintain the reports and dashboards to monitor performance.
maintain a roadmap of improvement initiatives to improve KPIs, more specifically related to segmentation, content improvement, and delivery strategies.
Develop and present clear and comprehensive findings and recommendations to the leadership team.
Work with the business infrastructure and demand generation team to coordinate the delivery of email campaigns as part of Vention’s multi-channel strategy.

University degree with a minimum two (2) years of experience performing analytics as part of a go-to-market team (marketing, sales, customer success, etc).
Experience working with Marketing automation software (Pardot, Marketo, etc).
Proficient in Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets and Microsoft PowerPoint/Google Slides.
Bilingualism.

FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all

Our Company

FedEx Express is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.

Our Philosophy

The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.

Our Culture

Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

If we’re going to work together, let us first introduce ourselves – because we are proud of our team at FedEx Express Canada. You know us as a global transportation company – and we’ve shipped some pretty interesting things over the years like part of the ship’s hull of the Titanic, a windmill, race cars, a helicopter, the shark from Jaws and a lot of panda bears who get their own chartered airplane!




If you are a positive, high-energy person who is a performance marketer with experience planning and analyzing customer journeys and marketing campaigns – do we have a great job for you!

FedEx Express Canada is seeking a Marketing Operations Analyst located in Mississauga, ON.




Currently on a Hybrid work model.




Job Summary:

The Marketing Operations Analyst is responsible for analyzing, monitoring, reporting, and delivering insights on the health of the marketing funnel, customer journeys and digital marketing campaigns to drive increased marketing effectiveness and revenue growth.




This role is part of the customer and channel engagement marketing team. The team’s mission it to know our customers and engage them effectively through digital and human channels across the buying lifecycle. By leveraging customer data and marketing technology, analyzing performance, and uncovering insights this team enables, orchestrates, and optimizes omni-channel customer interactions.




In this role you get to:

Manage marketing operations: Manage marketing ops from journey planning and cohort creation, through to campaign performance evaluation and business impact. Run queries to create customer target lists, upload and validate data. Measure campaign performance and corresponding business results.
Deep dive into customer interactions: Monitor, analyze and report on digital journey and campaign performance to measure and optimize KPIs and business results.
Provide strategic insights: Analyze campaign and customer data to identify insights that expand our understanding of customer behaviors, determine next best action, and make recommendations for campaign enhancements and journey improvements.
Support MarTech strategy: Ensure that MarTech stack and connection to SalesTech stacks are set up and analyzed end-to-end for journey and campaign success.
Collaborate cross-functionally: Be a business partner, collaborate with colleagues across the organization including Marketing Communications, Sales Operations, Customer Analytics, and Business Intelligence teams.




So, what do you need to do all of this?

You are data driven and are an experienced business analyst. You are proficient in SQL and have experience using Teradata Sequel and Sequel Developer, as well as Power BI for dashboard creation.
You are a performance marketer. You have a solid working knowledge of marketing and email campaign analytics. You love digging into numbers to mine for actionable insights. Experience working with Salesforce Marketing Cloud reporting is preferred.
You embrace evolving technologies. You seek out innovative solutions can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
You are strategic. Your critical thinking skills help to derive insights from data and inform decision making.
You are curious. You have the drive to dig in and learn the complexities of our business the FedEx data ecosystem with limited direction.
You are resilient and resourceful. You can deal with ambiguity and are a creative problem solver.
You're passionate about people. You build trust through respect and authenticity to collaborate with colleagues.
You’re a multi-tasker. You can juggle multiple projects and priorities.
You have a minimum of five years of professional marketing data analytics experience and university degree, preferably in business with a specialization in marketing or data analytics or in a quantitative discipline such as data science or statistics.




Some awesome perks to working at FedEx:

A competitive salary and incentives
A progressive benefits programs, including health and dental coverage and pension plan
A Career Investment Fund with up to $5k a year for programs or tuition reimbursement
Strong Community Service programs including diverse volunteer, charity, and fundraising initiatives to give back to both local and global communities
Discounted FedEx services, flights, hotels, entertainment and car rentals
A fun and diverse team who voted FedEx a best employer and a great place to work (we aren’t just saying that, it’s actually true)




We don’t expect you to deliver any helicopters or pandas – but if you can deliver on this exciting job opportunity, please attach your updated resume when applying. We thank all applicants and if selected we will contact you directly for an interview!

Together, we will save millions of lives.

Pivot is a behavioral change digital health company delivering clinically-proven solutions that empower people to take control of their health. Named to Fast Company's prestigious annual list of the World's Most Innovative Companies for 2020, Pivot is an industry leader in tobacco and vaping cessation. Combining behavioral science, proprietary FDA-cleared medical device technology, pharmacotherapy, community support, and dedicated coaching, we aim to help millions of people quit tobacco. We are growing fast. Join us. Learn more at https://pivot.co.

Summary/Objective

You are a creative, analytical and collaborative analyst. In this role, you'll help with operations/execution phases of marketing Pivot, driving toward actionable business decisions, and effectively communicating outside-the-box insights based on marketing metrics.

Essential Functions/What You'll Be Doing

Build automated dashboards to monitor and track enrollment, engagement and success
Monitor and report on marketing funnel to provide key metrics against growth KPIs
A/B test, build and track digital marketing campaign performance
Measure campaign effectiveness and optimize future marketing campaign strategy; provide recommendations by forecasting trend and funnel conversion
Synthesize and analyze data from disparate sources (e.g., Google Analytics, PostgreSQL DB, product analytics platform) to actionable insights
Support market research and user experience research on the Pivot brand
Present digestible stories with data to leadership team using various tools such as Microsoft Office, G-Suite and data visualization platform such as Tableau, Looker for client-facing reports


Competencies/Qualifications/Experience/Education

2 years of experience in Analytics (e.g., Marketing, Product, etc.) Experience as a Marketing Analyst is a plus
Bachelor's degree preferred (ideally in a relevant field - Marketing, Psychology, Economics, Management Information Systems, Math, Statistics, etc.). Master's degree in a relevant field is a plus
Familiarity with basic SQL queries (selects, joins). Advanced SQL skills are a plus.
Experience building dashboards in Tableau, PowerBI, or similar platforms
Experience visualizing data (e.g., bar graphs, line graphs, etc) in Tableau, PowerBI, Excel, R, Mixpanel, or other similar tools
Experience with spreadsheets (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets)
Familiarity with analyzing activity logs (e.g., page views, button clicks, etc)
Basic knowledge of Google Analytics
Ability to translate stakeholder requests into data questions
Ability to create reports and/or presentations, describe results, and tailor communication to different types of stakeholders
Intuitive, high-level understanding of A/B tests and what types of experiments are feasible and worth running. Experience with statistics (regression, power analysis, analyzing a randomized experiment) is a plus
Terrific attention to detail and outstanding organizational and communication skills
Interest in learning about marketing terminology, techniques, and methods of analysis
A strong desire to learn; comfortable in picking up new marketing tools
Experience programming analyses in Stata, Python, R, etc. is a plus


What We Offer

At Pivot, we'll take care of you. In addition to competitive salaries, challenging work assignments, and developmental opportunities, we offer medical, dental, and vision insurance, stock options, and generous PTO, including dedicated time for volunteering.

Flexibility to work remotely, in the office, or hybrid. Office is close to Caltrain, and close to 101.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Range for this position is $70k-$90k

The world of esports is growing and so are we!




Our Digital Platform Marketing team needs your passion for optimization, your one-team spirit, and your analytical skills. We are looking to hire an SEO & Marketing Analyst to join us in shaping the future of gaming.

At EFG (ESL FaceIt Group) we create worlds beyond gameplay, where players and fans become a community. We pride ourselves in having a corporate social responsibility which is that “IT’S NOT GG, UNTIL IT’S GG FOR ALL”. Our passion, craft, and DNA are aligned to create and shape the world of esports, gaming tournaments, leagues, events, and holistic ecosystems through our millions of players, fans, and heroes, as well as through our people, and culture. This is one of many reasons why EFG is a magical workplace, where anything is possible, and where you will thrive and experience a game-changing career.




As an SEO & Marketing Analyst, you will be responsible for driving relevant traffic to FACEIT through SEO activity and analysis of digital behaviour. You will be the driving force behind our SEO approach and come equipped with knowledge, enthusiasm and passion to build a strategy that impacts marketing objectives. You will also work across other channels to analyze effectiveness of activity and campaigns, providing insight and recommendations to further our digital marketing strategy. The ideal candidate is someone who not only has strong SEO, analytics and reporting skills; but someone who also goes above and beyond to be proactive and show how analytics can help the big picture when it comes to achieving wider objectives.







What you’ll do:




Create, manage and execute the FACEIT SEO strategy
Monitor and optimize on-going activity accordingly, based on analysis of behavior
Analyze sales funnels and customer intent to help wider marketing decision making
Collaborate with the digital platform and product marketing teams to optimize FACEIT for search purposes
Collaborate with the data team to ensure our tracking tools are set for purpose for marketing analysis
Be a key stakeholder in the management of our Google Analytics 360 account
Monitor and report on performance of paid search campaigns
Communicate updates and reports efficiently for internal stakeholders
Keep up to date with new trends and best SEO practices

30% Coordination and implementation of search engine optimisation tactics
30% Insight analysis of all performance marketing tactics
20% Reporting for internal stakeholders
10% Management of our Google Analytics account
10% Management of third party agencies







What you need:




Minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience in SEO and marketing analytics
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
Expert, up-to date knowledge of web analytics and marketing tracking tools
A knowledge or willingness to learn the ins and outs of the esports and gaming industry, including staying up to date on the latest trends
Demonstrated ability to communicate in the English language, both spoken and written




Application information:

Do you feel ready for the challenge of working at @EFG? Join us for a game-changing career where we will be shaping the journey of esports together with diversity and inclusion. We encourage you to apply by filling in our application form including your earliest starting date and your desired salary.




Please apply by adding the requested documents CV or your cover letter in English language and preferably in PDF format.




Our Recruitment Process – What to expect?




Our recruitment team is committed to carefully reviewing and evaluating your application for this role. We will look at your past studies, work experience, overall passions, as well as your personal relationship with games, to help us gauge the connection between these points and the criteria set forth by our hiring manager for this role.

You can expect to be invited for an interview if your experience matches and/or an email notification containing feedback if you didn’t qualify for this round. Either way, you will hear from us!




About us @EFG:

EFG is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.




Each of our brands play a significant role in creating worlds beyond gameplay.

They build, connect and nurture beyond game ecosystems to unlock more fun, fame, and fortune for gamers across the globe.




At ESL we create worlds where everybody can be somebody
At FACEIT we create a world where the community has the power to shape video games
At DreamHack we create a world where the gaming community comes to life
At DreamHack Sports Games we create a world where traditional sports meets esports
