ABOUT US Bath & Body Works is a global omni channel company that sells personal care and beauty products online and in more than 1,700 North American stores, including nearly 300 stores in countries around the globe operating under franchise, license, and wholesale arrangements.

At Bath & Body Works, we are committed to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture focused on delivering exceptional fragrances and experiences to our customers. We focus on recruiting, retaining, and advancing diverse talent where our associate population is as diverse as the communities we serve, live and work. In addition, we work to improve our communities and our planet in a way that will make us proud for years to come because we believe the world is a better place when everyone has access to the things that make them happy.

Join a team that is passionate about our customers; cares deeply for our communities and associates; where our values drive the right behaviors and where we set aside ego to bring the best products to market as we move to our goal to be $10B in revenue and beyond.

SUMMARY The Social Media Marketing Analyst will support data and insight-driven organic social media efforts through insightful and actionable analyses with a primary focus on customer engagement, channel, content and campaign optimization. The Analyst will play an integral role in the development of annual and campaign channel goals (KPIs), reporting of ongoing campaign and channel performance and the development of test and learn strategies for Bath & Body Works’ organic social media channels. The Analyst’s primary “customers” include Director and AVP of Marketing (Brand Engagement), Organic Social team and other cross-functional partners, including Brand Strategy, Customer Insights, Performance Marketing and Merchandising teams to deliver insights that will influence ongoing content strategy, full-integrated view of voice of the customer, the launch of new products, increase customer loyalty and brand engagement, and build the Bath & Body Works brand and social media community.

Roles & Responsibilities

Analyze and report on organic social media content and channel performance on a daily, weekly, campaign and quarterly/seasonal basis, including ongoing updates to be shared with organic social media team and leadership
Leverage data to connect the dots across marketing channels (including paid social, email, search, display, PR and influencer) to support an omni view of marketing performance; participate in omni marketing hindsight processes, integrating social media insights to deliver holistic marketing insights
Influence and contribute to the development of innovative and data-driven organic social media channel and content strategies
Primary responsibility is Bath & Body Works’ organic social media content, channel performance and growth, including Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, YouTube, Pinterest and Twitter, as well as future platform introductions
Provide in-the-moment insights to drive business and channel recommendations and actions within current and future campaigns
Proactively identify and escalate potential issues and opportunities; support the business with ad hoc analyses as needed
Support the surveillance of brand social media channels and the broader digital landscape in partnership with the Customer Insights team to uncover key insights and trends related to customer conversation themes and sentiment
Collaborate with organic social team to conduct data analyses that surface new ideas and insights, solve complex or unique challenges or uncover innovative test and learn opportunities
Optimize reporting templates and frameworks, including data visualization tools and measurement plans, that are clear, concise and easy to understand
Assist in establishing annual campaign channel goals (KPIs) for organic social media channels

Qualifications

2–4 years of hands-on social media experience in-house or at an agency with a focus on social media measurement and analytics
Superior MS Excel skills
Experience with a variety of social media measurement tools, including Netbase and Dash Hudson as well as native business analytics on social media platforms (e.g. Facebook and Instagram business manager)
Strong verbal and written communication skills with experience developing and delivering executive-level presentations
Passion for social media with a deep understanding of top social media platforms, including TikTok and Instagram, and in-depth knowledge of basic social media functions, such as hashtags, tagging, engagement tactics, etc.
Strong team player with a positive, proactive attitude and great interpersonal skills
Ability to think both analytically and strategically
Results-oriented with an ability to multitask, balance multiple workstreams and priorities, and change course quickly, if necessary, to achieve desired results
Bachelor's Degree required

PIMCO is a global leader in active fixed income. With our launch in 1971 in Newport Beach, California, PIMCO introduced investors to a total return approach to fixed income investing. In the 50+ years since, we have worked relentlessly to help millions of investors pursue their objectives – regardless of shifting marketing conditions. As active investors, our goal is not just to find opportunities, but to create them. To this end, we remain firmly committed to the pursuit of our mission: delivering superior investment returns, solutions, and service to our clients.

Since 1971, our people have shaped our organization through a high-performance inclusive culture, in which we celebrate diverse thinking. We invest in our people and strive to imprint our CORE values of Collaboration, Openness, Responsibility and Excellence. We believe each of us is here to help others succeed and this has led to PIMCO being recognized as an innovator, industry thought leader and trusted advisor to our clients.

Overview

We are seeking a fluent German-speaking Marketing Associate to help implement the events strategy for the Institutional and Global Wealth Management businesses in the DACH and CEE regions. This individual will manage proprietary events, the participation in third-party industry events (live, hybrid, and virtual) and will support key EMEA-wide events.

The successful candidate will report to the Senior Vice President, DACH CEE Channel Marketing Lead and will work closely with multiple internal stakeholders, including the central EMEA Marketing team based in London and Global Marketing team, as well as manage external vendors.

Responsibilities

Work closely with the DACH CEE Channel Marketing team and the EMEA Marketing/EMEA Events Team to develop and implement strategic events programs that is rooted in the PIMCO global vision and aligned with regional business objectives
Manage the full range of events across the DACH CEE regions, including virtual events, roadshows, live and hybrid events such as dinner and lunch roundtables as well as third-party industry event sponsorships, and help support EMEA-wide events (travelling across EMEA required)
Manage the DACH CEE events plan and the communication with key internal and external stakeholders
Negotiate event contracts and manage expenses
Work with finance department and the local marketing team to ensure budget tracking
Measure, optimize and report the performance of all events to enhance client experience
Coordinate with compliance to ensure all events and all Marketing material for events are fully compliant with regulations
Provide events marketing support for PIMCO and external industry conferences to enforce the protocols on brand and messaging governance to ensure the deliverables are on brand and messaging is aligned

Requirements

Understanding of financial markets and experience in marketing or events management (planning, execution, data-driven evaluation) across live, virtual as well as hybrid formats, ideally via Cvent platform (or similar)
Data-driven mindset and the ability of delivering best in class events based on data-informed decision making
Self-motivated, excellent communication and relationship building skills
Outstanding stakeholder management skills, including dealing with client facing teams and business leaders
Pro-active attitude, comfortable with ambiguity and an ability to solve problems
Excellent time-management, multi-tasking and organisational skills
Attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines
Exceptional work ethic and ability to succeed in high intensity environment
Fluent/native German and proficiency in spoken and written English: other languages, e.g. French, Italian, Polish, Hungarian, are a plus but not a must

** Please note this is an in-office role **

Senior Media Analyst – Remote Role

Overview:

This established, yet ever-evolving advertising agency, is close to 20 years in the making and has been chosen as a top NYC ad shop for years. It has roots which stem way back, and an energy and cohesiveness that evolved from the founding partners and directors who crafted their careers years ago when they worked together at leading worldwide firms. Today, as a top NYC ad agency, they create brands, plan their course, and migrate them through marketing transformation, using insights and marketing technology to create compelling campaigns and build engaging user experiences. They are a force to be reckoned with when it comes to ensuring that audiences are engaged at the right time, in impactful places, and with the right content to act. Not only are they a successful, creative shop that gets results, but they are also a dynamic, driven, inspirational group of professionals who love what they do. They are currently looking for a Senior Media Analyst to join them on their journey as they continue to grow their successes.

Ideal Candidate:

The ideal employee is innovative and passionate about digital marketing performance and storytelling through data. This agency is seeking an individual that has digital analytics experience, specifically with digital media campaigns and website analytics. The ideal candidate will feel comfortable working independently while collaborating with both Clients and internal partners. Strong verbal and written communication are a must.

The Senior Media Analyst will be responsible for ingesting, organizing and visualizing media campaign data, social campaign data and site performance data for multiple Clients in our data visualization tool, Salesforce Intelligence Cloud (formerly known as Datorama). This position will work internally with media planners and account management and will present data and insights to external marketing Clients. Presentation will include data visualization and reporting along with actionable insights presented in monthly, quarterly PowerPoint presentations. Actionable insights provided by Senior Analyst will be used to optimize and maximize efficiency of marketing and advertising campaigns.

Responsibilities:

Develop marketing campaign measurement plans including Key Performance Indicators across
Acquisition (Paid, Earned, Owned), Outcomes (lead forms, downloads, sign ups) and Behavior
(traffic, bounce rates, time on site, pages visited) in collaboration with Media Team
Obtain, ingest data from multiple sources and research data queries to produce data visualizations and dashboards in Salesforce Intelligence Cloud
Develop interactive dashboards and reports that showcase information in a clear and digestible manner, allowing for efficient tracking and optimization of media campaign delivery and performance
Identify opportunities for digital analytics enablement and measurement
Create meaningful and insightful presentations that translate data into actionable insights for marketing Clients and allow for marketing campaign optimization
Analyze information through layers of reported data, disregarding the unnecessary, to deliver analysis and insight and suggest optimizations to improve results
Generate insights based on current and past campaign performance data and develop analytics presentations for clients and internal teams
Communicate concise data points, trends and measurement strategies to a broad audience of both technical and non-technical teams
Research digital marketing trends in measurement, attribution, and modeling

Requirements:

BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience
3+ years professional experience in a Senior Analytics position (experience working in the financial services category preferable)
Must have B2B/B2C experience
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Must have demonstrated experience working in Salesforce Intelligence Cloud and/or Salesforce Datorama
Experience with marketing analytics metrics and tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, DV360 and other advertising platforms
Experience with data and data ingestion across multiple sources
Understanding of media metrics (digital media, programmatic media, buying models, etc.), both from a brand and performance perspective, preferred
Prior experience with media platforms, ad servers (CM), site analytics (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics) and ad verification tools and platforms (IAS, Double Verify, Oracle) preferred
Strong understanding of digital marketing and advertising strategies and tactics such as Display, Native, Paid Search, Social, Email
Proven track record for articulating data insights and building rapport with stakeholders
Self-motivated, confident, and independent with strong attention to detail
Problem solver willing to proactively collaborate

Compensation/Benefits:

The approximate base salary range for this position is $90,000 - $130,000 per year, depending upon the qualifications of the individual candidate, and level/years of relevant experience.
This agency offers a comprehensive benefits package (Medical, Dental, Vision, PTO, 401K, and company holidays).

TelevisaUnivision está buscando un Social Media Senior Analyst de Lifestyle para unirse a nuestro equipo para construir y hacer crecer una nueva vertical de estilo de vida a través de plataformas de redes sociales.




Nuestra misión es crear el contenido más atractivo en los medios hispanos y desarrollar el contenido de entretenimiento más poderoso para las mujeres hispanas en los Estados Unidos con un alto nivel de narración en torno a la belleza, la moda, la comida, el bienestar, el empoderamiento y más, ya que somos inclusivos y creativos.

El analista entiende la importancia del análisis de redes sociales para tomar mejores decisiones de contenido. Será responsable de realizar un seguimiento del rendimiento diario del contenido de los canales de Lifestyle en Facebook, YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, Twitter y otras plataformas. Se espera que el analista proporcione información y recomendaciones significativas que informen las optimizaciones estratégicas y las decisiones de producción de contenido basadas en métricas clave de rendimiento. Gestionarás campañas pagadas en redes sociales para impulsar el crecimiento orgánico y construir una comunidad en los Estados Unidos. Agregar y analizar datos de redes sociales para proporcionar información y recomendaciones significativas a los creadores de contenido y editores de estilo de vida
Generar informes semanales para las partes interesadas clave que realicen un seguimiento de las métricas clave de rendimiento y proporcionen recomendaciones prácticas
Trabajar con las partes interesadas internas para definir los requisitos del negocio, mejorar los procesos analíticos y desarrollar nuevas capacidades para aumentar los informes en tiempo real a través de paneles digitales
Ayudar en el desarrollo de KPIs para el equipo de Lifestyle
Planificar y activar campañas de redes sociales en todas las propiedades de Univision, utilizando plataformas publicitarias en Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, TikTok y Twitter
Mantenerse al día sobre las tendencias de la plataforma e identifique nuevas oportunidades y formas de mejorar nuestro contenido
Aprovechar las herramientas de investigación como Tubular para comprender el contenido de mejor rendimiento de otros medios y creadores en todas las plataformas



USTED TIENE:




Mínimo de 5+ años de experiencia en redes sociales
Experiencia en contar una historia usando datos
Se requiere bilingüe (inglés y español).
Conocimiento de la cultura latina e hispana en los Estados Unidos

General Summary:

This individual is a part of the marketing team, and will serve as the product management lead for one or multiple brands’ marketing efforts. Executes specific tasks and manages projects within brand strategy in support of marketing objectives. This position is responsible for assisting in the development and implementation of marketing plans to drive volume and profitability of assigned brand(s), both individually and through leading cross-functional teams.




Product Management within a consumer packaged goods organization. Three to five years related experience, consumer packaged goods experience preferred. Ideal candidate is a self-starter, detail-oriented, analytical, and a team player.




Supervisory Responsibilities: This position does not have supervisory responsibilities.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Business Analytics:

Manage shipment and consumption data, identify patterns and provide outlook and recommendations to drive business performance and brand health
Initiate and perform business analyses, identify issues and opportunities and make recommendations to Marketing Manager/Director by turning data into insights and stories to drive growth
Lead monthly business assessments.
Complete sales analysis such as new item updates, promotional and distribution analyses, and merchandising effectiveness.
Assess brand strategy including SWOT Analysis (Strength, Weakness, Threat, Opportunities), Media Performance.

Business Management:

Develop and manage volume and spending forecasts and make recommendations to Marketing Manager/Director of yearly volume, annual budget/spending, and process recommendations.
Track brand forecasts and brand marketing expenses throughout the year to manage within the given budget.
Lead cross-functional teams on assigned projects, developing and managing timetables and milestones, coordinating cross-functional efforts, and managing outside suppliers (e.g., agencies/vendors). Projects such as: commercialization, marketing programs, media performance, portfolio optimization, etc.

Marketing Planning:

Lead annual brand review to aid in development of marketing plans.
Assist the Marketing Manager/Director in developing the annual marketing plan.
Execute delegated portions of the marketing plan within the budget and on time.
Manage vendors in development of creative marketing materials/programs including packaging, selling materials, advertising, displays, coupons and FSIs.
Act as liaison between Ad Agencies and Marketing Manager/Director as needed to develop/revise advertising and marketing programs.
Partner with Market Research/Insights on research projects to support marketing objectives and brand strategies.
Collaborate with sales and category insights on the development of key marketing programs as it relates to selling materials, marketing investment, creative execution, and analysis of program success
Understand and help develop channel and pricing strategies and developing programs and products to support key customers.




Other Duties and Responsibilities:

Fulfill Storck Company Values; Belonging, Passion, and Growth
Other duties as assigned.




Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Solid knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Experience with data analytics; ability to translate data into a story
Knowledge of either IRI and/or Nielsen data and software preferred
Consumer / Business curiosity




Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree required; degree in Marketing preferred and three to five years related experience, consumer packaged goods experience strongly preferred.




Working Conditions: Hybrid Work Model, including Monday and Friday Work from Home, and Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday in normal working conditions for an office environment downtown Chicago, IL.




Other Qualifications: Must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccination by the date of hire to be considered. Proof of vaccination required. Company Vaccination Policy available for review upon request during interview.




Travel: Minimal 5-10%, Including International Travel




What We Offer In Return:

Storck USA offers an outstanding compensation and total rewards package, including competitive base + bonus plan, 401(k) with company contribution, medical insurance (including an HSA option and telemedicine), dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, paid parental leave, fitness reimbursement, tuition reimbursement, employee assistance, pet insurance, employee discounts (and candy!), employee referral bonus program, and, last but not least, flexible spending accounts for transportation, medical, and dependent care. And, we offer fantastic work/life balance with flexibility -- including "Summer Friday" hours year round!!

¿Quiénes somos?

Una startup de delivery de productos de supermercado, que ha logrado uno de los crecimientos más rápidos a nivel mundial e histórico. Hemos alcanzado el status de “unicornio” y operado en más de 5 países en menos de un año.

Buscamos brindar una experiencia de compra de alimentos inteligente, rápida y placentera; mientras que, le devolvemos tiempo a nuestros clientes con tiempos de entrega en minutos.

Bastante capacidad de ejecución, sentido de responsabilidad y atención a los detalles.

General Summary:

This individual is a part of the marketing team, and will serve as the product management lead for one or multiple brands’ marketing efforts. Executes specific tasks and manages projects within brand strategy in support of marketing objectives. This position is responsible for assisting in the development and implementation of marketing plans to drive volume and profitability of assigned brand(s), both individually and through leading cross-functional teams.




Product Management within a consumer packaged goods organization. Three to five years related experience, consumer packaged goods experience preferred. Ideal candidate is a self-starter, detail-oriented, analytical, and a team player.




Supervisory Responsibilities: This position does not have supervisory responsibilities.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Business Analytics:

Manage shipment and consumption data, identify patterns and provide outlook and recommendations to drive business performance and brand health
Initiate and perform business analyses, identify issues and opportunities and make recommendations to Marketing Manager/Director by turning data into insights and stories to drive growth
Lead monthly business assessments.
Complete sales analysis such as new item updates, promotional and distribution analyses, and merchandising effectiveness.
Assess brand strategy including SWOT Analysis (Strength, Weakness, Threat, Opportunities), Media Performance.

Business Management:

Develop and manage volume and spending forecasts and make recommendations to Marketing Manager/Director of yearly volume, annual budget/spending, and process recommendations.

Marketing Planning:

Manage vendors in development of creative marketing materials/programs including packaging, selling materials, advertising, displays, coupons and FSIs.
Act as liaison between Ad Agencies and Marketing Manager/Director as needed to develop/revise advertising and marketing programs.
Partner with Market Research/Insights on research projects to support marketing objectives and brand strategies.
Collaborate with sales and category insights on the development of key marketing programs as it relates to selling materials, marketing investment, creative execution, and analysis of program success
Understand and help develop channel and pricing strategies and developing programs and products to support key customers.

Fulfill Storck Company Values; Belonging, Passion, and Growth
Other duties as assigned.

Solid knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Experience with data analytics; ability to translate data into a story
Knowledge of either IRI and/or Nielsen data and software preferred
Consumer / Business curiosity




Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree required; degree in Marketing preferred and three to five years related experience, consumer packaged goods experience strongly preferred.




Working Conditions: Hybrid Work Model, including Monday and Friday Work from Home, and Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday in normal working conditions for an office environment downtown Chicago, IL.




Other Qualifications: Must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccination by the date of hire to be considered. Proof of vaccination required. Company Vaccination Policy available for review upon request during interview.

Company Description




Vention helps some of the most innovative manufacturing companies automate their production floor in just a few days. Vention's online-first manufacturing automation platform (MAP) enables its clients to design, automate, order, and deploy manufacturing equipment directly from their web browser.




Vention is headquartered in Montreal, Canada, with offices in Berlin and Boston, and is used in over 3,000 factories on 5 continents. In May 2022, with 300 employees (and growing), Vention announced the closing of US$95M in Series C financing, which will be used to grow Vention's go-to-market strategy, expand the company's global distribution footprint, and accelerate the development of its hardware and software platform.




Job Description




As Digital Marketing Analyst, you will play a key role in Vention’s growth strategy by building, executing, and measuring acquisition efforts to qualify leads before becoming customers. The Digital Marketing Analyst will be accountable for managing the end-to-end digital acquisition process and sharing performance insights with the broader team (from awareness to conversion all the way to ROI). We also are looking for those who can apply cutting-edge technology and practices for high value campaigns. Ideal candidates can develop, execute, and optimize digital performance across multiple channels.




More specifically, you will:




Manage day-to-day support and standardize the process of digital marketing campaigns from ideation to completion, from owning the project management, build, QA, deployment, measurement/reporting and more.
Conduct ongoing content, keyword, and URL audits to improve digital assets performance.
Providing a range of reporting, including individual posts, campaign performance, monthly digital performance, audience insights, competitive analysis, and custom reporting as needed.
Pulling metrics, creating data visualizations, and presenting clear analyses for collaborative growth with internal teams.
Analyzing large data sets of both qualitative and quantitative information from all major social media and digital advertising platforms.
Have an excellent understanding of how to analyze and optimize conversion rates across the sales and marketing funnel.




Be a trusted partner in developing the overall demand generation plan at Vention and can work both at a strategic and tactical level on projects and campaigns.




Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree in engineering, mathematic or economic preferred
Experience with advanced analytics and data manipulation
Expertise in Excel, SQL, and experience working with large data sets; strong numbers acumen. Data Visualization tool experience is preferred. (Tableau, Data Studio, Looker, etc.)
Experience working across multiple campaigns with different goals and sharing insights eloquently with a variety of stakeholders
At least 3 years of experience developing digital marketing strategy or demand generation positions with a track record of owning digital campaigns
Have demonstrable success delivering earned (SEO/SEM, PR/Media), paid (PPC, event sponsorships, social, display), and owned channels (website, email, webinars, podcasts, social media)
A “never satisfied” and “driven to optimize '' mindset is key
A curiosity to explore and test variables to improve future performance, as well as the ability to clearly convey results through insightful reporting practices




We'd love to chat with you if you are:




A motivated self-starter who can perform under tight deadlines with excellent attention to detail
An innovative thinker with original ideas, who can cultivate support from stakeholders and become a trusted team player
A strong work ethic, adaptability and autonomy are essential to success in this role
An ideal team member will provide suggestions for cutting-edge technologies to help Vention grow
Strong English written skills. Proficiency in any other language is an asset, particularly French and German

Company Description: PT Serasi Autoraya ( SERA ) adalah anak perusahaan PT Astra International Tbk yang saat ini telah dikenal luas sebagai salah satu perusahaan layanan transportasi dan logistik terbesar di Indonesia. SERA yang pada awalnya perusahaan jasa penyewaan kendaraan, kini telah menjelma menjadi perusahaan penyedia transportasi yang terbesar dan terdepan. SOLUSI DALAM BIDANG PENYEWAAN KENDARAAN SERA yang merupakan salah satu perusahaan transportasi terbesar di Indonesia kini menawarkan solusi transportasi yang berintegrasi dengan TRAC-Astra. Melalui lini bisnisnya ini, SERA menawarkan solusi terbaik bagi para pelanggannya dalam bidang transportasi dengan memberikan jasa penyewaan kendaraan untuk korporasi maupun perorangan. Melalui TRAC, tersedia pula layanan sewa kendaraan yang akan memudahkan para pelanggannya yang ingin menyewa mobil untuk mobilitas mereka. Selain itu, tersedia pula fasilitas pelayanan pengemudi yang akan bekerja secara profesional dan berkualitas sehingga memungkinkan Anda untuk menikmati perjalanan yang aman dan nyaman. SOLUSI JUAL-BELI KENDARAAN BEKAS SERA juga memberikan solusi bagi para pelanggan yang ingin jual-beli kendaraan bekas melalui mobil88. mobil88 adalah pemegang pimpinan dalam bisnis jual-beli kendaraan bekas di Indonesia. Terbukti dengan hadirnya 21 cabang perusahaan yang tersebar di banyak kota di Indonesia membuat mobill88 berhasil menjual ribuan unit kendaraan setiap tahunnya. mobil88 memberikan jaminan bagi para pelanggannya dengan menawarkan fasilitas buyback sehingga para pelanggan merasa aman saat melakukan transaksi jual-belI. Anda tak perlu khawatir saat akan melakukan proses penjualan maupun pembelian kendaraan bekas karena para staff yang handal dan berpengalaman akan memandu Anda secara profesional. SOLUSI DALAM LELANG KENDARAAN Sebagai satu perusahaan transportasi besar di Indonesia, SERA juga membuka kesempatan bagi Anda yang ingin membeli kendaraan dengan cara lelang. Berintegrasi dengan IBID-Balai Lelang Serasi, yang merupakan balai lelang yang akan memberikan solusi terbaik bagi Anda yang ingin membeli kendaraan roda empat serta berbagai macam produk otomotif lainnya melalui proses pelelangan. SOLUSI TRANSPORTASI SECARA KOMPREHENSIF DENGAN ASTRA FMS Melalui Astra FMS, SERA memberikan solusi transportasi yang menyeluruh dengan berbasis pada penggunaan teknologi dan informasi yang canggih. Pengelolaan proses transportasi akan semakin efektif, efisien, dan aman. AstraFMS telah teruji secara efektif dalam berbagai lini bisnis yang dijalankan SERA, yang mana di dalamnya terdapat fitur-fitur yang membuat para pelanggan mudah dalam mengelola transportasi, memantau kendaraan secara real time, meminimalkan waktu downtime, menganalisa kinerja pengemudi, serta membuat biaya operasional kendaran lebih efisien. Kaia Is a Mission-focused Health Technology Company.

Our story began in 2016, when our founders Konstantin Mehl and Manuel Thurner, set out on a mission to bring affordable and accessible relief to millions of people with chronic conditions. No strangers to chronic pain themselves, they decided to innovate ways to remove the obstacles many people experience in getting the leading-edge care they need in order to live their best lives.

How do Kaia apps work? Kaia uses a dynamic AI-powered algorithm. Our programs are based on multimodal rehabilitation, a holistic approach to managing chronic conditions. Our users have easy access via smartphone and tablet to our programs for MSK and COPD using this evidence-based approach.

Five years into our story, we are a leader in digital therapeutics, with 500,000+ users worldwide. Having raised $125 million from investors such as Optum Ventures, idInvest, and Balderton Capital. We are poised to create a global footprint in digital self-care; Kaia is patient empowerment made easy.

The regulatory landscape is quickly adapting to the digital ecosystem. Therefore, our mission and strategy bring new opportunities for exceptional talent to join our journey. With over 200 "Kaianeers" spread across the globe, we need now, more than ever, specialized talent to help take our mission further.

The Marketing Analyst will be an integral member of the growing marketing team. Reporting to the VP of B2B Marketing, this person will help support critical B2B initiatives in the United States. The ideal candidate will be willing to roll up their sleeves, have strong data and analytical skills and be able to support the marketing and sales efforts for health plans, employers and providers.

About The Role

Partner with the VP of Marketing on B2B marketing initiatives
Research and deliver data driven support to marketing events, content and campaigns
Research and support sales opportunities
Support creation of sales collateral
Develop a deep understanding of the market and how best to position Kaia's GTM approach


About you:

Bachelor's Degree, MBA a plus
Strong data and analytical skills are crucial
Marketing experience is a plus
Strong project management skills, and being able to work under direction but also independently
Passionate and energetic with a growth mindset
Strong oral / written communication and interpersonal skills
Have authorization to work in the US


The range of the base salary is $50-90k, which is just part of our competitive compensation/benefits package (more details listed below!) Please note that individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies and work location.

Please note that Kaia Health only hires in the following US states: New Hampshire, Colorado, Arizona, North Carolina, Illinois, Texas, Massachusetts, South Carolina, Connecticut, Florida, California, Indiana, Virginia, New Jersey, New York


Some of the benefits of being a Kaianeer:

You can directly influence the future of digital health in a team of industry experts and digital shapers.
You will work alongside serial entrepreneurs (previously founded and scaled another startup, Foodora).
You'll enjoy accessible leaders, a hybrid (home/office) or remote work environment, and flexible vacation and working times.
We support your professional development and have a budget and PTO set aside for you just for that!
Happy hours, team events, and knowledge-sharing sessions.
Join us if you're looking for an entrepreneurial adventure and an exciting place to grow personally and professionally.

A competitive salary

two free meals a week if you come into office

Role Overview:

The SEM Analyst will work closely with a small number of eCommerce client accounts to ensure the performance of their SEM channel is continuously improving and meeting or exceeding client P&L objectives. You will be directly responsible for managing, optimizing, reporting on, and communicating the effectiveness of multiple online advertising channels including paid search, product listing ads (PLAs), remarketing, display, and Amazon advertising.

You will develop an intimate working relationship with your clients and meet with them regularly. The SEM Analyst’s primary responsibility is to ensure client account performance is continuously improving, and that all potential opportunities for account growth are pursued.

Key Responsibilities:

Research, develop and implement advanced SEM strategies and campaigns across client accounts. This includes competitive analysis, keyword research, ad copy development and testing, bid optimization as well as numerous micro-optimizations.
Implement, manage and optimize our industry-leading product listing ad (PLA) strategy across client accounts to ensure client profit objectives are met or exceeded each month. This will include mastering our strategies and tools for data feed optimization and search query cleansing.
Perform frequent analysis of client campaigns including bid optimization utilizing our bidding analysis platform, account segmentation, keyword analysis or other ad hoc analysis.
Contribute ideas for product improvements across our technology stack in order to improve the quality of services rendered across client accounts and improve internal processes.
Stay current on industry trends and upcoming technology, channels and online marketing strategies.
Travel may occasionally be required.

Skills & Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree
Outstanding people, computer and problem solving skills.
Must be capable of learning quickly.
2-5 years of experience in the search marketing industry. eCommerce experience preferred.
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel & Office.
Experienced and knowledgeable of web analytics software such as Google Analytics, Coremetrics or Omniture.
Google Ads certification required.

About Omnitail

Our number one goal at Omnitail is to offer greater accountability and performance for our clients. The digital marketing industry suffers from a lack of transparency and integrity among agencies and vendors. We aim to change this trend by teaching our clients to measure success through profit, rather than just revenue or efficiency. We incorporate measures of COGS, VOH (variable overhead) and merchandise return rate (MRR) in our optimization process. We pride ourselves on working with each client to find the approach that works best for their specific business needs. Success through metrics like profit - not just revenue - equals greater accountability, integrity, and transparency: and that’s what Omnitail is all about.

Monitoring and reporting on digital media and marketing trends.
Researching products not yet offered and competition.

Description:

Position Summary

Market Analyst capable of developing, maintaining, and presenting accurate sales and market data to all company departments in a concise and timely fashion. Market Analyst will be the key focal point for all sales, market, and competitive information relating to forecasts, tracking vs. forecast, and maintaining historical records.

Market Analyst capable of developing, maintaining, and presenting accurate sales and market data to all company departments in a concise and timely fashion. Market Analyst will be the key focal point for all sales, market, and competitive information relating to forecasts, tracking vs. forecast, and maintaining historical records.

Responsibilities Of Position

Develop vehicle production forecast by platform, by month, for use in annual plan. Update on a quarterly basis.
Provide monthly market review and outlook write-ups to management.
Track vehicle production vs. plan and dealer inventory with emphasis on key TI Fluid Systems platforms.
Provide liaison with Auto-facts and input information into organization as appropriate.
Prepare sales reports for QOS and operations meetings.
Develop and maintain contacts for OEM scheduling information.
Develop annual sales plan using $ per vehicle and production forecasts by month by platform.
Maintain market review charts by platform, track new, replacement, and lost business and the sales impact.
Prepare market and sales forecast for three year plan submission.
Develop and maintain data bases for accurate part % usages, $ per vehicle by product group, and market share vs. competition.
Coordinate business unit responses to provide consistent format and summaries to information requests.
Provide analytical and research support and liaison with other TI Fluid Systems’ departments and TI divisions.
Other duties as assigned.

Skills Requirements

Knowledge of automotive industry and forecasting techniques.
Strong analytical skills.
Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills.
Proficiency in PC skills such as Microsoft Office.
Ability to interface with all levels of management.

Licensing Or Special Certification Requirements

Valid driver’s license.

Physical Requirements

Ability to travel (including air travel and long automobile trips), including some overnight domestic and international trips.

Working Conditions

Must work near moving equipment occasionally.
Some of work time is spent standing, walking, lifting and bending.
May be required to travel to plant and/or training sites.
Some of work time is spent working at a computer.

Education

POSITION SUMMARY

The Marketing Analyst is responsible for conducting marketing analysis to support profitable growth and commercial effectiveness. This involves creating and/or maintaining tools, systems, and processes to collect and analyze data in order to make recommendations on pricing, strategies, and products/services. Additional responsibilities include gathering and reporting competitive intelligence, analyzing customer trends, creating and maintaining customer forecasts in addition to measuring and reporting commercial activity through CRM (Customer Relationship Management) software.




PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for tracking, reporting, and analyzing the performance of marketing and sales activities, ad-hoc analytic requests, and development/automation of ongoing reports
Analyze sales/margin activity by customer, industry segment, and product lines to identify trends and recommend action
Understand and analyze customer needs, objectives, and requirements to develop and recommend pricing strategies
Develop financial models to assess the impact of pricing and other changes on company revenue and profitability
Research and collect data on prices, competitors, and market conditions to support pricing decisions
Implement and record price changes within the appropriate systems as well as communicate as necessary with the appropriate stakeholders
Create PowerPoint presentations to provide market and consumer insights to other marketing and sales departments
Provide data-driven insights to justify action in proposed marketing initiatives
Support S&OP initiatives through demand management by creating, maintaining, and communicating monthly forecast by customer and business segment
Collaborate with cross-function teams to implement marketing (and other) programs that improve the product/service offering
Support sales and marketing activity by transforming data into usable information on which to base decisions by creating dashboards in CRM as well as ongoing standard and specialized reporting through PowerPoint and/or Excel
Support utilization of the CRM (Customer Relationship Management) software to align organization towards Commercial KPI’s within the Sales and Marketing teams, including a working pipeline and opportunity manager as well as the evaluation of wins and losses
Conduct market research to identify new opportunities for profitable growth in existing markets or new markets for existing products
Lead the analysis and content of information and data to support the quarterly business review process
Any other reasonable activity as directed by Director of Marketing




QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in marketing, quantitative discipline, or business related field
5+ years of sales and/or marketing experience
Strong analytical skills, critical thinking skills, and problem-solving skills
Advanced Excel skills
Working knowledge with CRM programs
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
Strong presentation and communication skills, both verbal and written
Experience interfacing with national industrial customers (HQ level preferred)
Ability to effectively implement sales and marketing strategies
Demonstrated skills in achieving sales, profitability, and budget goals
High-energy self-starter as well as collaborative team player
Proven ability to effectively communicate cross functionally and vertically within company
Demonstrated commitment to building strong business relationships with customer




COMPETENCIES

Accountability/Ownership
Analytical Ability/Problem Solving/Decision Making
Business Knowledge
Communication Skills
Continuous Learning
Customer Service
Interpersonal/Relationship Skills
Quality
Sense of Urgency/Entrepreneurialism
Time Management/Planning/Organizing
Values/Trust/Integrity

Job Purpose




The responsibility of the retail marketing and insights manager is ensuring marketing strategies and promotions for cross-divisional campaigns are consumer centric and are ROI driven. Feed insights to the business to improve performance and always be the voice of the consumer by being the sole source of market data, market outlooks, and budget optimization and always on insights by leveraging partner data and studies conducted. The role also has a key responsibility to execute cross-categories campaigns and activations, therefore marketing experience is a must along with research experience.




Responsibilities




Research agency stakeholder management (GFK, IDC, Ipsos, Euromonitor etc.)
Refine market understanding and market outlook to keep the business updated on the market context for better market anticipation
E-commerce mapping and market sizing update and forecast per category per country in 2023.
Lead on transformational projects in the retail, through traditional retailers and non-traditional
Lead key data & analytics strategic work like MMM, pricing analysis, coverage analysis, etc.
Present insight findings to key stakeholders, with actionable recommendations for decision-making. Align stakeholders on data topics.
Deliver actionable insights via scalable reporting stack & dashboards allowing end-users to identify performance trends, determine root cause, and enable cross-functional actions
Support strategic planning processes as well as weekly, monthly and quarterly business reporting along with leading performance reviews with leadership & commercial teams
